Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: JBandNolie
Reviews.Content: The Back Bay Hotel was beautiful and in a great location. I loved that it was the old police headquarters, the building was very pretty. The staff was very helpful and although parking was offsite and kind of annoying to get my car, you don't want to drive in Boston anyways. The marketplace was a short walk but a very long frustrating drive! The rooms were very clean and tasteful, the sheets were luxurious and the bathrooms were nice but the room was kind of small, the elevator was probably the smallest I've ever seen! but all in all we loved the Back Bay Hotel and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend”
Reviews.Author: m0d
Reviews.Content: Impressed by the staff from the moment I arrived. Friendly , informative and helpful. Location excellent with Underground Transit only 2 blocks away. One drawback was lack of Tea making facility in room however complimentaryTea and Coffee in lobby every morning. Breakfast while nice was a tad expensive. Room spotless and bed very comfortable. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, good location, pity about the facilities”
Reviews.Author: JimmyD_8
Reviews.Content: The staff in the Back Bay were very helpful and it is in a great part of Boston. However, compared to other 4 star hotels in the US, the facilities are a bit lacking. First, the concierge desk was essentialy doubled up by staff from the desk. Also there was no display of attraction leaflets, like most hotels have. Second, the bed was fantastic but apart from that the room was no great: no minibar, no coffee making facilities etc. Third, to go to the fitness room, you had to walk through part of the bar! Fourth, the AC was very noisy. One plus point for me i suppose was that being Irish, the hotel did feel genuinely Iish- right down to the lack of facilities!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: ElPasoFP
Reviews.Content: Back Bay is a good choice. It is located in a very nice part of Boston. It is conveniently located to the subway, great shopping and restaurants. The lobby is fairly nice as is the downstairs bar. Service was very good especially maintenance. Our room was not cooling and it was fixed by the time that we returned later that day. The rooms are decorated very nicely; however we only had a small window which did not let in much sunlight at al and the view was poor. That would be my only complaint. The bathroom is very, very nice and big. The bed is excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience yet again”
Reviews.Author: NatureloverToronto
Reviews.Content: We travel to Boston frequently to see our grandchild and The Back Bay Hotel is our favourite hotel. It is extremely well situated in a most attractive part of Boston. The rooms are spacious and attractive and a little different from the usual luxury chain hotel. For instance, the hotel is situated in the old, historic Boston police headquarters. The pictures on the walls in the bedrooms are not only attractive but interesting, such as a portrait of James Joyce. The bathrooms are also spacious and comfortable with lots of large fluffy towels. We visited this weekend and the staff were excellent. When the doorman saw our granddaughter he immediately pulled a toy police car out of his pocket and gave it to her. The buffet breakfast was not outstanding but good enough and the dining staff were most attentive and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Location”
Reviews.Author: Judas4real
Reviews.Content: Had the pleasure of staying at The Back Bay Hotel during the week of Thanksgiving last year. We felt welcomed from the minute we step foot in inside this magnificent hotel. We had drinks at Cuffs downstairs and walked one block to have dinner at Davio's. The room was elegant and plan on staying there on our next trip. We walked everywhere or took the T to our destinations. If you enjoy shopping this location is #1, walking distance to high end stores.

Reviews.Title: “Greal Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Meganmooney
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Back Bay Hotel over the Christmas break and it was lovely! Our room was big enough for the four of us and everything was within walking distance. I wouldn't say much for the concierge but the the bellman was great - steered us to a great place called Billy's for breakfast and we ate there twice. I used to live in Boston so i know my way around pretty well but things change and it refreshing that he didn't send us to a touristy place.

Reviews.Title: “Very fine hotel! Lovely in every way.”
Reviews.Author: SusanM202
Reviews.Content: Lovely location, nice rooms, bar and restaurant. Clean rooms, very comfy! Room service was was best I've ever had. Wonderful food but what was impressive was the presentation...a cart with a flower and tablecloth. These things make a difference when traveling on business. Lovely, lovely hotel in every way. I have business kn Boston so I plan to return!!! P.s. this is not a cookie cutter hotel, in terms of decor. Very warm, traditional, homey yet modern and comfy. I enjoyed my night to relax and prepare for my meeting in this delightful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: uaimh30
Reviews.Content: A true gem of a hotel. Made welcome from the moment we arrived. The staff were excellent. The hotel is in a great location. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - well worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: ByrneA34
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in 2011 and 2012. Great hotel with big rooms. Excellent service from reception to bar staff. Buffet breakfast is great but maybe a bit expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: jefcove
Reviews.Content: Took my wife to The Back Bay Hotel for her 40th B-day. We had a great time. Check in was a breeze, room was fantastic and clean. The bed was comfortable and the shower and bathroom were nice. I highly recommend this hotel. I got a great price on line as well. Parking surprisingly wasn't a challenge either. There's a garage next door and overnight parking with a discount from the garage was only $23.00.

Reviews.Title: “I want to live here!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lucky_charm85
Reviews.Content: Oh my god what a hotel!!! From the minute you get out of the taxi your greeted by the nicest bunch of doormen who just couldn't be nicer!!! Lovely start! Reception staff were very efficient and checked us in quickly and recommended tours and shopping trips. Heather even organised a bus to wrentham outlet mall for us and booked our seats on the tour bus. So nice. The room was beautiful so clean and spacious. The bed was brilliant I tried to steal a pillow it was so comfy!!! the cleaning staff were excellent we had fresh sheets and fresh towels every morning. They even folded my pyjamas haha!!! the food downstairs was lovely bit pricey but it is a hotel restaurant so u kinda expect as much!!! They even held our bags on the last day as we did our final bits of shopping and sightseeing!!! It was in the perfect location walking distance of everything! Just perfect I didn't want to come home!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Hotelsnobb
Reviews.Content: Very centrally located and within walking distance of Boylston and Newbury Streets for shops and restaurants, the South End, and Prudential and Copley shopping...lots going on in this area. The hotel is in a gorgeous historic building and has an elegant but hip feel. The bar was even hopping when we checked in late on a Saturday afternoon, and were lucky for find a seat for lunch & drinks! Staff was very friendly and the food in both restaurants was great...excellent clam chowder! If you want to venture out for food, there are fantastic restaurants within a 5 minute walk. The rooms are on the smaller side, but loved the gigantic mirror in the room and the spacious bathroom, especially the motion sensor nightlight.

Reviews.Title: “What a view!”
Reviews.Author: petarandreev
Reviews.Content: Spent a fantastic night in Boston The staff was welcoming and extremely helpful and even watched my truck for me on one of the busiest streets in Boston while I went inside to check in and then headed to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a stay”
Reviews.Author: RajZ
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for almost 15 days and was most impressed with the staff. A big thanks to Neil who besides a certain glitch in the beginning did manage to do an exemplary job. Justin at the conceirge and the rest of the staff. A worthy stay for business visitors with an in-room wifi connection and prompt room service to housekeeping. You guys probably can change the breakfast buffet menu atleast once in a week. It really gets boring to eat the same things through out the week. A good bar in the hotel itself and quite love the location. For travellers, this one is quite centrally located. I did feel the need for an indoor swimming though, that would have completed it. But guess cant do much about it.

Reviews.Title: “Go for the whole experience (Hotel/Restaurant/Bar)”
Reviews.Author: aca925
Reviews.Content: The quality of this hotel is evident every step of the way. I arrived in the evening, to find a very trendy bar with the 20 - 30-something upscale crowd swarming the bar. The bed was dreamy. The room service was divine. The best part of this hotel was, for me, the price! I didn't want to pay $199 for the Westin, where my conference was, so I tried priceline.com. I put in $130, Five Stars, in the Back Bay area. This was the hotel I was given! Great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Nice break from the chains”
Reviews.Author: HurdyGurdyMan
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel through a priceline bid and was eager to check it out. Early check-in was granted and bell service offered. The room was modern enough although a king sized room only offered a queen size bed and the room itself was a bit on the small side.The bed itself was decent, not great. The bathroom was pretty cool with a heated towel rack and a motion detector light under the sink that was very helpful for those late night toilet trips. There was also a type of oversized walk-in shower complete with dual shower heads which me and my wife enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: mbld123
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at the Back Bay Hotel and were very happy we splurged a bit to stay there. Pros: - Very very comfortable bed and pillows - Very friendly and helpful staff - Clean room - Very quiet hotel, didn't hear any other guests around us - Great location, perfect for sight seeing and walking to and from the Charles Playhouse to see the Blue Man Group - Wonderful walk-in shower with 2 shower heads (one above as usual, and one at hip level) - Motion-activated night light under the vanity in the bathroom - 2 complimentary bottles of water in the micro-fridge Cons: - The AC has a low-powered mode that it goes into when there is no activity in the room. That's okay when you aren't in the room. However, you don't move enough while sleeping to keep the AC on, so we woke up a couple of times incredibly hot and had to get up and walk around the room to get the AC to kick back on. Sleep quality would've been and "Excellent" if it wasn't for this AC issue. - The Master Power switch was off when we first entered the room, so we were a bit confused as to why the bathroom lights wouldn't switch on, until we saw the "Master" label on one of the switches. This was generally fine, but that complimentary water was warm because the fridge was not on. - I knew this before-hand, but was still disappointed that there was no coffee maker in the room - The room was a bit smaller than expected, but was understandable considering we are in the city and we were in a regular queen-bed room. Overall, we were incredibly happy with our stay, and if we stay in Boston again, we will stay at the Back Bay Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Dreams...”
Reviews.Author: Daphne418
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed one night as a birthday get away in town. Just as the other reviewers describe, the Back Bay was cozy but charming hotel. You canâ€™t go wrong if you need a nice place to stay and close to the Back Bay area. A block away from the hustle and bustle of tourists and businesses, it was tucked away but easy to find, check in and out was smooth, overall service was great. Lots of shops and restaurants in walking distance or if you walk too far, take a cab back. We had a corner king room on the 8th floor. It was a smaller room but cozy and large bathroom. Overall clean and well decorated. A little worn but well kept. Only huge negative and turnoff was the extremely dirty remote which looked likeâ€¦never mind. Since the local restaurants were swamped in the afternoon with a 40+ minute wait and I was â€œstarvingâ€�, we ended up back at Cuffs, bar at hotel, for a late lunch and drinks. The food and service were good and drinks went down easy. It didnâ€™t feel like a â€œhotel barâ€�. We used the valet parking, room service for breakfast, and ordered a movie. All were great, though the movies are a little pricey. Breakfast was average but we chose to stay in versus going out. We came to relax and rest (I was under the weather unfortunately) and the hotel and room were extremely quiet and it felt like we were the only guests on the floor. I typically donâ€™t sleep well at hotels but in this case I got my 8 hours of sleep! A huge plus/kudos to the hotel for not making us feel like we were rushed or on their time table â€“ we felt like true guests. I didnâ€™t see a check in/out time on reservation, their website, or in the room nor were we reminded at check in. This set the tone for our 24+ hours of relaxing. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “A short trip, made very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Jcollins007
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Back Bay in January for 3 nights and really enjoyed it. Very comfortable room, clean, modern design with everything I needed. Staff were very very helpful. Only ate once, in the Irish pub downstairs, but the food was very good. I'd definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Boston 4 day break”
Reviews.Author: Barry G
Reviews.Content: We choose the Back Bay Hotel from the reviews on tripadvisor, and we were not disappointed. The Location of this hotel was excellent for getting around Boston, The room was very spacious clean and the large shower was great for a family of four. All the hotel staff from Valet services upon arrival, through to guest services and restaurant/bar were charming attentive and helpful throughout our stay. We would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I was tired, early and welcomed with open arms...”
Reviews.Author: Justine O
Reviews.Content: I had taken the red-eye in from San Francisco and arrived at the hotel around 8AM. I was tired and a wee cranky, anticipating to sleep a few hours in the hotel lobby until my room was ready. But lo and behold, they had a room available and were happy to get me in early. Now, as a seasoned traveler- this very rarely happens and even if hotels do have your room available, they often won't get you in until 12noon, and understandable policy. But goodness me, was I ever so pleased to be able to get some shut eye in a bed. The hotel itself was really quite stunning, the staff was utterly pleasant without being fake. The door men remembered me each time, the restaurant was a bit pricey but worth EVERY penny (delicious!). My room was on the 2nd floor facing a little alley but was surprisingly quiet. The room was a bit on the small side but laid out well and had everything I needed (free wifi and a desk). The spaciousness was were it counts- in the bathroom! Great shower. Overall, very, very please with the location, the price and the staff. I would come back and recommend this to anyone traveling to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Birthday Weekend”
Reviews.Author: BodhisMommy
Reviews.Content: For my husbands birthday I planned a night out in the Back Bay area. I found this hotel on T.A. and we got a great deal booking with one of their winter getaway packages. The hotel and service was consistently above and beyond. The valet service was so fast and helpful, they got our bags to our room shortly after we finished checking in and gave us bottled water for the ride home. And we were happy that we never had to wait for a taxi. We had a delux suite which was a generous size (especially if you are used to hotel rooms in the city). One of my favorite little details was the motion sensor light in the bathroom that was very dim - just enough to light the floor for you in the dark. The turn down service was a nice touch to come back to after dinner, we had an espresso maker in the room and complimentary water in the mini fridge (which is not stocked with a mini bar, something I really like). The building itself is gorgeous with every detail in place. We had no problems getting a wonderful nights sleep, never heard a single neighbor (which is something to appreciate if you have ever stayed somewhere where the walls are so thin you feel like you are sleeping in the hallway). We had breakfast in the restaurant on the ground floor in the morning, the buffet was included with our package (a $50 credit for 2), and it was impressive for a buffet. Included in the buffet was the option of freshly cooked eggs any way or an omelette. We were both very happy wit the service and food. Over all we were both just so happy with our stay, the staff, the amenities and all service from beginning to end. We hope to go back in the summer so we can do some more walking and less taxing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodations and personal service”
Reviews.Author: 4659kelly
Reviews.Content: Went to visit our son who lives in Boston. Wanted a hotel within walking distance of great restaurants and shopping...which Back Bay provided. The best part was their wonderful assistance with our daughter who needs a wheel chair. They provided one free of charge and were extremely attentive to her needs within the hotel. Definitely will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - Probably better located hotels out there”
Reviews.Author: DebAndNick
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel, tidy and all the expected comforts of a 4 star hotel. I just felt it was a business hotel and as a tourist for the first time in Boston there are far better located hotels, as we discovered on our many walks. Further out than i thought it would be and not much around it apart form a few more upperclass restaurants etc (when i say further out, everything is still well within walking distict, you just dont walk out the hotel lobby and feel like you are in the heart of it) . Didn't dig the "Irish" Bar downstairs, how its an irish bar i dont really know. Would stay there again on Business without a doubt...

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Boston trip with teens”
Reviews.Author: Elvis422
Reviews.Content: My family took a trip the week after Christmas. The location of the hotel was perfect. My high school and college aged kids were able to explore city independently while my husband and I could go sightseeing alone. We were close enough to walk to Copley Plaza, Newberry St., Boston Commons, the subway, and great dining options. Parking by the valet was costly but well worth it. Staff was very pleasant and helpful. On site restaurant and lounge was great too. Great memories!

Reviews.Title: “A welcoming stay, as always”
Reviews.Author: Helen C
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from Boston and my 3rd stay at The Back Bay Hotel. I really love this place. It's location is definitely a huge plus point - right in the heart of the Back Bay area, within easy walking distance of some great shopping (Newbury Street, the Prudential Center etc), restaurants and Boston Common, as well as a number of 'T' stations. As for the hotel itself, it has real character throughout: from the buidling (the old Police Headquarters, to the classic decor, to the people working there. The rooms (although not necessarily huge) are comfortable, very clean and have great bathrooms. The bar (Cuffs) downstairs is a great place to hang out, relax and defrost in front of the fire and feels much more cosy and welcoming than a lot of hotel bars I've been in. The staff have been fantastic on every visit and this time was no exception. They smile, say hello to you in the corridor and hold doors open for you. I have always made to feel like a welcome guest and will definitely return to the hotel in future.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: Elsa3
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. It is a very nice hotel in a good location. It is 3 blocks walk to Trinity Church. The staff was friendly and helpful. There is a bar/lounge on the botton floor which which nice to relax in after a day of touring. I especially liked the seperate shower and bath in the room. Shower also had a body spray. That was totally unexpected. I look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the name scare ou”
Reviews.Author: DCJD2012
Reviews.Content: I needed a last minute hotel for a business trip. It was the same weekend as a big event at Harvard, so there were very few rooms in the city. My travel service was able to locate a room at this hotel, and not knowing anything about it it, other than it being named the "Back Bay Hotel," I was in great fear of it being a small, independent tourist trap in the Back Bay. I was wrong. It was perfect for what I needed and I will stay there again. I was the very briefly, but found it to be more than adequate.The room service was also good and the front desk staff was extremely friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great First Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: BOBFOC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the New Years (First Night). Check in went smoothly. No wait whatsoever. They already assigned us a quiet room on a high floor, which was good as we'd emailed after making the booking requesting this. Room was nice. Some reviews here have said they're quite dated, but I'd more accurately used the description 'classic'. Decoration is old or classy looking, BUT not old if you know what I mean. I liked it as it was cosy. Free wifi, inroom safe, great bathroom, and a variety of tv channels made it a great place to rest when we weren't out and about sightseeing. Location is almost perfect (10 mins walk to two T stops). Just off the main square in Back Bay so you're near everything without having to contest with traffic and tourists. Loads of great restaurants nearby and the Prudential centre for shopping. Never used any of their other facilities, but staff were always courteous to us whenever we walked past. Checkout was smooth, and they gave us regular access to our luggage the day we left, whilst we were doing some last minute shopping. Would happily return here next time I go to Boston. Ps: Make sure you goto Neptune Oyster in Boston. Best seafood restaurant we've been to bar none!

Reviews.Title: “A short 3 night stay in January 2012”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth W
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent 3 very happy days in Boston , staying at the Back Bay Hotel.The hotel is very well located to be within walking distance of the "must see" items on our list. It is 5 or 10 minutes walk from underground stations. The staff at the hotel were warm and friendly, nothing was ever too much trouble.The concierge was painstakingly helpful in helping us to plan our sight seeing. The beds and rooms were very comfortable ;and we experienced very good room service for the evening meal ,the first evening. We ate from the good and varied breakfast menu, but chose to dine and the plentiful nearby restaurants. In all a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend out.”
Reviews.Author: Nahant_Snique
Reviews.Content: We needed a night out in the city, and the Back Bay Hotel didn't disappoint. We had a nice, corner room with King Bed and huge bathroom (I'm not sure if that's the case for all King rooms, but this was great). The location of the hotel is right around the corner from great restaurants and shopping... allowing you to walk around rather than taking cabs or T. The hotel restaurant/bar (Cuffs) was great and one of the few hotel bars we found in the city with a working fireplace to sit next to and hide from the Boston winter... Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: TheCogsShow
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in almost every capacity. The service is phenomenal and no matter what I called down for at any time day or night, they were able to accommodate me with a pleasant voice on the other end of the phone and a cheerful smile at my door. The location is perfectly placed in the center of the city and there are hundreds of great restaurants and bars within walking distance. I will definitely be using this hotel the next time I'm in Beantown.

Reviews.Title: “well priced, well located”
Reviews.Author: fearanti
Reviews.Content: stayed here for three nights in Jan '12. booked in advance and got a good non-refundable rate. Room was of decent size, quiet, good facilities. The breakfast service downstairs was haphazard each morning, but the food was fine. Great location for downtown Boston (near Boston Common which was covered in snow on my 5am walk). There was noise on the street outside from some construction but as soon as I mentioned it they moved me to a quieter, better room.

Reviews.Title: “First Class All the Way”
Reviews.Author: Global_Coug
Reviews.Content: Ok, this is another one of those spendy places that you're happy the firm is paying for when you're traveling. The Back Bay was in great shape, the room was well-appointed and spacious, and the staff were very polite and helpful. I'm a shower guy, so I liked the big shower that they had. I don't know if they have rooms with tubs, but you might want to ask if that's important to you. Also, despite the bathroom being very large, the countertop around the sink was very small and the only place for towels was about 6 to 8 feet away from the shower and the sink. On the other hand, the towels sat on a towel warmer. Gotta love it. My only other knock is that they went PC on the light bulbs. I really dislike rooms with dim lights and my idea of saving energy is make more of it. Finally, my room was very quiet. Nifty, Nespresso coffee maker in the room and I love espressos.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: TravelingCoaches
Reviews.Content: Stayed here so we could hit up a Red Sox Game and the SOWA market...both were within walking distance! I would especially recommend staying here if you are in town for a game. We met some people who arrived back at the hotel the same time we did (about a 30 min walk) and they drove! The hotel was awesome- staff were helpful, room was spacious and immaculate, and there were fantastic bathrobes to wear! I would recommend checking out http://boston.bestparking.com/index.php as we got great rates on overnight parking only a 5 minute walk away from the hotel!!! Can't wait to hit up another game soon- we will definitely re-book at Back Bay!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: 29Lu
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Back Bay for a few days in December with two kids. The room was very spacious and comfortable for all of us. We caught the train from New York to Boston and we were delighted to see that the hotel was within walking distance to the Back Bay Station. We were also within walking distance to Newbury Street (shopping) and the Boston Common. The restaurant in the hotel was excellent and all of the staff were very helpful and friendly. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Construction in the area”
Reviews.Author: DonnyQ
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, excellent staff, construction in the area means you will be up at 7:00AM

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay In Boston”
Reviews.Author: nhore
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely hotel. The Service was great from the moment we arrived. The Bell Men and the bar staff were excellent. Nice room, although was a little small. The Breakfast was overpriced, i had pancakes one morning and they were not tasty, nicely served but not great and a little burnt on one side. Good Location near Newbury Street and Shopping centres. The hotel consierge was a lovely lady she arranged a trip for us to the Wrenthem Village outlets which are definately worth the trip. Bar food was gorgeous and well priced. really nice warm fire and comfortable bar. We booked online on their website and they made a mistake on our bill we eventually sorted it out. its a good idea to check bill at the end just to make sure.

Reviews.Title: “really nice stay”
Reviews.Author: relco
Reviews.Content: We booked through Bookit.com and got a great rate. We were upgraded to a deluxe king corner room which was very nice and had a Nespresso coffee machine which was very welcome. There is turn down service, and the staff is very helpful and very nice. We ate at Ticos just a block away which was delicious and came back and had a delicious dessert and coffee at Cuffs Irish Bar. Breakfast in the morning in the hotel was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Not fantastic, but ok”
Reviews.Author: ChaseMeridian
Reviews.Content: I stayed 8 days at the Back Bay for a business trip in nov. 2011. I confess I had expected a bit more, seeing the reviews on Tripadvisor, but found the rooms to be fairly average and quite anonymous. The staff was great though, as was the food, and the location - close to everything !- can't be faulted.

Reviews.Title: “Xmas trip to Boston”
Reviews.Author: Alan&Sylvia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Back Bay December 26th - December 31st 2012 and had a wonderful city break. The hotel is housed in the old Boston Police Headquarters and has a great location and feel about it. Looks great too! We got a great deal with BA Holidays and got a free upgrade on arrival. Front of house staff were polite and helpful. Every member of staff were unfailingly friendly and attentive. We had late afternoon drinks most days in the Cuffs Irish bar and the staff were very professional. The location is excellent, quiet and convienient for most areas. There were good restaurants within easy walking distanct including Legal Sea Foods and Skipjacks which were both fantastic for fish. On our first day we walked the Freedom Trail and this was a great way of finding your bearings around the best city in the USA. We also bought a three day trolly bus ticket and this included a Duck tour (amphibious truck) of Boston harbour. The drivers were great and gave so much information laced with some humourous stories of city history. Highly recommended. Overall the Back Bay hotel was a perfect base for our trip and provided high quality, comfortable rooms with exceptional customer service. I can't praise it enough!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: baseball111997
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here in December. The location is great except there is construction going on all day and night. I would ask for a room away from the construction. The room was nice although not exceptional. The staff was very pleasant. The overnight parking fee is exorbitant but that is true of most hotels in Boston. I have stayed at most of the hotels in Boston over time. I would rate the Four Season as the best hotel so far but it is very expensive. Overall staying at the Back Bay hotel was a pleasant experience at a personable and small hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “From start to finish; superb”
Reviews.Author: EimearT
Reviews.Content: My first time travelling on my own, I choose this hotel as the location looked safe, and hotel was of a good standard, and being from Ireland, the in house Irish bar tempted me. On arrival service was prompt, there was alot of business Christmas parties on in the bar, which made me realise, this really is quite an up market stay! As I was travelling alone, I took solace in a bar a few feet down the street called Flashes, where I met some amazing people, and they have alot of inhouse beers, so definitly recommend for a pit stop. Great place, if like me, you are on your own, it won't take long to fall into conversation with someone at the bar! Hotel gave complimentary newsapers, the Irish breakfast was of ok quality. The room itself, had a fabulous big bed, stereo system, good sized bathroom, with both bath and shower. I didn't spend alot of time using the hotel facilities,but overall, close to the centre of Boston, very ideal for site seeing and the Irish feel completed my stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for girls' weekend”
Reviews.Author: Googlehead
Reviews.Content: A group of seven of us spent a weekend at the Back Bay and found it to be conveniently located for shopping, dinners and nightlife. The hotel itself was very comfortable and well-maintained. Check in was quick and incredibly helpful (complete with a tip for getting into a bar/restaurant around the corner on a busy Friday night). Beds were very comfortable in the room and the bathroom well-equipped and spacious. I especially loved the trick of having dim sensor lights beneath the bathroom vanity: no stumbling for lights in the middle of the night in an unfamiliar space. I also loved that the hotel acknowledges that I know how to function in a hotel room and did not post little signs everywhere. The Back Bay Hotel is a couple of blocks away from the busier areas which was perfect in my view as it made for a quiet stay. Highly recommend Tico for delicious latin food mere steps away as well as Mistral for Sunday brunch - though be warned - portions are enormous!

Reviews.Title: “Does what it does quite well!”
Reviews.Author: CardKirb08
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights over New Years in the Back Bay Hotel and really enjoyed it. If you're looking for a comfortable, modern home base for your visit to Boston with a touch of character, this is a great choice! Pros: Wonderful bed, very clean, flat screen TV with good channel selection (typical these days, but worth noting), in-room fridge, free bottled water, free wi-fi, shower, towel warmers, modern & stylish decor, friendly yet unobtrusive staff, location allows for short walks to the financial district, heart of Back Bay, Boston Common, and Beacon Hill Cons: "Superior" room is just a tad too small... I'd rather have a larger room and smaller bathroom than vice versa, While the location is ultimately convenient, it would have been nicer to be more in the center of Back Bay activity (hotel is on a sleepy block 2-3 blocks away from the "action"). We didn't dine in the hotel, but the restaurant menu was enticing. We didn't use the workout room either, but it looked surprisingly large. It's not a luxury hotel, nor a truly full-service hotel, but it's a great alternative to the over-priced options right on Copley Square.

Reviews.Title: “We'd go back to the Back Bay!”
Reviews.Author: J-and-M-on-tour
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in December & loved it! We got a complimentary upgrade to a deluxe room which was lovely! Huge bathroom - bath & separate shower, Nespresso machine & lots of space. Breakfast in the Stanhope Grill was included in our package & was great! Lots of buffet choice; fruit,cereal,yoghurt, pancakes, bacon, sausages, eggs benedict, scrambled eggs (with an option to order eggs anyway you like too) bagels, smoked salmon , pastries .... Fresh orange juice & tea or coffee - what more could you need? We used the bar several times too - not quite sure what makes it an "Irish bar" though? Although beers were fine, they did struggle a little with mixed drinks here, giving us a glass of coke to mix ourselves when we said we'd like to do our own mixing! Also , no Irish music, sports, staff ... Didn't bother us though, we've been to Dublin! The free coffee in the morning available in the lounge was a nice touch I thought . All the staff we encountered were friendly & helpful without being too in your face. Would definitely stay here again & recommend to friends too.

Reviews.Title: “Boston Back Bay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: scmcgloi
Reviews.Content: In all respect this hotel has the appeal of old school with an up beat twist on its amenities. I found upon my arrival the staff to be a little off with their greeting. Which can have an immediate impact on the outcome of someones stay. The room was spacious enough with a very comfortable kind size bed. The bathroom was outstanding with a steam shower and plenty of room. If you like the feel of old school with the updates I would recommend this hotel. I would've preferred a little more customer sevice interaction. Overall not a big fan of this place but would recommend it to someone who is looking for style, class and a quiet night in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “An awesome hotel in the Back Bay”
Reviews.Author: SarahAtkinson
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lenox last year and thought that was really nice - but the Back Bay Hotel was even better! All the staff was really friendly and helpful, the room was immaculate and a bit bigger than expected. It was nice to return to our room at the end of the day and have our ice bucket filled during the turn-down service. It's the little touches that make a huge difference!

Reviews.Title: “A very big Thank You”
Reviews.Author: annette h
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful stay at your Hotel. From the moment we arrived we were made feel at home. Thank you to all the wonderful Staff, every member was friendly and helpfull. Most definately a true Gem in a beautiful City. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Back Bay Gem”
Reviews.Author: CT316
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a Saturday night through a deal with SniqueAway. The hotel is located very conveniently to Newbury Street and the T line. I had previously stayed here when it was Jury's Hotel. Our room was a standard room with a king sized bed. The room was spacious with a nice-sized shower-only bathroom that looked like it was recently redone. The staff were friendly and helpful. The bed was extremely comfortable. My one complaint about this hotel is that there was no coffee maker in the room. We had to order pots of coffee and tea through room service. This was expensive and since everyone else was doing the same thing, it took quite a whole for our order to arrive. Overall, I like this hotel and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good location. Expected nicer room.”
Reviews.Author: PhilaTraveler22
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through sniqueaway and paid 140 a night for Friday and Saturday stay. I would have thought that the service, amenities and rooms would have been just a little higher-end for how much the rooms go for at regular price. The hotel is in a very convenient area- just a short walk from Back Bay station, the Prudential Center and nice shopping streets. The rooms are pretty small. The photos make it look larger. The shower is an older-style tub vs the shower enclosure I was expecting. Bed is comfy, tv is big (but very few basic channels). I would stay here again if I got a good deal- but even for the 140 I paid I would rather stay at another hotel I like, such as the Ames, if there was a special.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: BioPro W
Reviews.Content: The front-desk service was very friendly and helpful while we checked in. Our room was very nice--a large bathroom with both a shower and bathtub, a VERY comfortable bed & the espresso machine was a nice touch. The convenience of the fridge in the room was nice & I loved the night service of chocolates & a softly playing radio when we came in from dinner. Very nice!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but wish we had a larger room”
Reviews.Author: kad1227
Reviews.Content: Every year my husband and myself make an annual trip with my brother and his wife to stay overnight and take in a show in Boston. This year I selected the Back Bay hotel based on all of the excellent reviews it received. I reserved the Deluxe room thinking that it would be larger and would have the walk in shower that was described on the website. We were assigned room 820 and when we walked in, I was a bit disappointed but just figured the rooms are smaller at this hotel especially it being a police station at one time. We met my brother prior to going to dinner and when I walked into his room, my mouth dropped. It was a nice spacious room with a huge bathroom. He was assigned room 238. He actually reserved a superior room but as it turned out, he received an upgrade. I did inquire at the desk and they did offer to change our room, but at that point we were settled in and heading off to dinner. I guess I would just be aware that not all the Delxue rooms are the same so when you do check in, make sure you receive what you think you are getting. We did up going to the bar later that night and it was fun. Great drinks! We had breakfast at the Stanhope Grille the next day as it was included in on the AAA package but it only included the buffet. I was fine with it but my husband would have preferred to order off the menu. He is a pancake lover and was not impressed with the pancakes at the buffet. Construction at this hotel was a problem. We heard construction pretty much all night which was a bit annoying. Our room was on the 8th floor but we could still here it. The beds are quite comfortable the staff are extremely friendly. From the time we entered the hotel and left, everyone was extremely nice. The location of the hotel is excellent. We went to DaVincis for dinner which we all enjoyed which is only minutes away. We walked to the Citi performance Center which is also a nice walk away. Hightly recommend the Rockettes Christmas Show. It was excellent. We also parked at the garage at 100 Claredon which again is only a block away from the hotel. Look online for a coupon to park overnight for $19.00. Not sure what it would have been otherwise. Lastly, check out Marshalls at 500 Boylston Street. I really enjoyed that with the two floors. Better selection then any Marshalls out in the suburbs.

Reviews.Title: “Great city, great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: A&MLeeds
Reviews.Content: Really happy with the Back Bay hotel, lovely rooms and a good base to explore the city. Freedom trail walking distance one way and Pru center etc shops the other way. Free coffee in reception when we visited and free bottled water in the rooms both very handy.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: tmtkw
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the back bay hotel for 3 nights and I had a great experience there. The location was excellent (close to lots of restaurant and shopping!) still quiet inside the hotel. In the room was a large flat screen TV, refrigerator, complimentary bottled water, the latest 'Boston' magazine and some nice guides to the area. I also liked the free wifi in the room. BUT, there is no coffee maker however, if you ask, they will bring hot water and tea cups (they didn't charge for it) you can make a cup of tea if you bring tea bags!!

Reviews.Title: “just great”
Reviews.Author: david t
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Back Bay Hotel as part of a trip with Virgin Holidays and were not disapointed.Good location,lovely room,pleasant staff and Cuffs bar was just great-- the best blue cheese burger ever!

Reviews.Title: “Great place and great location”
Reviews.Author: Everyonehappy
Reviews.Content: We had a great family weekend in Boston with all ages with college age kids and an 83 year old grandma.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Blend of Euro American plus Good Location”
Reviews.Author: hawky_23
Reviews.Content: Hi, just returned from 5 days in Boston for our 1st visit there. (did NYC last year) Booked via BA and got a great deal, Thanksgiving week I find is great for tourist as most areas are pretty quiet up until Black Friday. (Then it just goes mad!) The Back Bay Hotel we found to be a fantastic all round hotel & base. We had a Kingsize deluxe I believe, great comfy bed, nexpresso machine, fridge, bottled water daily etc. Large bathroom inc bath, robe, quality towels in fact everything exceeded our expectations in every way. Every night with our weary feet we returned to classical music, dimmed lights and chocolates on the bed.. luxury :-) as part of their turn down service. Celebrating out 25th wedding anniversary on the arriving Monday we had bubbly on ice and hand made chocs awaiting us with a personilsed accompanying card (on the house I may add :-)... which was a wonderful touch. Staff were happy, attentive and eager to assist... many thanks to all the staff who made our stay so great. The area we found was ideal to explore as so central, 2 blocks up was Newbury St, which is a great walk leading down to the Prudential Building and Copley Mall etc, a few blocks away also is Boston Common etc.& easy to navigate to and from as next to the John Hancock bulding. The hotel bar "Cuffs" was appealing as again staff great, nice warm fire and always had residents or even passers by in, the beer (local lagers/beers etc) slightly more expensive than the street bars but acceptable. We are great explorers so did not actually eat there but scanned tripadvisor for "interesting" haunts to try, I can recommend the Paramount on charles st for an authentic Boston breakfast exerience, Mikes Pastries up on Hanover (Little Italy, for a carry out box of treats yum yum!) The thinking cup overlooking the top of the common for a relaxed and great coffee. We also tried Atlantic Fish Co.. superb fresh fish and slightly up market but then you get what you pay for :-) Even the food courts were good if on budget :-) For a real Boston feel and an economical meal try the pour house just past the prudential, great burgers, wraps and beer ooooo and more beers. (May look scary from the outside - but go in live a little) The back Bay hotel we found to have an excellent blend of european design and feel with great american service and would recommend this to anyone looking for somewhere to visit Boston who appreciates location, quality surroundings of both staff and the hotel as a whole. Boston itself was beautiful this time of year, not so fast and in your face as NYC, lower skyline meaning more light to the streets, all areas walkable, great shopping, it has a great culture and history, and the people much more friendly and a sense of humour :-) We hope to return - many thanks and well done Back Bay :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice facility”
Reviews.Author: Lambert B
Reviews.Content: Managed to get a good rate for a weekend in Boston. Hotel well situated, short walk to Newbury and the Boston Common. The main part of the city is small enough to be accessible on foot from the hotel. Attended play at Boston Centre for the Arts which was a seven minute walk. Hotel used to be the Police Headquarters which gives it a historical charm. The downstairs pub is always busy. Staff very friendly....the room we had (king bed) was on the small side but totally comfortable. Nearest subway is Back Bay or Arlington (a bit awkward access from the airport ..shuttle bus, subway, short walk but then 2$ fare is worth a bit of trouble). Restaurant in hotel is pricey and better to get breakfast at Gregory's Cafe next door or brunch at Club Cafe a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Wish it was perfect....”
Reviews.Author: SMUMOM
Reviews.Content: I wish I could say everything was perfect but unfortunantly there were a couple of issues. The good news is the hotel is very lovely and in a wonderful location, close to everything! I was traveling with my young daughter and we loved the convenience to all the shopping and restaurants. Room service was excellent and the food outstanding...the BEST coffee! The not so good news...I know from past experience at hotels that the late bird gets the left overs. We checked in at around 9:30 pm. and when we arrived at our room we noticed the door was ajar. I first thought they'd given us a room that was already occupied but we found it empty and clean so we went in and unpacked. The room was very lovely but there was a very damp/wet/sticky feeling in the air, like the humidity level was very high. I turned on the Air Conditioner to try to get the dampness out of the air, then left for a late dinner. Upon our return I notice the room still felt damp and that the A/C was not cooling. Then, when I finally took off my shoes and walked on the carpet, my socks were instantly wet! The carpet was completely wet....It appeared they shampooed it that day but obviously it was not going to dry quickly in that damp room without decent air circulating. I called down to the hotel desk and spoke to Chris or Craig? who informed me the carpets had been cleaned that day then apologized and offered to send up some slippers. I told him about the non-working A/C and he said it was too cold outside for the A/C to work? It was about 50 degrees outside that evening...balmy for Boston standards...he suggested I open the window.... Then, when I walked into the bathroom I noticed the toiletries consisted of only 2 bars of soap, no lotions, shampoo, or conditioner. I called Chris/Craig again and asked for the items to be sent up. If my daugher and I hadn't been so tired and already unpacked, I would have asked to switch rooms because of the wet carpet, but even though I didn't ask, it would have been nice for the hotel to offer. My guess is another guest had been given that room earlier in the day, they refused to stay on wet carpet and were moved but decided to pilfer the toiletries out of the bathroom before they left. We did try to sleep with the window open that night, until I couldn't stand the outside noise any longer....the sirens of police cars seemed to be constant. Slowly through the weekend the carpet dried...I turn on the heater when we were gone to help. It was still damp between the 2 beds even after 3 days. Based on all the previously stellar reviews of the Back Bay hotel, I have no doubt my issues are the exception and not the rule, it is just unfortunant it had to happen to me!

Reviews.Title: “Consistently good”
Reviews.Author: LondonWelshDragon
Reviews.Content: I stay in this hotel on a regular basis. The rooms are very well appointed and its comfortable for a short visit. Good location too.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, the Back Bay Boston”
Reviews.Author: Sally F
Reviews.Content: This was a great experience. The hotel facilities and staff were all top notch. Everything was friendly and luxurious. FOr a family of four on a budget, we requested the lowest priced room and were impressed by the large space, fine decor and towel warmers! The location is within many landmarks and the Aquarium. Also the staff gave great reccommendations for local dining that kept us away from "chains". the hotel dining was also very good. We enjoyed the pub as well as the breakfast. All superb. We will stay here every time we go to Boston. We are now officially spoiled!

Reviews.Title: “Everything was just swell!”
Reviews.Author: TIpperGee13
Reviews.Content: We spent so long deciding on where to stay in Boston. We just couldn't decide! I am sooooo happy we chose The Back Bay Hotel. The staff were super helpful. The rooms are comfortable, smartly decorated. Bathroom is perfect for two people on a short stay. We had a room with a shower but no bath which was fine. I asked for a room on a low floor because I suffer from vertigo and the reception sorted this in advance of our arrival. (this never happens!! however many times i have asked in other hotels i always end up on the 22nd floor! ugh!) There is a great room service list which is 24 hours and very quick. I recommend the Breakfast Buffet at $23 - well worth it! Sets you up for a day of sightseeing! The restaurant is great. We ate in there on the first night. Lovely food. Well cooked. Great flavours. Great Clam Chowder. I must say how nice Greg (I think that was his name) in the restaurant was. Really helpful, friendly and genuinely interested in making your evening/stay as good as possible. Big thumbs up! Thank you Greg! I would definitely stay here if I am in Boston again. The location can not be beaten to discover the city. The 'T' is a couple of blocks away as is the Amtrak line to NYC. If you need your Starbucks fix there is one two blocks away. The Pru is within walking distance. VERY GOOD PLACE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Good location”
Reviews.Author: summersalt9
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights in October and really enjoyed it. The hotel is in the old police headquarters which is pretty cool history. The room was a good size with very nice bedding. The bathroom was one of the best parts. It was large and included a large walk-in shower with towel warmer (though the towel warmer was across the bathroom from the shower which didn't make much sense), two large spa-like terry-cloth robes, generous complimentary spa-type toiletries, and a large 'close-up' mirror for applying make-up, etc. (in addition to a regular mirror, of course) Also in the room was a large flat screen TV, refrigerator (w/2 complimentary bottles of water inside), the latest 'Boston' magazine and some nice guides to the area. The front desk staff was very helpful and very pleasant. (Though the doorman didn't say hi or welcome me once.) The front desk staff were more than happy to let us leave our bags in their holding area near the front desk since my flight wasn't until 5pm on Sunday. Note, the little coffee/barista on the first floor (you must pay for coffee) is NOT open on Sunday mornings. (But there are many coffee shops you can walk to.) Breakfast is NOT included but there is a restaurant in the lower level of the hotel. We did not eat there so I don't know if it is good or not. The restaurant across the street seemed popular in the evening so I imagine it must be pretty decent, however we did not eat there. The location of the hotel was in the nice Backbay area with lots of shopping and restaurants within an easy walk. To get here from the airport was pretty easy, however you do have to take two different 'T' trains (switch once) to get there and then walk about 2-3 blocks. (Though I imagine most people that stay here would pay to take a cab from their airport which is about a 20 min cab ride I believe.) The closest 'T stop is about 2-3 blocks away but the stop is pretty central and allows easy access to most other parts of Boston without switching trains much if at all. I'd definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: lissea
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right in the heart of everything in Boston. Walking distance to Fenway Park and to the Aquarium. Lots of restaurants close by. Lovely ambiance. Rooms were large and spacious. Very clean and modern.

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Stay”
Reviews.Author: missybrown
Reviews.Content: A truly first class hotel Beginning with the hotel's lobby with museum quality art and sculpture The rooms are a great size complete with very comfortable beds, soundproof walls large marble bathrooms tub and separate shower. Every room is equipped with a wonderful Nespresso machine . The staff is trained well ready to accomodate and the hotel bar Cuffs was great. The hotel is in the best location within walking distance to superb restaurants shopping. The hotel is part of the Eurpoean Doyle Group and certainly has a boutiquey European feel throughout. Next trip to Boston I will be staying at the Back Bay Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “best price for location”
Reviews.Author: Baggagegirl
Reviews.Content: Comfortable room, plenty of space to share with my Mother. Easy walk to Newbury St., which is fun window shopping and restaurants. Pleasant staff. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel for reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Voyles
Reviews.Content: beautiful room, attractive lobby and facilities; not cheap but reasonable for an upper end hotel in the heart of the city and attractions; next trip to Boston will return here; it is owned by an Irish company and has a European feel;

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: WileyMom
Reviews.Content: The guest services were wonderful, as soon as we walked in they were able to accomodate our requests (early check-in). Otherwise, their restaurant's clam chowder is pretty amazing. We slept well and were very impressed. On the down side, the rooms are pretty small but it's only because it's an old building. Charging for internet in their business center is also not a good move, in my opinion. You're already paying a hefty amount for the room.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Bathroom & Helpful Concierge”
Reviews.Author: Maakiii
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3nights at this hotel (Nov 9-12,'11) in Room #830. This hotel is very close to both train stations (couple blocks), orange line/amtrak Back Bay station & green line Arlington. Train was very easy to use and we felt very safe ($2 per ride). We took taxi several occations and it took much longer than train and charged us more than usual, so it is better to use train. Also, Boston is very easy to walk. We walked most of the sights include, freedom train starting point (10min), duck tour departure point(5min), Cheers restaurant at Becon Hill(10min), Faneuil Hall Market Place (20min) etc. Copley Square is just around corner and plenty of restaurants, cafe, shops are near by. We took taxi to airport and it was 15min ride and cost $16 plus tip. Very good location! Hotel Room (Superior Room with 2 DBL beds) Pro: Spacious and very clean bathroom with plenty of towels. Complimentary Wi-Fi (good connection), local calls, use of room safe and empty mini refrigerator. 2 small closets with plenty of hangers. Hotel Room Con: No coffee maker in the room, Not good view, Heat/Air Conditioning does not walk well and our room gets very dry(tend to get very warm but you can open small window). Complaints: *This hotel advertise as umbrella provided in the room for complimentary use but there wasn't any in our room. We asked several times but no umbrella available, so we end up purchasing one on our own. *3adults registered and stayed in the room but house keeping only set the room for 2 adults every time they clean our room. We kept reminded both guest service and house keeping but they seems cannot set room for 3 adults, so we have to ask every day to bring up another bottled water and towels. *We requested and made special note at the time of booking but they seems not reading it or ignored. (maybe we booked from hotels.com?) Nothing special for anniversary celebration or birthday. Notes: Our room was by the elevator and across from the construction site. However, we didn't hear much noise and it was fairly quiet considering in the city. Hotel Service Pro: Lovely and very helpful concierge Heather! She is very friendly and informative. Also, we didn't catch the name but another concierge who work in the evening was very helful as well. Both of them went extra mile to help us. Great Job for both of you & Big Thank You! Hotel Service Con: Internet- if you don't have i phone/pad or laptop, they have two computers available but they will charge you by minutes. Boarding pass printing is free but didn't work. Overall, we like this hotel as it is very clean and great location. Also, friendly & helpful concierge made our stay more memorable. Hope we can visit Boston again near future to see Bruins!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and great location!”
Reviews.Author: exeter95
Reviews.Content: I stayed here when it was Jurys and the location was so great, I thought I would give it another try. This time, the rate was amazing (through a third party website) and when I called the hotel to ask if we could come a night earlier and have the same rate honored they agreed and were very pleasant. The room was large, clean and quiet. The pub downstairs is a great place to meet for a drink. The hotel "scene" in Boston isn't that great - the W and Nine Zero are popular but sparse and poor in service. The Fairmont Copley and Park Plaza are from another era. I would definitely recommend staying here to visitors of any nature.

Reviews.Title: “Back Bay Everytime!”
Reviews.Author: Mary S
Reviews.Content: Just back from a fab weekend in Boston celebrating two special birthdays made all the more special by staying in this terrific hotel.It is ideally located to suit a shopping mad gang of ladies who also want to sample the delights of this great city.Everything was within walking distance and if not, a taxi was only a whistle away.We were greeted by Nuala Creedon and her colleagues who answered all our questions patiently and graciously. The rooms were spacious and beautifully presented and Cuffs was the ideal way to unwind after a busy day with well priced food, drinks and even the odd cocktail. Looking forward to a return visit already.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed here for the Boston Bruins parade!”
Reviews.Author: renik20
Reviews.Content: We had an absolute blast in Boston! We drove down from Canada for the Bruins parade last spring, and semi-randomly picked a hotel - and got really lucky with this fantastic pick! The hotel was literally two blocks from the parade route, and an ideal location for sightseeing in the North End after the parade was over. We only stayed the weekend, but had a wonderful stay. The hotel was immaculate, modern, trendy, and the room was great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all round!!”
Reviews.Author: Niamh H
Reviews.Content: Hi, a group of 8 girls stayed in the Boston Back Bay Hotel for a long weekend - 4 nights. It was absolutely fantastic. From the moment we arrived at the hotel, to the moment we left, we were treated superbly. The bedrooms were spacious with a fantastic en suite bathroom and lovely products. The coffee making machine is a real treat! Staff were attentive and friendly throughout and a special mention to Nuala at front office for looking after all our little requests. Overall, a ten out of ten rating. Enjoy your trip to Boston!

Reviews.Title: “best weekend stay ever”
Reviews.Author: Bernadette C
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Back Bay Hotel in Boston last weekend and it was absolutely fabulous. The bedroom was really lovely and everyone we met in the hotel was really friendly and helpful. Front desk and concierge was particularly good with everyone we met going out of their way to deal with our many queries and requests. Nuala Creedon was absolutely great and she made our trip the success it was. I cannot rave enough about this hotel - its location, food, staff etc etc I could go on and on. Go and stay there and see for yourself. I

Reviews.Title: “I'll stay here on my next visit”
Reviews.Author: bamafan2
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. Great location and staff. The rooms are well appointed but they are small. The hotel has a nice downstairs bar (Cuffs) that serves decent food, esp the burger.

Reviews.Title: “nice, very nice.”
Reviews.Author: joetrident
Reviews.Content: a good quality comfortable hotel with good friendly staff. All you would want from a hotel in it's price range. recommend heartily.

Reviews.Title: “all excellent, except pricy breakfast”
Reviews.Author: andrewv45
Reviews.Content: Stay often. Nice roons, good location, good bar in evenings. didnt give 5 stars as on the 3 times I had breakfast, every time I got a snotty waiter. this time a friend was joining me so I wanted a bigger table - the place was 3 quarters empty but he didnt like it. Then its $23 + tax + tipf or an average buffet. Then when I checked out the hotel again charged tax on the breakfast bill. Overall though, its great - just go elsewhere for breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Excellent In All Respects”
Reviews.Author: ST1951
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Back Bay for six nights at the end of October and am so pleased that I chose to do so. It was an excellent experience and, without any hesitation, I am happy to recommend it as your first choice when you stay in Boston. The location is great. Just a short walk to Boylston and Newbury Streets. In fact, the majority of Boston can be reached in a very short space of time. I considered staying at the Omni but am now pleased that I didnâ€™t as the Back Bay is, in my opinion, in a better location. Transfer from Logan was easy and took less than 30 minutes. Courtesy bus to the Airport T station, Blue Line to Government Centre and Green Line to Arlington. It was then a short walk to the hotel. A great welcome at the reception desk and fast check in. My room was great. Absolutely no problem at all with size. A huge, comfortable bed, complimentary bottled water in the fridge each day, bathrobes and a great walk in shower. I requested a quiet room and it certainly was. It was absolutely no fault at all of the hotel but on the first night the guy in the room next door was trying to get Olympic Gold Medal in the door slamming event. He seemed incapable of closing his door quietly. What is the matter with these people? Donâ€™t they have any consideration at all? Luckily he moved on after one night hopefully to take a shower at the Bates Motel. I put the pictures and light fittings back on the wall and it was completely tranquil after he had gone! The complimentary Wi Fi was fine. Speed was fast enough for most things and easy to connect either as wired or wireless. Large flat screen TV and also a mini Hi Fi system for playing CD's and the radio. Lots of storage space for clothes. I only had breakfast in the Stanhope Grill on three days. At $23.00 I felt the buffet was a bit pricey as I donâ€™t eat a lot for breakfast. Coffee and toast is all I need. There are several fast food places round Copley Square and, once I had found them, I went to them instead. I used Cuffs Irish Bar a couple of nights. The beer, food and service were fine and prices were OK. It was busy on some nights so I chose to go elsewhere as I wanted a quiet drink. It seemed to attract the after work crowd and was quieter later on in the evening. Overall I cannot think of anything adverse to say about the Back Bay. As far as I am concerned it ticks all the boxes. Great location, rooms and staff. I only post reviews on Tripadvisor for hotels that I can recommend and the Back Bay is certainly at the top end of the five star rating and highly recommendable. Try it and I am sure that you will agree.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel that Really Works”
Reviews.Author: John P
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nicely located in Back Bay. The staff is professional and Heather Coughlin, the concierge, is top of the heap. She never steered us wrong. The place is worth your time, attention and patronage.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ashtree88
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights and loved it! The whole hotel was spotlessly clean and treally quiet. The bed was so comfortable so we got a great nights sleep! Every morning we got a complimentary newspaper delivered to our room, which was a really nice touch. The staff are lovely and gave us some great advice about shopping, sightseeing and transport. The hotel is in a perfect location for seeing Boston I would absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boston Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michelle787
Reviews.Content: A beautiful and elegant hotel. I like their warm services and the elegance of the hotel rooms. Checking in and checking out was a breeze. Located in a convenient location too.

Reviews.Title: “Unique and Genuine Property in a Great Part of the City”
Reviews.Author: Sensenigr
Reviews.Content: This is my second trip to the Back Bay Hotel in approximately two years. This visit again was great, and even better than the first time around. We stayed for three nights over Labor Day Weekend. The hotel is located in the great Back Bay area of the city. You are so close to so many great restaurants, Boston Public Garden, the start of the Freedom Trail, Charles River, Beacon Hill and so much more. We arrived late on a Friday evening and were checked in by a friendly person at the front desk. The hotel is as I remember it; however, the front lobby is decorated beautifully and better than before. I got to admit though, it was disappointing to see the water wall at the entrance not working at all during our weekend. (Of course, that didn't sour my view of the hotel). We had a deluxe standard room on the 2nd level of the hotel. You do not stay at the Back Bay Hotel for the views, as most rooms face an internal roof or the street/alley as did ours. However, the room was beautifully decorated! It had subtle tones and the decor was casual-elegant. The amenities in the room were great. These included robes, slippers, Napresso machines, great LCD TV with a wide selection of channels, a super comfortable bed, refrigerator, plenty of outlets, a great working A/C Unit, complimentary bottled water and so much more. The bathroom was great with elegant lighting including under vanity lighting when you approached the bathroom, heated towel racks, great water pressure and more. We were also very pleased with the housekeeping and the nightly turndown service. The property has a really nice workout facility/room for a mid-sized property. There is a bar on property, which we did not utilize; however, we did have breakfast all three mornings in the Stanhope Grill, the on-site restaurant. The breakfast buffet was excellent and including yogurt, cereal, fruit, cold meats, pastries, scrambled eggs, eggs benedict, potatoes, bacon, sausage, pancakes. You could also order omelettes and waffles at no extra cost. The cost of the buffet also included juice and coffee/tea. Some people say it is expensive; however, I would say it is on par for a in-hotel restaurant in that area of the city. One final thought, for those who complain of noise. Boston is an urban area. You will have some noise. The noise was not bad and we were on the second floor. For those that complain of the noise, try a suburb. Seriously though, you will enjoy your stay at The Back Bay Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good business hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: GiulianoTA
Reviews.Content: In Boston for work in July, I chose the Back Bay hotel for the location, walking distance to everywhere I needed to go in downtown Boston and a relatively short trip by cab to the office in Needham. The room, service and ambiance meet the expectations of the business clientele, I was at the Colonnade hotel back in January and I certainly prefer this one: the room was large and modern, the sleep quality excellent, the service professionally impeccable. I didn't have breakfast at the hotel so I can't comment on the quality of food. This is certainly an excellent option for a business trip, if only sightly impersonal. Due to the location I will probably return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “I'll Be Back!”
Reviews.Author: Duberto
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it all: excellent facility (including a small, but reasonably well-outfitted gym); very friendly and helpful staff; and very comfortable, updated rooms! I didn't eat at the restaurant, but did visit the bar - it could do with being a bit more swanky in order to match up to the rest of the hotel, but then again: (1) the food was decent, the drinks were poured full, and the staff were on top of things; and (2) it's Boston, and one is only steps from an incredible number of great places, particularly as this hotel is a stone's throw from Copley Plaza, Newbury Street, the Public Garden, etc. Great!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: deathbycupcake
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Back Bay with my teenage daughter and her friend on a recent trip to Boston. From the outside it doesn't look like anything special, but the rooms are exceptionally nice although a bit small. The location is so great though that we were pretty much only in the room to sleep. The beds are very comfortable and the linens are very nice and clean. The bathroom was exceptionally nice with a towel warmer (!), big fluffy towels and robes, and well-stocked bath products. The staff was extremely nice and helpful. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My New Boston Favorite!”
Reviews.Author: SeattleToAnywhere
Reviews.Content: I travel often to Boston for business and always stay at the Lenox Hotel. However, this last trip was booked with short notice and the Lenox had no vacancies, so I stayed at the Back Bay hotel. My trip was for 10 nights, so I booked a deluxe king - smart move. The room was spacious, the closet with plenty of room for all my clothes and the bathroom - equipped with dual shower head and heated towel rack - was just enough to make me feel at home. Service from the front desk, maid service, bellman and valet were always with a smile. Location is easy to/from Logan. Walking distance to lots of bars & restaurants and just a couple blocks to the green & orange lines and the Amtrak station. For my next trip to Boston, I'll definitely be staying at the Back Bay Hotel...my new Boston favorite!!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb, but at a price”
Reviews.Author: ramses2nd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Back Bay with 2 small children whilst visiting Boston over the Columbus weekend and it's difficult to find anything to fault. The location is excellent, 15 minutes walk from the park and the start of the Freedom Trail, 5 minutes walk from the nearest Metro station and lots of great bars and restaurants within easy walking distance. Staff were friendly and very helpful. Our baggage went missing on the flight to Boston, but the hotel provided us with emergency items at no extra cost. The room was spotless with a large bathroom and plenty of space for the 4 of us. The valet parking was great when turning up late at night, although I moved the car to the nearby Clarendon garage after the first night as this was 1/3 the price when using a voucher I printed off their website before going to pay and is only a minutes walk from the hotel. In fact the price is the only thing that wasn't great about this hotel. I'd definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel feel, perfect city location”
Reviews.Author: HungryBay
Reviews.Content: Great service, friendly check-in process, good rooms, very clean, bar not so crowded you can't get a server's attention, good location to Pru Center, Copley Square, shopping on Boylston St area

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is very nice, but their crowning glory is Amy English..”
Reviews.Author: Southbaycouple
Reviews.Content: Amy was involved in our stay from start to finish... & made us feel special & important...if all the staff at this hotel had her attitude & follow through...there would be no reservations available...the room was quite nice & not as small as expected after reading info on tripadvisor reviews...very clean, & comfortable...has nice restaurant & bar...good food...not as Irishy as I thought...very modern...very beautiful hotel & centrally located...had a wonderful time....

Reviews.Title: “Well...well....well”
Reviews.Author: CiaoMilano
Reviews.Content: This wonderful well-positioned hotel has gone on to our list of 'special places to stay'. From the moment we arrived we were treated as special by every member of staff we encountered. The hotel from top to bottom is beautifully decorated. We had two rooms...one regular and one superior and both were of an excellent standard and spotlessly clean. The superior room had a coffee machine. They supplied bottled water daily to both rooms. The breakfasts were a pleasant experience with a very good variety of food. The hotel had a very hip but inviting bar and terrace downstairs which we enjoyed on a couple of occasions. The bar food was excellent. We hope to one day return but in the meantime we will continue to highly recommend this fantastic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Venue for a Wedding!”
Reviews.Author: Jean P
Reviews.Content: This hotel is PERFECT for a medium to small sized wedding. The space was welcoming and warm, had an art decco flair with a bit of hipness to it. We absolutely loved the layout- ceremony upstairs in the living room, reception in the restaurant - it all flowed very nicely. From the beginning of the process through to the end the staff was phenominal. Charlene Navarro helped with many of the details by sharing her experience and maintaining a sense of calm during a fun but stressful time! We highly recommend having the ceremony and reception in the same place, it is easy for everyone. In addition, if you have an evening wedding and guests from out of town or even those who may be driving a bit of a distance - can stay overnight because you have the ability to save a block of rooms for your guests to reserve.... it was so convenient!. The staff was friendly and respectful to everyone... even when we had a few glitches with the reservations- everyone was still courteous. The food was excellent as well! We would recommend this venue for people who want that old fashioned service with a capital S - Thanks again everyone for making our day special and important!!!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, opulent, and delightful”
Reviews.Author: travelnovelist
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well worth the price! The rooms were comfortable, with terrific beds, and of course, robes, slippers, etc.! After a long transatlantic flight, this was a great place to relax and unwind before a series of business meetings. The location is near many of the great restaurants and streets of central Boston (especially the Italian ones in the Back Bay), a stone's throw from the Public Garden, making this location a walker's delight. The metro is also just around the corner. All the staff, from reception, concierge, bartender, room service, etc. were extremely friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jjwalter
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the back bay hotel. It was very convenient to the T and to Boston Commons and the Old Town Trolley. The rooms was not large but comfortable and it did have a small refrigerator. The downstairs bar was a little noisy but comfortable. While we were there, they had a free wine tasting in the upstairs lounge. We missed having a coffee maker in the room. There were quite a few restaurants with a 4 block area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: etmjam
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Back Bay Hotel. Tahrien & Bill welcomed us at check in. Our room on the 8th floor was complete with king bed, espresso maker, towel warmer, robe, slippers, free bottled water in the fridge (which was free and replenished daily), and turn down service with chocolates. We had dinner in the Stanhope Grille our first night and it was great, our server (I think his name was Douglas) was super. We had drinks in Cuffs our 2nd & 3rd nights and service there was just as good. Free boarding pass printing was another bonus. This hotel does not nickel & dime - it was so refreshing to have so much included. Highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel; Great Location; Attentive Staff”
Reviews.Author: anncsb
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation at the Back Bay and when I arrived, the desk clerk apologized and told me that there had been a water problem and my room was not available. I thought that my trip was going to be ruined, but they booked me at the Ames Hotel, gave me money for a cab and told me that I would definitely have a room the next day. (The Ames Hotel was lovely!) The next day I was upgraded to a deluxe room and found a fruit basked and a bottle of wine and a letter of apology in my room. What could have been a disaster, turned out to be an adventure.
