I got to try out two hotels and was treated like royalty. The Back Bay hotel is in a great location, close to the T and shopping. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A B
Reviews.Content: I only have good things to say about this hotel. Best location in Boston (Back Bay area, close to good stores, restaurants, cafe, besides being on a walking distance from Amtrak Station). With incredible rooms and excelent service, Back Bay hotel is well worth it. The building itself is very nice and hotel bar/restaurant is also a good option (specially on cold nights).

Reviews.Title: “great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Katie H
Reviews.Content: The Back Bay Hotel is tucked away just minutes walk from the hustle and bustle of Boston's great shops and restaurants. The room was what you would expect from a city hotel; stylish and well equipped although a little on the small side,it was spotlessly clean with a very comfortable bed and a large than average, nicely furnished bedroom. The concierge was very helpful and overall the staff were very friendly. We didn't eat in the restaurant-preferring to sample some of Boston's great restaurants instead, but the prices looked reasonable for a city hotel. Overall a great hotel to stay in for a stay in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: lal7276
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice. Not to fancy but very nice. Room was nice. Enjoyed the stay except for the laundry bill I received. They took the charges off but it was aggravating having to call them about it. The location was perfect for getting around. Close to the subways and we walked most places. There is a little place to eat a few blocks away called Charlies. They only accept cash and it's communal seating. It's a greasy spoon place. It was yummy. The hotel people can tell you where it is. I would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Back Bay charm in an urban hotel”
Reviews.Author: Triangletravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel combines urban elegance with nice touches. The rooms are a little bigger than many in big cities and have lovely features like towel warmers, espresso machines and a wonderful bed. The staff and service were friendly but busy. The concierge was helpful and the location is great for walking to the arts museums, freedom trial and restaurants. Its a little pricey but deals can help. The rooms were inviting but there is so much to do in Boston, you won't be there too long.

Reviews.Title: “Good, not great”
Reviews.Author: ccb2
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend stay. Room was a nice size and clean. Be forewarned, this area of Boston is noisy at night. The good: The bathroom has a motion sensitive light under the sink which gave off enough light so that you didn't have to turn on overhead light. The not-so-good: 1)The room is not very well lit. Even with the curtains open, there was not enough light to read the Boston related magazines in the room. 2) While the comforter is encased in a very pretty silky cover, it refuses to stay on you/the bed at night! Every time we moved the comforter slid off of us and eventually on to the floor. 3) The front desk was not very helpful. We asked them if they could recommend a place for breakfast and she gave us the name of a restaurant nearby. When we asked her what kind of restaurant it was, she said is was a diner/greasy spoon. Is that really where you want to send your guests when they ask for a nice place to eat? 4) We has also asked one of the hotel staff if there was a nice coffee place nearby. We were told there was both a Dunkin Donuts and a Starbucks up the street. (Btw, there is a SB every two blocks - talk about overkill!) We actually discovered a small shop on Newbury Street (Wired Puppy) which was the type of coffee shop we were looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic trip”
Reviews.Author: TracyHek1
Reviews.Content: An excellant hotel in a great loaction. The hotel was lovely, the rooms large, clean and quiet. The staff were very helpful and nothing was too much trouble. The location of this hotel made it easy to get everywhere in Boston and would recommend this to anyone wanting a stay in a top class hotel in a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Would love to return....”
Reviews.Author: GMJB8126
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights and enjoyed the hotel and great staff. Really cozy and friendly. The rooms were very comfortable and quiet. The staff were so nice. Please forgive me young Irish guy, I can't remember your name but you helped us a couple of times so thanks very much! Also the young ladies who tried to locate a shoe store for me. I never did find it but now I have an excuse to make a return visit. I would definitely recommend the Back Bay to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Ratters09
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our last 2 nights in New England after a 3 week trip. The hotel was within easy reach of shops, restaurants and sightseeing. We absolutely loved our time in Boston and marvelled at the architecture of old buildings which mingled so closely to those that were super modern. Our stay at the hotel couldn't have been better, the room was very spacious and clean, complimentary bottles of water were left in the fridge every day for our use; the bathroom was luxurious and had heated towel rails. We had one evening meal in the restaurant which was very good and moderately priced. There were plenty of choices for breakfast and we opted for the buffet breakfast which offered a large variety of both hot and cold foods (well worth the money). The service was extremely good and the staff ensured that the needs of the paying guests were well catered for. All in all our experience at the Back Bay Hotel was excellent and we wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: kirkbngr
Reviews.Content: The Back Bay was the perfect hotel at the right price for a two night stay in Boston. We booked through Hotwire and only had to pay $279 a night which was a nice deal. The service provided exceeded our expectations with the helpful doorman taking our bags up to our room and the friendly front desk staff. The room we had was great with comfy beds, modern touch to it and a large clean bathroom WITH HEATED TOWEL RACKS! The complimentary bottled was a nice touch. Our room however was across from the construction site but the windows kept the noise out so that was nice. Overall a great hotel in a great city and a place to definitely stay at again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “The Back Bay Hotel is a Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Sandra W
Reviews.Content: Just come back from staying in this hotel for 6 days. Staff all very friendly. Location is perfect for shopping and sightseeing. Tube station is 5 minutes away. Bedroom was very good with the most comfortable bed ever and a very large bathroom. Breakfast at the hotel was very good with plenty to choose from. Hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at The Back Bay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lisa H
Reviews.Content: Great location, friendly service, close to Fenway Park and Copley Place. The Concierge, Heather, helped us plan 4 excellent fun-filled days for the entire family, including a game at Fenway, the City Pass, the SuperTrolley and even a visit to the Sam Adams Brewery. We were sent to Liberty Wharf for dining on the water and several other wonderful restuarants. The front desk clerk, T, was very friendly and offered great advice for local dining. You will see us at the Back Bay hotel next time we are in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Back Bay Hotel - Great place and good staff”
Reviews.Author: jeffm123
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of a 2 day stay here on business. Rooms were very good, with all facilities, a very good size bathroom and very comfortable bed. The building itself has some character as a former police station/headquaters and some of the older features in the foyer have been retained. Restaurant and bar area on the lower ground floor were very tasteful set out and I have to say the buffett breakfast was very good value, in my view. A word about the staff - very good, attentive service in my experience from the housemaids through to the front desk and concierge. I needed to do some emergency shopping on arrival and the concierge pointed to some quick options, as well as a discsount voucher for a store (and I got the best bargain for a sports jacket!). Wait staff in the restaurant also very friendly. Location-wise I found it very convenient, being only a block from Copley Square and short walk to Boston Common. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others. (One point to note though, because I arrived just after midnight, in a jet-lagged state, as I walked in I lugged my suitcases up a staircase wondering why there was no elevator or if I had come the wrong way - I completely missed the elevator which was there just inside the entrance at ground level!)

Reviews.Title: “Love the service”
Reviews.Author: Stevetherover
Reviews.Content: Arrived tired after flight from UK and were greeted with politeness and friendliness by all. Great location, free coffee on Sunday mornings and the best pillows I can remember, will definitely return

Reviews.Title: “Go the Red Socks”
Reviews.Author: alastair4
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel while touring the USA in August. Fabulous stay in Boston, loved the city and the hotel. Location was excellent with access to great restaurants and shops for both of us. Service from all the staff could not have been better. Concierge was great value and recommended a lovely seafood restaurant ( unfortunately I've forgotten the name ). The room was clean and spacious, with a good size bathroom and a nice comforter bed.We want to come back to Boston at some stage and would certainly stay in this hotel again. Go the Red Socks

Reviews.Title: “Total letdown”
Reviews.Author: mekanoid
Reviews.Content: After glancing the high rating and shelling out $400 a night for a last minute trip to Boston I was extremely disappointed with this hotel. It is NOT a top rated boutique by international standards. Check-in was crude and transactional, the rooms feel outdated with shaggy carpet and an empty bar fridge (except comp water). Internet is free which was a plus. I treated this hotel like a $400 a night hostel and got out first thing the next morning; the staff were much more helpful on my departure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: 183glen
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary. On arrival we were offered a free upgrade and also had champagne and truffles delivered to our room which was a nice touch. The room was very nice, however had to request a hair dryer as there wasn't one in the room and also a shower cap. I didn't like the fact that the 2 coffee cups provided were different sizes which was awkward if we both wanted a large cup of coffee! We returned after a busy day sight seeing to discover at 3.30 our room hadn't been serviced and on another occasion the coffee cups were not replaced. The location is very good and within walking distance to many shops and restaurants. I would certainly recommend this hotel for a trip to Boston

Reviews.Title: “Old Police Station but you can't tell!”
Reviews.Author: marq33
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice but not what I had expected for four stars. Everything was nice and new and good location but close to a fire station which I heard sirens several times in the middle of the night. The rooms and restaurant were nice.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for better”
Reviews.Author: Alison973
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel for our anniversary and couldnt have been happier. The room was large and immaculate. Service was efficient and courteous. This was the perfect location for us as we were doing the Jimmy Fund walk the next day. We were in such close proximity to great restaurants and shops, it was perfect. Cuffs was a good place to end our night. Would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, but a little bit of a let down”
Reviews.Author: Sarahfaraway
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel in an excellent location. The food was nice. The breakfast buffet was very good, with lots of choice and welcoming friendly staff. Given the class of this hotel, I would expect to get bathrobes and coffee making facilities as standard. Having to call room service to get a morning cup of coffee was an annoyance. I now understand the Deluxe rooms come with this facility, but to me, this should be a given in all rooms, given the amount we paid per night. The bathroom was starting to look a little tired. The toilet was stained and there were chips in the wallpaper. It was also very noisy, though this was half expected because of the city location. We had a room at the back of the hotel and suffered the noise of delivery trucks arriving early morning, every morning. So I would make sure to ask not to be located at the back of the hotel. Some of the staff were less than welcoming, but I think that comes with being in a big city hotel. Still, a warmer welcome from staff on check-in would have been nice after travelling so far to get there. Purely for the location, I think the Back Bay is a good hotel, but it's not a great hotel. I have stayed at the Liberty hotel previously and I would personally say that it has the edge over the Back Bay hotel, given the points above.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: n8fire
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at the back bay hotel on a recent business trip to Boston. I selected it for the decent rate and the good reviews on tripadvisor. I was not disappointed. Although the rooms are on the small side, the location is great and convenient and the hotel amenities made it a very comfortable stay. Breakfast was very good at the downstair restaurant and the pub had a nice atmosphere in the evening and it was great to relax with collegues. I'll definitely

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: brithammer
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights here over the 4th of July weekend and had a terrific stay. They were very accommodating when we asked to change our room. The Decor is really really beautiful inside, and very cool looking on the outside. And the Location was hard to beat. Very comfortable beds, our rooms also had very large bathroom. The only thing I found not great was the restaurant downstairs for breakfast. Very expensive for a very basic meal, but the waitstaff could not have been friendlier.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: thisisbeaker
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Back Bay Hotel for 3 nights at the start of our 2 week trip to New England. We arrived at about 6.30pm, having caught a cab from Logan airport (driven by the most grumpy driver I've ever come across). If I recall, it cost about $35 - a toll or airport charge gets added to the meter fare, which confused me when I got much less change than expected. The lady at check-in was very friendly and helpful. She provided us with a local map and explained what facilities were available at the hotel. We were pretty tired, so most of it didn't really go in, but the map proved very useful later in our stay. Our room was on the 2nd floor, with a view of a back street, so nothing really to write home about. I half considered asking to change it, but I figured we weren't really going to be spending much time in the room. The room itself seemed a bit small (a superior king), but it was perfectly fine. It was very tastefully decorated and clean. The shower was very good and the bed very comfortable. It was a bit noisy early in the morning, but then we were in a central area in a bustling city, so I guess it's to be expected. We didn't really experience much else the hotel had to offer, aside from room service on the first night, as we ate all our meals out, and were too tired after long days to sit in the bar at the end of the day. The room service was very quick, and actually pretty good. I wasn't hungry, but the wife had beer battered cod and chips and a soft drink. Including tip, delivery charge etc, it cost $28 - pretty pricey, but I've had really bad meals that have cost more, so it didn't feel like too much of a rip-off. All the staff were very polite, and said hello when we were coming and going. Only one slight irritation, and that was when we were leaving to get a cab to collect our hire car. The door man asked if we needed help with our bags. I said we were fine, and started to head to the line of waiting cabs. He then asked if we needed a cab, and having said we were going to grab the cab I could see waiting, he then insisted on taking my case and putting it in the trunk/boot of the cab. I obviously then had to tip the guy, when I felt I was quite capable of walking a few meters to the line! Only a minor grumble really. Overall we enjoyed our stay here and would recommend it. We really appreciated having a fridge in the room, as opposed to a minibar, to store drinks in. Complementary bottles of water was a nice touch. The location is pretty good, as most of the areas the average tourist would want to visit are in easy walking distance. We booked using hotels.com, and took advantage of their price match promise, ending up with a refund of just under Â£100. Make sure you take a screen shot if you find a cheaper price after booking. Also, we used quidco, a cashback site, that had a 12% offer with hotels.com. So the Â£620 we paid when we booked (for 3 nights), ended up being Â£445 after the cashback and the price match refund, which I thought was a great deal for a hotel of this standard.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: salf0rdian
Reviews.Content: On arrival the reception staff were more than helpful and that was indicative of all staff during our stay and especially Heather(think thats her name)the concierge, very knowledgeable with regards getting about on the T, where to eat breakfast(thanks for letting us know about Billy's & Charlies's)and sightseeing. Our room was more than adequate, large bathroom with bath and separate walk in shower, two double beds in room with plenty of wardrobe space etc, rooms were kept spotless and towels changed every day. Did not eat in restaurant but did eat in Cuffs bar on a couple of occasions, ate breakfast out as after looking at the menu provided we thought $17plus for a breakfast was a bit over the top. There are a couple of negatives to this hotel, the first is the air conditioning, it is so loud that it is impossible to keep it on at night, second are the building sites across from the hotel, (when checking in perhaps ask if your room overlooks these sites), if you are a early riser(and I mean early!!!!)fine, otherwise take earplugs, work commences round about six to half past and the noise of mechanical diggers, pneumatic drills etc is no joke at that time of the morning. All in all we had a most enjoyable stay in Boston and I would definitely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: poorashell
Reviews.Content: The service was great. Hotel very clean. Hotel is downtown price a little high. Didn't eat in the restaurant but the food in the Pub was very good.. About 1 1/2 wallk to Fenway. Freedom Trail is a bit of a walk, but subway is 2 blocks away form hotel. It's cheap and easy to use. I would recommend staying here. But next time I go to Boston I'll probably stay closer to the North End where the freedom trail and more tourists things are.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: RonFinlay
Reviews.Content: Rooms are comfortable and clean and service professional. We stayed only one day, so it was hard to get a sense of character: the impression is of a well-run but slightly soulless high quality chain hotel. Being only a few minutes' walk from Boston Common and Charles Street puts you in the heart of the city, yet it's quiet at night time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, great looking hotel and bar”
Reviews.Author: Arwen1979
Reviews.Content: We were greated by a young man on reception who was really helpful, every other member of staff we met was excellent. Lovely looking hotel in a fair location, the bar we ate in the bar the first night and visited for drinks on our way back from town on the second night. The air conditioning was quiet compared to other rooms, I would stay here again and recemmond it to anyone young or old.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for your Boston stay”
Reviews.Author: Vanessacmc
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel purely from the tripadvisor reviews and it was a great choice. The location was ideal, initially I was a little worried we weren't at the waterfront but being in the heart of Back Bay is brilliant. Easy access to all attractions and hundreds of fabulous restaurants on your door-step. Perfect! There is a very good concierge service. I sent a couple of emails before I arrived and they were answered very quickly. During our stay there were always guests at the concierge desk, and they were very helpful. The rooms were very nice, quite spacious and with modern decor. The beds were exceeding comfy! There was a fridge which was replenished with bottled water each day. The bathroom was a good size, lots of towels and big heavy bathrobes. A large shower but no bath. My only disappointment was that we were on the first floor facing an alleyway ( the view didn't particularly bother me). However on the friday and saturday night there seemed to be a bar/club open in the evenings who played very loud music until the small hours of the morning! That said I'd happily stay here again, just asking for a front facing room and higher up!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good service”
Reviews.Author: ABC2927
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at this hotel during a road trip. Can' t fault this hotel except that we would have loved a kettle in the room for our early morning tea! Had breakfast both mornings and it was great. Central location within easy walk of shops and attractions. Staff couldn't have been more helpful and friendly, had a great conversation with the guy on reception about UK football! Would definitely stay here again and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “great service & very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrsLSouthWales
Reviews.Content: Back Bay Hotel has very friendly staff who went out of their way to help all their guests during Hurricane Irene last week even giving a discount on food, bar and room rates. We stayed for 5 nights and used the bar a few times (shame it's so dark in there though). Room really comfy and great king size bed. Good location for getting out and about and for Back Bay station just around the corner. Nuala and her colleagues on the front desk were great

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in a good location staffed by friendly people”
Reviews.Author: Vidi_10
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel from 25th until 31st August 2011. ( which included Hurricanre Irene/tropical storm weekend.) It was my third time in Boston and it as a most enjoyable experience. The hotel is well located in a nice part of town .The transformation from its preevious life as a police headquarters haves been successfully and tasteefully achieved. W ith the threatened hurricane the staff exuded calm and helpfulness. the front desk manager Nuala was perticularly helpful at all times. I will unhesitatingly return

Reviews.Title: “First class service in a great area of Boston”
Reviews.Author: Azgators
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel in a convenient area of Boston. We only use the T to get around Boston when we visit, so this hotel was ok, not greatly located to a T. There were two stations about equal distance from the hotel. You could also get to the Copley Square shopping area and Newberry street with the high end shops. We ended up getting this hotel for a great last minute price on priceline, as we arrived early morning into Boston without any reservations for a last second birthday getaway. When we arrived to the hotel at 9am we were given a room with a queen bed, told that we could wait for a room with a king, but since we just had 5 hours of rest we wanted to get into a room for a nap. Since we booked on priceline, we, as usual, got the smallest possible room in the place, but that doesn't bother me, we don't go to Boston for a hotel room. The Room: was tiny and facing another building on a low floor. I wouldn't want to pay rack rate for this room, but since all we wanted was a bed for the night, it was fine. The bathroom was acceptable, there was plenty of furniture in the room, a small closet (with an umbrella in it for you to use on rainy days, which it was). The bed was very comfortable, it is a bit on the soft side, so if you prefer a harder bed you might want to go elsewhere. Now the issue that was a big concern to us, but was taken care of very well by the manager. When we arrived I noticed blood spots on a pillowcase. I thought it was odd and asked if someone could come change it while we went off to breakfast. They did. I didn't think of looking at the rest of the sheets. Upon our return later that evening, getting ready for bed I thought a more thorough look at the bedding was in order. There were blood spots on the other pillows and the sheets. Not the kind of spots like from a bed bug, but from someone being cut and leaving a trail. At that point we called down to ask to be moved because blood that isn't yours is just not a good thing to be laying around in. Maybe the maids finger was cut and she didn't know it as she made up the room. A minute after our call the manager on duty, Miss Nuala Creedon, called to apologize and say that we would be moved if we wanted to gather our things, that she and a bellhop would be up to help us move. We expected a room of the same size/location, what we got was a great night in the Presidential Suite. WOW. Beyond amazing. I've had small complaints at other hotels, but have never been upgraded like that. I doubt that was the only room available in the hotel, they didn't even know it was my birthday, and the staff made it clear that we were important to them. Thanks. As for others who have noted the noise in their rooms. Yes, both rooms we had were a bit noisy, but the hotel is in the middle large city, with tons of traffic, and yes, a fire station in view. Can't blame the hotel, I've stayed other places in Boston, it is always noisy. Our 10th floor room was just as noisy as the 3rd floor room. Best part about this hotel. Its a 4 star hotel with free wifi in your room, amazing, that never happens. It wasn't even hidden in some "resort" fee. Top notch in my book. We didn't use any of the other features of the hotel so I can't comment on the restaurant or workout room. As for parking, what are you doing driving in Boston, even the natives don't drive. A one day car rental is the same price as parking overnight, so just rent for one day from the airport like we did, you can drop the car off anytime. To me, the difference between a 4 and a 5 star rated hotel on tripadvisor is the service you get. And for The Back Bay Hotel, they are definately top notch in that department. Thanks again to Miss Nuala Creedon, if you have any issues when she is on duty I am confident you will be more then happy with her service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff, attractive room”
Reviews.Author: Lzbth57
Reviews.Content: We were visiting our daughter in Back Bay area and this hotel was very convenient. It's also only a block away from the Back Bay train station. Walking distance from Boston Commons and Public Gardens. The hotel is a former police station and so it has lots of character, while at the same time being elegant. Reception area very attractive, as was our room. Bathroom was large and luxurious. Only complaint is that I could hear noise from other rooms, so soundproofing was not that great, which is surprising given the care taken with everything else.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: LizFlo
Reviews.Content: Would not hesitate to recommend The Back Bay hotel. Its in a good location and spotlessly clean. The staff were a delight to deal with right from the doorman, reception,bar staff and cleaners. They were helpful, friendly and welcoming.The 2 rooms we were allocated were perfect for us and our teenage sons. We will definitely stay here again, should we be lucky enough to return to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great city”
Reviews.Author: GeoffMcf
Reviews.Content: We had two thoroughly enjoyable days in the historic city of Boston, and the Back Bay Hotel was a wise choice. It was in an ideal location close to Boston Common and everything was of a high standard, from the welcome received on arrival to the quality of the accommodation itself, and the restaurant, where the service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Very Classy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunny4440
Reviews.Content: First time in Boston and I picked the hotel from site reviews. Staff was wonderful, helpful and friendly; nothing was too much. The Deluxe King was beautiful, clean and the best bed ever. It rained 3 days out of 4, but they put an umbrella in each room which came in handy.Great location in Back Bay area and in walking distance of many sites and close to the hop on/hop off trolley. I would definitely stay again. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel and Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: Gorgasw
Reviews.Content: This is a very lovely hotel with a great location. We stayed in a standard room, which was fine as one doesn't go to Boston to sit in their room. The location is very nice, we walked to Fenway, Beacon Hill, and all around the Back Bay section. It's also quite convenient right off I-90. A few minor small observations kept me from rating the hotel a 5 star: upon check-in, I asked for a room away from the elevator banks which resulted in a two hour wait. The fitness center is very small and limited in scope. Breakfast was pricy se we opted to go out each morning to the local Panera, Au Bon Pan, etc,, and lastly, valet parking is high at $42/ day. Overall, a pleasant stay and we would return again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel for a city break in beautiful Boston”
Reviews.Author: veronica-ks
Reviews.Content: We received a very warm welcome at The Back Bay Hotel. Staff were friendly and service was very good, in the reception area plus the restaurant. The Back Bay is conveniently located for a short stay in Boston, with restaurants and sights within walking distance. We couldn't find anywhere locally to have breakfast other than big chains, so ate in the hotel which was good, but expensive. Our evening meal in the hotel was extremely good. Rooms are comfortable, with a good bathroom including robes. I would certainly return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “3 BBBs”
Reviews.Author: Puravida013
Reviews.Content: Wow! Reading all feedbacks from past guests are so true. My BFF and I had a wonderful Birthday Bash in Boston. Hotel and location was excellent. All the staffs are so friendly . Shoutout to Ms. Nuala! , who went all the way for a upgrade and a surprise bottle of champagne to us. We ladies had so much funs. As World travellers, always like to stay in downtown areas, where all the actions and excitments are close by. Walking and close to metro transportations.Really get to see the city.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, modern facilities, impecable cleanliness, nice decor.”
Reviews.Author: GUSDALI
Reviews.Content: Certainly a great hotel with good location, modern facilities and a pretty decoration of both the room as the common parts. There are also a cozy lobby bar, a lively tavern and a fine restaurant in the hotel, all of them highly recommended. Only the concierge service did not seem so friendly, although it was efficient.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back”
Reviews.Author: Mary C
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in the Back Bay Hotel with family for 7 nights. Hotel was fabulous. Rooms were lovely and very spacious for four adults and bedrooms were well air conditioned. Service was excellent. Location wise hotel is prefect, five minute walk from the T, within walking distance to lovely shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Mayzer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 8 nights and found the location perfect for exploring the city during the day and very safe to return to after a night out. The staff had great tips and recommendations in particular Heather and Nuala. Only drawback would be the small gym but Boston Common Park is just down the street if you fancy doing some exercise!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value if you can get a Deal”
Reviews.Author: codebluev7
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent a weekend at the Back Bay Hotel. We got a deal through sniqueaway.com . I mention this because with out a deal, you may find yourself a little unfulfilled. The room was very nice as was the bathroom. There was no view to speak of. The location of the hotel is excellent being a 5 minute walk to Boylston and Newbury streets. The restaurant and bar did not get our attention but there is an abundance of choices two blocks away. The staff was pleasant and helpful. Easy access from I-90. If you are looking for a nice room in the heart of the Back Bay and can get a deal you will be happy. Just be prepared for the following. $42.00 parking, limited room views, and average service.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, service, and location”
Reviews.Author: Jeff N
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Boston for 4 nights here and were delighted with this hotel. We booked via priceline and were a little nervous prior to booking as some of the hotels in the Coppley Square area looked a little old and worn down, but Back Bay Hotel was clean, spacious, and modern. The service we received with everyone there was top notch, and Bill at concierge was very helpful with restaurant recommendations. The other things we really liked was: free wifi, free WSJ and NY Times every day, and free bottles of water. The location is also perfect as it is close to the Boston Common, the shopping area on Newbury, and a few minutes away by foot to a subway station, which in turn is a few short stops away from major attractions - getting around in Boston from our location was quite easy. One neat thing was the shower which had a nozzle at waist level, but I found the water to be very hard. The other negative comment I would make would be the pillows which I found to be a little hard. But this is more of a personal preference, and all in all, I would have no hestitation recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: citygal8
Reviews.Content: I got an excellent price on priceline and was still given excellent customer service. There is free wireless internet in the rooms and 2 free bottles of water are provided in the refrigerator every day. I called the hotel and let them know that I would be coming later and they allowed my daughter to check in without me which was really helpful since she arrived before me. This is a top notch hotel with nice amenities. The rooms are on the small side but nicely furnished and laid out, so quite comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Room Looking a little bit worn”
Reviews.Author: BMLloyd
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel as our first stay was wonderful. However, we had not realised that the first time we had been upgraded as this stay we were in Standard Room. Still all the failicities, accept did not like the fixed shower head. Our stay was split as stayed for a few nights, went to Cape Cod for a week and then returned for a few more nights prior to flying home. Both Standard Rooms were looking tired on the decor side. Drawers not staying closed or cabinet door not closing fully. Had to ask a couple of times for extra pillows. On the second stay we did have room service and this was very efficient and the food was excellent. We had booked our holiday with Virgin and was not told until the last morning that we got a discount on food and drink if charged back to the room. Would have done this a lot more and probably would have eaten a couple times more at the hotel if we had been made aware of this at the begining. Can't fault the staff , very helful and friendly. Will definetly be going back, when we visit Boston again, Hotel is ideally located and only a couple minutes walk to Boston Common, which we generally walked to each morning.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravel00
Reviews.Content: Very clean, good location. Upon check in we requested a quiet room. Our room faced a construction site and when we requested a quieter room we were given an upgrade.The staff was very accommodating. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but...”
Reviews.Author: CPSH
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Back Bay hotel at the end of a two week trip through New England. It is very chic and the public areas are well-appointed. Even though we arrived looking like tourists (shorts and T-shirts) we were greeted pleasantly and professionally. Our room was on the 7th floor. It was nicely decorated but smaller than rooms at much cheaper hotels on our trip. Fortunately it did have a fridge because we purchased breakfast items to keep in the room rather than pay for the exorbitant $23.00 breakfast downstairs. One thing that really bothered us was the lack of a coffeemaker in the room. I know the hotel wants you to spend money in its restaurants but who wants to get all dressed in the morning just to get a cup of coffee. Every other hotel on our trip (mostly Hampton and Comfort Inns) had in-room coffee makers and they costs a lot less than Back Bay. One other drawback to this hotel (through no fault of their own) is the lack of restaurants in the immediate area. If/when we return to Boston, we will look for a hotel that is closer to restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay! Would return in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: Metryman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at The Back Bay Hotel the first week of August 2011 along with another couple. We all thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The service was top notch from the doorman to the concierge to the front desk. Everyone we met was extremely friendly and more than willing to offer tips on good restaurants, shopping, entertainment, and most importantly, directions! Our rooms were clean and comfortable. If I had to offer any kind of critique, its that I wish the room would have had a mini-bar. Plus there were no vending machines. But it did have a little fridge and so we were able to stock up on drinks and snacks from a nearby CVS. The location was great and within walking distance of just about anything you could need. And if you wanted to take the subway (the "T"), the entrance was a couple of blocks away. If we ever return to Boston, I'd go back to The Back Bay Hotel in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Go Here!”
Reviews.Author: Leftybaseball
Reviews.Content: Had to check our bags with the valet on checkout day as our flight was later. Went back to claim them and they only had three of the four .the one that was missing had our most valuable items ( computer, business checks, keys, airline tickets, signed Red Sox memorabilia , clothes and more). No real concern or urgency was exhibited and obviously their security is lax. I wouldn't feel safe there ever again

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: travelingcactus
Reviews.Content: First time I. Boston. Location was good I walked everywhere including north end. But I am fit although no more then 1.5 miles anywhere. Everything was top notch. Very european feel but rooms bigger. Lots of sports channels for the guys in the room. Comfy bed. Great pillows. Water at times was not as warm as I like but no big issue. They have this nozzle in shower that squirts water straight out at waist level. I took this as a bum washer. I took full use of this and enjoyed the cleanest bum in boston for the four days I was there. What a treat. The restaurant at the hotel was good. But expensive. Eggs and bacon. 17 dollars. Ouch. But I would stay here again. I got a web special and paged about 850 including taxes for 3the nights.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, very good service but noisy at night”
Reviews.Author: HarpendenSmiths
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Back Bay hotel in Boston with our two teenage children.The rooms were of a good size and very clean. The shower rooms are large and very pleasant. We had only one complaint, which was not the hotels fault, but we did find it very noisy during the night. There were trains blowing their horns and a construction site opposite which appeared to work throughout the night. The staff at the hotel were extremely curtious and friendly. The hotel is very well positioned for the major attractions. Overall a really good choice but a shame about the noise. Free wifi access was a very welcome bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Gem in Boston's Back Bay”
Reviews.Author: NewlyRetired28
Reviews.Content: Elegant hotel with a warm feeling. Walking distance fom the train station, atttractions, shopping and restaurants -lots of restaurants. Everything was perfect. If I ever go back to Boston, The Back Bay Hotel will once again be my choice.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious room”
Reviews.Author: RandiGelfond
Reviews.Content: Great staff - friendly & helpful. Every amenity we needed was available. Convenient to everything, too. We'll definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Dannytac
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly situated right in the heart of Boston. Walking distance to most of the hot spots, you will be happy with this hotel. I had a small issue arise which was immediately addressed by Jackson one of the hotel managers who couldn't of been more helpful and understanding. Hotel staff is friendly and accomodating. Rooms are nice and you will enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in an Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: beckymharris
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel was outstanding! The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly. The room (superior) was a bit on the small side but clean and comfortable. The bar in the hotel is very nice and the location is perfect (close to subways). It was our first time in Boston and we found it very easy to get around and appreciated how helpful the hotel staff was in offering advice on how to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel and will definitely stay here again!!”
Reviews.Author: Jeronamo99
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel, which is very close to trolley stop and subway stations. Excellent location. We stayed in the larger room (Superior) with 2 double beds. Room size was great and the bathroom was large. Staff were all very friendly and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Comfortable Boutique Hotel . . . rooms a little small”
Reviews.Author: Moochiebpaul
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a true four star hotel with nice comfortable beds and amenities. The room was a bit small compared to other four star hotels I've stayed at in Boston, but the quality and service were clearly above average. I was not charged for a roll-away bed, which in this day and age seems more the exception than the rule. Also, the internet was free . . . but, on the other hand, valet parking was (gulp) $42 a day. The location is good and there is great shopping (Newbury Street) and plenty of fine restaurants nearby. This is the second time I've gotten this hotel on Priceline, so I did get a tremendous deal at $175 (plus tax and fee) for the quality

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good choice”
Reviews.Author: skysam
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the July 4th week while on vacation. Great location - we recommend the Back Bay area as the best location for a pleasure stay in Boston and the Back Bay Hotel has a prime spot. Close to Back Bay, South End, Public Gardens, Financial District, Fenway. All within walking distance. The hotel is quite comfortable and the staff are a pleasure. We had one poor experience - the Wi-Fi did not work in our 9th floor room, however once we found the right person to help us (front counter receptionist Natalie) everything was taken care of. Natalie explained that the 9th floor has some Wi Fi problems so she had us moved to another floor and all was fine after that. Unfortunately the 1-800 technical services person (the hotel recommended route for service) was not very helpful. All the hotel staff; front counter, bellhops, and bar staff were very friendly and quick to offer help. Just one note on something not related to the hotel - Boston taxies are awful! We took 5 cab trips and all the taxies were very dirty - one smelled of vomit - and we're not sure if a few of the cars were safe. We had a Deluxe Room (one up from the standard) and it was comfortable and spacious. Nice touch with towel warmers. We did not make use of the fitness room - we got our exercise walking around Boston!, or the restaurant. We went to the basement bar once - it was very basic but will meet your needs of providing a nice spot for a nightcap. The hotel is part of a bus shuttle service to the Wrentham factory outlets - convenient if you do not have a car and it is a great place for shopping. Almost everything is closeby: Newbury Street is a block away, great restaurants, Prudential Centre, Fenway Park, Boylston Street, theatre district (5 minute walk to the theatre for Blue Man Group). We recommend and would stay at the Back Bay Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fun pub”
Reviews.Author: Chianti_girl24
Reviews.Content: The staff here is very friendly and goes out of their way to help you. I had a king size bed in a very tiny room - it reminded me of European hotels a bit. Not complaining, but if there was more than one person, it would have been very tight quarters. The Irish pub downstairs was great and the outdoor seating area was comfortable. It was very hot when we were there and it almost felt like they had AC flowing in the outdoor area - flashes of cold air came from somewhere and felt GREAT! The location is perfect for walking to Newbury St., Boston Commons and Copley Square. I will stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Have stayed twice and would return”
Reviews.Author: KWCRB
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel, with a solid restaurant and bar on-sight. It's well-lit, appointed and staffed with nice people. This is B+/A- property.

Reviews.Title: “Chic hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: gnat23
Reviews.Content: Nice place to stay-got a great deal on a special from another site. Contemporary decor, clean, nicely done.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Ruth123
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as it was rated highly on Tripadvisor. I was so pleased by the whole experience. From the time we checked in to the time we left the service and the ambience was superb. We ate in the bar twice as the food was very good. The room was quiet and the air conditioning came as a welcome relief during a heatwave. This hotel has set the standard I will judge others on in the future. My only regret is that the hotel is so far away from home that I can't return on a regular basis. The location makes it a perfect place to explore Boston and all it has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Can see why it's rated so highly on tripadvisor”
Reviews.Author: Lightning2010
Reviews.Content: The back bay is in a great location - close to shops and sights, the staff are really friendly and it ticks all the boxes for a stay in Boston. The rooms are a decent size but the king size beds are to die for... really comfy. I'd rate it as a good 4* hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend it to everyone”
Reviews.Author: duck53
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, helpful staff and, daft as it sounds, the free bottle of water each day was so appreciated as it saved time going to buy a drink to take out into the heat of summer. If we ever come back to Boston, we would use the same hotel, but will also check out others within the group.

Reviews.Title: “delightful!”
Reviews.Author: CapeCodKathyH
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. Small yet efficient. Great location. Staff outstanding. Great outdoor patio with wonderful martinis.We truly enjoyed our stay here and thank Trip Advisor clients for true reviews. Our room was lovely, clean, new, modern and every extra you could imagine The location was truly perfect for exploring Newbury Street, Public Garden, Copley Square, Beacon Hill! I would return for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more”
Reviews.Author: Stsdeb
Reviews.Content: The furnishings in the room are very nice, although the room is smaller than other hotel rooms . We have stayed in 4 star hotels in Boston and those rooms were larger.Very slow at check out.The service in the restaurant is outstanding.My suggestion is they visit the lobby of the Lenox Hotel and see the station set up for coffee and tea for their guests. I think this would be a nice touch because there are no coffee makers in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but don't eat at their restaurant!”
Reviews.Author: Mangrum79
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with great staff, especially the bell hop. The restaurant however was HORRIBLE. Food was so so but the service was awful. We waited forever just to place our orders which caused most of us to get the breakfast buffet even though we didn't know it was $23 each. My husband and I ordered eggs and a yogurt parfait. This took at least 30 minutes. By the time they brought out the food the yogurt was room temp and disgusting. Eggs were good but how hard is that to make. The icing on the cake was when the server did not return our friends change and gave himself a $10 tip that was undeserved.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel / great location”
Reviews.Author: Eauboy
Reviews.Content: I can see why there are so many positive reviews of this hotel. Our three night stay was quiet, comfortable, clean, and everything worked just as it should. Our room was the 'superior king' room, which was plenty large for two. The bathroom was spacious (more so than expected) and the bed, linens and the rest of the trimmings were all good. There was even a mini fridge with complimentary water, which is refreshing change from the usual mini bar. The staff was friendly. And of course back bay is a wonderful neighborhood, and you have an easy walk to the public gardens and Boston commons, too. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Friends/family Boston trip - the perfect spot!”
Reviews.Author: MowerFamily
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, hotel staff very helpful and professional, our room was spacious for 2 adults and 2 kids, large bathroom with bathtub separate from a gorgeous shower, sumptuous bathrobes and toiletries, and the beds were comfortable. We were in a handicap room could be why we had more floor space and larger bath. We ate brunch around the corner at Geoffrey's and highly recommend them for your meals. Not so with the hotel's breakfast buffet the day prior, slow service and untrained wait staff - food ok. It was our 11th wedding anniversary and the concierge sent us champagne and chocolate covered fruits and a lovely card - thoughtful of them! Easy to get to everything in Boston. We walked to Chinatown, Duck Tours, Boston Gardens, swan boats and took the T to the North End. Suggest a taxi vs the T only $11 for our taxi ride to the Constitution in Charlestown - easier, quicker and nicer than riding T. Our kids can't wait to go back, and neither can we - without kids next time!

Reviews.Title: “Go somewhere else for breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: nicg109
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice. The front desk staff and valet are great. We arrived early, so I went in to ask the front desk if it was ok to drop our car off and was offered a room 3 hours before check in time. The room was clean and nicely decorated. We stayed on the 8th floor, room 812. No view but that was ok we didnt spend much time in it. The location is perfect with so many shops and restaurants within walking distance. If you are looking for a less busy place to talk and have a drink try the bar at the mediteranian restuarant, out the hotel to the right, I think it is called Avila. The bar service was slow there but it was a nice atmosphere. If you are looking for a louder place, Cuff's bar at the hotel is nice. Not a big crowd but you can sit outside or inside. So now on to the one negative. The breakfast buffett at the grill in the hotel was so bad. My partner and I had one plate and didnt touch half of it. It was overpriced at $25 a person and the one time I went up there were no eggs, no pancakes, no blueberries, no strawberries, just empty trays. My partner went up just for eggs when the tray was finally refilled. He had one bite and that was it. All of this after waiting 10 minutes for coffee. It was another 10 minutes to pay the bill. I almost cried when I handed over my card. It was the worst $40 I have ever spent. Go to Dunkin Donuts or Starbucks instead.

Reviews.Title: “Money can't buy this...”
Reviews.Author: The_room_next_door
Reviews.Content: Rated hotels rarely shine outside their category. It's all about the money and what can be included / left out within the financial confines of the Star Category. So what's left to distinguish them? Soul is the answer. Hotels without souls are ten a penny but find one with a good one and you've found home. The Back Bay has the warmth and genuine sincerity of a home from home. This isn't down to one individual employee, it is manifest throughout the entire staff. It's the greeting that gets you first. You are drawn in before you make it to the front desk and from there on you are spoiled. The rooms are clean, the service is excellent and the decor is tasteful - as with most other hotels in this price range. But you can't buy what they excel in and imitations can be spotted miles off. The building itself, the former headquarters of the Boston Police Department, is a treasure and what you find inside is priceless. This was our first time there and we will be back. We had some unexpected bad news during our stay and had to reschedule to leave early. ALL the staff ensured that arrangements were made swiftly and without fuss. In particular, Nuala Creedon was exceptional. We had been bowled over long before we had to leave though, as you will be when you first approach that desk.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: brazuquinha
Reviews.Content: The staff at The Back Bay really makes the difference. The hotel is obviously excellent. The rooms are clean, spacious and comfortable, but the staff makes sure you are having a perfect time. They are always friendly, ready to answer your questions and from what I would see are able to remain calm under pressure. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Wilhelmina87
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights on a rainy weekend in June. In my opinion, this is an excellent hotel. It is located within walking distance of the Public Gardens and about 2 blocks from the Metro. The staff was always friendly, courteous and patient. They provided us with an umbrella. The room and bathroom facilities were fine. We had breakfast in the hotel and also ate in the dining room and the bar. All the food was excellent and the service was good. While the hotel was on the expensive side, it was well worth it and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great price for the location”
Reviews.Author: A22L
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Back Bay hotel this past weekend. The location is terrific (easy walking distance to Copley Square, the public gardens, subway etc) and given that we paid $140/night all in (on priceline name your bid) this was an amazing deal. The room is a little on the smaller size but was perfectly adequate for us (very comfy king sized bed). Room service could have been better (there were visible cup watermarks on the counters that they hadn't wiped away) and I suspect they didn't change the sheets but merely refolded it back neatly, as I have long hair and I found a strand when I got in the bed the second night. On priceline they fall under the "4 star" category but I would say they are definitely on the lower end of that range. Nevertheless for the location and price (and if you're planning to be out and about a lot) it was great

Reviews.Title: “Comfy bed, noisy aircon”
Reviews.Author: LondonWaffle
Reviews.Content: Rooms are big, beds are cosy! Good location too if you want to tour the surrounding area - close proximity to lots of restaurants and bars. The air con makes a fair bit of noise though, so I would suggest ear plugs so you get a quite nights sleep

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and great value”
Reviews.Author: DebfromOhio
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Back Bay for one night on our way to Maine. I used price line and got a room for about $150. The hotel is boutique pretty and the staff is top notch. The rooms are luxurious, the common area beautiful and location is 5 minutes from Newbury street. The concierge worked hard to find us reservations, and find me a last minute manicure on Newbury street. This hotel is a jem!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, convenient downtown location”
Reviews.Author: JZ52057_2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Back Bay Hotel for two nights for Independence Day. I bid the hotel through priceline at almost half off the regular price. The hotel is conveniently located in Boston Downtown area. The room is a little small but the bathroom is very nice with two pieces of bath robe. The bedding is of good quality and of designer taste. The bed is very comfortable. Unlike the other hotel, we were provided with good size (3oz) of shampoo, conditioner, body wash and location, enough for 2 adults and 2 kids. We liked the smell as well. There was a flat panel TV, old fashion radio, a dorm size refrigerator and a free safe in the room. We got two free bottle of waters inside the refrig. This was very nice. Not sure about the room service since we moved from one king bed with a roll-away bed to a room with 2 double bed. We moved our luggage by ourselves since we were in a hurry for a tight schedule. There were a few things we were quite surprised: 1. Use the computer at the business center is free only for the first 15 minutes, After that it is 7 dollars (can not remember the exact amount) for the next hour. Wifi is free though. It cost 79 cents for a black and white print, about $1.5 for a color print. 2. The hotel has a third party company for velvet parking, which is $42 for a day. We ended up parked the rental car in the garage just two block away for $35 for those two days. 3. Since we booked the hotel through priceline, I got a king size bed for 4 of us, I called the hotel ahead of the time for 2 double beds. The man on the phone said they had no rooms with 2 double beds any more. It would cost us $20 for a roll-away bed per night. Luckily, when we arrived at the hotel, the lady at the front desk waived $20 charges.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable wedding weekend”
Reviews.Author: TravelerYon
Reviews.Content: So glad I picked the Back Bay Hotel as my home base for my wedding weekend. We looked a over a dozen hotels in the Boston area and this one an obvious choice. You will see when you start your search. Trust me. Swing by this hotel and your choice will be easy. We started off with Tiffany, who was working with us over the course of the year leading up to the wedding. She was awesome. Represented the hotel extremely well, and made us feel relaxed the whole time. She was promoted and left the property and with a month to go, left us in the hands of Charlene Navarro. What a true professional. So much detail and vision went into the wedding planning with Tiffany and to have this wedding handed over with less then 30 days,would make any couple say "oh boy." She was on her A game.Charlene got up to speed....and fast! She responded to every email promptly,called us back with answers, took the lead on planning and organizing her staff ,made suggestions that made the flow of the evening and look of the reception more appealing, and took care of details behind the scenes that we had not thought of to make the day more special. Also kudo's to Andrew who made the night run smoothly as well. The staff on a whole, was very professional and deserves to be commended. The front desk staff, the doormen, even the waitress' who work in Cuff's. We would stop in for a bite to eat or a drink after a planning session, and they would take the time to know our name and to ask how our planning was going. We had room blocks for our guests, and had several people stay from out of town. They can't stop talking about how great the Back Bay Hotel is. I travel with a Major League Baseball team for a living and stay at some of the best 5 star hotels in the country, and I will be honest and tell you, the Back Bay Hotel is in the same league as far as quality and service. EVERYONE who was involved in our wedding that weekend, kept mentioning service. Have I beat this topic to death yet? Food was amazing! Rooms were large and clean. Very affordable as well. You get a ton for your money and you get to custom design your menu, take over a resturant, and have staff you KNOW ...work for you. Great place for a wedding. They will throw in little touches and make you feel like you are their biggest VIP of the year,on your wedding weekend. I wish the wedding didn't fly by so I could have taken more of this in. I will always have the Back Bay Hotel to thank for a great wedding experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: cpacraig
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked this hotel for three nights over 4th of July weekend. We absolutely loved it. While the room was small (normal for a big city), it was extremely comfortable and nice. Large shower, comfortable bed, flat screen tv, what more do you need? The location was excellent being two blocks from the T station, and two blocks from many shops and restaurants on Boylston street. We were able to walk anywhere we wanted to go. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. One thing to note, it is a $30 cab ride from the airport, although you can easily get there using the T, just changing trains once. I would highly recommend and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “STELLAR Wedding Experience”
Reviews.Author: BeachyKeen15
Reviews.Content: We had our wedding reception at The Back Bay Hotel in their restaurant, The Stanhope Grille...perfect for our small group of about 55 people with a small dance floor. The coordinators ensured all of our requests were not just met, but with great enthusiasm and confidence! I was nervous to turn over the plans to anyone after I had carefully pieced together the details of our reception myself BUT when I saw the end result and how happy my guests were, I was thrilled! Tiffany helped with almost all of the original planning. Charlene and Andrew took over to execute the last minute details, the entire set-up and the coordination of EVERYTHING on the actual day. They were stars!!! The additional staff that served and cleared the food even stepped in to help with the best man speech (he had a flip chart). They were eager to please, answering everyone's questions and clearing the plates quickly. The bartender never seemed to have a line and always had a smile when I breezed by. Come to think of it, EVERYONE had a smile the entire time! The quality of the food was outstanding. We did a mix of "upscale picnic" food as we called it with sliders, fries, some Italian dishes and several desserts. The presentation was perfect. The price? Completely reasonable. We were on a budget and we stayed on budget. How many couples can say that?! Brides and grooms...don't be fooled by the bigger (more expensive) packages and don't try to do it all yourself with several vendors at an empty venu. Choose The Back Bay Hotel. It is beautiful so you don't need many decorations, the staff is top notch, the rooms are gorgeous and the food choices could not be better. You can make the menu your own, give the decor a few personal touches and you are on your way! Oh, and one extra bonus...they upgraded our room for free which totally made us feel like royalty! This was completely above and beyond our expectations. I would not hesitate to recommend them to anyone looking for a place for a small wedding...or a big one! They have plenty of beautiful function spaces on the upper level as well. The Back Bay Hotel allows you to ENJOY your wedding planning experience! You will not be disappointed. :-)

Reviews.Title: “All the Good Reviews are True, What a Treat!”
Reviews.Author: cs35
Reviews.Content: I took a last minute getaway to Boston and stayed at The Back Bay Hotel, it was truly a treat. I was going to stay at a different hotel, but I read too many reviews about bed bugs, so when I saw all the glowing reviews I had to stay at the Back Bay. Valet parking, check-in and out was effortless. The clerk that checked me in also checked me out, and remembered my name. I was impressed. It's small details like that which make for a great weekend. They have free Wi-Fi ,which so many of the large chains make you pay extra for these days. It gets to be tired the way the larger chains nickel and dime you for every service and amenity. The room was very nice. My room was a deluxe with a king size bed. It was exceptionally clean. I felt confident that there were no bed bugs. The bathroom was well stocked, four big bath towels and robes. I was a little disappointed when I saw that the toiletries were not Kiehls as I had seen on trip advisor, but my mom fell in love with them. In the deluxe rooms they feature Aromatherapy Associates brand. I'lll admit it smells great. I actually think I purchased a candle by them at another hotel. The best part was my mom asked me to order it when I got home, she has received several compliments. Sadly, the soap is only stocked in hotels. As for the restaurant and bar, I was impressed. I didn't have the breakfast buffet. I ordered a la cart from the menu. They have a nice selection. Sometimes, I find breakfast at hotels to be focused on the buffet. The service was very attentive, but not overly attentive, you could relax and let down your guard. The bar was nice. Again, there was a nice selection of bar food. The flat bread pizza was excellent. The only flaw that was found was about the air conditioning in our room. My mom found it too loud. Honestly, I thought it was fine. It blows a lot of air through a small vent. The location is great. Close to the Prudential Center, Copley Place, The Boston Commons. There are also great restaurants close by. Go to Boston and stay at the Back Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Hstanhope82
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Back Bay hotel with my mom for the Canada Day long weekend. The hotel was in a prime location, close to Newbury street and the shopping in the Prudential Center and Copley Place. We were super close to an abundance of excellent restaurants, including Grill 23 (across the street) Sorellina's (amazing upscale Italian within 2 blocks) and Stephanies on Newbury (you must go here for people watching and Sunday brunch) The service at the hotel was great, we were even able to check-in early - 9am! Our room was spacious and the mini fridge was stocked every day with 2 fresh bottles of water. The free wireless Internet was a huge plus, as that typically costs at least $20/day at other hotels. I will definiltey stay at the Back Bay for future trips to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: MAORBristol
Reviews.Content: I selected the hotel based in part on the reviews on Tripadvisor. The hotel was okay but I was a little disappointed and it did not compare well to the hotel (same star value) that I subsequently stayed at in New York. The room was fine even if the decor was a bit staid and the bed comfortable. The bathroom (shower) was good and though it had a lot of space just had a shower - no bath. Couple of points 1. The light switch to turn off the lights was no where near the bed - I found this very odd as it meant you had to get out of bed to turn of the side table lights. 2. I tried to use the 'free' 15 mins internet access in the business centre to but failed as it did not recognise my card ( I paid elsewhere and the hotel bill with the card) .The card need to be swiped before I could log in 3. The bed covering and 'fancy' bolster were of a quite shiny (synthetic? ) material and quite old fashioned. The elevator had a very 'jazzy' reflection backwall - all reminded me of the '80s 4. Quite close to emergency services area so opening the window meant a lot of siren noise but the air con did not go low enough for me. 5. All the hallways had very low lighting. 6. I had thought I was getting a kettle/ coffeemaker in the room but was told only deluxe room got this. I really don't see why this can't be provided as standard - one of the front desk staff made a bit of a joke about it later which made me feel a little uncomfortable. 7. The selection of TV channels made me think it was focused on businessmen given the limited selection of general channel and then the large selection of US sports channels All this was not terrible and the room was fine but it suffered in comparison to a NYC hotel and to a Mariott that my friend stayed in in Boston that I saw and was much cheaper - I felt it was quite pricey for what you actually got.. It was in a good location and near everything but I would not recommend it to solo social travelers as it appeared more geared to businessmen.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: constantf
Reviews.Content: A really good hotel just a short walk from shopping and eating at Newbury and Boyleston Streets and the large Prudential Mall. Boston Common is the same short walk on the other side. Excellent room and bathroom. Great service as you would expect from a top hotel with Irish connections. Hint: If you're coming by train, Amtrak stop at at Back Bay station before the centre of Boston. Get off there and you are only one block from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel. Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Neec
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel in every way. The building, staff, rooms/bedding, location and amenities were wonderful. We were first time travelers to Boston. The staff was very informative and made our trip the best. I would not hesitate to stay here again. One tip .... a coffee maker in the room would have been nice. However, coffee service and a limited/light breakfast is available for purchase in the seating area near the front of the elegant hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Classic hotel with excellent rooms”
Reviews.Author: sokeeffe
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Back Bay Hotel for a week while on a business trip to Boston. Arriving on a wet Sunday afternoon I was checked in quickly and found I had a very spacious room. Containing a large bathroom, chest of drawers, and a desk it was very comfortable. Complimentary robes and slippers were a nice touch. Breakfasts were decent, with large portions, but a little pricy overall. Eating and drinking in the attached bar was actually very reasonably priced. My only real complaint would be the quality of the WiFi. Being a big and luxurious hotel I was expecting a nice quick and stable connection, but unfortunately the evenings I used it it was patchy and with a low bandwidth. Having stayed in the Charlesmark hotel on a previous trip perhaps I was spoiled with their excellent WiFi. Overall though I would recommend the Back Bay and I would be happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bcabs
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because we were in town for a long weekend and it was in a great location. It is a beautiful hotel, very clean, smallish rooms but sufficient for my husband and I. Easy walking distance to the T and restaurants. We also walked back from a game at Fenway and it was about 1.5 miles but it was pleasant, very safe. Loved the hotel, if we return to Boston we would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Boston Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LauraG0
Reviews.Content: I really appreciate this hotel, is close to everything, the room and the hotel is amazing and the stuff very friendly and proffessional.

Reviews.Title: “Great overall experience. The Back Bay Hotel has a style of its own.”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeF_111
Reviews.Content: Many hotels pass the test for what I expect - they have clean rooms, and are appointed with good or better beds, furniture and decor. They anticipate the business person's needs, such as convenient power plugs. Yet, it is rare that any of them have a personality and this is where the Back Bay Hotel shines. It starts with an unusual building with a great history. The bar is lively and the hotel staff engaging. If you are bored by the chain hotels who are good but uninspired, try the Back Bay.

Reviews.Title: “One minor, really, complaint”
Reviews.Author: jdjn9
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I stayed here for three nights while visiting family. The room, staff, bar and location were all top notch. Housekeeping and even turn down service. Very high end for the price. One teeny complaint, even on a higher floor and a corner room, we could not leave our drapes open because of complete lack of privacy. Definitely not the hotels fault that he buildings are so tight, but I'm a Florida girl and I missed my sunshine in the morning. It felt kinda gloomy but, as said, a really teeny complaint compared to everything else. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: lambchop101
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a couple nights to wind down after a work conference. It was in a great location, mostly. Close to shopping and restaurants and the T. The only issue I had was the proximity on one side to the fire station. That meant some really loud siren noises at certain points throughout my stay. I stayed in most of the time, just vegging out. I know, sounds a bit crazy, but I got up extra late and stayed up late, too. In the mornings, I noticed the housekeeping was quite loud, even with my door closed and the "do not disturb" sign on my door handle. If you leave early to explore the city, this should be no problem to you, though. The front desk and doormen were absolutely superb in terms of service. I would definitely recommend the hotel, just be aware of the noise levels. If you are used to living in a city with a certain amount of city noise, it shouldn't be an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Superb quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: Larpool
Reviews.Content: Nothing to fault the quality of this hotel , absolutely perfect . Luxurious and clean and very attentive welcoming staff , excellently placed . Definitely one to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: UALsandiego
Reviews.Content: I definitely likes this one. The rooms were stylish and comfortable, the staff was very friendly, and the location is great. There is free wifi, the bathrooms are really cool with all the fancy indirect lighting. Rooms aren't very large, but I would say that's ok, given the overall quality of the rooms. Nice bar and restaurant downstairs. I would definitely stay here again, and recommend the Back Bay Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch hotel”
Reviews.Author: Martha123
Reviews.Content: This is a terrific hotel. It's very close to shopping, the T, the Public Gardens, Newbury Street, Beacon Hill, etc. The staff are wonderful and go out of their way to make you comfortable. My room was a single but it was huge, with a queen bed, big desk, a fainting couch(!) and a huge bathroom with a spa shower. Wifi is free and works beautifully. I didn't eat at the hotel so I can't comment on the food. I would definitely stay here again and have already recommended it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: rickjurewicz
Reviews.Content: Was there 6/2-6/6, what on outstanding stay!!!! All of the staff was professional, courteous, and accommodating. Concierge service was awesome. Wonderful old hotel, The old Boston Police Headquarters. Completely modernized and updated. Free WiFi !!!! Room was outstanding , king sized bed was extremely comfortable. Huge glass enclosed walk in shower, separate tub, furniture style vanity, heated towel bars, thick comfy bathrobes provided, 42" LCD TV. Didn't do their restaurant but Cuff's (their bar) was fun and always had a small crowd. Hotel is right in the middle of everything, don't need a car or cab. Very walkable to all the hotspots, and attractions. Top notch restaurants, and bars all easily within a 15 minute walk or less. 25 minute walk to Fenway Park, same to get to the heart of the North End. Boston Garden ,and Commons are a 5 minute walk. Loved the hotel, staff, and location will defiantly stay there next time in Boston. Restaurants---- Stephenie's on Newberry St. Villa Francesca in the North End. Mistral, 2 blocks from the hotel, Fabulous!!!!!! If You're there on a Sunday, check out the Langham Hotel for buffet brunch. $52 per person and worth every penny!!!!

Reviews.Title: “what agreat hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: leixkil
Reviews.Content: My friends and myself spent three days in Boston ,we really did choose the best Hotel in Boston the staff were more than helpful the concierge Heather is a gem she was so friendly she is full of information and ideas without her help we would not have done all we did thanks to her , also the bell man , bar tenders, and the reception , our room was spacious for three of us , and we had more than enough towels (lovely and soft) and lotion etc, the Back Bay Hotel is the place to stay it is so close to all shopping and great Restaurants and Bars we will be back for sure .

Reviews.Title: “Classy, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: septemberfalls
Reviews.Content: This hotel lived up to all the great reviews and ratings - you can't really go wrong here. Would recommend to pretty much anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely building, great location, stylish vibe.”
Reviews.Author: NandySelson
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal through Expedia, met all our requirements, very central for all attractions. Only criticisms are the rooms are small and no tea/coffee making facilities. Free Wifi though!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: AussieF
Reviews.Content: The next time I am in Boston I will definitely be staying at the Back Bay Hotel. It is a great location for accessing the theatres, the city centre and the delights of Newbury Street. The staff are very friendly and inviting. The rooms were really lovely. It has an old world charm with modern facilities.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: AndysBridgend_UK
Reviews.Content: The amenities are all of a very high standard. The rooms are beautiful, very comfortable. The hotel staff really couldn't be more helpful. The bar serves very good food at a reasonable price. Really couldn't find fault with any thing and hope to return to this hotel at some point.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel service I've ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: Taylorrae05
Reviews.Content: The service provided by The Back Bay Hotel is second to none. Everyone we encountered on their staff did an outstanding job!!
