I could list 5 examples, but I'll just take your time with my favorite: This trip was part of our honeymoon. My husband called ahead and requested a bottle of champagne be sent to our room at a designated time. Not only did the champagne nearly on the dot, it was accompanied by a plate of delicious chocolate truffles, homemade whipped cream and strawberries AND a card! My husband asked if there was something he should sign and the gentleman replied, "No, sir. This treat is compliments of the hotel with our sincerest congratulations." WHAT?! Awesome. The location is perfect and the hotel is clean, comfortable and pretty. Oh, and we booked the room via SniqueAway.com. Usually bookings through a third party vendor land you across from the elevator on the second floor crammed into the tiniest room in the house. Not this time! The Back Bay Hotel put us in a corner room with two huge sets of windows tucked away on the fifth floor! Loved it. LOVED IT!

Reviews.Title: “Not quite as good as it was”
Reviews.Author: KentishTourists
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Back Bay for our one night in Boston over the Memorial day for the past 5 years, and we've continued to go back as the hotel has offered everything that we've needed for a relaxing stopover. This year, for the first time, things were not as perfect as they have been. It's still a good place to stay, but we feel it has slipped a bit, eg rooms looking a bit tatty, cooked breakfast poor and we had to ask 3 times to get a foam pillow delivered to the room. Still a good hotel, just not as great as it was.

Reviews.Title: “Planned a single stay but returned for a second because we liked it so much”
Reviews.Author: stubarker
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked initially for a 2 night stay on the 21st and 22nd May 2011 then went off to continue our holiday elsewhere in New England. However we cut short the 'elsewhere' and decided to return for a further 2 nights at The Back Bay because we had enjoyed Boston and The Back Bay so much. We found the staff to be really helpful polite and informative. The bed was comfortable and the room and bathroom clean and well equipped; the room was adequate size. Evening dining in the restaurant was not over priced and the quality was very good. Full breakfasts were quite expensive but we opted for the reasonable and plentiful 'continental' buffet, About 10-12 minutes walk will see you in the historic and interesting centre. A very agreeable experience!

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: capoeivan
Reviews.Content: The hotel it's very good. It's collocate near Arlington Metro. Sleep Quality it's very nice. Rooms are very confortable and the bath is large. Internet connection is free and the wifi signal is good. Service is ok. There are restaurant, bar and gym

Reviews.Title: “Loved Boston, Loved the BACK BAY”
Reviews.Author: UniversalRoamer
Reviews.Content: The Back Bay Hotel is housed in what was the old Police Department building. The lobby, and the rest of the public areas, are decked out with gorgeous art deco fittings and furnishings. Our room, was fantastic! As far as details go: towel heater to go with the big, fluffy bath sheets, good size ordinary towels, bathrobes, slippers, Aromatherapy Associates products, Nespresso machine, two bottles of complimentary drinking water per day, an umbrella, spacious bath room, plenty of power outlets and free internet. If there were any obvious negatives, they were the lack of hooks in the bathroom, and no tea. Yes, no tea in Boston. No tea party here. It was only a few mintues walk to two different metro stations so very easy to get around. Staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: akanetchan
Reviews.Content: My friend & I enjoyed our time in Boston. It was nice to come back from a long day of exploring & sight-seeing to this beautiful hotel. Its walking distance to the subway, Newbury street, & Copley place. The staff were very nice & friendly. It was a pleasure to interact with Nuala at the front desk on the day of our departure. I will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Hartford2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for on a Friday night since we were going to a Red Sox game. The second we pulled up to the curb we were warmly welcomed. We were given different parking options (garages other than their ownâ€¦ however, we ran over our time limit in the garage we parked in â€“ it was our own fault and looking back, we should have had them valet for us, $42). Itâ€™s a cute hotel in a great location. The check in process was super easy and fast. I LOVED our roomâ€¦ it was so clean and pretty. The bathroom was my favoriteâ€¦ the sink had a motion light detector so at night as you approached it a dim light came on so you could see where you were going. The shower had a great water pressure and they even had a towel warmerâ€¦ so FUN. We did not eat at the restaurant, but wish we had time to have a drink in the barâ€¦ it looked really fun! I would definitely go back to this hotelâ€¦ everyone we bumped into that worked there was super niceâ€¦ seemed to go out of their way to make you feel welcome. I got this hotel by using Priceline.com. I got it for $125 â€“ it was a steal for how awesome the hotel is! I would highly recommend this hotel and will go back if we have the chance

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, service and value”
Reviews.Author: RosieStLouis
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised - The hotel is a refurbished Police headquarters and the atmosphere is quaint, comfortable and welcoming. A first class property with robes, slippers, all the amenities of the best hotels without being overpriced. The service was excellent- staff was responsive to inquiries and took the time at check-in to explain the layout, services and locations for various activities. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: evanw86
Reviews.Content: What an incredible hotel. Between location, facilities, and can-do attitude of staff, this is one of the best I've seen.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel at great location - walking distance to bars and restaurants”
Reviews.Author: joostPaloAlto
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the second time with colleagues. The rooms are clean and nice. The bar downstairs was lively every night, although we didn't spend a lot of time there, since we headed out to nearby restaurants / bars. The breakfast bar at the lobby level was perfect for me, as it serves coffee and pastries quickly. All in all a solid hotel for business travelers. I will probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “lived up to expectations for a quality, boutique hotel with all the travel necessities - well done”
Reviews.Author: tims_travels11
Reviews.Content: web representation of this hotel was accurate of our actual experience: good service, very comfortable rooms, good in-house restaurant/bar, wi-fi and all still relatively new. good location for central boston. would stay again when in boston.

Reviews.Title: “It is always about the service”
Reviews.Author: kmurphy01
Reviews.Content: Recently our extended family stayed at the Back Bay Hotel for my daughter's college graduation. I was concerned about the quality of the hotel and service as we had loving family traveling quite a distance and they are well-traveled, accustomed to the very best. When my sisters arrived, without any questions on my part, they complimented the service upon their arrival, and said they had never experienced such a caring and informative bellman ( I wish I had his name), but honestly we experienced superior service accompanied by friendliness throughout our stay. So many thanks for being a wonderful part of our celebration in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Boston hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Kate4D
Reviews.Content: We had a superior king room, and found it to be comfortable, well furnished, and quite spacious. The bathroom was very attractive, but there was not much room around the pedestal basin to spread your toiletries out. I would prefer a shower cubicle, rather than a shower over a bath. The supplied bathroom products were of a high quality - mmmmm! Staff were very friendly, helpful, and courteous. Great location - easy walk to Boston Common.

Reviews.Title: “Not equal to the competition.”
Reviews.Author: barinr
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at numerous hotels in downtown Boston over the last few years. Most experiences have been good to excellent, Back Bay, previously known as Jury's falls short. The carpet in our room was dirty. We asked to be moved, something we almost never do, and the "better" room had carpet that was just as dirty. The shower had mildew problems and the smell was bad. On the plus side, the staff couldn't be nicer. It's like a beat up old car with a nicely appointed chauffeur. The public areas are nice but a bit dowdy. At these prices, I think you are owed something better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pc_96
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here with my teenage son while exploring the area. Check in was a breeze and everyone was very nice throughout our stay. Close to shopping, subway and attractions. Very good rate booked through Priceline. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A modern hotel with an at home feel.”
Reviews.Author: kat7hy_11
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough wonderful things about this hotel. My husband and I stayed over this past weekend as a part of his birthday festivities. We purchased the room through priceline but we were treated as if we were staying in the presidential suite. From the minute we were greeted with genuine warmth by the staff to our gorgeous room to an amazing lunch at the 'Cuffs' restaurant, we were blown away. We have to give a special thanks to Nuala at the front desk - the champagne and your kindness made a great stay even better. What we loved is that the hotel combined a great history (former Boston Police headquarters) with a clean modern twist and decor. The historical factor was there in spades, yet the care with the design and cleanliness did not make you feel as if you were staying in a place that was 'run down' in any way. Thank you to everyone there for being a shining example that a lovely hotel can have warm and down to earth staff. We will be making our stay at the Back Bay a yearly tradition!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AFontenot
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Back Bay was wonderful! We couldn't have asked for better. The location was perfect - in the heart of things and only a couple of blocks to two different T stations. Heather, the concierge at the hotel, was wonderful. She suggested some great restaurants and helped get reservations. Very informative. All of the staff from the doormen to the housekeepers and everyone in between was very helpful and courtesy. The rooms were very nice, clean and very quiet. I would stay here again anytime I was back in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel in a lovely area”
Reviews.Author: lewpylew
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have just returned from a 2 week trip around the East Coast of the USA. We spent 4 nights at the Back Bay hotel and loved every minute. We arrived by train and the hotel is about 5 minutes walk from Back Bay train station. The hotel is set in the old police station building and is a stunning building both inside and out. We had a room on the 6th floor at the back of the building. A spacious room with a gorgeous bathroom - lovely smelling toiletries and a power shower with a second attachment which is great for massaging your lower back. When we arrived I phoned to ask for the bedding to be changed as my boyfriend has a feather allergy. This was not done for several hours but then by surprise an hour or so later some sparkling brut arrived in an ice bucket with an apology letter which was very kind and totally unexpected. The hotel is within easy reach of many of the city's attractions by foot or alternatively you can hop on the trolley tour which is about 10 mins walk away, or hop on the Arlington tube stop 5 mins away. The only downside was our room was next to a building site and we experienced quite a lot of noise early in the morning. Would not hesitate to come back here : )

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service, excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LEHF
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Back Bay hotel for 7 nights from 21st April. The room was very clean and beds very comfortable. Standard rooms have no bath only a shower, but it was a lovely huge shower but could do with more shelving or storage for shampoo, etc. Rooms come with free wi-fi which was great for keeping in touch with family and getting any tourist info on the city. You also got 2free bottles of water daily to your room, which again is great considering other 4* hotels can charge $2-4 per bottle! There are coffee making facilities in the room, but no tea facilities. However on asking for some we got a tray with a kettle, mugs and teabags sent up to our room! There is a fantastic irish bar, Cuffs downstairs which we tended to go to for a few drinks most nights and food on a couple of occasions. Food and drink was reasonably priced for a hotel and very tasty, excellent staff and service aswell here. The hotel was in an ideal location for getting around Boston, it was 5 -10 mins walk from Newbury and Boylston Streets, Copley Plaza and Prudential Centre. My husband and I also walked to Long Wharf for the harbour cruise and aquarium. It was about 1.5miles away which took us no more than 30mins to walk. This was also beside Quincy Market and Fanuiel Hall. It was also only 15mins away from Boston Common and Theatre District. Very centrally located. while in Boston I had an accident and burnt my fingers on hot tea, the help and assistance provided by Nuala Creedon, Asst Front of House Manager, was great. She was very helpful and directed us to the local ER. Thereafter she offered us any help we required for the duration o our stay. We didn't use concierge as I like to plan ahead for holidays, but I heard 2 different members of staff being very helpful and informative with guests, which was lovely to see. Overall I would highly recommend the Back Bay hotel for your stay in Boston. We will definitively return!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECTION”
Reviews.Author: MTaub123
Reviews.Content: We just got back to NYC after an awsome long weekend over the Easter Holiday and stayed at this really lovely hotel. I had read the reviews here on Trip Adviser and based on what I read, I booked immediately and soo glad I did! This hotel is a gem .. fabulous location and best of all, the staff really aims to please and in that regard, I would like to give the exceptional Nuella Creedon a very special shout out and a very special thank you including the nice bottle of champagne you had sent up to our room... lunch at Cuffs in the hotel hit the mark as well .. looking forward to our next Boston outing .. and I know where I will be staying again ... :)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: MTOchoa
Reviews.Content: The Back Bay Hotel has great service, a great location, and a very helpful staff. The rooms were well-appointed with large bathrooms even in a standard room like mine. The food was very good. I ate right at the bar one night and another with my wife for brunch. The brunch had a great variety including eggs your way. The hotel is located ust two short blocks from Boyleston so you are close enough to the action without paying the highest prices. I also enoyed the Irish flavor and service of the Doyle Group Hotels. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kinapak
Reviews.Content: We arrived on the day of the Marathon, and Nuala had kindly remembered that we were celebrating our anniversary, so the bellboy delivered a bucket of champagne to our room on our arrival! Great start. We wanted tickets for the Celtics game on Tuesday, and Heather, our concierge was fantastic. She rang all her contacts and secured 2 excellent tickets for us. Heather was excellent during our stay and was a real fountain of knowledge. She also recommended Billy's for breakfast, which was a great call! Heather also got us a reservation at the Chart House restaurant, and the food was fab. The room was clean, spacious and had the best shower I have ever used. No complaints about cleanliness, service or location, all were great. Free wifi was also very useful.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jalice80
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Back Bay for Easter weekend for a Getaway, Reserved through Sniqueaway and it could not have been better! The room (superior) was fabulous, (incl. plush bath robes), etc. The staff was more than accomodating and the location is super. ~ VERY close to Tico's, Geoffrey's Cafe, Mistral, and Skipjack's....and Trinity Church! We had a wonderful time and can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: SFBarbara
Reviews.Content: My 18 year old daughter and I stayed at the Back Bay Hotel for several nights while she looked at local colleges. The hotel was perfect for us--every amenity we could want. The two double beds were great, bathroom was large, well lit and stylish. I appreciated the pedestal make-up mirror that you could take into the bedroom, scented bath products, plush robes, powerful blow dryer. And you could open the windows! Woo Hoo! The staff went out of their way to be friendly and helpful, from the time we made our reservation until we left. Location couldn't be better--walking distance to Newbury Street shopping and dining. Saw some amazing exhibits at the Boston Museum of Fine Arts. The hotel bar is great. Didn't eat at the restaurant so can't comment.The only small note of imperfection was that room service was slow. I can absolutely recommend this hotel and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, the ok and the good”
Reviews.Author: cvillelawyer
Reviews.Content: We arrived Friday, April 15, 2011 at the Back Bay Hotel after a long day on the road and received a well appointed room with two beds a great bathroom, a refrigerator and wine cheese and granola bars. We were in town for the Marathon and our reservations were handled with great care and expertise by Charlene N., I cannot say enough good things about Charlene, her excellent work and most of the staff at this hotel. Valet staff, bell staff and all the rest welcomed us to the hotel. The room is good a good size for us and met with our expectations save the fact that there is no coffee maker in the room. I was told that all deluxe rooms come with one but ours is missing or maybe we are not in a deluxe room as we expected and reserved. Saturday morning, we ate breakfast at the hotel's Stanhope Grill and loved every bit of the breakfast. My kids loved the chocolate chip pancakes and my marathon running wife loved the fact that the yogurt was plain yogurt with lots of good fresh fruit for her to add. The location is perfect for all things marathon related and was be a good base for the race and sight seeing in Boston. Dinner on Sunday at the Stanhope Grill was less than great but overall pretty good. The runners carbo-loaded at reasonable prices with no entrÃ©e more expensive than $15. The drawbacks were that the soup was cold and too salty, my duck breast was barely warm but delicious (imagine how good it could have been if it was actually hot) and our waiter did not box up my daughter's entree to take back to the room. The former was more of a problem than the latter which was just a small annoyance. The meal was not perfect but good service and the quality of the rest of the food served to the others eating with us led me to conclude that the kitchen was probably pretty good and the soup and duck were exceptions and not the rule. The trip ended with a request for a coffee maker. No coffee maker but how about coffee delivered â€“ sure/ok â€“ then no coffee was delivered. We went downstairs and purchased coffee from the breakfast lounge and departed. All said the Hotel was just great. We would stay here again though it is unlikely that we would eat more than breakfast at the hotelâ€™s restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: CMCPanama
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for the first time for College visits because all other hotels where I usually stay where booked for the marathon Monday! It was a blessing in disguise! We all loved the hotel, it rained for two days, and they gave me an umbrella to use during our stay, internet was free as well as bottled water and coffee! The Avis rental office was around the corner. All in all, next time we'll stay there again, it was different from the usual Copley stay but two blocks from Arlington T station and surrounded with different and excellent restaurants!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you like feeling overcharged for everything..”
Reviews.Author: AngNDan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Back Bay for marathon weekend. While the hotel is beautiful, and pristine, we do not recommend it. We paid just under $1000.00 for a two night stay. There are NO coffee makers in the room. There is a "coffee bar" in the lobby. We paid $6.00 for two small styrofoam cups of coffee. Parking for one night cost us $42.00. We had to move our car the second night to a garage that was not on a road that was closed. We found one just around the corner, and that one only cost us $27.00. We felt very over charged for everything at the hotel. The beds were very uncomfortable. Horrible to be honest. The female working the concierge, knew nothing as far as marathon info went. We asked for directions to the center where the expo was, and she had to google it! Why hadn't the manager prepped his employees? After she looked it up online, her directions were horrible. She told us it was 2 blocks away. Yes, if each block is about a mile each. She seemed very unqualified for her position. My husband will be running the marathon again next year, along with friends who also qualified. We will definitely not be returning to the Back Bay and will recommend our friends do the same.

Reviews.Title: “Service Above and Beyond”
Reviews.Author: CheckingIn10
Reviews.Content: I have been to the back bay of Boston many times but this was my first stay at the Back Bay Hotel. Aside from a great central location and stylish hotel setting the real difference is the fabulous staff. Nuala at the front desk check in could not do enough to make you feel at home and get the most out of your stay. Amy was also very helpful at check out. The bellmen made dropping the car off extremely easy and seamless. I have stayed at the Fairmont, Marriott and Westin Copley before but prefer the personalized service and location of the Back Bay Hotel. Try Skipjack's restaurant for a good seafood dinner...only 2 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely incredible service!”
Reviews.Author: CLMaxey
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Back Bay Hotel during a week-long conference. The room was clean, warm and inviting, with turn-down service every night. The staff was incredible! I couldn't ask more for friendly service. I actually enjoyed calling for a wake-up call - Natalie, who took the call each night, was awesome! She was very friendly and you could actually hear her smile over the phone. After a couple of nights, she even remembered what time I needed the wake-up. This may not sound like a big deal - but after 10 hour days of being in a stuffy conference room, it was a pleasure going back to the hotel. I would absolutely recommend this hotel (and actually have to several people in my company who will be travelling to Boston in the next few weeks).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, great location”
Reviews.Author: waking2dream
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with my stay at the Back Bay Hotel where I stayed two nights. I spent one night at the Omni Parker House Hotel before transferring to the Back Bay and the contrast could not be greater. Great personal service and a good convenient location. I was able to walk everywhere I needed to get to. The room was large, clean and comfortable. The robes and Aromatherapy Associates toiletries provided were luxurious. I was also very happy to have free internet connection which was not the case at the Omni but which should be standard at all hotels by now. It is always a surprise when it is not! They even provide a newspaper of your choice in the morning. While the room was lovely, there were a few small, easily remedied things that would have made my stay perfect. The bed was very comfortable but I would have liked a duvet (a blanket was provided) as the temperature control in the room was not adjustable. I was able to select a higher temperature, but the thermomostat would auto reset to 68 so I ended up being cold during the night. There were also no facilities to prepare tea or coffee in the room, which surprised me for a luxury hotel such as this one.

Reviews.Title: “A Boston Treasure!”
Reviews.Author: maresy54
Reviews.Content: From now on, The Back Bay Hotel will be my only choice for accommodations when visiting Boston! The incredibly gracious, efficient staff makes guests feel as though they are the most welcome travelers in the world, and everyone entering this hotel is welcomed like a VIP. Understated elegance combined with sleek modern touches make this hotel a perfect blend of Old World charm, and trendy, upscale vibrancy. Well located near The Commons, Newbury Street shopping, wonderful restaurants and transportation hubs, the Back Bay Hotel is an absolute treasure! The rooms are beautifully decorated with luxurious amenities, and our huge bathroom was filled with high end toiletries. The elevator has a whimsically charming feel, and throughout the building, attention to detail is outstanding. As the former Boston Police Headquarters from the Roaring Twenties, it's appropriate that the ground floor pub/restaurant is named "Cuffs". Memorabilia from the building's former incarnation highlights the theme of the pub, and service, as well as food selections, are excellent. While The Back Bay Hotel is listed as a 4 Star property, my experience is that it's 5 Star Superior all the way!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay !”
Reviews.Author: Rod009
Reviews.Content: Warm, friendly hotel with great staff, large well equipped rooms and superb location for all of boston's sights ! would definately recommend this hotel to anyone considering staying here

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: BrendaCConway_NH
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Back Bay Hotel while attending a friends surprise birthday party in the area. What a wonderful hotel this is. Great location. We walked everywhere, but is also very close to the "T". The room was spotless and was spacious. Modern bathroom with heated towel bars and walk in shower. Flat screen tv's and mini refriegerator. Beds were fine. Ate breakfast at the restaurant downstairs on Sunday morning. A little pricey, but the food was excellent. We will definitely go back to the Back Bay Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: annof2manyhorses
Reviews.Content: We stayed here only one night, but it was really nice. The staff was helpful and professional. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: Business50
Reviews.Content: I travel to Boston on a fairly regular basis and always stay at the Back Bay Hotel (formerly Jury's). The rooms are very comfortable and clean and the staff are exceptional. In fact, during my previous stay, I left my iPod touch in the room safe. When I realized what I had done (two days later) I immediately called the hotel and spoke with Tahrien. He indicated that nothing had been turned in but he would look for it and call me back. Within 30 minutes he called back with the good news that he had found my iPod. I was thrilled - thank you so much Tahrien.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff & Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: martinTricia_11
Reviews.Content: Just had a 4 night stay with my wife and daughter. The room was excellent with a convient bar on the ground floor serving snacks ( Cuffs) The location is great, with a car hire firm (Avis) around the corner, we parked there over night which was cheaper than Valet parking.Cab from the airport was 25 dollars. Will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel. Absolutely would return.”
Reviews.Author: DisneyDad89
Reviews.Content: The Back Bay is defintely worthy of its high ratings! The location is excellent, service is great, architecture and history are really cool. The rooms are spacious and quiet, amenities are very good. Great shower! Bed was a little on the firm side, but not a big issue. Free high speed wireless is a big plus! Highly recommend Ate at Mistral nearby, and it was FABULOUS.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale hotel, but lacking in 'normal' amenities”
Reviews.Author: Trayci2684
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a beautiful hotel with a neat history (since it was formerly the police station). My husband and I arrived to the Back Bay hotel late in the evening, tired from a day filled with travel. The check-in process was efficient and the front desk clerk was friendly. The room was nice, but a little small. Each of us had two pieces of luggage (of average size) as well as a backpack. There was really no good place to put all of our luggage so that it was out of the way. We constantly had to rearrange the luggage so that we were not tripping over it. The bed was incredibly comfortable and the shades drown out all light in the room, so you don't have to worry about being woken up by the sun in the morning. However, it was very warm in our room one of the nights during our 4 night stay, which made it difficult to sleep. The bathroom was wonderful! It contained quite a bit of granite and was very large. The walk-in shower was very relaxing at the end of the day. The bath products provided by the hotel are some of the very best that I've had (from a hotel). There is a motion-activated nightlight in the bathroom, which is great to help you see in the middle of the night...but be careful - the light goes out quickly and only detects motion near the door of the bathroom (not near the toilet). The bathrobe and house shoes that were provided added a nice touch of comfort and home. The view out of the window was of an office building next door...not exactly picturesque, but not abnormal for a hotel in a large city. The walls inside of the hotel were pretty thin so be prepared to hear people walking around and talking, especially during the early evening. The turn down service was very nice. I thoroughly enjoyed the chocolates left on the bed in the evening. Overall, the service was excellent and the people who worked at the hotel were friendly and helpful. I would have appreciated a normal coffee pot in the room instead of a fancy espresso machine. And, for the money, I would have liked either a complimentary breakfast or an evening reception (or both). It would have made the stay more enjoyable. The high speed Internet was very slow for us. In fact, I used the 3G connection on my iPhone and was able to surf the Internet much faster than if I connected to the wifi. The location can't be beat. You are only a few blocks from the metro and in a very nice area of town. We felt very comfortable walking around in the neighborhood in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular, Clean, Perfect Location!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: skeezicks_02889
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Very clean with all the amenities!!!! Staff was very helpful and nice. Great location too.

Reviews.Title: “Really mediocre hotel, so not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: demichej
Reviews.Content: There are 2 major complaints I have with this hotel. 1) We bought our room on SniqueAway (which is associated with TripAdvisor) at a "decent" price. We show up and they put us in literally the smallest room in the hotel, guaranteed. It was a hallway....then bed. We called and they did in fact move us, so +1 for their service there. HOWEVER, why in the world did they put us in such a terrible room to begin with? My only guess can be that it was because we bought from a 3rd party. 2) If you actually pay full price for this hotel you are a sucker. There's NOTHING to it. The business center charges you like $10 for 15 minutes on the computer. It's a hotel, period. There's absolutely nothing there that warrants the price (maybe location!?!?!)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, attentive staff - will be back!!”
Reviews.Author: Hatterpride
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed @ The Back Bay Hotel during my daughter's track competition at the Reggie Lewis Center. We were pleased by the value that we received for the staff attentiveness as well as the overall accommodations. The check-in process was seamless and the front desk staff were very pleasant. The Bellman and the housekeeping staff were also both pleasant and responsive to our needs. Our room was well appointed and clean. It came with 2 cozy robes and upscale toiletries. The bathroom was large and boasted a walk-in shower with a powerful shower head. The bedding was plush and comfortable. The hotel has a busy bar area and a hip overall feel. It is located in the heart of the Back Bay which makes it a choice location to stay in. There are many good restaurants within walking distance and plenty of shopping. Very safe area for walking. We will most definitely be back again when visiting the city. Thank you for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location, we will be back.”
Reviews.Author: DawnMDe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights over St Patrick's weekend. The location is excellent, very close to Newbury Street, Copley Place, Prudential Mall, Charles Street, The Old Town Trolley Tour stop, Boston Common, the T, TD Gardens, the airport (15mins) etc. The staff were very friendly and helpful, in particular the concierge Heather. The restaurant downstairs serves really good food and the rooms were perfect. I can't recommend the hotel highly enough, we will certainly be back!

Reviews.Title: “A good stay in the heart of Boston”
Reviews.Author: Daylove
Reviews.Content: The Back bay is an excellent hotel and I was surprised by the level of customer service offered and the spacious comfy room. The only negative is that meeting space is limited and the business center is very small. The downstairs bar is small and packed in the evening. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Bob98fatboy
Reviews.Content: Great downtown location. Close to everything and subway. Excellent restaurants, bars and shopping in area. Stayed in the "Superior King" room and was extremely tiny. Nice but tiny. Approximately 250 square feet. AC was a little noisy since room is so tight. Would recommend a little bigger room if price is not too much extra. Staff was friendly & helpful when needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel/friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: allenooo
Reviews.Content: Stayed the past weekend here on a great priceline rate, we recieved the standard room with queen size bed but it was a very nice room, big enough with a desk, chaise lounge and a nice bath with walk in shower. The staff was very friendly and efficient. Cuffs was a nice place to hang out for a drink and a snack. Had breakfast in the Stanhope, pricey but convenient and with great pancakes. The hotel is in the business and theatre area, so if your going for historic sites you can take a long walk or the T. Only complaint is the $42 for valet.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't go back too noisy and water pressure weak”
Reviews.Author: Supertemp
Reviews.Content: The room was comfortable and clean. The room faced the back of the hotel and was near or sounded like right under a noisy air or heat unit. I didn't get any sleep but the person I was in the room did. Took a shower and water pressure was really weak both night and morning. Didn't bother washing my hair. Was afraid it wouldn't rinse the suds out. Overall it is a beautiful hotel. I'm sure if we stayed another night the staff would've moved us to a more quieter unit. The hotel was beautiful and the front desk staff and doormen were extremely polite and helpful. Who designed this hotel? Did they take into account of the noise level? I am a light sleeper anyway so only take this advice if you can hear a mouse burp.

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk Staff Nuala”
Reviews.Author: tonygnj
Reviews.Content: Nuala went out of her way to make sure I got a special food treat and water before i retired for the night. Thanks Nuala the extra effort was appricated

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way possible!”
Reviews.Author: groggsdunne
Reviews.Content: Thanks to all the staff of the Back Bay Hotel, 350 Stuart Street, Boston. Myself and my husband stayed for five nights. Our stay in this hotel was excellent! The staff are out on their own, they are so helpful and geniune! We would highy recommend this hotel and hopefully will be back sooner rather than later! Thanks again

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite hotels in Boston”
Reviews.Author: AllaPrima0
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently enjoyed a short stay (one night) at the Back Bay Hotel in Boston. For Christmas, I had received tickets to the BSO, and while we were seeking just a brief night away from home, we wanted to try something new, and after some Internet research, I settled on the Back Bay Hotel. It already had wonderful reviews and has a convenient location (across the street from Grill 23, two blocks away from either the Copley stop on the Green Line and the Back Bay stop on the Orange Line), so I booked us a Superior King room for a Saturday night. We arrived and were greeted by a very helpful and friendly woman at the front desk. She offered us the services of several different amenities, many of which we declined (no wake-up calls for us on Sunday morning). We found our room spacious and spotless, with a large bathroom, complete with heated towel rack and a shower with multiple shower heads. Perfect for relaxing. The room came with complimentary waters, a stereo system, and an espresso machine. After having enjoyed a hot shower, we stopped at their Irish bar, Cuffs, for some cocktails and an appetizer. The bartender was very friendly, and helped me with a drink choice off of their cocktail menu. We opted to share a cheese and charcuterie plate, which was enormous and marvelous. Later, when we returned to the hotel (around midnight), the bar was hopping with plenty of happy sounding patrons, and were we not exhausted and stuffed (after dining in the North End), we may have joined them again. After our night out, we returned to our room to see that we had received turndown service, complete with plush robes, slippers, and chocolates. The curtains completely blocked out any semblance of light and sound from the street below, so much so that when I woke up at 8am the next morning, I was surprised to learn that the sun had even risen - it was still relaxingly, quietly dark in the room until we opened the curtains. Though we were in a bit of a hurry to catch a train, we opted to try breakfast at the Stanhope Grille, the museum's full-service Irish-American restaurant. They have several a la carte menu items, but we both chose the well-stocked buffet. Happily stuffed on eggs, lox, and toast, we had a smooth and easy check out, and a charming doorman helped us with our bags to the taxi stand on the corner. All in all, a spotless, marvelous stay, which I am sure we will repeat. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: chrisinatlanta
Reviews.Content: our family recently traveled to this hotel and had an excellent stay. I especially liked the walk in shower, the friendly staff, and the hotel bar (which was very crowded and lively both nights we were there). As with many hotels in Boston, it was very close to the T as well as Newbury street and Copley Place. I only have two minor issues: 1) we paid extra for a larger room. I had expected an incrementally larger room than a normal double, but it barely contained enough room to add a cot. 2) i realize that parking is expensive in Boston but $44 a day seems a little excessive.

Reviews.Title: “So amazing! I felt spoiled.”
Reviews.Author: etacar11
Reviews.Content: I wish I could afford The Back Bay Hotel on a normal basis, but I could only stay there with the great internet rate that I got. It was quiet, clean, beautifully furnished. The bathroom was as big as the bedroom area! Tub + shower stall + phone + towel warmers? Do I need all this? No. But it still felt great to have it all there. The room also had a fridge and coffee maker that I didn't need but it was lovely that they were there. Only two blocks from the Back Bay train station, so the location is very convenient. I only dealt with the staff at check in and check out but they were very friendly and helpful. I couldn't have been happier.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a great location with very friendly ,helpful and attentive staff.”
Reviews.Author: joecarr99
Reviews.Content: We checked in on Fri after a long trans-atlantic flight for a four night stay in Boston , the staff were very welcoming and helpful from the minute we got there . The Hotel had a nice fire lighting and had a nice warm atmosphere throughout the reception and bar / restaurant area. Our room was on the 7th floor with a street view . It was very comfortable with a generous size bathroom (no bath). After a great night sleep we both had a very tasty breakfast , I had the hot and cold buffett and my wife had the hot oats with fresh blackberrys . The staff could not do enough for us all through our stay from advising us on restaurants , shopping destinations , things to do and not to do . The location could not be better as we could walk to wherever we needed to go . I would definetly reccomend this Hotel if travelling to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: saint22
Reviews.Content: My young daughter was born with hip dysplasia which requires us to visit the Children's Hospital Boston a few times a year. She is doing fine and it has given us a chance to visit many different hotels in this great city. We stayed two nights at the Back Bay Hotel and it was a brilliant experience. Curbside valet greeting was friendly, warm and energetic. Upon entering the hotel, you ascend the frosted glass stairs to check in. The lobby was beautiful. I especially admired the bronze sculpture of the serene kneeling woman whose body had the texture of hundreds of small pine cones. Check in was warm and friendly and we rode the elevator to our deluxe room on the 8th floor. The room was very inviting in shades of brown and gold. The bathroom was beautiful and spacious with seperate shower and bathtub. The room was handsome. The room had two double beds which were extremely comfortable. Water bottles were complimentary as was the hotel WiFi for our Ipad. The breakfast in the Stanhope Grille was excellent and we enjoyed hot chocolate in Cuffs after skating at the Frog Pond in Boston Common. The hotel was quiet and classy. It was beautiful. Everyone we encountered from the friendly doormen to the service people were gracious and professional. This hotel is fully deserving of its lofty ranking here on TripAdvisor. It was a brilliant travel experience. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best sleeps of my life”
Reviews.Author: Shivan_Dragon
Reviews.Content: We came in the night before the most recent snow emergency; and the staff was wonderful. The check in process lasted less the five minutes, and in that time they made sure I had the room I wanted and had made me reservations for Italian just down the street. The room itself was wonderful. Very well maintained with a very modern look to it. What made the room was the bed and the assortment of pillows and bed coverings. I hit the bed after dinner and was out like a light. The service was excellent; calling down for the car from valet was a snap and by the time I came down they had it waiting for me within ten minutes even with the terrible weather. Great location, great service, and wonderful sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Stunning *****!”
Reviews.Author: Emma-Bubbles-
Reviews.Content: My Mother and I stayed at the Back Bay from 14-19th January 2011. On arrival the hotel was easy to find from the subway station and the hotel reception staff were incredibly welcoming and friendly. They had for some reason checked us in from the 12th however they rectified this immediately and provided us with a front facing room. The lift of the hotel is fab, the back wall is lined with mirrored/coloured paper and therefore makes a very enjoyable ride! The corridor to our room was fresh, carpets were clean and everything was well maintained. We were overjoyed with our room, the bathroom was lovely, the complimentary products were divine, the complimentary dressing gowns were lovely and warm, and two bottles of complimentary water were available in the fridge daily. The room had heaters, fridge, phone, tv, hi fi stereo and a huuuge closet! The only problem my mum had (light sleeper) was that there was some work going on across the road-nothing like england- they start at 7am!!! and she wasnt too impressed that she got some interrupted sleep. I didnt hear anything though to be fair. The concierge ensured we got tons of coupons for shopping! and she also checked to ensure our flight was arriving (a snow storm had begun!!). I would stay here again in a heartbeat, the best inner city hotel ive ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Bronze35
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Back Bay after a business trip into Boston. The hotel greeted us with warm moist towelettes that smelled like lavender upon arrival. An experience I've only had in Europe, never the United States! The staff was so accomodating we couldn't have asked for more. The room was clean and cozy with a lovely large bathroom and wonderful bath products. I love the light sensor that turned on automatically in the middle of the night (senses motion I presume), lovely touch! The Concierge was knowledgeable and friendly. The beds and linens were so comfortable I had a GREAT nights sleep each night. The price was a GREAT value!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Execution of Our Wedding, Including "Losing" Our Gifts”
Reviews.Author: girlyrobyn
Reviews.Content: Our wedding reception was at Mistral, a wonderful restaurant and event location (around the corner from the Back Bay) that we highly recommend. We held our ceremony at the Back Bay Hotel. Our guests stayed overnight there and we also treated everyone to breakfast in the hotel's Stanhope Grille the morning after the wedding. Planning with Tiffany [-] went smoothly and she was very helpful. She seemed to cover all the bases and reminded us of things we may have overlooked. I was confident things would go smoothly under her command. However, the day before the wedding, Tiffany emailed me that someone named Marcelo would be in charge of the event because she wasn't working the weekend of our wedding. We are pretty laid-back people. I used to moonlight doing a some wedding catering and I've seen it all . . . I also know that things go wrong and most things don't bother me. But after our weekend at the Back Bay, all I could think was that it seemed like the adults had gone away for the weekend and left a bunch of college kids to run the place. To begin, we had welcome bag/amenities we paid to have delivered to our guests rooms on Friday. We delivered them to the hotel around lunchtime on Friday. At 8 p.m. or so, my mom said she hadn't received her gift bag and we had to call the front desk to ask them to please deliver the welcome bags. On Saturday, I arrived at the hotel in my own car, in a wedding dress, with bags in hand. The valets took my car, but didn't help me with my multiple bags, which I struggled to get up the stairs. There were 3 valets just standing there, yacking with each other. I mean, how could you miss me in that big ol' dress? And how come the valets didn't know a bride was showing up? Where was Marcelo? I never saw him. Next, incorrect names were on the hotel event monitor screens that announced our wedding, even though I specifically spelled out in the contract which names (and the correct spellings) we wanted. (I have been previously married, and they used my ex-husband's last name, not my own last name. Also, a guest told me that the day before the monitors had my correct last name, but that it was spelled incorrectly.) A champagne toast with ginger ale option (specified in the contract) was supposed to be passed out as soon as my husband and I walked back down the aisle. No one from the hotel was there with the toast, and after waiting, I had to go to the front desk (where the staff was hanging around and joking) and ask them to please bring it out. It took them quite a bit of time to bring it, and when they did, there was no ginger ale for the kids and teetotallers. This took more time to rectify, which confused the guests, who were expecting a toast and couldn't figure out what was going on. During the toast, which was a speech given by one of our closest friends, the staff at the front desk was still joking, laughing and chatting so loudly that one of our guests had to excuse himself from the room and go ask the desk to keep it down so we could hear the speaker. My parents had invited our guests to breakfast at the Stanhope Grille in the hotel for Sunday morning. The hotel was supposed to apply the charges to our master account, but instead charged our guests for the breakfast. We had to have them back the charges out individually and reapply them to our master account. This was embarassing, because we intended to provide breakfast for everyone. Some guests who checked out prior to our realization of this error may have been billed for breakfast. I have to try to find out in a tactful manner who they were and try to rectify the situation. When we left, the bellman took our bags out to the car. The silver cake stand that we needed to return to our bakery was with the bags. When I retrieved it from the trunk of the car to put in the front seat for the drive home, I noticed it had been dropped and had a large dent on one side. The dent occurred in the five minute span of time that the bellman had the luggage trolley with our bags. No one would take responsibility for it. My husband had had enough nonsense by now, and went to the front desk to complain. He really got upset when the girl at the desk listened to him and then said, "Oh well, things happen." Finally, I learned today that at least one guest had left wedding gifts for us at the front desk. They had requested the gifts be delivered to our room. We never received them. We are currently missing a few gifts, one was a magnum of Veuve Clicquot champagne. It's pretty uncomfortable when your relatives call you to see if you liked the gift they left for you and you have no idea what they're talking about. I don't even know how to go about asking people if they left gifts for us at the front desk, nor can I imagine a way they can make this up to us and my relatives who paid for gifts that can't be located. The Back Bay Hotel is very nice, clean and seems like it has everything going in its favor. I was really shocked by the apathy and lack of focus we experienced. By contrast, definitely have your wedding reception at Mistral. Everything was executed in an exceptional manner. The staff is lovely, attentive and friendly. The food is exquisite and the room has a fantastic vibe. Couldn't be better. Just find some place other than the Back Bay for your guests/ceremony!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic! Cant wait to stay again!”
Reviews.Author: pudpud88
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fantastic, everything we wanted was there. We felt at home here, we came and went as we pleased. The staff where so polite and nice with any questions we had. The hotel room was more than we expected. We had a flat screen tv, fridge and lots of storage space, and an umberella for or if it rained. Every day the room was cleaned and was cleaned when we left which meant we where never disturbed. The hotel food was pricey but well worth the money. The location was very good only short walks to resturants and sights. It has the charm of boston all wrapped up in one place!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: ladyinmaryland
Reviews.Content: I never make a hotel reservation without checking the property out on TripAdvisor. So, when I was looking for a hotel for a quick getaway the weekend before Valentines Day, I read the reviews for various hotels (even those where I have Top Tier status and could stay for free) and it was tough with the various reviews about bed bugs, rude and inattentive hotel staff, etc.; none of the things I wanted to contend with on a romantic getaway. So, when I read the reviews for The Back Bay Hotel and most were positive, I booked via Expedia. I was not disappointed! From Sean who greets you on the street, the valet team, Jaime in the Stan Hope Grill, the concierge who tended our bags in the absence of the bellman and the front desk reception staff, first impressions are lasting. The property is well-maintained, the King Suites roomy, clean and quiet and the artwork and sculptures throughout the property are pleasing. Every detail is taken into consideration even down to the potpourri in the ashtray section of the hallway waste receptacles! Our stay was further enhanced by the little extras like complimentary wi-fi, the heated towel rack, stereo system and upscale toiletries in our suite. Breakfast in the Stan Hope Grille was really good and Jaime was very attentive. The location is perfect to explore the city on foot, just blocks from Copley Square. The valet rate is $42.00 per night. Cuffs Bar located on site is a nice place to chill after a day exploring the city. A great stay, canâ€™t wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Poor air - needs remodeling”
Reviews.Author: somesville
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and they offered us a different room after we asked for it. The first room had very strong disinfectant odor. The second room was better, but also some odor. Overall it looks like that the place has seen better days and needs a complete remodeling. The rooms did not have a coffee maker, but they offered free coffee in the basement. There is no parking on site, only valet. We used a public garage not too far away. Overall we were really disappointed and happy that we stayed only 1 night.

Reviews.Title: “Just wonderful”
Reviews.Author: fivestarKent
Reviews.Content: We received a very warm welcome and had a throughly enjoyable stay, we would not hesitate to return!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: odiabo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently got married at the Back Bay Hotel. It is a beautiful hotel that has a great location in the back bay- a short walk to both the Green and Orange T lines. The hotel staff was amazing and they went out of their way to make our stay unforgettable. While we were there for our wedding we were treated like honored guests. From big things like having our room upgraded to the presidential suite to smaller things like hot cocoa waiting for us at check in and champagne and hand made truffles waiting for us in our room after our wedding. You certainly don't have to be getting married to receive great service at this hotel. All of our friends and family raved about the friendliness of the staff, the cleanliness of the hotel and its amazing decor. Several of our guest even got upgrades of their own. I recommend this hotel to business travelers and pleasure travelers alike. Also, if you are looking to plan an event go here for the most amazing service in town!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: The4fortysomethings
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in great location. Hotel decor was lovely and our rooms were spotless. Very comfortable and staff were very pleasant. Great bar downstairs for a cool beer on a hot day or a quick bite to eat at any time. Not many places to get a sit down breakfast nearby though.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: gondaa
Reviews.Content: My wife enjoyed our stay at Back Bay. This was our first trip to Boston and the staff was very helpful and the facility was very clean. My only issue is that I do not like to miss a work out and the on site fitness center was pretty limited. I do realize most hotels do not have a complete center but there was minimal equipment.

Reviews.Title: “Just a great Boston Hotel”
Reviews.Author: leximadison1
Reviews.Content: Great location and service. Would highly recommend to all. Just around the corner from Boston's best shopping and within walking distance or short drive from great dining choices.

Reviews.Title: “Grand surroundings - Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: LordyLordy01
Reviews.Content: My husband booked the hotel as part of a surprise week long trip to the States for my 40th birthday. He wanted a luxurious hotel, close to the centre of things as we were only there for a couple of days. Our room was lovely - the nesspresso machine was very welcome! The bathroom toiletries are particularly nice too. I would also highly recommend the hotel breakfast - classy & satisfying, just like the hotel!! We also had drinks in the bar one evening & would highly recommend it as a spot for people watching! Many thanks to all the tem for making it an enjoyable stay

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Eve Stay - Everything but a visit from Santa himself”
Reviews.Author: Craig_Finley
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay in Boston for Christmas Eve and was very happy to have picked the Back Bay Hotel. Located close to many major downtown areas, a simple walk to public transit was certainly a plus, but the welcoming staff, quality of the lounges, common areas, and the room set a high standard. Christmas Eve is certainly a night you want to be special. The staff went well out of their way to welcome me and make sure everything was taken care of. Christmas morning was the same with the restaurant serving a great breakfast, and plenty of other guests also giving praise to the staff. It's always tough to be the ones working on the holiday, and from the welcoming valet/door staff to the housekeeping - everyone was just happy to help. Rooms had comfortable beds, were well laid out, and the the free wi-fi was a nice plus!

Reviews.Title: “Casual Yet Refined”
Reviews.Author: abaxter
Reviews.Content: We got a deal on this hotel through a discount travel site, and boy did we luck out. The location is fabulous, situated near wonderful shops, restaurants and attractions. The hotel itself is beautiful and clean. It has great design and style. The entrance, the lobby, the bar and the restaurant are all tasteful and welcoming. I can't say enough about the staff. The door man, the front desk staff, the bellman, the concierge, and the wait staff were all friendly and helpful. The rooms are very nice with beautiful linens, an espresso maker, a great stereo, operable windows, and a huge marble bathroom. My only minor complaints are that the water pressure left something to be desired and it was warm in the room, although not unbearable, despite the fact that we kept lowering the temperature on the thermostat. Also worth mentioning is that in a room with two beds, the beds are full sized, not queen. Overall it was an awesome stay and we would definitely return if the price were right!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible suites, horrible bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: B_Shao
Reviews.Content: The back bay hotel might have hit a value-for-money sweet spot - $200/night - with its regular rooms, but its suites, at $695/night, are terrible deals. In the suite I stayed in, the bathtub is as small as that in a motel, even though there is ample space for a longer, deeper, and wider tub in the suite's bathroom. The water pressure in the shower stall is so weak that it made showers something to avoid rather than enjoy. And the light switches in the suite was numerous and confusing - it takes me a few minutes every night just to turn off the lights. On the plus side, the people are nice, location convenient, and service good. At the price the hotel is charging however, my suite was probably the worst hotel room I have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BJLindy1
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this hotel!! It was unique in that the building was originally the Boston Police Headquarters. The interior design was modern, eclectic, and really stunning. The staff were so friendly and accommodating, the location was awesome, and the amenities were fabulous! I especially enjoyed the luxurious terry bathrobe and matching slippers you received upon arrival. My friend and I really had a great time, and would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: LukeBris90
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights over new years and had a great stay. All the staff were helpful and gave us really good ideas for things to do on new years. We stayed in the base room and were very happy with the size and quality of the room. The little touches such as heated towel rails and sensored night light in the bathroom and many others set this hotel apart from others. The location is great as you can find pretty much anything you want in a 5 minute walking radius from the hotel. In room dining had. Decent selection and wasn't all that expensive. The only things I didn't like about this hotel was that the restaurant doesn't really offer a selection of simple food as it was very Irish orientated and also there always seemed to be a queue at reception. I would gladly reccommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TriniIan
Reviews.Content: The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful. We interacted with at least 8 different staff members and all were over the top friendly. The room was a bit small, but it was clean, in great condition and attractive. The hotel is located near a rental car area, there are 2 T stops within blocks and lots of restaurants near. They stored our luggage for us during our last day there so we could check out on time but still get out and explore the city. I am very happy with our stay at Back Bay hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant but a little sterile”
Reviews.Author: luxlovernyc
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3-night stay at the Back Bay. As others have noted, it's a comfortable property and in my view, reasonably priced compared to others. The staff was friendly and very service-oriented and the bar and public areas very well maintained and pleasant. I was less impressed with the room itself. While a deluxe room, the space was oddly configured as others have noted, so the actual room was really pretty small and unlike most hotels, idn't have any kind of seating for reading or lounging other than the bed. I have to say the bed was really comfortable, but the rest of the room didn't live up to standards of equivalent 4-5 star hotels. We had asked for and got a corner room, with lots of light, but that may have been a smaller space. Personally, I'd have preferred a comfy chair and reading lamp than the table with the nepresso machine (they provide complimentary coffee downstairs anyway). The lighting in the room wasn't great anyway -- hard to read in bed at night without having a tiny book light. The bathroom, while spacious, with a separate tub and shower, was cold (seemingly no heat) and the large window wasn't frosted in any way, so anyone could look in from surrounding tall buildings and you couldn't really appreciate the natural light. The tub was quite small, so not a great soaking tub. We didn't have trouble with room service -- ordered coffee one morning and arrived promptly, but we did have the breakfast buffer in the restaurant one morning, which was mediocre. There's a Starbucks and Au Bon Pain two blocks away -- better and good value. All in all, it was a pleasant stay and the bar was a great place to hang out, but I will probably try a different hotel next visit to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “SWANK HOTEL, FRIENDLIEST STAFF, NEW YEARS EVE 2010”
Reviews.Author: diamun
Reviews.Content: Last second reservation from Priceline for FIRST NIGHT in Boston for Mom and Twin girls age 13. Drove down from NH. Couldnt get directions from website to save my life, so called hotel directly. She gave me directions in one sentence. MA Pike, Exit 22, Copely, second light on the right! Bellman was a giant, and quickly became my best friend. He took care of my vehicle, hailed Taxi's and treated us like family. This is a 4 star hotel, so expect to have money when you go, and PLEASE tip! I loved the room. We had 2 double beds or queens (not sure as I have a king at home), with a zillion pillows like I have at home. Big screen TV, and small stereo system, and fridge under TV cabinet with complimentary water. Marble bathroom, heated towel rack, and under the sink area was a pleasant motion light! So in the middle of the night, when your not sure of the light switch, it will come on for a bit, and then turn off. Need it again, just put your foot slightly under sink area again, back on it comes. How cool is that? There is a phone on the wall beside the sink and above the toilet easily reachable. When I called the front desk while my girls were still sleeping, I had some questions which Craig happily and professionaly answered and looked up the information when he wasnt sure. When asked about late check out, he said he would give me until 2pm, although I didnt think I needed it. One of my daughters wanted to ice skate on the Frog Pond in the Commons, although it was too warm to do so. I loved the designer of this hotel. Hotel was spotless! I have high standards and it passed flawlessly. Mind you it was sloppy outside with high temps in the winter after a recent blizzard, you would never know inside. Front desk was patient as I had 2 teenage twin daughters talking to me on each side, my cell phone ringing from family and me juggling bags upon check-in. Room service menu looked great, almost used it, but opted to go downstairs instead. The Breakfast Buffet was awesome, pricey at $23 a pop, but the food was outstanding, and easily kept us full most of the day without fast food junk. All you need to do is sign the bill to your room. Housekeeping staff were very present throughout the hotel, especially on the floors with a genuine smile and Happy New Year, (with eye contact) it seemed when ever we got off the elevator. Whoever hires the staff, and trains, great job! Other reviews had mentioned paper thin walls, I did not find this on NEW YEARS EVE, so I had expected not to sleep well. (We were on 3rd floor as well, 322.) I heard some doors slam, people just walking in their rooms or leaving without holding door. Thats about it. I slept like a baby on probably one of the most partied nights in the year. Although we were out of the hotel most of the stay, I looked around and there was ample space to entertain. The location is meant for the theatre district. Its a safe area, but as a woman would not walk alone at night, common sense. Its about 3 city blocks South from the Public gardens. We had to walk all the way from the Boston waterfront near Aquarium back to the hotel, and I did it with a torn Meniscus. Not fun, but if I could do it anyone can. Plan on it, because of the million people after the fireworks anything else is out of the question. Speaking of that, best spot to view the First Night fireworks at midnight? On the pier between Aquarium and Marriot hotel. There are 2 parking garages on Stuart Street where the hotel is. Valet park is well worth it. Supplies in room : hair dryer, iron & board, safe, umbrella, soaps, shower gel, shampoo, conditioner, body cream. Easy to travel light, which we did, worked out perfectly! Info channel gives a history lesson of Boston, and tips on where to eat and what to do. Fabulous info, as I am originally from Boston, and wanted to still try some suggestions. Boston is a great city, and compact, if you havent stayed before, please do, there is something for everyone. Just like anything else, go with a positive attitude, bring your common sense and make some happy memories!

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and expensive”
Reviews.Author: robincSF
Reviews.Content: The hotel is new, very clean, and close to everything. We picked it as it is close to the Amtrak station and has king-sized beds. The bed was very comfortable with upscale linens. Having just stayed in a fabulous hotel in NYC we were a little disappointed in this hotel by comparison. The shortcomings are that the rooms are small for the price, and do not have all the amenities we expected from an upscale hotel, such as a coffee maker in the room and shoe-cleaning kits (it was very slushy outside.) The other odd experience we had is that the hotel seemed quite empty yet they had the few guests all rooming next to each other and unfortunately, the walls are rather thin. We tried to take an afternoon nap when we arrived but were unable to with all the noise. The hallway noise is even worse. And I agree with others that the room service is exorbitantly priced. We paid $25 for 2 waters, an apple and a coke! This was our first time in Boston and we don't know what the competition is like but we will probably try a different hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: Kjasie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Back Bay hotel for 3 nights last month on a business trip. The staff was friendly and willing to help when I had questions and/or concerns. The bellman hauled cabs rather quickly and gave good advice on the best routes to go (via walking) and places to eat. The restaurant turns into a night club at night and can be rather loud when first walking into the hotel. Luckily I never heard a bit of noise from my 3rd floor room. My room was cozy with ample space to do work and sleep! The bathroom was nice along with the toiletry amenities each day (Avida and Kiehl's products) and the heated towel rack was a plus. Heated flooring would have been even nicer on a cold Boston morning! My only complaint in the room was that I had a hard time getting plug sockets to work. I ordered room service one morning since the restaurant didn't open in time for me to make my business meeting. The room service came promptly (food still piping hot); however, my order was incorrect. They quickly fixed it (within 5 minutes). Overall I would definitely recommend staying at the Back Bay. This trendy little gem is near the mall and convention center, and blocks away from the massive public library!

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: yaddayaddayadda_10
Reviews.Content: I really like this hotel. I often stay here when I go to Boston for business and it is in a great location, the rooms are nice and clean with a big bathroom and it is somewhat reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a long weekend - great location”
Reviews.Author: kiwitravellerpam
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at this hotel for a long weekend and it was perfect. Great location with a selection of restaurants, bars and shopping nearby, and also an Avis pick-up centre if you're looking to hire a car and travel elsewhere like we did (although the service there is atrocious). We got a fantastic price for our room through Travelocity's Top Secret Hotels - arond $200 less than the usual room rate - HIGHLY recommend Top Secret Hotels to anyone looking for a 4-5 star hotel bargain. The hotel service execeeded our expectation - friendly doorman and very helpful concierge staff who spent 20mins giving us recommendations on things to do outside of Boston (we drove through Salem and and up to Kennebunk). She even took the time to search and print some hotel options for us. The room was pretty good - we had two twin beds and there was a reasonable amount of space left around the room. It was also extremely clean. The bathroom had an separate shower (vs. over the bathtub) which can be hard to find. We had terrific weather in Boston - picture perfect blue sky - which made our stay even more delightful, with the leaf fall framing our pictures beautifully. Recommend doing the Freedom Trail to see the sights and orientate yourself in the city which is definitely best done on foot. Also highly recommend Atlantic Fish company - some of the best seafood I've ever tasted. Sales tax in Boston is cheap too so we spent quite a bit of time shopping. All up a good stay - would return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for anything more....”
Reviews.Author: claraho
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just returned from a weeks stay in Boston and The Back Bay and I have to say that we had an amazing time! Firstly, Boston is a beautiful city and the hotel is right in the middle of absolutely everywhere. Everything can be reached by foot - it truely is a walking city! When we arrived at the hotel, we were greated by very friendly door staff and the lovely Daniel took our bags to our room for us. The Reception staff were lovely and made sure we had all the information needed. Heather at the Conceirge was brilliant in offering us advice on places to visit and eat. Cuffs Bar was a lovely place to have a quiet drink in after a day spent walking the streets of Boston. All in all The Back Bay is more than we expected and the service was second to none. The staff go out of their was to help you and after a week of staying there we felt like we were known by all the staff. Prior to departing for Boston, my partner e-mailed the hotel asking if we could have a room with a view is available as it was a special holiday and when we arrived we were checked into a lovely room (846) and we had been left some chocolates and champagne from Heather, which was a lovely surprise! The room was lovely and spacious, bed extremely comfortable, huge bathroom with robes, lovely toiletries, complimentary water left daily in the fridge, newspapers each day and free WIFI. The Back Bay Hotel is a hotel that we will be visiting again, extremely helpful staff, fabulous location, very clean and is a perfect base to explore Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Coming Home Again”
Reviews.Author: tami1027
Reviews.Content: The weekend of Thanksgiving my husband and I decided to get away from everything, and enjoy a little time alone. We decided to go to the one place we know we will always enjoy, The Back Bay Hotel, Boston, MA. Where you are welcomed like an old friend, weather it be the first time or the hundreth time. The Hotel is warm and inviting from the doorman to room service. It is a beautiful hotel, we very much enjoyed our stay and was in no way ever disapointed. Again, thank you for a wonderful weekend, and we will be back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for better”
Reviews.Author: WayneDonaldson
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Very nice staff, very comfortable and spacious rooms, nice bar, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant fun place to stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Hello2World
Reviews.Content: Back Bay Hotel is run by a British chain and is in a renovated former police HQ. It's beautifully furnished and very high-tech. Our room was very large and the bed very comfortable. Oddly, though, the space was not well used. There was one small chair though there was room for either a table and chairs or a lounge chair. Next to the sink, bathrobes hung but nowhere to hang a face towel, and little counter or shelf space. But high-end toiletries were provided. Free wireless internet is provided but it seemed to be incompatible with our MacAir. Only the higher-priced rooms have coffeemakers but coffee is available in the restaurant in the morning. The bar, Cuffs, is fun. Great atmosphere and interesting specialty drinks. The location is near theatres and shopping but the closest T station is about 3 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, suprisingly quiet, and luxurious hotel!”
Reviews.Author: xtos
Reviews.Content: Note: I live in Boston, but was awarded a free night's stay here through my business. This hotel is housed in what used to be the Boston Police Department headquarters, so I've always been wanting to stay here and see how they transformed this landmark building. While I did not pay for my stay, I'm writing this review with the mindest of how I would view this hotel if I had actually paid for the room based on the current prices listed on their website. (which is currently listed at $195 for a Superior King for the month of December 2010) Check in was smooth, personable, and very friendly. I was made to feel right at home and even offered a warm towel to freshen up. The staff also asked me if I already had dinner plans and was more than eager to offer suggestions. My room was a Superior King and was very spacious and full of all kinds of unique and helpful items that set this hotel apart from other hotels I've stayed at in this class. For starters, it's stocked with a great selection of amazing Kiehls bath products. They also have a towel warmer, hair dryer, iron, safe, and an empty fridge, so you can go out and buy your own things and keep them cold. Many hotels overstock the mini bar, so you can't really use the fridge for anything you might want to buy on your own. In my opinion, this was better and if I really needed anything else they have 24 hour room service. The bathroom had a motion triggered nightlight which was so helpful in the middle of the night. Never saw that in a hotel before and think every hotel should have them. Clever. There is also a really nice CD player and sound system with a remote control, a huge flat screen television, free wifi as well as an ethernet cable for laptops and a large desk. (One thing that they didn't have in the room that I felt would be a nice addition is a DVD player, but perhaps that will come in the future.) The room was also very quiet, as it was in the back part of the hotel. Not sure how the front facing rooms are for sound, but my room was really quiet, the bed was very comfortable, and I slept very well. Another great feature of this hotel is the amount of drawer space for your clothes. Many hotels either have just one drawer for your clothes or just enough for one guest. While I was a solo traveler, I noticed at least 3 large drawers on each side of the bureau as well as plenty of space in each of the nightstands and a very large closet. Plenty of space for two guests to store clothes. My room didn't have any views, and I'm really not sure what views the other room would offer in this part of town, but I wouldn't expect too much in that regard since the hotel is surrounded by lots of other buildings. Breakfast was also very good. They have an extensive buffet option, but I chose to order from the menu. The bar area is also very nice, with a very cool and modern fireplace. There are also lots of great restaurants nearby, including Geoffrey's that offers great comfort food and cocktails at surprisingly low prices and Grill 23 which is a really great steakhouse with typical steakhouse prices. Overall I had a really nice experience and I will definitely be suggesting this hotel to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for the third time in four years!”
Reviews.Author: Shnboston
