Reviews.Content: Having returned to stay at The Back Bay Hotel for the third time in four years says it all! The hotel is as good as ever, the staff obliging and the bar food excellent. Maybe there could be a bit more variety on the menu. Mind you when I did ask for something off the menu they obliged me. I have to say most of the door men were very friendly, especially Sean who made it his business to say goodbye to us before we left for the airport and before he finished his shift. I saw him do the same to another couple also. I recommend The Back Bay Hotel to anyone travelling to Boston as it is so central and in a very safe area. I hope to return for the fourth time next November! Mary, Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Not Perfect, but can't argue for the price & location.”
Reviews.Author: IslanderGirl
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Boston for a few nights just to get away. The type of trip where the comfort of the hotel mattered as we might spend loads of time just lazing in the room. We used trip advisor to find this hotel and narrowed down our choice between the Back Bay and the Mandarin Oriental based on comments. Not that we don't spend $300 a night on hotels...but we just couldn't justify it based on the images, reviews, location etc. of the Back Bay Hotel. We decided to book it and then if necessary visit the Mandarin for dinner or spa. We spent 3 nights at Back Bay for roughly the cost of 1 at the Mandarin. The rooms are small, we were warned so booked the 'deluxe' and i was still a little taken back by how condensed the rooms were, but by the time I awoke the next morning, I was settled in and was happy for the corner room with lots of natural light coming from both sets of windows and a very spacious bathroom (no tub). The first morning we were awaken by the maid service at 8 a.m. ish....they were talking in the hallway then actually knocked on the door. This was a surprise for me, I think the earliest housekeeping has ever knocked. They then continued to vacuum around 9 a.m. (Bay Bay Hotel would recommend you start this activity later in the morning). The second night we put up the 'do not disturb' sign before going to bed and discovered our room actually was a part of a set of 2 rooms that had a door separating us from the main hallway so we closed this too and were not awaken on the 2nd morning. For breakfast, it is worth the savings to put on some clothes and go downstairs to the buffet, our first day breakfast was US$70 and the food is below average. The food doesn't improve downstairs, but at least it costs much less. The Concierge, after making our booking we recieved a very nice email a day or so later introducing us to their concierge services (bonus points) however we struggled to connect with the desk before we traveled. We called from Miami before boarding our flight to Boston to book our luxury transfer to the hotel since we were landing at midnight, but the Concierge had left for the day and the young boy at the desk speaking to my boyfriend on the phone recommended we take a taxi....not the right answer, we live in the Caribbean and had not yet adjusted to the temperature change so standing in a line waiting on a taxi (although less than 15 minutes) wasn't what I had in mind. However, the next day we met the lady working at concierge and she was the best concierge person EVER so this cancels out the fact the front desk don't do quite such a good job at it in her absence. So basically the trick is not to compare this hotel to the Mandarin, they are not the same category, but if you compare it to a Hilton or a Mariott the Back Bay comes out with flying colours on the rooms. Food could use some improvement, bagels were stale and smoke salmon lots of brown bits. However, the chicken sandwich on the dinner room service was Excellent, so breakfast is really the area that missed the bar. Another point, not critical but once our taxi dropped us off at midnight, because of the one way streets we were let off at a door where the bar was and the street was littered with University students who were out on a Friday night. When we got through the doors no easy sign to tell you to get in the elevator to go up one floor to the reception area. Not a nice welcome. The side door is the taxi pick up and drop off area, better signage or a bell person at the door, especially at night would be a nice touch. The room got 2 free bottles of water on a night, really warm robes, slippers, towel warming racks in the bathroom, fabulous bathroom products, sensor light under the sink counter when you open the door at night (nice comfort feature) etc. are all the reasons we feel this hotel exceeds its price category. We were not familiar with Boston, but between the concierge and the location of the hotel itself we were perfectly positioned to become fast learners. Loved the trolley tour of the city with the free harbour tour. Great French Bistro around the corner "Le Mistral" best food we've had in awhile and we are in the food business.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Respite - Worth Every Penny”
Reviews.Author: momeees
Reviews.Content: My husband and I leave the kids at home each year and travel to Boston for my birthday. We recently returned from the Back Bay Hotel after staying at the Ritz-Carlton a few times. We were not disappointed in the least. Even before we arrived, I was contacted by the concierge (Heather). I arranged for in-room massages (Rolling River Massage Co.) since it was November (brrrr), and there was no spa on site. Heather arranged everything for us. Location: Very convenient, Walk to green line and orange line T stations were short. Shopping and the Common very nearby. Great location. We flew in from JFK (it was actually cheaper to fly than to drive -- as bad as gas prices are now -- and to park in the hotel lot). We didn't want to search for street parking on the holiday weekend, so left the car at home. Everything we needed was local, even trips to Cambridge by taking the T. Front desk: Staff were very pleasant, and our room was ready very early since we had an early flight from NY. They were all helpful and also gave us a late check out time. We had dinner reservations at a VERY local place (Erbaluce) however, the front desk staff had not heard of it. It was highly rated and fabulous. I made sure the desk staff knew of the restaurant (to refer others to), since it is right around the corner. Have a few reviews upcoming for great restaurants we went to, so look for those under my screen name if you're interested. Rooms: We had a corner deluxe room with separate walk-in shower. Room was very comfortable, nice-sized. Bed was comfy. Room noise from street was a bit loud, but that was really the only drawback for the room. We were given champagne and chocolate to celebrate my birthday. A very nice touch to say the least. Nice robes to use (and slippers), towel warmer ... very clean, too. **FREE-WIFI HOTEL WIDE was a big bonus.** Restaurant: We had breakfast at the hotel three mornings. Moderately expensive, especially for the buffet. If you're like me and don't eat a ton of carbs, order off the menu. Portions are large enough (for breakfast) that you actually get more if you order a traditional breakfast (or oatmeal like my husband did) than if you try to find good stuff at the buffet. The buffet had good choices, don't misunderstand, but we don't eat many carbs (muffins, pancakes, french toast, etc.) Fruit was not too flavorful, since it's out of season. Waitstaff very nice. We had drinks at the bar one evening. Nice enough, I suppose. Overall, what a nice experience. Worth every penny. Would definitely come back to stay here next year. Keep up the great work!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for more”
Reviews.Author: scottandhayley
Reviews.Content: We struggled to decide what hotel to choose and what part of Boston for our weekend break (without children - hoorah!) and after staying here feel we couldn't have chosen better. The rooms were a good size and well appointed. The bed was very comfortable and much needed after walking for hours each day. We didn't eat in the restaurant for dinner but breakfast was good, if a little expensive, and the Irish bar was a good place to unwind and enjoy some bar food. On the map the hotel may not seem that close to the major sights but Boston is a small city and nothing was more than a 30 minute walk away. Boston common is only a couple of blocks away, the shops and restaurants of Newbury St almost on the doorstep, along with Copley Place and even Quincy Market and downtown is walkable but with a subway stop just round the corner you don't have to walk anywhere if you don't want to.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: dollydaisy1
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for 3 nights from 12th November. When we checked in, they were so helpful explaining where the shops & restaurants were, and even offering us a discount voucher for one of the stores. The room was clean and the beds - SO comfy. And it was lovely to have Starbucks served in the lounge! Everything was in walking distance and the location was fantastic - equal distance between the Prudential Centre and Quincy Market (and only a couple of blocks from Filene's!). We got lucky with the weather which made Boston even nicer. I hope to be back soon and will stay here for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: pfm81
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, close to all the action. Service at the concierge was great. The rooms were somewhat small, but very clean. Free wifi was great. The only complaint that I might have was that i had to wait like 20 minutes for a taxi to appear so that i could go to the airport, but other than that, everything was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice but Not Refined or the Best”
Reviews.Author: hfk2
Reviews.Content: Although I felt we got the value for what we paid, the attention to detail that you expect at a place like this was not on par to what I expected. The Internet service will make you cry if you want fast service that allows you to stay on - it kicks you off after being idle for about 8 minutes. The wait staff at the bar were incredibly slow and not accommodating. The concierge sent us to lunch at a place where she said there wouldn't be a wait, and the wait was almost an hour. Overall, it was a nice place and great location, but they need to improve their services.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in an Incredible location (hotwire 4star hotel!)”
Reviews.Author: Aphishionado
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on Hotwire for $199 a night - superb decor, great hotel bar "cuffs" which is a tribute to the fact that this building used to be the police headquarters. exit the building and you are in the center of the city on 2 blocks from the prudential center and copley square. i would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, excellent service!!”
Reviews.Author: jkaram
Reviews.Content: Simply stated, I had a smile on my face from the moment I entered the hotel. Somewhat awkward finding the reception desk, but otherwise this place is top notch. Service is impeccable from the bellhop having your elevator floor pre-selected when you arrive, to the complimentary robes, slippers, and umbrella! An absolutely beautiful, comfortable, and quiet atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “FIVE STAR SERVICE AT THE BACK BAY HOTEL.”
Reviews.Author: gena
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, Great Staff, Great Location. Rooms spotless and very comfortable. All the staff were helpful and friendly. Would definatly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Could easily be my new home in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: 0567cg
Reviews.Content: We stay in Boston frequently and have hit all the so-called "top tier" hotels, like the Boston Harbor and Intercontinental. This place tops them all in my opinion. Among other things, everything just seems like much less of a hassle here. The location is just great. You are steps away from Boston Common and all of the shops and restaurants around there. Warning, however: they charge $40 for overnight parking, which I think is ridiculous, even for Boston. So we parked outside of town and came in on the T. You can walk or take the T almost anywhere, so you really don't need a car. The Arlington T station is steps away from the hotel's door. The hotel staff is friendly and accomodating. The rooms are very clean and well maintained. The bathrooms are very upscale and almost as big as the main room. And the hotel never seemed either crowded or noisy, even on a weekend. The coffeemaker is a very nice Nespresso machine. But it only makes espresso, in small cups, so you will have to make 19 or so if you expect a full cup of coffee. Not a complaint - just a heads up. Also, the elevators are few in number and small in size. There is literally a waiting line at times. As I've said, we've sampled many hotels. We would never return to some of them. We would return to others, but only if necessary. This is one to which I would happily return. I don't say that about many places.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay at the Back Bay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: grumpyoldguy
Reviews.Content: From the outside and in keeping with it's surroundings, the hotel retains the image of an old style police HQ. Whilst inside it has lighter feel with a number of modern touches. We had booked two rooms, one for our 18 year old son and one for my wife and myself. The front desk staff were friendly, welcoming and checked us in very quickly. We were pleased to find our room had been upgraded to a deluxe (free of charge). The rooms were clean and had everything expected of a quality hotel. Our room was on a corner so we had a good view of the surrounding area at the front of the hotel. The bathroom was spacious with a good sized walk-in shower and had top quality toiletries. The decor was modern, the room clean and the bed very comfortable. Breakfast was good with plenty of choice although a little pricey. As we were unfamiliar with Boston we were pleased to find the concierge pleasant and helpful with plenty of good advice. She also made reservations for us in a number of restaurants and issued tickets for sightseeing tours. One of the outstanding restaurants we visited was the Top of the Hub which is situated on the 52nd floor of the Prudential building. Quite expensive but great food and a unique dining experience. One word of warning though, you need to take photo ID to present to security in the lobby, even if you have a reservation. Overall, the Back Bay Hotel is a very good hotel made even better by efficient and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: loopy4u
Reviews.Content: I have recently returned from a four day stay at the the back bay hotel in boston with two friends. As soon as we arrived we were very impressed with the location, staff, accommodation etc. We were greeted by a lovely receptionist named Natalie Doyle, who was very helpful throughout our trip. Heather the concierge was also very helpful with arranging trips and places to visit. Every member of staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The room was spacious and the beds are very comfortable, the bathrobe and slippers are a nice touch. The location of this hotel is perfect. Would highly recommend the Back Bay Hotel. If i return to Boston i will most certainly be staying in the Back Bay Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, Professional and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: imustbedum
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a concert in the city. Unexpected surprise. Although it belongs to a company of boutique hotels which can usually mean great service, it does not always guarentee it. You are guarenteed it here. Great location to everything in the city. Spend a little bit more to stay here. You won't regret it. CUFFS is a great little city bar to boot.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem in Boston”
Reviews.Author: mayliang
Reviews.Content: We had never heard of this hotel and typically stay at the Ritz when we travel to Boston on business. We certainly won't again! The Back Bay hotel is conveniently located and has all the amenities you need whether you're traveling on business (WiFi and a business center are available) or for pleasure (a nice hotel restaurant and a hopping bar). Rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “upscale and cozy...prime location!”
Reviews.Author: ameliamarie23
Reviews.Content: stayed with my husband on the last night of our anniversary trip to new england. the staff were all accommodating and polite. the beds were to-die-for comfortable. the location was perfect!! walkable and quick to a few metro stops... we will definitely stay again if we visit boston in the future...

Reviews.Title: “The Back Bay Hotel Boston was a perfect choice for family attending a wedding”
Reviews.Author: morgan048
Reviews.Content: Several members of our family and close friends booked rooms at the Back Bay Hotel Boston for the wedding of our son at the Boston Public Library, just a few blocks away. The staff could not have been more helpful! The rooms were lovely and well appointed. We used the bar for gatherings at night and the parlor for gatherings in the afternoon. We traveled with children and older adults- everyone felt welcomed and comfortable. I highly recommend this hotel for groups who need space to talk and interact in an intimate setting. I would love to return to Boston and I would choose this hotel again as a first rate place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service but plan on getting out and about”
Reviews.Author: Ostergaard
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice and located close to Boston Common, Newbury st. etc where you can walk in a few minutes. The concierge was particularly helpful and went out of her way to offer suggestions for dinner, events and sights and they all met or exceeded our expectations. The rooms can accommodate a family but not if you like staying in the room for extended periods during the day as they are small and you can only sit on the bed. At the same time the hotel does not offer much common space unless it is part of the bar or restaurant to hang out.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Service”
Reviews.Author: seahoyden10
Reviews.Content: The people that work here really make this hotel. Although the rooms are lovely and the location is great, the employees of this hotel are true professionals. From the bellmen to the front desk to the concierge to room service to housekeeping, we couldn't have asked for better service. People were genuinely kind, friendly and attentive. I was not surprised that one bellman came from the Four Seasons Maui as he was open, helpful and yet respectful in the manner that one finds in the best hotels in the world. I can't express what a pleasure it was to stay at this hotel. And the Kiehl's products don't hurt!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: FranÃ§ois_Bogacz
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Superior Room for 3 nights. The devil is in the details: I had to call 3 times to have our breakfast tray removed from the hallway of the hotel. It stayed there from 9am to 6pm. This is totally unacceptable for a place such as the Back Bay, which is otherwise comfortable, well located and well maintained. I also thought that the "Superior" room was nothing superior in terms of size - I don't even want to imagine how small the regular room must be - or design. Last but not least, the lighting in the shower was inexistent once you had closed the bath curtain - quite a gloomy experience. All in all, I would probably return there since I think this is probably one of the best places in that location but I think it is really expensive for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Mini_the_Minx
Reviews.Content: The staff at check in were friendly and welcoming and our room (718) was beautifully appointed, very clean and the pillows were wonderfully soft! The hotel is ideally located for shopping at the Prudential Centre or Newbury Street and it was only about a 20min walk through Boston Common to Faneuil Hall. Just one gripe - forget the Kiehl's toiletries - give me coffee making facilities! Of the 6 hotels we stayed in on our tour of New England this was the only one we couldn't make ourselves a cup of coffee in.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Shaz_00125
Reviews.Content: Mum and I had an amazing holiday at The Back Bay Hotel (Boston) which was central to everything - the perfect location. The room was fantastic, lovely decor. The staff in the hotel was wonderful - kind, helpful, knowledgeable and nothing was too much trouble. They made this and even more perfect holiday! We are returning next year and look forward to another fabulous break!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, very stylish,clean and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ALAN083
Reviews.Content: We were very well looked after on checking in. Nothing was of any bother and requests attented to promptly. All very friendly, professional staff who, along with concierge, gave very good advice on Boston. Nuala was especially nice and helpful to us. I would highly recommend to anyone wishing to explore this pleasant city and the hotel is so convenient to all sites as well as the efficient subway system.

Reviews.Title: “Smart contemporary hotel”
Reviews.Author: Callycam
Reviews.Content: Very nice room, huge bed, lovely bathroom. Couldn't fault it. The bed was extremely comfortable ensuring a great nights sleep. Actually there was one little issue: the air conditioning was a little bit noisy but the room was very warm so we had to keep it on the whole time. Would definitely return to this hotel if visiting Boston again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a stylish location”
Reviews.Author: Lesley098
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in September 2010. The hotel has a lovely cared for feel to it and the staff are all very friendly and helpful. The lounge areas are beautifully decorated and very peaceful. We would definitely stay here again as the location is in the stylish Back Bay area of Boston and very nice. Nothing was too much trouble for any of the staff we met. Special thanks to Kimberley who assisted us with information on being able to walk from the station to the hotel as we were travelling by Amtrak. This was invaluable and saved having to take a taxi for a very short ride.

Reviews.Title: “DISCO ELEVATORS!”
Reviews.Author: jillllllllll
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. I stayed over President's Day Weekend while visiting a few old friends, and got a wonderful deal through a travel site (I can't remember which at this point). While the location is a little off from the heart of the Back Bay, It posed no problems as far as finding cabs, getting to Newbury St., etc. I usually am not an avid room service person, but because of my own poor time-management skills, I needed to get a quick bite while I showered and got ready for the evening. Room service was available from the downstairs Irish pub "The Stanhope Grille" and was hands-down one of the best cheeseburgers available in Boston Proper. Lastly, the elevator. It's a myriad of color and holograms. Total disco elevator. Need I say more?

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: happy_camper_ww2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in October 2009. Fantastic hotel, great service, good location, excellent bar. No complaints at all. We will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for a short sightseeing or shopping trip.”
Reviews.Author: deniseanddoug
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in prime location. Large rooms, very well furnished including very spacious bathroom. |Good choice for sightseeing or shopping. Near the T or metro. Very helpful staff. Breakfast somewhat expensive but several other options in vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional hotel”
Reviews.Author: ElizabethD708
Reviews.Content: The Back Bay is an exceptional hotel in Boston. It was conveniently located to the Boston Commons and Freedom Trail. The room was comfortable in size with two double beds and very large bath with rain shower and heated towels. The hotel is very quiet and the beds were great. The conciege was extremely helpful. The breakfast while on the expensive side was very good. I had the baby spinach and buffalo mozzerella omelet. It was wonderful

Reviews.Title: “It lived up to our expectations.”
Reviews.Author: KentishmaidSevenoaks
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights -18th and 19th September and after a long flight from the UK and a nightmare trying to follow the Virgin driving instructions from Boston Airport we arrived tired and a bit fed up. From the valet parking to the friendly check in it all went very smoothly and they were the only hotel ( and we stayed in eight on this trip ) that offered to take our luggage to our rooms !! Yes there is no coffee or tea maker in the room but it was not a hardship to go downstairs for an early drink which could be drunk in peace if your partner gets up later than you. They gave us a lot of help with direction and answered any questions we had without us feeling we were a bother. All in all we enjoyed our stay very much and even my 76 year old mum that was with us rated this hotel as one of the two favourites on her trip-the other being the The Williams inn in Williamstown. As for the man who went down to Breakfast without any shoes and then got offended what can I say !!!

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous”
Reviews.Author: Allentownpaguy
Reviews.Content: Boston has become one of my favorite places to visit the past few years and the Back Bay Hotel is always my preferred place to stay. It is elegeant and comfortable all at the same time. It is certainly not the cheapest place to stay, but well worth it in my opinion. An upscale hotel certainly has it's advantages. The bar is excellent as well and the location is very central.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel , great location”
Reviews.Author: taffydoc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights.Very friendly staff.Rooms good size and very comfy bed! Walking distance to most of central Boston attractions and only a couple of blocks from the metro station. Back Bay area was a very nice area to be in with lots of top eating spots and shopping.Cuffs Bar in hotel served good food and local beers with a nice outside area for sitting on a balmy evening.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money and they humiliated me !”
Reviews.Author: Furfighter
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a six week trip to the states , I stayed in hotels which varied from mom and pop outfits through to Days Inns and upwards to Sheratons and Hiltons . This was the most expensive hotel of the trip and I chose it because of the excellent reviews on this site - My initial experience was favourable as the young lady who checked me in was very pleasant and managed to put me in a room with a bath . It went downhill after that . The room was quite small for the price . A major disappointment was the fact that there was no tea/coffee making facilities in the room and this is where the trouble began - I need a cuppa first thing in the morning to get going so on the first morning I opted to go down and have the hotel breakfast rather than get dressed and go out in search of coffee or use the hotel coffee shop - Breakfast was not included in the extortionate price charged for the room . I'm a bit of a free spirit and went down to breakfast barefoot - the man who seated me glanced at my feet and I was aware that he realised I was not wearing shoes but he said nothing . I was seated and told that someone would come over to take my order , whereupon I was supplied with coffee by a waiter who clearly did not understand my British English very well as the waffles I requested never arrived. The rest of the breakfast was a buffet , which was adequate but quite disappointing and ruined by the fact that the restaurant manager chose to come over halfway through my meal and inform me that it was 'against health and safety regulations ' for me to not be wearing shoes ,admittedly they offered to get me some from my room but I was then further interrupted by them telling me that they did not want to go in to my room as I had left the do not disturb sign on the door - overall I felt this was a very embarrassing and humiliating experience and that they only wanted me to put shoes on as I was probably lowering the tone of their establishment - I wonder if I had been wearing my Rolex and jewellery if the attitude would have been different ? I feel at they should not have allowed me to be seated in the first place and if they had had a kettle in the room this would not have happened . I was massively disappointed with this hotel compared with the reviews given.The internet was free but slow , the fitness room was hardly bigger than my room . To be fair ,the location was excellent , the bed was comfortable , the towels large enough for my plus size frame and the toiletries supplied were nice quality but I cannot justify the cost of this hotel and would not recommend it to anyone and I would never stay there again as there are plenty of other hotels in that price point nearby .

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault but nothing great”
Reviews.Author: angus s
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in the hotel half a dozen or so times now, mainly due to familiarity and it serves me well: good location - walking distance to good variety of restaurants, the park, Prudential and Copley malls; rooms are all a decent size, with comfortable beds; good breakfast; always v clean and staff all polite and helpful. However, don't stay here if you're after something special - it does everything well but nothing exceptional or truly memorable. I would sum it up as a typical US downtown hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What all hotels should be like.”
Reviews.Author: zulu26
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Back Bay twice during an 18 day trip around New England and have to say that this is the best hotel we have stayed in.The location was just right,20-30 mins walk to the harbour and the same in the opposite direction to fenway park.The hotel itself was immaculate and furnished to a really high standard and the rooms are so comfy we could have easily stayed in all day! All the staff were a credit not only to the hotel but to Boston tourism as well,their friendliness,advice and help was second to none.For food and drink we can highly recommend the Cuffs irish bar downstairs,the food,drink and bar staff are all excellent and the atmosphere with all the locals is very warm and friendly.Before we had even left Boston to return home to the UK we have already decided to come back to the Back Bay for a week next March,and we can't wait.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel with the friendliest of staff”
Reviews.Author: SarahandMatthew
Reviews.Content: I cannot fault the staff at this hotel - they all seemed to go out of their way to assist us and really made the difference between us having a good time in Boston to a great one. The hotel itself was very plush; breakfast in the downstairs restaurant was amazing and the rooms were very modern and fully appointed. If I went to Boston again, I would stay here without thinking about it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice amenities included”
Reviews.Author: SF94597
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this property several times due to its convenient location for my business needs. Rooms do vary - this week I was in a Deluxe Room which includes a separate tub and shower (with overhead & side shower heads). Rooms are not large, but include nice amenities: in room coffee maker, complimentary water that is replenished daily, turn down service, robes/slippers, quality shampoo/conditioner/lotion/body wash & soaps, free wi-fi, in room safe and choice of USA Today or WSJ. The downstairs bar is always busy & food & drinks are reasonably priced for area. Hotel gym is a bit small for size of property.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: RuthChicago_Illinois
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights while visiting Boston to see friends and sightsee. While not an inexpensive place to stay, the Back Bay Hotel gives you your money's worth. The staff unbelievably helpful and friendly (not in an annoying way). From the waiter at breakfast offering to give us to go cups for our coffee, to the bellmen asking if we'd like a bottle of water to take on our walk, they don't miss a beat. The room was great, my favorite feature being a motion-sensetive night light in the bathroom. No need to turn on the overhead light in the middle of the night! Added bonus of free WiFi and even a full sized umbrella in the room for our use. Other hotels should send their staff here to learn a thing or two.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service at its best”
Reviews.Author: GalwayDubs
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed 3 nights at this excellent hotel and would agree with all of the positive comments posted. Its very easy to compliment a hotel when everything goes right but the sign of real customer service is how a hotel deals with any unexpected problems that arise. On our first night 6th September we were allocated a lovely room on the top floor. Unfortunately that night a fault developed with one of the chiller fans on the roof immediately above us which caused the room to vibrate all night and we got little or no sleep. We went down to the reception early on the 7th and were immediately transferred to another room. While we were waiting to transfer we were given a complimentary breakfast. Now that's what I call real Customer Service. The problems of the previous night were quickly forgotten and we enjoyed the remainder of our stay. Free Internet access was also an added bonus

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service, rooms are snug”
Reviews.Author: vagabond116
Reviews.Content: This is a gem of a hotel in the Back Bay area. We found it online from Trip Advisor comments and we were not disappointed, it's beautiful. The service is world class and the staff is efficient, friendly and professional at all times. My only slight hesitations are the rooms are pretty snug, but very nicely appointed and energy efficient. Typical room size of an older, urban hotel. Parking was hefty and restaurant and bar prices were more Manhattan in my way of thinking. That said, we would not hesitate to stay here again because there is a trade off of having everything close at hand and so well handled. I can not say enough about the staff. We witnessed a terribly rude guest making preposterous demands while managing to be a total horse's butt by talking down to everyone. For once it was a European traveler rather than an American that was rude. In spite of all this, the staff maintained total dignity, listened, proposed options and carried through with everything they said. When it was complete and the guest was out of ear shot, not one of the staff made snide remarks, rolled their eyes or slapped him (which I was close to doing), they all resumed their tasks in a highly professional manner. I'm sold, these folks are clearly very well trained and share in a great pride in their efforts as well as the hotel they represent.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Boston!!!”
Reviews.Author: CCDeluxe
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough how amazing this hotel is. My wife and I have stayed here every year we go to Boston for a getaway. The staff amazing, the food excellent and the rooms spotless. You will not be disappointed. Even better the last time we stayed was our anniversary and the hotel matched the price from a year earlier ($295 for a corner room). Now that's class!!!

Reviews.Title: “Staying at the Back Bay Hotel, Boston, was like being invited into someones home, only better.”
Reviews.Author: nana015
Reviews.Content: Everything about our stay at the Back Bay Hotel, Boston was first class. The professionalism and friendliness of the entire staff was excellent and was present throughout our entire stay. The location is wonderful as it was within walking distance to all major transit routes and central to many tourist sites. We will most certainly stay at the Back Bay Hotel in the future and highly reccommend it to any one visiting the Boston area.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant - Would go back!”
Reviews.Author: SweetheartBear
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the end of a three week trip to Boston and was delighted with this hotel. Is the former police headquarters so is an amazing building! The staff are very friendly and helpful where possible. Room was a nice size although no bath only a shower and not a massive amout of floor space. Free wifi in the rooms and free bottles of water in the fridge in the hotel room! Cuffs Bar had a nice atmosphere and we had a good lunch there on our first day. Good location and lots of nice restaurants around! Definitely a good choice!

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend this hotel to anyone and will definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: bur102
Reviews.Content: While holidaying in Boston and Cape Cod in September i stayed at The Back Bay and found my stay to be an excellent experience. The rooms were of a very high standard, the food was very good and all the staff were incredible....the waiters/waitresses, housekeeping and reception. I have been fortunate enough to holiday in the United States many times and have stayed at many many hotels but The Back Bay has by far been the best. I have stayed here before and will definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “Solid 4 stars, and quaint with the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoToTheWorld
Reviews.Content: I liked the Back Bay Hotel quite a bit, but even more after spending a single night at the relatively nearby Marriott Copley Place. The minute you walk through the doors, you can't help but appreciate the modern decor. And the entrance and lobby areas are neither huge nor sterile so you don't feel like you're in a mega-hotel/warehouse, which is how I felt the minute I walked into the Marriott. And front desk service is prompt and very friendly and quick to help when asked. As for the room, we had a Superior Room with two double beds and it was plenty large enough . . . not small at all. The room was clean and attractive, the beds comfortable with nice linens and a typical flat screen tv as you expect to find in any decent hotel these days. A/C worked just fine too. And there was plenty of closet and drawer space for clothing. But the best part of the room in my opinion was the over-sized bathroom. There's no tub, but the shower was great, modern and featured a light body sprayer. I appreciated the fact that the high glass shower door prevented the bathroom mirror from getting all fogged up. There was a heated towel rack which although of little use at the beginning of September was still a nice touch. The bathroom also featured high end Kiehl's toiletries. I was also really pleased that the hotel provided free high speed internet service, and it was plenty fast. I'm tired of getting nickeled and dimed at hotels so make sure you take into account the free internet when comparing hotel rates. Location was great in the heart of Back Bay. You're a very short walk to many restaurants, Newberry St., the T, Chinatown, and more. Even if you plan on seeing the historical sights and the Freedom Trail, this is the perfect location because of its proximity to both the T and nightlife/restaurants. When I return to Boston, I would definitely stay at this hotel again. It's certainly a solid 4 star hotel which may not necessarily wow you, but will certainly please and impress you.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ryans_auntie
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. I stayed twice for two separate business trips in July. The location is a two minute walk from the Back Bay train station. There are a lot of great restaurants in the area. The bar downstairs is great. Good drinks and a tasty lobster roll. My bed was very comfortable. I loved the amenities. Great sized bottles of Kiehl's products. Loved it! My only disappointment was that I had a deluxe room my first visit...turndown service, coffee maker, music on in the room before arrived, etc. My second stay was a standard room...no turndown service, no coffee maker, etc. Plus the room was a lot smaller. Oh well, the corporate rate was still good and the bed was still comfy. One tip...look in the fridge below tv. There are two bottles of water (no charge). I will definitely stay here again when visiting Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Just as good!”
Reviews.Author: 1206irene
Reviews.Content: This is was our second time here and it was just as good as last time! Very friendly from the word go. Lovely, comfy room, brilliant walk in shower and a bath robe to die for!! Great to get bottles of water every day. Just a couple of things.... Lighting isn't the best- could be brighter and a light nearer the bed would be good. No coffee maker-we were sure we read there was one in room. But that said, we would highly recommend this hotel- the location is so good. Staff exceptional. Very clean. Did not want to leave.......

Reviews.Title: “A great great hotelâ€¦..”
Reviews.Author: WarringtonTravellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Back Bay hotel based on a recommendation from a work colleague and we were not disappointed. The hotel is modern and of a high standard. The room was of a good size with a lovely bathroom. The hotel is with walking distance of Bostonâ€™s attractions, shops and restaurants. We loved the Cuffs bar which was very lively in evening and had a great meal at the Stanhope Grill, we sat outside in the courtyard, food and service was exceptional. We also ate at Da Vinci restaurant, just around the corner and this was great too. As everyone says if you go to Boston you must do the Duck Tour, we did and it was great Quack Quack !!! I can also recommend the Freedom Trail and a visit to the top of the Prudential Building for a great view of Boston. We loved the Back Bay hotel and we loved Boston, next time we will stay for a little longer

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff make this hotel very welcoming”
Reviews.Author: emmesse2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Back Bay Hotel during a recent business trip to Boston. It is very central with only a 5 minute walk to "the T." (subway) The staff are incredibly friendly and very helpful, offering advice and assistance with everything. I stayed in a deluxe king room which was very large, with huge flatscreen TV and nespresso machine. The room and bathroom were immaculate and the bed very comfortable. I was glad of the umbrella in the closet on the day of torrential rain and the large laptop-sized room safe was something I hadn't seen before. I ate in the bar downstairs where service was also very friendly but the food, though delicious, did take some time to arrive. Minor annoyances: The room seemed quite dark and could have done with an overhead light. There's no master light switch by the bed, so I kept getting into bed and getting up again to turn off the fiddly lamps! Aircon is loud, but it wasn't too hot so I didn't need it on much. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: zagazoo
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Back Bay hotel! The room was nicely decorated and spotless. The bathroom was very clean and the bed was super comfortable (although there was no light switch near the bed). The location of the hotel is ideal as it is very near to shops and places of interest. Complimentary internet connection was also a nice touch as not many hotels offer it. We would definitely stay in the Back Bay hotel during our next visit to Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location with very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: meemo30
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Boston. The rooms were lovely can't fault it in any way. The staff were really nice and helpful. We stayed here for 3 nights and the location of the hotel made it very easy to explore the city on foot.

Reviews.Title: “Back Bay a Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Wongobears
Reviews.Content: Every room comes with great amentities, like the refrigerator stocked with a couple of bottles of water, an umbrella in the closet for your use, Frette turkish cotton towels, and Aveda bath products. The two computer business center allowed you to use for 15 minutes per day, but we only used to print our boarding passes, as there is free wi-fi throughout the facility! (A must for our children!) Do upgrade to the Deluxe room if you can---we did, with four adults---and you receive a larger room, a huge bathroom (separate shower and tub), turndown service with chocolates, robes & slippers, and a Nespresso machine. Loved the chaise lounge, too. Location was great...five minutes walk in any direction brings you to a station for the easy-to-use subway system, as well as to the restaurants & boutique shops along Newbury. Ten minutes walk brings to to the edge of the Boston Common. Five minutes walk to coffee shops and to a CVS for necessities and snacks. Friendly staff, able to give a suggestion or a hand upon request. Minuses were few: small elevators (but they came promptly!), bar food was just okay. The Back Bay Hotel was a great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Good,just like last year”
Reviews.Author: capecodder110763
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Back Bay again this year after nice stay last year.All staff very friendly and helpful.Allowed late checkout and then stored our bags until we were ready to depart for the airport.Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Very comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: JelliGirlSW
Reviews.Content: We did a tour round the east coast of America and this was our first stop on our organised tour with Virgin. As we were driving ourselves round in a hired car we found that the sat-nav (or GPS) came in very handy when trying to find the hotel in the big city! Once at the Back Bay Hotel, we were given our room keys and gave our laggage to the porter. The porter was very efficient and brought our luggage up very quickly. The rooms were lovely, maybe a little on the small size but the beds were very comfortable- I didnt want to get out of bed in the morning! The room was equipped with a big flat screen tv, cd player and fridge aswell as an iron, and an ironing board in the closet. The rooms were very clean and the bathroom was lovely and spacious. For dinner we went out of the hotel and had a wander round the nearby streets until we came across this lovely Italian restaurant- a new one called "Vapianos". The food was lovley. Breakfast was eaten at the hotel in their restaurant- a bit on the pricey side but what do you expect in a posh hotel like that. The food was also very nice- the service was brilliant. Overall I thought that our two nights here were a great start to our 2 week tour and I would definitley return to this hotel if I came back to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “An elegant hotel that provides a relaxing stay.”
Reviews.Author: dtwclerk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Back Bay Hotel to attend a wedding at the hotel and it was a great experience. The Back Bay is a luxury boutique hotel that avoids the mass crowds of the more run of the mill chains, and the staff provides very personalized service. The location itself is convenient to several attractions in Boston, and in particular it is only a couple of blocks away from the Commonwealth Avenue Mall. The bar downstairs is quite good and it was pretty packed at nighttime. What really impressed us, however, was the hotel staff's service on the day of the wedding. There were a number of logistical details that we were helping the bride and groom with, and at every turn the hotel staff (bell hops and managers alike) was quite willing to help us out. The wedding turned out wonderfully and it was due in no small part to the hotel staff's assistance. You won't go wrong staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay In Boston”
Reviews.Author: Ger67
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family for 3 nights at the Back Bay Hotel during August. The staff at this hotel are extremely friendly and helpful with special thanks to Nuala at reception who went out of her way to help us during our stay and Heather for her excellent dining advice and bubbly personality. The accommodation itself was clean, inviting and what you would expect. The airconditioning although a little noisey at times kept us cool on those balmy summer evenings. It is situated in a very central location with restaurants and shopping malls within walking distance and easy access to taxis and the subway for anything further a field. Overall we enjoyed our experience and Boston is a great city to visit with family.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel! Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: WendyM98
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Back Bay Hotel in June 2010. Excellent hotel, great staff and absolutely perfect location - within walking distance to just about everything. The staff were very friendly and most helpful and patient for all of our questions. We will be back there next year - made our trip to Boston most enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “The Back Bay Hotel location, staff, and service is incredible.”
Reviews.Author: Alandra0102
Reviews.Content: This hotel experience reminds me only of one other hotel that provides ensuing impeccable service: The Ritz Carlton. The staff was always friendly, professional, and always willing to assist you. I will definetly stay at The Back Bay Hotel in the near future and will recommend this hotel to all of my friends and family. I can't say enough about the staff. Kudos to Nuala Creedon and Heather. You are the greatest! One recommendation: update fitness center equipment.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chris200475
Reviews.Content: When they found that I planned to purpose to my girlfriend that evening, the Back Bay Hotel really went out of their way to make it a very memorable stay for both of us. In addition to a wonderful room and spectacular service, they also provided a few little complimentary extras. The Back Bay Hotel is now our special place in the city and we can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch hotel”
Reviews.Author: RedRocks10
Reviews.Content: My Wife and i traveled here with another couple to see a concert at Fenway. We stayed one night. We live in Connecticut so we drove in. The hotel is located very conveniently off I90. It was right turns all the way in and right turns all the way out with absolutely no local traffic to contend with. Check in time is at 3:00 but we arrived before noon the valet greeted us as we pulled up. The front desk easily and happily accommodated us with one of the rooms. As we were checking in the valet found us and handed me some cash that had fallen out of my pocked onto the floor. I was impressed! After dropping our bags in our travel partners' room we hit the city. 2 blocks away from the T (Boston's subway) made this hotel a central hub to the city. We will be back here again. In fact I am already making plans for an autumn retreat with my wife. For the Price (a bit more than $200 with AAA) and the impeccable, warm, genuine service and staff, we would not consider another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Sailaway1002
Reviews.Content: The staff, especially at the front desk was extremely friendly and accommodating. Our room was always very clean. We stayed five nights and would definitely chose the back bay next time again!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JFortMyers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at The Back Bay Hotel on Stuart Street in Boston on August 5, 2010. Arrived that day into Logan airport and took T to hotel, which is only a two block walk. Impressive lobby in the old police headquarters. Got great rate thru the AAA website ($220 including all taxes which we figured was about $192 before taxes). We were in town for Red Sox game. Hotel within walking distance of Fenway although it is a bit of a hike. Fitness room well equiped. Ample machines and TVs. Room was very nice but a bit small. Bed great. Fine for one night but would like a larger room if we were staying longer. Hotel offered free internet but speed so slow we used our aircard.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding stay at an Outstanding Hotel - 1st time but won't be the last!”
Reviews.Author: SSMcKenzie
Reviews.Content: The Back Bay hotel is the former Boston Police Headquarters. The staff is among the nicest group of people you'll ever meet. The hotel is owned and managed by the Doyle group - which if you haven't figured out is of Irish heritage. The rooms are up to date with a nice decor. The bar "cuffs" offers a great atmosphere to hang out in, with an outside patio for the summertime. We didn't eat at the restaurant but checked out the menu which looked reasonable. The location was minutes from local shopping, restaurants, etc. The best thing about this hotel, besides the modern look theyâ€™ve given the old building, is by far the people that work there! They truly go out of their way to help and make sure your stay was the best experience possible! We've stayed at the Marriott, Westin, etc in Boston and nothing compares to the Back Bay Hotel! This was our 1st stay but certainly will not be the last - I won't stay any place else unless they're sold out!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful people, location, service and amenities in the Back Bay”
Reviews.Author: bern2paris
Reviews.Content: Everyone that we encountered at the Back Bay Hotel gave the impression that they were interested in making our stay as pleasant as possible. My son and i came to visit family in the area, and we had a wonderful time. The room and bathrooms were clean and first rate. The Nespresso machine in the room was a big hit. The bar and restaurant were also very nice. But the nicest thing about the Back Bay Hotel is the people working there - from Natalie on the front desk to Yuri in the restaurant. Friendly and very helpful. We will make this our base whenever we travel back to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Deserving of star rating!”
Reviews.Author: MoranFamily
Reviews.Content: We travel a lot. And when we're spending as much as we had to to stay in Boston, we expect a lot. This hotel did not disappoint. As a mother of small children and a nurse, cleanliness is a top priority and at the Back Bay Hotel, I was impressed. Exceptionally clean to the last detail, from the lobby to the guest rooms. The location was very convenient to the Arlington T station. Our only complaint was that there was no in-room coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Complete Luxury”
Reviews.Author: vandyman59
Reviews.Content: I was required to attend a workshop sponsored by my employer and one of my colleuges recomended that I stay at The Back Bay. From the moment my cab pulled up, I was treated with the highest level of respect. You would have thought I was a VIP. Very easy check in, and a lot of personal service. The room was super, complimentary wireless internet allowed me to keep up with what was happening in my office. The Bay Bay and Boston as a whole gave me an entirely new impression on the Northeast. Friendly, attentive service, great accomodations. I'm ready to come back to The Back Bay for a pleasure trip.

Reviews.Title: “Back Bay ---luxury in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: titania378
Reviews.Content: I booked the Back Bay after looking at many hotels on line, and I was not disapointed. The hotel is immaculate, beautiful and has lots of spoil-you-rotten touches. I had requested a corner King room, (a bit of an upgrade from the room offered with our package) and when we arrived, we were quite early for check in, but the front desk said they would give us the first available corner room. My husband and I stored our bags, and after a quick walk around the neighborhood returned to a gorgeous room. It was spacious and beautifully appointed----great sheets and lovely bedding, large body pillows. The view wasn't perfect, but the hotel isn't all that tall---and we had lots of light. The bathroom was stunning---with thick, luxurious bathrobes and soft slippers, towel warming racks, lovely shampoos. We had a minor issue with our shower pressure -- it was weak, but when I spoke with the front desk staff it was fixed within in hour---and terrific after that. The cleaning staff was in early, so we returned from lunch to a perfect room, and turn down service includes chocolates. There is an in room fridge as well, with complimentary waters. We also enjoyed great service at "Cuffs" the bar downstairs, and finished our evenings with drinks on their patio. The location is very central in Boston--a couple of blocks from the subway (to and from the airport very easily) and to other parts of the city. Our concierge and all the staff could not have been nicer. We requested a few tips for breakfast and other sites and everyone was very helpful with local favorites. All in all, we had a perfect stay at the Back Bay.

Reviews.Title: “looking forward to return visit!”
Reviews.Author: sunny2991
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel on June 24th for 3 nights and like other reviewers didn't want our stay to end!! the staff were so friendly and being from Ireland it was particulaly nice to hear some familiar Irish accents from the staff. This being our third visit to Boston and having stayed in several different hotels in Boston this hotel was by far the best we have stayed in. the rooms were spacious and super clean, and were equipped with some of the most comfortable beds!! while this is a very busy downtown Boston location we had no problem sleeping and i am a very light sleeper! this hotel is exceptionally good value for money for locaton, ambience, quality and overall experience. would definately recommend this hotel to everyone and we look forward to staying here again when we return to boston next year!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with attentive service”
Reviews.Author: jewel_leaf
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing! It is absolutely lovely. Spacious rooms that are nicely decorated, with lovely touches like Kiehl's toiletries, complimentary water bottles, robes/slippers, umbrella for daily use, chocolates on your pillow etc. It is pricey, but well worth it! The check-in staff and other staff are all helpful and friendly. We didn't get a chance to talk to the conceirge, but she looked to be helpful as well. One tip though - if you book through a third party (Orbitz, Expedia, etc) they may change your room type. Eg, we reserved a double bed room and they 'upgraded' us to the next step up king bed room. Depending on the number of people you're staying with this could be an inconvenience to get a cot. They were able to switch us back on the next night of our stay which was good though.

Reviews.Title: “Calm Before the Storm”
Reviews.Author: madelonChicago
Reviews.Content: We chose the Back Bay Hotel after reading the reviews on Trip advisor and were so pleased. We had traveled to Boston to enjoy a few days before attending a family wedding in Waltham & Harvard, Ma. Just walking in the door, the serenity settles over you. The staff was welcoming and thoughtful, the rooms were perfect. We ate in the bar area and our dinner was better than at no name down in the harbor area. Shear Madness was an easy walk as were Copley Square and the Prudential Center shops. We enjoyed the trolley and walked the whole city. The wedding was beautiful but we treasured our time in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel,great staff,really felt welcomed & valued,home from home.”
Reviews.Author: surestart1
Reviews.Content: Your holiday is what you make of it, but also what the staff make of it. We had a little bit of a mix up with our rooms when we arrived,but the staff were excellent,they upgraded us which was great. All staff,the reception,concierge,bell boys,doorman,chamber maids etc were great,nothing was too much for them. As a single parent i saved long & hard for this trip & the staff made it worth every penny & more. They gave us really good service, tips & advice on where to go & how to get good value for money when doing things. I can't thank them enough,so could the manager please pass on my personal thanks,i would recommend & return. Your staff are all "singing from the same hymn sheet" welldone...Oh...& i've stayed in some of the best hotels in Europe & the Caribbean but the warmth of the staff & how they made us feel so welcome was great.

Reviews.Title: “You will LOVE this Place”
Reviews.Author: TheoVenturaCounty_CA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Back Bay Hotel last week with my husband and 2 daughters, 11 and 13. I loved the idea that it was the old Police headquarters. It is beautifully decorated with top notch customer service, super comfy beds and in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “We didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: mizmof
Reviews.Content: We were going to Boston for a Red Sox game and found the Back Bay hotel on Hotels.com. We had never heard of it before but based on all the fantastic reviews and the rate ($150+tax), we booked it......and boy are we glad we did! This hotel is well staffed, clean, and luxurious feeling. We had a room on the 5th floor w/ 2 double beds and upon walking in, we were like WOW! But wait..., then we saw our bathroom and were like DOUBLE WOW!! It was HUGE and Beautiful- seperate tub, walk-in shower for it seemed like 4 people , towel warmers, bathrobes, granite countertops, nice bath products...I could have stayed in the bathroom the whole time and would have been content...even the window treatment was top-notch. Now there were a few things I didn't care for or that can be improved upon: 1. Clock in rooms are not lighted so it's difficult to see time in the dark 2. The nespresso maker was just "ok". The coffee wasn't that good. Better off having regular coffee makers since not everyone likes espresso. 3. Fan in bathroom did not work Can't think of anything else but the nice touches such as the slippers, chocolates and turn-down service far outweigh these minor things. We ate a buffet breakfast at the Stanhope Grill in the hotel and it was well worth the money. We really didn't want to leave and can't wait to stay there again. Go Red Sox!

Reviews.Title: “The Back Bay Hotel is a premiere hotel with the friendliest staff imaginable.”
Reviews.Author: rickOsceola
Reviews.Content: This was a first time staying in downtown Boston, so our family was a bit apprehensive about getting to the hotel from the airport and the usual problems sometimes occurring during check in. I called the Concierage two days prior to our arrival and she was able to give me directions, suggested a cab as our best mode of transportation and suggested the amount of fare needed. She was right on with both. As we arrived in front of the hotel, the valet hailed our cab to a parking spot, helped the driver unload our luggage, placed it on a cart, and directed us to the desk, advising our luggage would be in our room. All of this in a most pleasant manner. The desk staff checked us in and asked if we needed anything before going to our room. They directed us to our room, again with the most professional and polite manner. Throughout our stay I asked the desk staff, valet and concierage for directions, suggestions for meals, and even shopping suggestions. Each time I received an accurate direction and a courteous response, "If you need anything else just ask." Our family has traveled across the United States on leisure and business trips and we all agreed the staff of the Back Bay Hotel was the best of any we have ever dealt with.

Reviews.Title: “Under Arrest?”
Reviews.Author: Walkhome
Reviews.Content: The Back Bay Hotel is located in a building that what once was the Boston Police Headquaters. It is only a few minutes walk away from the 'hop on-hop off' tourist buses and the Back Bay station where you can access the subway. There is also an Avis car rental station just around the corner. The hotel staff are very helpful and accommodating and the rooms have everything which you would expect from a superior hotel - including an umbrella! We made use of it one rainy Boston night. The hotel restaurant is good. The only downside was that the room didn't have a coffee maker in the room - you'd need to upgrade to an executive room to get one of these! Would we stay there again - certainly - as long as we could negotiate a coffee maker in the room!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, could use a little more space in rooms!”
Reviews.Author: bigbadjc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I picked the Back Bay from internet listings and reviews for a two night stay before boarding a cruise ship. The room was priced reasonably compared to other Boston hotels and the location is perfect. The neighborhood is very upscale and near the Boston Commons. The hotel service is excellent and the housekeeping is impeccable. That said, the room size was half that of a Best Western costing one third as much. Our king size bed room had only one chair to sit in. The bath had no storage space for your toiletries. The room also had an energy saving thermostat that turned the setting up when you left the room. It meant that when you came back in the heat of the late afternoon you had to wait for the room to cool down and never did it get as cool as we like to sleep. This is a very nice friendly hotel, but suffers from the same problems as all higher end, big city hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and professional”
Reviews.Author: jcronogue
Reviews.Content: Perfect for the business traveller, comfortable rooms, responsive staff. Excellent Back Bay location.

Reviews.Title: “A great recommendation from trip adivsor”
Reviews.Author: elgallagher
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on other tripadvisor reviews. I thought it was a good price in a good location and I would stay again without hessitatoin. - it is 3 blocks from Arlington station on the T (a short walk). Arlington Station is on the edge of Boston common - it is about the same distance from Copley Plaza. -There is a refrigerator in the room to keep your takeout left overs. - there is a parking garage at the start of the bock. - The pool and gym are included in the rate as well as free wifi. no regrets.

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: glenysPlymouth
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Back Bay from 6th-9th July as the second leg of our trip to the USA. This hotel is wonderul. The staff are courteous and go out of their way to help, the hotel is immaculate and classy and the food and service top notch. Our room was very big with 2 double beds and the bathroom was huge with a big shower room. Room service was a delight and the breakfast was first class. We thoroughly enjoyed staying here again and I only wish the Back Bay was cloned in all major cities.

Reviews.Title: “Its just like going home to meet the Family after been away for a while”
Reviews.Author: jeananne087
Reviews.Content: Like I said from the minute we arrived it was just so relax I could not believe how fast we were through check in. All death with so swiftly we even had I really was amazed the staff at the front desk could not have been more atentive. I was travelling with 4 teenage girls and they were great with the girls, telling they were all the best shopping were to be had. And there directions were spot on.. We had a wonderful dinner that evening in the dining room and teenagers are fussy eaters at the best of times. But the staff had no problem ajusting the menue so suit there needs, it was the first time in our whole trip that I felt relaxed enough to have a glass of wine. On arrival at our rooms I just could believe the level of comfort every little detail is taken care of wifi was a big hit with the girls so the could get on face book and tell there friends back home. To be honest I would have easily stayed in my room the level of comfort was that good The Back Bay really is in a beautiful part of town The are some beautiful quint shops you no the kind were you pick up that gift thats hard to find. The beautiful Parks and gardens the whole feel of the place says chique elegance and it really is. There is such a warm about the place I can understand why people fell in love with the place. I have done a lot of travelling thr out my live but Beston will take some beating. I had only one problem about the whole stay the girls to and that was that our stay wasn't long enough... But at least now we know were our next holiday break will be with the family of friends we mad a the Back Bay, I would so like to thank them for being to so wonderfully kind. Have a stay and see if what i'm telling you is not true it is one of the best hotel experience's I have ever had.. I aaaam so sorry I want to post some pictures but for the life of me I kind find them on my pc !!! o

Reviews.Title: “Will return”
Reviews.Author: khaney50
Reviews.Content: Great location with close proximity to the Common and Newbury Street. Third trip to Boston since 2007. Previously stayed at Omni Parker House which was undergoing construction in 2007. Returned in 2008 and stayed at the Taj. Will probably return to the Taj on next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and fantastic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: chillout62
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Back Bay Hotel in March. Our first visit to Boston and we were not disappointed. From the moment our cab dropped us at the hotel things just got better and better. Greeted by friendly door staff, friendly and professional reception staff and friendly porters. Note the word friendly, nothing was too much trouble for anyone. Great location for exploring Boston, with the Common/shopping and the' T' all in easy walking distance. To be honest Boston is a great city for walking and we did plenty of it. We didn't breakfast at the hotel but had dinner in Cuffs, great food at reasonable money with a real buzzy atmosphere. We had a beer or two most nights and had a good time, fairly busy on Friday & Saturday nights but that just adds to it. Plenty to see and do, Beacon Hill is just lovely and sitting on the common eating lunch watching the world go by was special, check out the JFK museum and the views from the Prudential building are worth experiencing. Should we return to Boston it will be the Back Bay every time!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location and great service”
Reviews.Author: joella1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Back Bay for 3 nights as part of our recent trip to Boston and Cape Cod. We really enjoyed our time at this hotel. The service is great, we had a deluxe room and loved the Aveda cosmetics, robes etc. The room was spacious with a lovely shower and bathroom. The breakfast restaurant is expensive but the food we had was great. Cuffs bar was a great place to hang out - and as we were staying at the time of the world cup a consoling place to watch England loose to Germany! We will definitely stay here again when in Boston - the location is brilliant!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Boston Hotel, will now not stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: stuosman
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I were in Boston Mid June for a holiday from England, UK and chose to stay in the Back Bay. This location is perfect as you are a stones throw from the shops of Newbury street and a 5 minute walk to the western edge of Boston Common. You can easily walk downtown in about 20-25 minutes and the the nearest T station (subway) is 2 blocks away. The staff were wonderful and helpful and the hotel facilities are brilliant, free wifi is a particular bonus as a European traveller. The hotel has lots of character and the rooms were excellent. We stayed in a deluxe room and got all of the features that we were promised. We ate twice in 'Cuffs' bar and were not disappointed. The breakfast in the main restuarant is really good as well but like most downtown hotels is a little bit expensive. Don't listen to the negative reviews of this hotel as they show nothing more than the exceptions to the general service that you get I am sure. I come to Boston from the UK to see the Redsox play and have stayed in a couple of hotels, neither of which are anything in comparison to the excellent Back Bay. Book now, you won't be dissapointed. We'll def be back.!

Reviews.Title: “This small luxury hotel will be the only place we ever stay when in Boston.”
Reviews.Author: ToviHannanhJoah
Reviews.Content: Everything about the Back Bay Hotel in Boston is first rate. From the beautiful lobby and efficient check-in, to a turn down service available only at five star hotels, we loved every minute of our five day stay. The rooms are spacious, with beautifully appointed marble bathrooms almost as large as an entire room in other big city hotels. Thank you Back Bay -- we hope to see you again; we plan on looking into other hotels in the Doyle Collection for future trips to the U.K. and Ireland.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: JRMiller07
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay at the Back Bay Hotel over Memorial Day weekend. We used the T to get around and found the hotel conveniently located near the Back Bay station. We also found it to be very close to many shops and restaurants and a short walk to the parks. The room itself was nice and interactions with hotel staff, although limited, were pleasant. We would definitely stay here again when traveling to Boston!

Reviews.Title: “My family hated to leave this perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: swass415
Reviews.Content: Our good vibe started when we called for diretions and the receptionist stayed on the phone with us for 15 minutes guiding us through the array of one way streets in Boston. It was only better from there. An amazing curteous and friendly staff from maids to bar staff to bellmen, great bar food, lovely restaurant, beautiful sleeping accomodations. I really appreciated the huge Frette bath towels. Nice touch with compliemntary bottled water and wi-fi in rooms. Great location in the Back Bay. We travel alot for business and vacation and this hotel rates as one of the best ever.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel overbooked my room last year”
Reviews.Author: MarkJeong
Reviews.Content: WARNING, DO NOT STAY OR BOOK THIS HOTEL: I am finding hotel where I want to stay next week in Boston. Last year's things remind me why we should not make a reservation in The Boston Backbay hotel. This hotel overbooked my room even if I fully pre-paid my stay and then attempted to waive its responsability. In some jurisdictions, selling the same thing (the right to occupy the room) twice, is considered fraud. In my many (over 20) years of travelling, many of which have been for business travel around all continents and staying at hotels of all levels, from small family owned hostels to high-end Asian ultra-luxury palaces, I had never experienced such an unethical and illegal behaviour as the BackBay Hotel. This hotel does not honor its basic contractual obligations, even when stays ave been pre-paid. Leaves no option but to sue in court. Do not run the risk, stay elsewhere. There are plenty other ethical options in Boston. I cann't not forget this kind of experience in The BackBay Hotel in rest of my life.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Staff I have ever had to deal with!”
Reviews.Author: Sandra9179
Reviews.Content: Here's how it went when we checked into this hotel: 1. Valet agreed we could leave our car at the curb until we checked in and took our luggage to our room - normally about a 30 minute task. 2. Front desk had 2 women on, one was helping a guest, the other was on the phone. I waited 20 minutes without acknowledgment from the staff before I was checked in, which took about another 10 minutes. Took luggage to room. All of this took about 40 minutes. 3. Went to curb to get the car and was told by Valet we were gone too long and the charge was $18, which he put in his pocket! 4. Went to lounge that evening for a drink before dinner. Server brought our first drink. We waited a considerable time (about 20 minutes) for a refill. She was nowhere to be found. Husband goes to bar and she is sitting at the end flirting with gentlemen guests. He had to request a refill. She was embarrassed, she was caught. 5. Went to room to catch the news. TV language and prompts were in Spanish. Looked for Channel programming card to change language on remote. Not in room. Called concierge, asked if he could guide me through so I could change language program, he said he didn't know how to do that. Would send someone up immediately. 2 hours later front desk calls to ask if we had trouble with the TV. I said "too little, too late" and hung up the phone!!! 6. Air conditioning in room was noisy and did not cool. We had to set it on fan all night. Did not call any staff member to help because at that point we knew this was useless. 7. No in room coffee next morning. Came down to lobby seeking complimentary hotel coffee. Most hotels have this service for their guests. Concierge pointed me to a room. Went there and found the guest ahead of me paying for coffee. Thought I was in the wrong room. Went back to concierge and asked if the Back Bay had complimentary coffee for their guests. Was abruptly told, "NO". We went down the street to a small business coffee shop, paid more but that was NOT the issue. I have written to the general manager and the CEO of this chain. They have a staff that is more invested in their personal satisfaction and interests than in guest "HOSPITALITY". They do not seem to be aware of what that concept means. If you are in Boston, try the KIMPTON CHAIN. They know what it means to satisfy the guest and their staff is exceptionally trained in guest hospitality and guest service. DO NOT book a reservation at the Back Bay until they retrain their staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location,gracious staff,friendliest bar,great value. Strongly recommended”
Reviews.Author: gassendi10
Reviews.Content: We are a senior couple,experienced travelers both in U.S> and Europe. This was an exceptional hotel in terms of cleanliness, friendliness, and location. It is located near two public transit lines and is in walking distance of fine restaurants and great shopping areas. The staff is superb, both the concierges, the desk persons, the bartenders and the doormen. It was just a great pleasure staying there and we would certainjly recommend it to anyone visiting Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Friscotravelers
Reviews.Content: The location is great and the staff friendly but this hotel doesn't do the little things that make a great stay. We booked a deluxe room because of the touted separate walk-in shower. None of the other plusses in the hotel's own literature are worth paying a nickel more for. However, our room did not offer the promised separate shower and when we called to inquire about the mixup were told that "not all deluxe rooms offer the walk-in shower feature." Then how can you advertise it as a deluxe room? The bathroom was designed so poorly that the very large door, when opened cut off a full third of the bathroom making it impossible to access when someone was standing at the sink! The drawers in the chest wouldn't stay closed so we had to wedge paper in the corners to keep them from hanging open. It appears that paper or shims of some kind were used underneath the furniture to try to level it but the attempt was unsuccessful. Local newspapers were generally unavailable on the weekend and we were directed to a 7-11 down the street to get a Sunday paper. We found one at a different hotel and will likely consider that place for our next visit.
