Excessive noise was another problem: traffic noise from the street even though we were on the 5th floor, hallway noise and slamming doors, even the A/C unit made a racket when it was running. Definitely not a place for quiet relaxation. We love Boston and the location is very convenient but we will not stay here again. There are better options for the money.

Reviews.Title: “We got 5 star service for a 3 star price.”
Reviews.Author: winelover97
Reviews.Content: Went to Boston with another "50 something friend" to visit my daughter. I wanted to stay in Back Bay because of the great location, but it can be difficult finding a nice place under $300. A few years ago I stayed at the Boston Park Plaza after getting a good deal. Another beautiful hotel, but wanted to stay somewhere else this time. The price at Back Bay Hotel for a standard room with 2 double beds was $249, but I got the AAA discount, which brought it down to $225. We drove to Boston from PA, and from the moment we stepped out of the car, we were treated like VIPs. I choose not to use the valet service($42 a night) to park my car. After doing some research on overnight parking garages, I found 2 garages within a few blocks. There was a coupon that could be printed, and I only paid $25 a night. When we checked in, Natalie upgraded us to a Deluxe Double. The room was beautiful, especially the spacious bathroom: heated towel rack, oversized towels, robes, slippers, a separate bath and step-in shower, large vanity with hand-held mirror, decorative glass container with q-tips and cottons. The room had a flat screen TV, stereo, frig with water, expresso coffee maker - not your typical hotel room ammenities. There was even a golf umbrella in the closet for us to use! The beds were comfy, and turn down service was provided with chocolates on the bed. Since it is not an extremely large hotel, the staff can make the guests feel so welcomed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - very happy with our choice”
Reviews.Author: clairemc10
Reviews.Content: Staff incredibly helpful, friendly and courteous. Great location for local attractions, especially Fenway Park, home of the Red Sox. Good fitness centre, nice bar and restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, staff and location!”
Reviews.Author: Italianadventure
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 day stay in Boston, staying at the Back Bay Hotel. I had emailed with a few questions, mentioning that we would have an early arrival. Not only was our room ready by 0900 we were upgraded to a lovely room on the 6th floor. Quiet, luxurious with the most attentive staff, always there to answer any questions. Heated towels, seperate shower, a tassimo in the room, turn down service. It was lovely to be spoiled. This hotel is in a perfect location to the T, but we actually walked everywhere. For those of you from out of town, a Frommers was a great guide. As were the many Bostonians who stopped to ask if they could help. A perfect "holiday" in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “ticks all my boxes”
Reviews.Author: dan773
Reviews.Content: we stayed 5 nights. if we go back to hotel I would saty again as I dont think you'd get better these are the bullet points less than 5 min walk to tube / metro rooms big clean and comfortable free internet access via wifi or two desktops that you can use staff friendly and helpful centrally located. Boston is small and everywhere is walkable (if you dont mind walking) failing that the tube is easy to use ($15 for a week unlimited use) there is a bar attached to the hotel which was busy and the prices the same as the other bars we had drinks at staff

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing stay...”
Reviews.Author: austintoanywhere
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Back Bay (formerly Jury's) hotel for work numerous times, and I used to really enjoy staying there. The last trip, however, I noticed that things seemed quite loud (doors banging, rooms being cleaned), but I assumed it was just something unusual and limited to that trip. However, this trip, I stayed several days, and it was unbelievably loud every day. One morning, we counted 41 door slams within a couple of hours -- and we were at the end of a hallway, seemingly away from the bulk of the rooms. Looking through the peephole, it was clear that most of the noise was the cleaning staff going in and out of rooms without bothering to catch the door. In addition to the noise, our room wasn't cleaned two different days. The first time seemed to be a miscommunication, which happens. But even after they did clean it, I had to call twice to get things they'd forgotten. The second day, however, there didn't seem to be any reason why it wasn't cleaned. With the exception of one person, staff was very helpful and polite, which was appreciated. It was, nevertheless, a disappointing experience. I don't think I'd spend my own money to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “They gave away my room”
Reviews.Author: DallasDrew
Reviews.Content: I expected a better experience after reading all the positive reviews on tripadvisor. I called the hotel ahead of time to advise I would be arriving after midnight and was assured there would be no problem. On check in everyone was very polite, however there was no turn down service, no bell boy to take our baggage to the room and the room provided had 2 full beds instead of 1 king. I called down and spoke to Frontdesk/Craig. He politely told me there was nothing he could do after making him aware we had made this honeymoon reservation 6 months prior. His attitude frustrated me so much that I went to the front desk and asked for the manager, turns out it's Craig. He made it clear that they were not required to hold any rooms and our reservation was only a request; in addition had we booked our room through the actual hotel website and not a 3rd party (travelocity) then the reservation would have been guaranteed. He would simply not budge and it was 1am. I retired after begging for something to make up for the poor service we were receiving and got breakfast comped and some champagne. Didn't really make up for having to sleep in a different bed from my new wife or having to deal with Craig's surliness. The hotel was beautiful, the rest of the employees were very nice and breakfast was excellent. Craig should be trained to the standards of the resto f the staff or let go. If it is this hotel's policy to treat 3rd party reservations as 2nd tier, then this should be clearly spelled out also.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel staff I've ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: Griffin83
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week based on Trip Advisor reviews, it was a fantastic hotel, lovely, spacious rooms, a little noisy in the hallway in the evening, but no complaints what so ever. The room was spot on and the highlight were undoubtedly the obliging, friendly staff who were extremely pleasant and always left us with a smile on our faces! The hotel is in a perfect area, steps from the shops, amazing restaurants, the Common and local to the subway (perfect for getting to the legendary Fenway Park!). Highly recommended. Cheers Back Bay Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: beccx
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights at the end of a two week trip to Boston and Cape Cod. We arrived well before check in time and weren't able to check in but the lady on reception was really helpful, took all our details and gave us recommendations for somewhere to have lunch. When we came back the room still wasn't ready but we took a seat in the bar and the receptionist then came and found us when the room was ready for us. Everyone was very apologetic that the room wasn't ready for us - very kind given that we were the ones who had turned up early! The room was nice, everything you'd expect in this standard of hotel, large comfy bed, huge flatscreen TV, fluffy robes and a cool Nespresso coffee maker. We had booked a Deluxe room and had been allocated one in the corner of the hotel - unfortunately there wasn't much to look out on as we were only on the 2nd floor but it was nice to have that natural daylight from so many windows! The location of the hotel is good - near to Copley Square, Newbury Street and the Public Gardens. We had started our trip in Boston at the other end of town so it was good to get out and about and see the Back Bay area. We had drinks in the bar before heading out for dinner on our last night. Service was good and the bar was lively. Overall we enjoyed our staff. Every member of staff we came across was really friendly and helpful and we felt very welcome. I'd recommend this place to anyone looking to stay in the Back Bay area.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Therese002
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely the best hotel I have ever stayed in. The location is great, only 3 blocks from the T (Boston's subway) and only 3 blocks from Boston Common. The staff are very friendly as well. The rooms are incredible. I stayed in a room with 2 double beds and there were 3 people. Two people in one double bed was tight so make sure you like who you are sharing a bed with! There is a flat screen tv in the room with around 20 or so channels. They also have free wifi although I had problems connecting to it after the first day. They graciously stocked us with lots of towels and toiletries. The bathroom is great! There is a towel warming rack in it and they also have really nice robes you can use. There is a nice hairdryer that is like a regular hairdryer, not one connected to the wall like you see in most hotels. There was also a mini fridge in a cabinet under the tv. The rooms are also very, very quiet. I never once heard any noise from the hallway or the street. There is also a digital thermostat on the wall to control the room temp. Being close to the T was great. Took about 20 minutes total including walking and subway ride to get to Fenway and about 25 minutes total to get to Boston Brewery (Sam Adams brewery). You are only 3 blocks to the Boston Common which is where the Freedom Trail starts and only 5 or 6 blocks from the original Cheers bar. I can't say enough about the hotel. The doormen were super nice and carried our luggage for us to the elevator. They also have a concierge desk to help you with anything you need in the city. There is a bar/restaurant in the hotel called Cuffs, although I didn't use it. It was always filled with people and seemed like the place to be. They even had seating outside as well. I would highly recommend staying here. I got a great deal on a travel website when I booked the hotel with my flight. It's a great deal for a great place to stay. I will definitely stay here again when I go back to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Citiestraveller63
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at this hotel and wished we could have stayed more but our travel plans wouldn't allow us to. This hotel is luxury itself! From the time you enter to the time you leave all the staff are very polite and friendly and nothing is too much trouble. Heather the Concierge is a delight, a true Bostonian, who knows everything you need to know. Tahrien and Maria at the front desk and Fitz from room service are a credit to this to this top class hotel! We had a king bed room on the 4th floor which overlooked the street but we slept perfectly and heard no noise at all. The room was spacious and housekeeping was very good each day. We used room service whilst there and it was great too. Free wi-fi worked well too. The hotel is well located for sightseeing, restaurants and transportation. We were travelling on to NY as part of our holiday and Back Bay station is just a few minutes walk away to get the Amtrak. We will definitely stay at this hotel again without any hesitation it's fabulous! If you're going to Boston don't miss out on this hotel it's a must in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: crazycanuck99
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about this hotel! I could go on for pages about the things they did for us. We traveled along way to experience TD Bank Garden and Fenway park, but found so much more. From the time we arrived everything was looked after. We flew all night and arrived at 11am and found our room ready and waiting. The package I had delivered to the hotel was ready when I arrived the staff always had the right answer. The hotel is close to shopping and the T will take you every where you need to go. My wife and I walked up and down Boylston street at 1am and never felt safer. Boston - You have an amazing city & The Back Bay Hotel is an AMAZING place to stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: smk007
Reviews.Content: The hotel is superbly located, close to the Public Garden and convenient for Newbury St and the T. The reception staff were very pleasant and helpful, the doormen usually ignored me. The room, a deluxe king, was comfortable but a bit smaller than I have seen in equivalent grade rooms in other hotels. The shower room was quite small with only one vanity unit and no bath (pictures attached). There was little counter space available and this was rather inconvenient with two people in the room. Bottled water was supplied every day and the Nespresso machine in the room was a nice touch. The safe was too shallow to accommodate a standard laptop. Internet access was free in the room. Overall, a decent comfortable hotel in a good location, although I was slightly disappointed in some details.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice.”
Reviews.Author: FamiliaE
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay. The room was spacious, the beds were comfortable, everything was of good quality and fancy. The hotel is in a former Police Department Building (very old one) which was also an extra detail for our girls during our visit, the building is very nice. It is located a couple of blocks away from Copley Place, a very fancy mall with very good stores.

Reviews.Title: “At last, a beautyfull hotel in a beautyfull city”
Reviews.Author: Anthonydoyle04081979
Reviews.Content: What can I say, loved every minute.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: big_D123
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in during the Boston marathon for convenience to finish line area. Excellent choice. Room was not ready on our arrival. They offered another room but lady at check-in recommended to wait for our room since it was a corner room. Wait was worth it. Nice large room on 8th floor on corner. Large bathroom - shower only. I would have preferred a tub after the marathon. Very clean and nice amenities. Free fridge and free espresso. Room service VERY overpriced, poor quality food. Breakfast buffet downstairs much better. Had dinner one night, good food, but also rather pricey for small portions. Exceptional service attitude by all employees - bell men, reception area, concierge, maids, room service. Nice bar areas. Lively crowd. Overall very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Expectations Met, and they were high!”
Reviews.Author: noloelpollo
Reviews.Content: I was originally staying at the Hyatt and when the Back Bay opened up I took adavnatge, considering it is #4 currently. With a #4 rating my expectations were high, and they were totally met. I would strongly consider paying a bit more to stay here in the future. What was particularly pleasent was the great aroma in different places in the hotel. By the elevator it was sandlewood and vanila. The library it was lemon grass. Could see where the scents were coming from but very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: aggiegirl93
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Back Bay Hotel earlier this week. The staff there is really great, from the doormen to the front desk staff. Natalie, in particular, was outstanding. The rooms are exceptionally clean and feature comfortable beds. I do wish that all four pillows on the bed weren't feather pillows. I am not a fan of feather pillows. The housekeeping staff are very noisy early in the morning, starting in on rooms at 8 am and banging doors. Ok for business travellers who need to get up early, but not the best for leisure travellers. Next time I will bring ear plugs. Also, be sure to put your "do not disturb" sign on your door so they don't come in on you! We dined at the Cuffs restaurant two nights in a row. The first night was exceptional. We had a great waiter and the food was excellent. The second night was a disappointment. The waitress didn't write our orders down and what do you know, she got my order wrong. I'd recommend that orders always be written down. The hotel has a great location. Overall all, I rate it highly and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming definitely going back!”
Reviews.Author: BlkCrow
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Boston alone for an over night stay to watch an event at the Hancock Theater , across the street from Back Bay. I'm a country gal not use to City's, so some what nervous and feeling like a fish out of water driving the streets, finally my Nav delivered me to my Hotel The Back Bay, were to park? no problem the incredible friendly valet service eased my fears and immediately made me feel like I arrived home. Stepping into Back Bay and being greeted by an Irish speaking Gal (i'm Irish) made me feel pretty special. The charming old world yet modern touches makes the Back Bay a unique experience. I upgraded to turn down service upon check in, wonderful, again another service that makes this place warm and inviting. Beds are warm, comfortable, bathrooms very clean through out hotel,beautiful, even the soap, and fresh towels in downstairs bathroom! Heck the bathrooms alone are an amazing experience, beautiful! I was very dismayed to read the childish review by one reviewer, so ridiculously written that one can only suspect a jealous Competitor wrote it is my opinion! Again being a country mouse in the big city the staff was very helpful, considerate and forward thinking in service. Brent in Valet was there 24/ 7 to direct me to streets I was looking for, sushi place, shopping, its all close by and upon leaving Brent even put a bottle of water in my car for the trip home! The gym was perfect, good equipment and free weights! The breakfast buffet was excellent, I had a special request, white omelet, no problem! I checked out the next morning and had no place for my bags, they kept them for me while I went to Hancock Theater. Midday I found I could stay in Boston another night and stayed in one of their smaller rooms rather then the deluxe which included the turn down, so I experience both rooms. The regular room was smaller then Deluxe but just as cozy, the lighting, and over all atmosphere in the rooms is like a charming private room one might find at a best friends house. As you make your way through the hall ways one feels as though you are winding through a charming house. The decor is well thought out in that it is modern, yet old world. My bathroom in both rooms was amazing, clean, incredible robes, shower with large shower head, great pressure and not cramped. Again very well thought out in design, a unique atmosphere and experience. I guess I can't say enough about The Back Bay, their staff and amenities. All of the staff called me by my name through out my stay. I've been home for a week and think "Back" on my trip and the Back Bay is right in the forefront of a great weekend in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great area”
Reviews.Author: WestNorwoodWanderers
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a fantastic area if you're going to Boston for sightseeing. It's just a 10 minute walk to the green line subway station, which takes you to most of the key Boston landmarks. It's also within walking distance of Boston Common, and the Back Bay shopping area. Hotel itself is what you'd expect of a 4* establishment - friendly staff, clean spacious rooms, good quality bathroom with towels, bathrobes etc. We especially liked the twin headed shower room. The hotel does have a bar in the lower floor, which is lively at night, but we never experienced any problems with noise. Overall this is a great value hotel for its price bracket. We'd go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: oliverpd
Reviews.Content: We used World Points to reserve a queen bed room at the Back Bay Hotel during Boston Marathon weekend. The room was very nice as was the bathroom. Service was excellent. We had to store our luggage while we figured out alternative travel plans after our trip to Ireland was cancelled due to volcano in Iceland. The hotel staff were very helpful and accommodating. The Back Bay is within walking distance of anything you might want to see in Boston, even way out at the North End. Located near many nice restaurants in both the Back Bay and South Boston, I highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a nice, friendly homebase to explore Boston

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel - superb staff!”
Reviews.Author: BandMandB
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Boston Back Bay Hotel for 4 days sightseeing with friends. Superb hotel with good sized bedrooms and excellent ensuite bathrooms - all immaculate. Excellent atmosphere in the bar , excellent full breakfasts in the restaurant and excellent additional starbucks style breakfasts served in one of the lounges. What really made our stay memorable was the superb service by staff - from the welcome given by reception staff to the waiter at breakfast - a really impressive customer service experience! All in all - exceptional !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Back Bay Hotel Stay”
Reviews.Author: viczic
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel, breakfast was awesome, beds comfortable, suites are very clean and in a great location new Newbury Street shopping strip!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel--GREAT staff”
Reviews.Author: EasternIllinois
Reviews.Content: I was curious to see if the Back Bay hotel was consistent in quality with Croke Park Hotel in Dublin, also from the Doyle Collection. I was pleased to find that it was. I think something that this chain is doing better than other hotel chains is their customer service. We stayed at this hotel because my husband was running the Boston Marathon and because of our positive experience in Dublin. The Back Bay hotel has an excellent location for the marathonâ€”and the hotel was quite a busy place. What I found that was consistent with the Croke Park Hotel was that the staff was so professional. The concierge at the Back Bay Hotel was amazing. I think most reasonable people would have started to become annoyed at the endless chain of questions our group of five had for him. But, he was such a gentleman, and had such a great demeanor. He even double-checked with my husband to be sure he was clear on the transportation process for the runners to get to the start of the marathon. Another feature that was really nice with this hotel was that their adjoining rooms connect a little differently than what I have seen in the past. Instead of having a door between the rooms, they have made the ends of the hallway rooms adjoining. So, we had a private hallway with a locked door, and then we could chose to either lock our doors or leave them open. I felt this offered another level of security (all three locked doors at night), and it also made it so there was absolutely no hallway noise. This hotel was actually one of the quietest hotels I have stayed in! This hotel certainly has the staff to make it world-class. For example, even though the restaurant and bar were overwhelmed with marathoners after the raceâ€”I could tell the staff was trying so hard to please everyone. I caught a couple of workers on the verge of a run trying to serve people. (And the food was good!) My only suggestion to this hotel would be to pay slightly more attention to detail to take it to the next level. The carpet in our room was showing a little wearâ€”and they could have added little touches like fresh flowers in the rooms, or chocolates on the pillows, or linen squares on the floor by the beds. But, from my suggestions you can tell that there is not much room for improvement, and I donâ€™t think you will be disappointed. I know I will look for a Doyle Collection hotel the next time I travel.

Reviews.Title: “We'll come back to the Back Bay”
Reviews.Author: ArturoE
Reviews.Content: A stylish, comfortable, clean hotel - with great coffee (Nespresso) in certain rooms! We we're here for the Boston Marathon (fourth trip) and found the BBH a great location for many central attractions and the marathon events. Definitely worthy of a return visit. Can't say that about the others. One drawback - poor water pressure in the showers.

Reviews.Title: “Back Bay is lovely!”
Reviews.Author: GlassesQueen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Back Bay while I was attending a conference in Boston last week. My husband came along, traveling for pleasure. It was a fantastic stay for us. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The smell of the lobby mirrors the best spa you have ever been to. Loved it, although they would not share their secret of the scent. I am presently working with a local herbalist to duplicate it in our medical office. The hotel was very clean and they thought of little things, including an umbrella in the room, which we needed for one day only, but were glad it was there. The bar, Cuffs, was time well spent. The food in the dining room was great as well as the wait staff. We will return when we visit Boston again. We specifically appreciated the concierge/doormen (since our son once held that position at The Blakely in NYC). They were welcoming every day when I returned to the hotel after a long day of meetings. They were always willing to answer my husband's questions during his explorations throughout our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service at a Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mg10116
Reviews.Content: The quality of the hotel was what I would expect in this price range in downtown Boston; well-appointed, clean, comfortable rooms. What made it stand out was the staff. Everyone from the bellman to the bartender to the front desk staff were exceptionally courteous, friendly, and helpful, and every minor detail was attended to. It was also nice to have free internet at an upscale hotel. I also attended a meeting at the hotel (in the Yeats room) and was very pleasantly surprised at the facility. The room had a large window and lime-green chairs, so it was bright and energetic, as opposed to all of the dreary hotel conference rooms out there. The service provided to my colleagues during our meeting was also excellent. I would recommend it for small business meetings.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bex67
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights over Easter and had a really lovely time. The location of the hotel is perfect and the staff are all very helpful and pleasant - they booked a table at the Capital Grille for us on our second evening which was fantastic! Our room was really comfortable and we had everything we could have needed. As the weather was so nice over Easter, it was quite nice to come back from a day's sightseeing and sit in the outside bar area and have a drink. Would definitely recommend to our friends and family if they were coming to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: IronGuard
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business Friday and through the weekend. I stayed here before and found the hotel to be absolutely charming. It is housed in the old Boston Police Headquarters. I was on the 7th floor. I found the service to be excellent, everybody really wanted to be of assistance. I had a problem, but management immediately attempted to resolve it and make it a positive experience. The bar ("Cuffs") is a happening spot at night and the drinks were mixed very well. I really like how close this was to the Back Bay and South End. The only negative thing I would say is that the gym is very small. If you like to work out, you probably won't be pleased with it. However, you can get a day pass to Boston Sports Club for a fee, or you can walk or run around the city for exercise. Overall, I think this is a great location with great service. You really can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “The Writing is on the Wall...”
Reviews.Author: PlecWriter
Reviews.Content: I recently planned and executed a 2 day business trip to Boston and I used a Travelocity airfare/hotel package to do the booking. One of the first hotels to come up on their recommended list was The Back Bay Hotel in Boston's Back Bay area. I checked the reviews and they were generally fine so I purchased the package estimating that the hotel portion was about $175-$195 per night so my expectations were high. Upon arrival I found the hotel to be a boutique type of facility with potentially limited amenities. Initially, the two bed room seemed OK, reasonably clean, if a little cramped in the bed area. Now for the scary part - I went out to dinner and upon returning I heeded nature's call and sat down to use the toilet. I made sure to wipe it down first before putting my bottom on it and the alcohol wipe came back dirty - not good. Yet considering the urgency of the moment I proceeded. Moments later when I reached for the toilet tissue I looked at the wall next to the bowl and my stomach sank and I immediately felt ill - there was a foot long streak of what looked like human feces smeared across the wall. Clearly the guest before me was not happy with this hotel. I immediately went to the front desk to report the issue and demanded that the Housekeeping manager see this repulsive sight. About 10 minutes later Mr. D.-- came up to my room and viewed the brown streak and deemed it 'unacceptable'. I was moved to an 'upgraded' room for the remainder of my short stay and conducted my business meetings in Boston and that is the essence of the tale. Quite disgusting. One note - I checked out the '24 Hour Gym' in the basement - A claustrophobia inducing dump. I am sorry but The Back Bay Hotel has not earned it's 4 stars. No way! **For those with a morbid curiosity about my experience and if you genuinely think you can stomach it, I will attach a grainy cell phone pic of the nastiness described above.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BOHSMAN
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Boston and we booked the hotel mostly due to the positive reviews on this site. We were not disapointed. As previously mentioned by many contributors, the friendliness of the staff was second to none. For some reason, there was no concierge available on our first two days, but it did'nt really matter as both the reception and bell hops proved to be a fountain of local knowledge. Rooms were spotlessly clean and everyone commented about the extreme comfort the beds afforded. The in room fridge was also extremely handy with complimentry water. Food in the restaurant was also top notch, both for breakfast and dinner., however due to the lack of decent alternatives for breakfast we had no choice but to have same here. This was a rather pricey experience, but the quality made up for the cost. All in all, a terrific time at the Back Bay, and we will be back!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a good location, with friendly helpful staff and an atmospheric bar.”
Reviews.Author: CZS17
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel and thought the location was excellent, just a short walk to the Public Library and the stop for the Trolley Tour (highly recommend this). The room was spacious, clean and tidy. Don't expect a view at the back of the hotel - you're looking into other rooms. But draw the curtains and it doesn't matter, plus we didn't spend much time in the room anyway. The staff were all really friendly and helpful, like most of the Bostonians we met. The bar was buzzing and we were lucky to get a table the first night, but that was probably due to the locals having drinks after work. This makes for a really good atmosphere, but not for those who want a quiet little corner. The food was good and the prices very reasonable for a hotel, probably why the locals are willing to drink and dine there. Liked: The location, the bar, the friendly staff and the free wi-fi!! Disliked: The $42 per night valet parking (but this is probably reasonable for Boston), NO tea or coffee making facilities in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique-like Hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: jh030
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an awesome location to all transportation and fun things in Back Bay, Boston. I really enjoyed the amenities, including the great staff. The hotel feels like a boutique hotel and the price is great and fair. I would recommend staying here, or at least checking it out! - Javier

Reviews.Title: “top notche”
Reviews.Author: ethan1999
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights at the Back Bay Hotel. Reception was friendly, room was super clean and well appointed. It was a great location and "surprise" the wi-fi was free! The Hotel really exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Back Bay's Best”
Reviews.Author: Jewelwatt
Reviews.Content: The hotel is lovely with nice sized rooms and spacious bathrooms. The location is perfect for walking to the convention center for meetings or the opposite direction for seeing some of Boston's history. Newbury Street, Boston Commons, Beacon Hill, Faneuil Hall and the Hynes Convention Center are all within easy walking distance. The hotel feels like a boutique hotel and it was nice to be on the edge of the convention mob instead of in the midst of it which meant quieter nights and more intimate public places. Complimentary bottled water was a fabulous touch. A Panasonic CD/Radio system was great especially with a selection of discs to 'check-out' at the front desk. Our room did not have a coffee maker but what did that matter when they offered free Starbucks in the lobby! And there was a mini fridge with wide open shelves for your own purchased snacks. There's a grocery two blocks away and soda and snacks are easy to pick up at Walgreen's or CVS within walking distance. No over-priced mini-bar! The bathroom was stocked with Kiehl's toiletries. The towels were a bit stiff and rough but they were generously sized and there were lovely terry robes to cuddle up in after a shower. The only thing I did not like about the room was the 'Master Switch'. If you needed to use the bathroom in the middle of the nght you had to turn on the master switch in order to turn on the bathroom light. Unfortunately, this also turned on the ceiling light outside the bathroom which illuminated everything - not great for the person still trying to sleep. The concierges were friendly and helpful though when we inquired about a local sandwich shop, they had no idea where one was and spent quite a bit of time on the computer looking for one without success. We found Au Bon Pain only two blocks up Berkeley on Bolyston right next door to Starbucks. Ignoring the sandwich snafu, we would recommend The Back Bay Hotel to everyone and will definitely stay here next time we visit Boston or come for another convention!

Reviews.Title: “4 star to the core”
Reviews.Author: Kerrouez
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, lovely and clean rooms, helpful and pleasant staff at all times. Perfect location, will definitely make a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “it was nice stay in the middle of Boston”
Reviews.Author: ayusunny
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights for my spring break. Actually, a huge storm came during our stay. so we couldn't go sightseeing to the town. we were like stuck in the hotel all the time. a bar on the ground floor was cool and we had really good time there :)

Reviews.Title: “All Around Fabulous Stay at The Back Bay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: intlfoodtrvl
Reviews.Content: The Back Bay Hotel combines luxury and convenience at a moderate price. The front desk and restaurant staff are extremely friendly and accommodating, though be cautious with the doormen who are not quite as helpful. I asked one of the gentlemen to hail us a cab, at which he sighed in disgust and pointed to a taxi waiting at the end of the block. The rooms were modern and spotless, with huge marble bathrooms and Kiehls products. The beds were a bit hard for my liking, but I delighted in the daily turndown service that offered tasty mint chocolate squares. The lounge downstairs provided some late night satisfaction with its delicious Hummus Platter. The smooth, creamy chickpea puree was served with herbed feta chunks, kalamata olives, and toasted pita points. The gym was located in the basement and was rather small. However, it was clean and provided cups of water and reading material. Lastly, the hotel was in the heart of the city with easy access to restaurants and tourist attractions. I would definitely stay at the Back Bay Hotel on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hank1dog
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Back Bay Hotel which is located in the back bay area of Boston. This was a very nice hotel and the employees were friendly and helpful. This hotel is in a good location if you are interested in the back bay area. The room was clean and spacious with a large bathroom. Onsite valet parking was $39 but definately worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Rain, Rain, Rain”
Reviews.Author: HarrogateGb
Reviews.Content: First of all dont let the title of the review put you off this was nothing to do with the hotel more to do with the horrific weather we had. It rained and I mean rained. The hotel is excellent, reception and concierge staff very good, welcoming and the room was nice and spacious. Usual stuff such as LCD TV and mini bar to put your things in rather than paying the rip off prices from the mini bar. Bathroom huge with a massive seperate shower, they give you Kiehls toiletries which are excellent. The bed was excellent. All in all an excellent place to stay, would recomment it. Also try the restuarant across the street Grill 23 ?,steaks are good and so is the service.

Reviews.Title: “Uber Wonderful Hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: terrilarry
Reviews.Content: From the moment you are greeted at the door by the doorman you just feel like you're special. We have stayed in lots of "chain" hotels. This Doyle Collection hotel should be your home away from home in Boston. We can't wait to try out the Doyle Hotel in Washington. Every hotel should stride to be this excellent. The shower has a "mini me" (as pictured), shower rack is heated, towels are big & fluffy, bathroom amenties are Kiehl's. The coffee maker is Kuerig...nice. Fridge with free water. The food in the restaurants if not like hotel food...it's way beyond that.... I give this hotel 100%. Been there & going back!

Reviews.Title: “Service, Staff & Facilities way beyond expectations”
Reviews.Author: KKDeeMc
Reviews.Content: This is an extraordinary hotel. From the moment you arrive the staff are so welcoming and helpful - they are genuine and sincere and really want to do their best to make you enjoy your stay. The rooms are gorgeous with beautiful furnishings and well appointed bathrooms. Breakfast is fantastic - great buffet or choose from a la carte - again the staff are brilliant. Having stayed at many different hotels throughout America and Canada myself and my husband both felt we had found a real gem of a hotel. The bar had a good buzz to it in the evenings - it seems to be well frequented by locals. The hotel's location is really great, easy walking distance to Copley Square and the Prudential Shopping Mall. Lots of restaurants etc nearby. We know without doubt that we'll be staying at this hotel and will be recommending it to anyone we know who is looking for a hotel to stay in when visiting Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RGHH
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights in the Back Bay Hotel and would highly recommend it. The service was outstanding. All employees really went out of their way to make us feel welcomed and comfortable. The rooms are well appointed with the most comfortable bed I have ever slept on. You cannot beat the location, close to great restaurants and points of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable stay at the Back Bay”
Reviews.Author: xp01321
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights, and it was my second stay at the Back Bay in the past year. Although I was pleased last time, I am really impressed after my second stay. Arriving at the hotel after a transatlantic trip that left a lot to be desired, I was pleased to arrive at the hotel. However, it turned that I had been given the wrong room at check-in, so I was not exactly pleased when I walked into a room in which somebody was already staying. That said, I was very impressed with how the staff handled this situation. Hands down, this was the best customer service I have seen in a very long time. It was personal, caring and focused. The following day, I went to the concierge with some complex questions regarding something I wanted to get while in Boston, and together with the front office manager, they again exceeded my expectations. I can wholeheartedly recommend this hotel, and I think that more than a few of their competitors could benefit from a stay at the Back Bay Hotel. If nothing else, they would learn a thing or two about good service!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: travelbug61
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Back Bay Hotel for one night on a Priceline bid, and only wish I could've stayed for a week. The beautiful historic building used to be the Boston police headquarters, but inside it has been beautifully updated with modern decor. My standard room was compact in size, but so comfortable and luxurious. Both wired and wireless Internet service worked great. The bathroom was gleaming and immaculate. Best of all was the staff, who were all welcoming and helpful. I'd love to stay here again on future visits to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location, excellent service, great ambience”
Reviews.Author: DublinBrenda
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in the Back Bay Hotel on a recent trip to Boston and were very impressed with every aspect of our stay. The atmosphere throughout is one of comfort, character and quality. Our room was beautiful, and there is a great Irish bar downstairs. Each staff member that we encountered was professional, welcoming and helpful: The concierge went out of her way to help secure concert tickets when we were unable to make a booking online; there is an excellent valet parking service, and front desk and bar staff were exceptionally friendly. The location is terrific, and the hotel outstanding in every respect. We highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Like staying with family you like or really goods friends”
Reviews.Author: Daisymaise
Reviews.Content: The staff in this hotel really made this holiday. They were more than helpful. Nothing was too much trouble, good humoured and ready to have a laugh with us whenever we came into contact with them. Have recommended it everyone we have spoken to since our return to Ireland. Hope we get back to see them all soon.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: betsyg
Reviews.Content: This was my first time visiting The Back Bay Hotel. A friend and I planned a weekend in Boston and we stayed at the BBH for the Saturday (1 night), and we were pleasantly surprised. The BBH is the former Jury's Hotel. We were told that the Jury-Doyle group split up and some properties went to the Jury's and others to Doyle. The Boston location is a Doyle, so the name changed but the hotel is the same, The staff was very welcoming, and attentive. The hotel and room was very clean, and reasonably sized. The bed, linens, towels were all of good quality and comfort. I highly recommend this hotel for its location as well as facility. It is near the theater district, Copley shopping, Newbury Street (a short walk away) and many excellent restaurants! (The Grill 23 is right across the street.) Also the Mass Turnpike (RT90) is only a couple of blocks away, so it is an easy in-out to the highway. The BBH has a restaurant, which I visited for breakfast. They offer a breakfast menu, as well as a buffet. The food was fresh and very good. There is also a small coffee area for a light fare. The bar was quite the "happening" place on a Saturday night! I don't know what the weekend room rate would be, since we were able to book the room through Priceline (and paid a great rate.) I would highly recommend this hotel, and I hope to visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Unwind”
Reviews.Author: rrosen1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent a night at The Back Bay Hotel. We were extremely pleased with the ambiance, the rooms...loved the heated towels in the bathroom. The staff is professional, very pleasant, and truly appear to anxious to make our stay a very pleasant occasion. The hotel has all the luxury without being stuffy. I look forward to staying there again. RNR

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: AliHWatford
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four night break to Boston. This is not the first time we have been and not the first time in the Back Bay (formerley Jurys) The Rooms are spacious and the beds very comfortable, especially the sheets. The staff cannot do enough for you from Reception to Room Service. The concierge is so helpful and nothing is too much. It is a great location and the Bar (Cuffs) is quite buzzy and fun. You must go to Wrentham Outlets for real bargains you have to order the bus/taxi from the concierge it is well worth it at $42 dollars return.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice...”
Reviews.Author: kbiviano
Reviews.Content: My husband and I did a quick overnight in Boston and left the kiddos home with their grandparents. I got a steal on the room through priceline. $100/night, including taxes/fees. Great location. We were able to walk to our dinner at the Oak Room. The hotel is nice, very clean, staff is quite pleasant and helpful. The doorman was particularly kind and courteous. Room was nice, but small (to be expected though in an old building in an old city). Bed/linens/pillows were all quite comfy. They provide Kiehl's bath products in the bathroom, which I love. Only minor downsides: * the hologram backdrop in the elevator cabs does not make sense with the decor. It looks cheap and tacky, and I cannot for the life of me figure out who would ever have chosen that and why. * there are no towel hooks next to the shower. The bathroom in our room was long and narrow. The towel rack was at one end, the shower at the other. There were 2 hooks for the bathrobes, but even those were too far from the shower to be useful. * the clock was not digital. Obviously not a huge deal, but I found it annoying to wake up in the middle of the night and not being able to see what time it was. A couple tips: * parking at 10 St. James Ave. (entrance to the garage on Stuart St. as well) was $14/day on the weekends. * avoid the Stanhope Grill for breakfast. We ended up spending $50 for breakfast for two. Obscene in my opinion. A glass of orange juice was $4.50. I can buy a gallon of OJ for less than that.

Reviews.Title: “excellance at it's best.”
Reviews.Author: aqnnapoliscatski
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Boston and we were very impressed with the overall quality and service we got at this hotel. Our trip there was for a wedding and our son got married there at the hotel. Service and help staff were the best we have ever had. The bar/night life was outstanding and the restaurant was one of the highlights of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: SeeMikeWrite
Reviews.Content: We had a great weekend getaway at the Back Bay Hotel. It's located right in downtown (just off Copley Square), so it's perfect for getting anywhere in the city and is surrounded by great restaurants and shopping. The service at the hotel was excellent--they had a terrific staff that was completely accommodating of all our needs and ready to help right away. It's the sort of service you'd expect at a hotel that cost twice as much. The rooms were clean, modern, and spacious with nice amenities, as well.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: rjkaski
Reviews.Content: Everything you want in a hotel, Great location, friendly staff. clean, neat. Everything good is just a short walk or hop on the subway and be anywhere in Boston in minutes. Will be my first choice in Boston hands down.

Reviews.Title: “Decent price for very good location”
Reviews.Author: hereinbody
Reviews.Content: We stayed on a 3 nights for 2 package so was pretty good value. Hotel is in a great location. Comfortable room but nothing extraordinary. Did not eat at the hotel, but bar is nice. Can buy coffee/small breakfast from the upstairs bar if you're leaving early in the morning which is a nice touch. Staff were all very helpful. Good gym as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: 5manor
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3nights recently with my mum and aunt. Our stay started off by us being upgraded from a superior room to a deluxe room which was a lovely surprise. Room was perfectly adequate if a little on the small size altho the bathroom was huge! The staff in the hotel couldn't have been more helpful, anything we requested was dealt with very promptly. The concierge was also so helpful as were the doormen in the hotel! The location of this hotel couldn't have been better, is within walking distance to anything you'd need from restaurants to shopping!! Also the T station was within a 5minute walk frpm the hotel. Value for money in this hotel is second to none and I wouldn't hesitate staying here again or recommending this hotel to a friend!! All in all a great stay in a great hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Looking forward to going back!”
Reviews.Author: 1206irene
Reviews.Content: We- my husband and our 16 year old son- stayed here for 4 nights in October 08 and had a fabulous time. Going back this August - just us and I can't wait-staying 5 nights this time. Good to hear the hotel is still as good as it was!!

Reviews.Title: “The nicest hotel i've had the pleasure of staying in”
Reviews.Author: martiangirl198
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is really easy to find, on a quiet street in the Back Bay area, just a very short walk to all of the shops, bars and restaturants. The hotel itself was wonderful. The rooms were very plush, even with your own robe! Very very nice. The value for money of the Back Bay Hotel was outstanding. I would definately recommend the hotel and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Sandybeach67
Reviews.Content: Reception desk was extremely helpful. They arranged it so I was able to check in early. Rooms were decorated beautifully. Great location for Boston. Overall great ambiance, I would highly recommend this hotel. Appreciated the towel warmer

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ghcb1983
Reviews.Content: we decided to go to Boston for our annual vacation and we were not disapointed. Boston is a fantastic place and i highly recommend it - although perhaps not so much in the winter. we stayed at the Back Bay hotel and got a fantastic deal on it - the hotel was beauitful inside and out! our room was comfy, cozy and the location is fantastic - right in the theatre district! the staff were very friendly and the complimentary water was a nice touch! we were going to only stay one night but decided to stay 2 nights due to the location and the "home like" feeling! Highly recommended! Only negative thing i will say - and again - i may not be the best judge of this as I have only ran across this once - but the parking is a little pricey! if i had to pay full price for the room i would like to think parking would have been included. They have their own garage - week nights run about 39$ and weekend overnights run 20$ a shot! - kinda pricey! on a side note though - if you dont mind a short walk - the Boston Commons Gargage is only about 15 mins away and parking is much cheaper - weekends starting at $11 a night! - i think week days are 20$ which is still cheaper!!! :) All in all though it was a great trip and we will definatly consider this hotel again! :)

Reviews.Title: “no frills yet lovely hotel..”
Reviews.Author: apples99
Reviews.Content: We were in Boston during the Thanksigivng break stayed here. We loved the place, the rooms are a tad bit to smaller side, but it was lovely and cozy. Room service and housekeeping were excellent, but the walls could be a bit thicker. We were coming back from dinner, and could hear the shower run from the next room. Staff were great when we arrived on site, but we had called a couple of nights before we left to just confirm our reservation and the gentleman on the other side was rude. I guess he was busy and the front desk (assuming) was not staffed properly, but when we arrived there, the staff was great. My husband left his phone in the car, and it was brought upto us within minutes, and that being said, valet parking was expensive, and we're from NY. The location is just perfect, we would defintely stay here if and when we head out to Boston. And do try the Irish bar!

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jennyq7
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights on a 3 city trip to USA. This was the best hotel. The bed was very comfortable with quality bedding & pillows. The bathroom had nice toiletires & a curved shower curtain rail. The 2 bottles of water every day is a really thoughtful touch. The receptionist was friendly & helpful so were the men on the door. The concierge was helpful, friendly & easily approachable (which i cannot say about the hotel in New York we stayed in) when we asked him to telephone to check our airport transfer times he did it immediatlley with a smile. The lobby, bar & lounge were beautifully restored. The hotel has a designer interior with sculputures but is comfortable and inviting .We loved their large Christmas trees and decorations. Everyone was helpful & polite, especially a senior looking suited lady who took our photo by the fire. Our only grumble was the restaurant prices seemed high so we did not eat at the hotel. Maybe a speacial deal for hotel residents would have encouraged us to eat. (the menu had really tempting dishes on it). We would recommend this hotel and stay there again. It is convenient for all tourist sites. Boston is a clean city with interesting achitecture & lots of history. The duck tour was funny and gave a great insite to Boston. It must take a long while to put up all the christmas lights.

Reviews.Title: “From the Greeting at the Door, to the Chocolate on the Pillow, to the Espresso in the Room - Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Vasco_DeGama_20
Reviews.Content: Our family recently enjoyed a stay at The Back Bay Hotel in Boston, MA. We are a family of 5, one of whom (my oldest daughter) is in a wheelchair. We can't say enough good things about your hotel and especially the staff. Starting with Sean (and the rest of the door staff), to Ryan (and the front desk staff) the maid staff and Humberto and the dining room staff, all of them were fantastic. In addition to being very courteous, truly helpful and attentive, they have the right stuff when it comes to making a hotel stand out. My youngest, was especially thrilled with the night time chocolate (which your staff was incredibly generous in augmenting, hopefully we are not getting anyone in trouble) as were the adults with the espresso machine in the room. The hotel is a bit tight but manageable for a wheelchair user. Great location in Back Bay and easy walk to the Commons, Freedom Trail and other major sights.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended.”
Reviews.Author: ALFRED99
Reviews.Content: As usual my wife checked out the Back Bay Hotel (formerly Jury`s Hotel) before booking for four nights in November 2009. Warmly welcomed on our arrival, registration was efficient and we were quickly in our room. We had booked room only in a standard room which was a good size with plenty of wardrobe space and a well equipped shower/bathroom. Room was very clean with a good large and really comfortable bed with excellent pillows. The Hotel is well located close to the main street of Royalston where you quickly get your bearings for Copley Place, main shopping centres, the public gardens and beyond to Quincy Market and the harbour area. There is a cab rank within feet of the Hotel entrance. All of the staff were very friendly and helpful and on the few occasions we used room service for breakfast we were delighted by the speed, organisation and presentation of the refreshments. When eating out do try Durkin Park (Quincy Market) and The Cheesecake Factory (115 Huntington Avenue) for good inexpensive food and really interesting but different atmospheres. This was a return visit to Boston which remains a nice, compact and safe City to walk around and use the hop on hop off buses to get your bearings and see the sights at the wider locations. In the good weather months take the Duck Tour and see the city from the river. Overall a great stay in a delightful Hotel where our only criticisms would be the lack of Tea/Coffee making facilities in the room and rather inadequate double glazing which let traffic noise into the room. Everything else was of a very high standard with very friendly and professional staff. Our special thanks to Ryan (Night Concierge) who dealt most promptly and effectively with noisy people in the next room in the early hours of one morning. Finally we went on to New York by train and the station is just at the rear of the Back Bay Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL. HIGHLY RECOMMEND.”
Reviews.Author: poshcatlady
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one week from boxing day till 2nd jan 2010, and i cannot recommend it highly enough. The location is perfect, and the room was great. Housekeeping perfect, reception staff really helpful, especially Ryan who sorted out our transport to the airport which had not turned up as arranged. Would definately stay there again on our next trip to Boston. Brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: iano1550
Reviews.Content: Stayed with some friends in Feb 09 and had a wonderful time. Beautiful hotel and so well located, everything is nearby. Cuffs is a great bar and the buzz is great at the weekend. Check out Grill 23 next door

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: B1GDOUG1E
Reviews.Content: It's over a year since I stayed here, but I've just not been on Trip Advisor since to be honest. The Hotel was lovely and the staff very friendly - lots of info re shopping, night life and travel etc. The Room was big and it was honestly the most comfortable hotel bed I've ever slept in. The food was just excellent. We arrived quite late on our first night and we went straight to the hotel bar - I ordered a pint and some Buffalo Wings and the beloved had Buffalo Shrimp. Massive portions and very tasty. We paid extra for breakfast each mornign as we had booked on a bed only basis, but the food and staff were so good, we didn't mind the extra expense. We only had a proper sit down dinner in the hotel restaurant ( Satnhope Grill ) on our final night and it really was Beautiful. Cuffs bar seemed to be the hot spot on a Saturday night, when I went outside there was a huge queue to get in. It's a nice bar, but it's not a wonderbar - see what I did there? Boston on the whole seems to be quite laid back though - it was very hard to get a drink after 1 am and even the more raucous student bars were a bit subdued. I had a very relaxing time though and the hotel definitely helped. It's an excellent city and I felt safe walking around at 4 am to be honest. It's in a nice area with loads of restaurants and shops very close by. My girlfriend had arranged the trip for my birthday and when the hotel learned this, they sent up a complimentary bottle of champagne to my room. Upon seeing my ID in the hotel bar the Barman also set me up with a round, as it was my birthday. Overall, I loved this hotel and we're trying to arrange a trip back next year.

Reviews.Title: “OUtstanding!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTraveler
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this hotel! The staff is lovely, the rooms are well done and (most important to me) unbelievably clean and well maintained. Not one detail has been overlooked in the fabulous restoration of this former police station. My daughter hopes to go to college in Boston and if she does, we're staying here whenever we visit her.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RanaC18
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Back Bay hotel: Excellent location, walking distance from the shopping area and the Boston park. Excellent service, the staff were very helpful and welcoming. The rooms are perfect, big, very comfortable beds, with all amenities and an Espresso machine!. Free internet connection. Plus we paid a very reasonable price. I encourage you to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel with superb location”
Reviews.Author: linnyb04
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights at The Back Bay Hotel and were very impressed. From the moment we left our car with valet parking until we check out at the front desk, every staff member we encounted went above and beyond to be not only pleasant but extremely helpful. A fantastic location for all of the sight seeing, shopping and eating that Boston has to offer. We had breakfast daily in the restaurant and the selection and preparation of the buffet is outstanding. We had dinner there our first night and were very pleased. We even ate one evening in the bar and were impressed by the extensive bar menu. Would highly recommend a quick meal there after a day of sight seeing or shopping. The room was cozy with excellent high speed internet connection - free to boot! The bedding was luxurious and stocking the frig with free bottled water daily was a nice and welcomed touch. The bath was spacious and well equiped. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will defintely return when we are again in Boston. Although every staff member we encountered was outstanding; Jaime, a waiter, was so superior that I feel that it is necessary to mention him by name. A real asset to The Bay Bay Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Dazzling Experience!”
Reviews.Author: BrittyBearBoston
Reviews.Content: Although I am new to tripadvisor, I am an avid traveler. I've been around the world and back and I have seen all the amazing places of the world. I actually used trip advisor to help me pick a hotel in Boston's Back Bay area since so many seemed wonderful. The reviews on this hotel sold me, so now I feel it's my duty to do what I can to show my appreciation for this gem of a hotel. I returned earlier this afternoon from the Back Bay Hotel after spending a long weekend in Boston. Let me just say that the hotel and every single aspect lived up to what I expected from reading the reviews. I picked up my friend from the airport and we arrived to the hotel before noon. We drove up and instantly were greeted with friendly service. The valet attendants were pleasent and very accomidating. They unloaded all of our bags for us and then when we went in to the front desk. They had available a room on the third floor, but asked if we would consider going out for lunch and allowing them to prepare us a room on the top floor. They offered us a beverage and to store our bags. We went out to lunch at "Souper salad" and then received a call maybe thirty minutes later, letting us know our room was now ready. We returned to the hotel, checked in and then proceeded up to our room. The bell boy brought our bags up right behind us. The hotel appearance was beautiful. The bar and restaurant were on the bottom floor and taking the glass staircase with the waterfall up to the main lobby with the beautiful chandeliers and vintage furtniture...fabulous! We had a standard room with two double beds and a fabulous view! The beds were extremely lush and comfortable. There was a desk and comfortable chair for all the work on my laptop. We had a mini fridge, flat screen television, as well as TWO closets. You almost never find that in a hotel. I must also note their was a safe in one of the closets, very convenient especially if you're traveling with lots of cash and electronics. Also they offer complimentary wireless which in this day and age is always a plus! The bathroom was lovely, encased in marble. The vanity was large and with a granite counter top, the towels were soft and fluffy and there was a towel heater...great for the winter. I also must note the excellent rainfall shower head and the fabulous smelling shampoos, lotions, and soaps they provided. We did not partake in room service, however we did eat at the restaurant one night, The Stanhope Grille. I had the filet and it was excellent. They also brought a complimentary hors d'oeuvres over to us. The service was superb! We did not take in the bar either, not our scene but it seemed lively. I did wonder if it would make our room noisy, however we didn't hear a thing. No loud music from the bar, no street noise from the bussling street below, just peace and quiet. When we left each day, the maids came in and made up the room. No complaints whatsoever, they did a fine job. They made the beds, replenished the water (2 free bottles per day), fresh towels, fresh toiletries, and all that jazz. We did the valet parking, $39 dollars per day BUT with unlimited in/out priviledges and speedy service. It's comparable to any place in Boston and well worth it. I would note names of those who were particularly helpful, but I find it unneccessary seeing as everyone we encountered was just above and beyond accomidating. The concierge was such a help and the front desk staff was equally wonderful! Everything about this hotel makes it top notch, but the location is out of this world. It seems as though everything is within walking distance and for those things not within walking distance, the Arlington T station was right around the corner. We used it once to visit and see Fenway Park and Hynes convention center. We went on a one mile walk and saw the Boston Common, Cheers bar, and then Park Plaza for shopping and dinner. Newbury street is just two blocks away and their are restaurants and more shopping in the vicinity, absolutely amazing location. Some suggestions for dining: 1) Legal Seafoods (Park Plaza) 2) Smith and Wollenskys Steak House (Arlington Street) 3) Fire and Ice - Sunday Brunch (Stuart Street) So overall, my experience was just sheer perfection. I truly can not wait to return for another lavish getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: DeeDublin
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Jurys/Back Bay hotel and I would recommend it to anybody visiting Boston. The hotel is very welcome as are the staff. We had our breakfast twice in the hotel and it was worth every penny plenty to choose from and all very fresh and hot. The rooms where huge big enough for all of us and our shopping. The beds were the best they were so comfortable perfect for relaxing after a day of walking. The hotel is located to all the main shopping areas which are in easy walking distance, with Fileneâ€™s basement and Marshalls less then a 5 minute walk away. We decided to take a trip out to the Cambridge Mall which is worth a day trip out. The train station is about a 5 min walk from the hotel and that will bring you straight to the Mall. Having a good and nice hotel makes your holiday all that better and the Back Bay hotel ticks all the boxes. Just hope on my next visit they have put in a tea and coffee maker in all the rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, wonderful hotel and city”
Reviews.Author: KPDiggit
Reviews.Content: We spent a wonderful 4 nights at the Back Bay Hotel. The staff were always warm and friendly, even going so far as to rescue me when I needed a chocolate fix late at night! The bedroom was elegant and stylish with a large bathroom stocked with great Korres goodies. The down stairs bar Cuffs was vibrant and cheery. We had cocktails there and a great burger on our first night. We were on a mission to sample Boston's many culinary delights. Would recommend Myers & Chang for fun. informal but excellent Chinese fusion food; fantastic and excellent value lunch ($20) at The Top of the Hub with staggering views and breakfast/brunch at Zaftigs- amazing, great choice and a real authentic american experience. It's not far on the T. At Grill 23 we watched the Boston glitteratti and emptied our wallets. It was an experience but very exspensive and not sure the food was worth the $, wine a rip. Had a good lobster and great service at Boston's Legal Sea Food restaurant near the hotel.For a real American diner experience the Pour House on Boylston Street was fun and good value. All in all a wonderful long weekend in a great city. The hotel helped make the stay a perfect way to celebrate my 50th!

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming hotel”
Reviews.Author: compassreaders
Reviews.Content: Centrally located hotel, particularly for the best shopping in Boston, the Prudential Centre, the start of the fun Duck Tours and Back Bay Station for the metro and easy access to the airport. We were very pleased with our room and bathroom. Our room was on the eighth floor with marvellous views over the city towards the sea and colourful sunrises. The hotel has spacious comfortable lounges, and free internet access on the computers at the back of the lounges. The staff were all exceptionally helpful and welcoming. We are returning to Boston next summer, and will be happy to stay at the Back Bay Hotel again. We spent our first evening in the hotel's bistro but thought the food was not as good as we were hoping to have. Other evenings we dined at Lucca's, Hanover Street, North End. The food and wine was very expensive, but the meals were amazingly good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and staff, a real treat”
Reviews.Author: Beckgrove_massive
Reviews.Content: I chose the hotel as part of a surprise 30th birthday present for my girlfriend. We stayed for 5 nights and have both agreed that it is the best city trip we have ever experienced. We wanted a really special memorable trip and the Back Bay definitely delivered. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful - nothing was too much trouble. We made use of the concierge to make dinner reservations, had room service and when asked where we could pick up a range of toiletries reception were happy to supply them complimentary and deliver them to the room. The rooms were immaculate and spacious - the beds are enormous! Cuffs bar downstairs is contemporary, the service is excellent without being invasive and the food is great. In terms of location, The Back Bay is really central - in walking distance of Boston Common, The Prudential, many excellent restaurants and Newbury Street for shopping. I would definitely recommend this hotel to couples looking to explore the city whilst enjoying a real treat in the process.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mrsmop
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights, travelled up from New York by train, easy few minutes walk from station to hotel, at the end of our stay we were picking up a hire car from Avis which again was located just round the corner and could easily wheel our cases, no need to get a cab. On arrival our room wasnt ready but were able to leave our bags, the concierge provided us with a map and suggested where we should head for, recommending Newberry Street, which was a delight, restaurants, cafes, bars and designer shopping. Close to Boston Common, visited the Cheers bar. Following day headed for Quincy Market and did a City Tour. Hotel is also close to Copley Square, plenty of places to eat and drink. It was great to return to the hotel and find Cuffs bar, open and full of life, so often when staying at a hotel the bar is empty or closed, a great end to a day. The rooms are of reasonable size, the shower was enormous (no bath, but dont use a bath so really not bothered, would have been nice to have had a coffee maker in the room, was told they are only in deluxe rooms. Would definitely recommend this hotel and if I ever returned to Boston would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Would definetly recommend”
Reviews.Author: savannahDublin
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Back Bay for 2 nights with our teenage family , for a mid-term break before driving to Cape Cod and a last night in Salem. Boston was an easy city to get around as a tourist. Our family could not recommend the Back Bay Hotel highly enough. The location is excellent and we it is definetly of 4 star level if not higher. Check-in smooth. Rooms exactly as we had reserved. Bathrooms huge. Beds comfortable. Turn down service greatly appreciated at the end of a long day walking around city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; room a little stuffy and pricey”
Reviews.Author: Pavlich
Reviews.Content: Boston is an expensive place to stay. We probably got a pretty good rate at the Back Bay Hotel (about $240 per night). But it still seemed a lot for what we got - room was nicely appointed, service was excellent, but room felt a little stuffy as if it hadn't had fresh air for a while. Location is great - could walk to everything we wanted to visit, such as Boston Common and the Freedom Trail. Restaurant was surprsingly good. All up, not bad, would stay again if we got a better rate.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect end to our vacation”
Reviews.Author: HFTSM
Reviews.Content: I booked in advance directly through the hotel website and got a great deal. The hotel is beautiful and in a great location. Great selection of restaurants within walking distance. One day it never stopped raining, but such a nice room we didn't mind hanging out at the hotel. Enjoyed breakfast in their restaurant. Everyone was very nice and helpful. Loved Boston and if we return will stay at The Back Bay Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant choice”
Reviews.Author: marpel
Reviews.Content: Booked directly with hotel and got a great deal 3 nights for price of 2. Cannot fault this hotel - great quick breakfast option in relaxed surroundings. Great rooms. Bar brilliant. Food options excellent - staff could not do enough to help - even loaned us an umbrella as it started to rain when we left the hotel. Easy access to the T. Easy walking into city. Would definitely stay here again. quality hotel at a reasonable price

Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: DWM64
Reviews.Content: We had 4 nights at Back Bay, and found the staff really friendly and helpful, the rooms comfortable , really well equipped, and cleaned to a very high standard. Beds were lovely, bathroom well appointed. The only thing was the drawers had minds of their own and didn't close. Restaurant served good food, both breakfast and dinner. Cuffs bar was very lively and entertaining. Not the best location, nor the cheapest, but if we return to Boston we'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yoko75
Reviews.Content: Great location, great room, great service. Everybody was so nice at all times. The girl at reception, Natalie, looked after us very well. We got some great recommendations from the concierge desk on things to do and see. The location is perfect, within walking distance of all the main attractions. Never had to take public transport. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who goes to Boston

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: m757
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. Priced right, beautiful room, warm, helpful people, and a great location in the Back Bay. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “watch your bill”
Reviews.Author: dragonrn67
Reviews.Content: Was charged $175.00 for smoking charges. Had to fight tooth and nail for removal, said they were, removed, only to then be charged again a few days later. Rooms small. Cuffs, bar downstairs lovely, but pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Back Bay Boston”
Reviews.Author: aussiejackScotland
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights stay at The Back Bay Hotel in Boston. A lovely hotel in a great area close walking distance to shops, restaurants and places of interest. The people of Boston were very friendly and helpful and took time out to help whenever we stopped to ask for directions. Found a lovely little restaurant recommended by a local called "CODA" on Columbus Avenue at the corner of Dartmouth well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in the heart of Boston”
Reviews.Author: Waveydaveygavey
Reviews.Content: Stayed with family for two nights. Staff were fantasic, could t be more helpful. Great location for Newbury street and only ten minutes walk from the common / part. Hotel retains a personal feel missing from many of the corporate hotels. Am returning to Boston at the end of the week and will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for exploration!”
Reviews.Author: star_one
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at the Back Bay Hotel. Beautiful building converted into a great hotel from the original Boston Police Headquarters. Excellent location for exploring historic Boston on foot and close to 'the T' stop. Comfortable, modern decor with relaxed atmosphere. Check in was swift and room was clean and cosy with spacious bathroom and walk-in shower. My only concern is there were no coffee/tea making facilities in the room (Starbucks could be purchased downstairs in the obligatory throwaway cups!). Take time out to check out the Paramount Cafe for breakfast, Houston's for supper and the Liberty Hotel for cocktails! The Prudential Tower offers extraordinary views of the City - great value for money and really interesting audio tour. Boston Trolley Tours (the orange one) offers an up-close and personal quirky guided tour where you can hop on and off at your leisure. GREAT city - would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest value for money hotels I've stayed at (and that's not to say it's budget).”
Reviews.Author: Steinbeck1805
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 4 nights in October on a leisure trip. I booked through their website, for an average of 250pn excl tax for a deluxe room. Check In was actually a slightly protracted affair and there weren't enough hot towels at reception for all of us. It doesn't matter so much to me, but it is one of the signs that the Back Bay is not the utmost in luxury. That said, everything does have an upscale feel and if you take the check in as a negative point, it only got better. The room was comfortable with views onto the streets. The king bed was making me want to linger on it forever. The bathroom was clean and had nice toiletries as well as bathrobes that I wish I cut have squeezed into my suitcase. What else - complimentary wifi worked hassle-free. Staff, including Concierge, were were friendly and even more helpful. Room service prompt, with some simple items such as hot water (for our own tea) brought without any charge. It's hard to point anything in particular, since everything was just as it should be, entirely uncomplicated. We also tried the Stanhope Grill, twice for breakfast, once for dinner. We chose from the buffett, where everything was fresh and of high quality, but the choice may indeed be larger at "true" luxury hotels. But dinner was the real smacker - the restaurant is overlooked like so many of its hotel peers and it shouldn't be. The room wasn't full, not helping the atmosphere, but our waiter, drawn from an old English movie apparently, more than made up for it.
