But the food was the real highlight - I had, among others, the Filet Mignon and rarely if ever have I eaten a better steak (neither in the UK, nor US). Sides were equally excellent. I frankly didn't expect this. Ok, any negatives? Well, not many. The hotel seems to have just to guest lifts, which only was a problem when one day one of the staff lifts broke down. It was more an annoyance to them than to us. And once I got a flippant answer on the room service. But that's already it. So, if you want a very comfortable hotel for both business (I quickly peeked into the conference area) and leisure without wanting to pay for staff standing 3m apart without further business than wishing you good night, than this is it. I'm normally not inclined to give an "excellent" since doing very well what you promised you would do is already an accomplishment many fail to deliver. The Back Bay is a very good hotel and the reason I gave 5 points is not that its service is unique - I had comparable service and attention to detail at other hotels - but rarely without paying a lot more for it.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: symoncurtis
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel due to the reviews on this forum and i have to say i am very pleased we did. OK it may be a bit pricey but i do believe you get value for money and the location is great being only a short walk from many major areas like the Prudential Centre, Boston Common, Newbury Street and countless bars and restaurants. We were given an exceptional welcome on arrival and the front desk staff couldn't do enough for us. The room itself was a good size, very clean, very comfortable and very quiet. Lots of nice extras were in the room too like a safe and an ironing board and iron which were nice touches and very useful. Strangely though no tea/coffee making facility? The only downside to the room was the lighting which was quite poor and the switches seemed to operate the lights in a very peculiar way meaning the bathroom light wouldnt go on unless the main light was on?? Still, a minor niggle all things considered. We used room service once for breakfast and everything arrived as ordered and on time though it could have been a bit hotter. Oh and we got a complimentary newspaper each morning sent to the room too. Nice. The public areas of the Hotel are modern, clean and welcoming. There is a nice bright and airy lounge area to sit and read the papers if you like and a very handy little area with two computers to access the internet which was great for checking up on areas to visit , booking tour tickets etc. We had breakfast once in the hotels Stanhope Grill Restaurant. Very good service again and a very nice meal but again on the pricey side at $60 for two people! There is also a bar called Cuffs where we had a meal the night we arrived. The food was excellent and the service great. This was more reasonably priced too considering the portion sizes which were excellent. The drinks though were again very expensive. One other thing to note about the bar though is it could quite possibly be the loudest place on Earth, even when only half full! One other thing to note from a financial point of view when budgeting for your stay, there are three taxes to add on to the room rate which will add between $35 - $40 dollars per night. So if you were staying for a week this could really mount up. Overall, an excellent place to stay. Great location, great staff and great rooms and we would definetely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: LindsayLu
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 2 nights at the Back Bay Hotel 10/16/09 - 10/18. I think this might be my favorite hotel that we've ever stayed at. The room, service, location, food, were all fantastic! Room Service was really quick! We ordered breakfast to our room and it was DELICIOUS. Try the french toast - you won't regret it! Everything about this hotel was just perfect, I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “one of the best in Boston”
Reviews.Author: dodici12
Reviews.Content: I have to say, I've been to a number of hotels, and this one was great- Lovely lounge/restaurant on main floor, very new and clean, staff very attentive, a refrigerator, make up mirror and safe in the room. Two blocks to the T. Certainly will stay here again. Only con- breakfast not included, but they do offer both cold and hot breakfast for purchase.

Reviews.Title: “From the eyes of a Travel Consultant”
Reviews.Author: pmpctc
Reviews.Content: My hsband and another couple stayed here on the 4th of July 2006 it was the best hotel I had been to. The food was great, The Pub was like you were in Ireland the bartenders were all Irish and had a great way of making you want to stay there to drink. The locals go to the pub, we could get into the bar after 6pm for all the Bostonians.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: eneia01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Back Bay Hotel (formerly Jury's Inn) in Boston for one night in September. It was not cheap, but was a wonderful stay. The room was beautifully appointed. A large entranceway with huge wardrobe had a door off it to the (very large) bathroom which had a large sink and worksurface with a large, walk-in shower (large enough for 2 people). The room had a wealth of storage space and a big, super-comfortable bed. Our room did have views, on the 8th floor and we had a lovely stay. When we arrived the room which had been set aside for us (on the 8th floor with views) wasnt ready but we had the option of a larger room without views on the 7th floor. Preferring views we left our bags with the bellboy and went out into the city for the afternoon, returning later to checkin. The bellboy brought our bags to the room and insisted on putting mine on the suitcase stand so that I didnt have to lift it. We didnt use the bar (it was very very busy) but we did use the (free) internet on the PCs in the lounge area. This was a nice touch as normally you have to pay for internet connection. The concierge was also very helpful. The location was good. We are happy to walk most places anyway but we happily did the freedom trail and walked down to Little Italy and back at night; this took about 20 minutes on foot. For people who aren't willing to walk, there's a taxi rank to the side of the hotel. A great hotel, not the cheapest in the area but in a great location and a very comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, exceptional staff, great location.”
Reviews.Author: ybme21
Reviews.Content: Centrally located in the heart of Back Bay, wonderfully appointed and comfortable rooms. The staff is friendly, courteous and very helpful. The restaurant and bar is excellent. We are looking forward to a return visit. The Donnelly's, York, Maine

Reviews.Title: “Great attitude--nice facility!”
Reviews.Author: Giveypup
Reviews.Content: So, I think the true test of a hotel or restaurant, etc., is the attitude and aptitude with which the establishment resolves problems. We had successive problems with a non-working heater in the room and a noisy exposure to Dartmouth street and across from two elevators (despite our request, in writing, for a quiet room). Swiftly, and with some compensation, our heater was fixed upon the engineer arriving the next morning, and then we were moved when mgmnt. agreed that we, indeed, had been given one of the noiser rooms despite our noted request for a quiet room. Additionally, Kamid (gosh, I think I may be crucifying his name, but he functions as the concierge and answered the phone at the front desk, too, I believe) was a doll--he was so helpful with every inquiry and request--the Amtrak schedule to and from Providence and getting a remote for me for the TV in the exercise room as well as calling engineering, again, to up the temperature in the fitness room since you could see your breath (sort of) when you exhaled; it was so cold down there. Cesar and Maria, both in managerial positions, were both so helpful about the problems we were having--really very 4 Seasons in their approach--the willingness to take care of things and without any attitude that has become fairly common in the service industry. The room service food was very good--the lobster bisque was good, and the pulled pork sandwich was excellent, twice, with no grizzle. We had a mess-up with the yummy coffee bean gelato dessert, and room service rectified it by sending another one, without charging. My exclusive criticism of the hotel would be to somehow make the room phone connect to the different entities--housekeeping, room service, concierge--without having to bother the nice folks at the front desk. Oh, yes, and voicemail retrieval is a bit of a convoluted bother. Finally, I appreciate the free Wi-Fi, and the location is excellent--walking distance to trendy Newbury street and easy access to Amtrak and the "T." We will return.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem of a hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Dunzy
Reviews.Content: Five of us travelled from Ireland to Boston for the U2 show in september.Having stayed in this hotel 3 times previously i had no hesitation in making it our number 1 choice for our stay.We managed to get a great deal on price by booking directly with the hotel's website.They had a deal stay 3 nights pay for 2. We stayed a total of 4 nights and had a great time.All of the staff members we encountered were very helpful and courteous.The staff in the hotel restaurant where we ate our breakfast each day were simply fantastic.I could go on but it's already been covered in the many previous reviews. If you're after a great hotel with good service and convenient location then the Back Bay is for you.I've already booked a return visit for November !

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel for visit to Boston”
Reviews.Author: ianlpaterson
Reviews.Content: Very stylish hotel sited in Back Bay area of Boston. Ideal for walking or trolley tours of Boston and Cambridge areas. Comfortable and quiet rooms in the heart of the city. Gym and restaurant facilities available. Whilst in Boston consider visit to JFK museum/library. Visit North End for Italian food feast.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance with a warm, personal touch and attention to all the details...”
Reviews.Author: Sorsana
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in very few hotels that I would rate as highly as this one, The staff here from doorman to front desk, from bellman to maintenance and housekeeping staff all treat me as if each were my personal concierge. By the same token never do I feel I am being toadied to nor is there a hand out waiting for the next tip. The restaurant is superb, room amenties include personal espresso maker, bottled water, newspaper, wireless internet--all at no extra charge and the room rates themselves are as good if not better than any of the other the other big hotels in the area while the atmosphere is that of the best boutique hotels.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: eleemd1
Reviews.Content: Great location in Boston, walking distance to T stops, Large rooms with huge bathrooms, totally posh and upscale, great service, good breakfast buffet

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel- thin walls...”
Reviews.Author: TakeahikeMaine
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Boston Back Bay hotel with a friend on a Friday night while we were in town for a concert. Upon arriving at the Boston Back Bay, we were greeted by the doorman offering assistance with our bags. We had carried them from the parking garage already, so we declined. We were then directed to the front desk. The lobby is very nice- a bit loud, though, from the bar downstairs. I check us in and was offered a warm towel to clean up with- again, I delcined (figured I could do that in my room...). The room was well appointed- lights were on and everything looked welcoming. We freshened up and left for the evening. The young men in the lobby were happy to help us with directions to the "T" and to the Hosue of Blues. While we were gone there was turn down service- the room was nicely lit, the radio playing (a rock station, which I found funny), and chocolates on our pillows. The bed was comfortable, with a nice, warm down comforter. The only problem we had, really, was with other guests and "thin walls". At about 2:30am we were awakened to drunken yelling in the hall that lasted a while. I was just too tired to move and figured someone else would call the front desk. Then, at about 7:30 in the morning we heard either room service or housecleaners knocking on the doors and were, again, woken. If not for the noise we would have really enjoyed a great night's sleep. The bathroom was nicely appointed with toiletries and wonderful thick robes. There were slippers in the closet, as well. The separate bath and two-headed shower were a great addition to the large bathroom. Also- there was a hair dryer (not the tiny hotel kind- a real hair dryer). We enjoyed the breakfast buffet. Made to order waffles were yummy! Sweet and warm, mmmmmm. Checkout was easy and the bill was correct.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: Colo01
Reviews.Content: I arrived in Boston on a Friday night and took a taxi from Logan Airport to the hotel ($24.00 Fare + $6.00 Tip). I booked the "pay for two nights get one free" rate. This came out to about $135.00 a night. This is a GREAT PRICE for such a high quality hotel in downtown Boston. Check in went smooth and front desk was helpful with restaurants. Room on 9th floor had a eastern view. Room and bathroom was clean and well kept up. Bed was comfortable and hotel was quite. The two bottles of free water daily was also appreciated.Overall stay was excellent. Restaurant downstairs was priced accordingly for Boston. Breakfast was about $15.00 per person. Did not find a lot of cheap choices for breakfast other than fast food around the hotel. I do have to admit, I didn't look too hard. The hotel is only two blocks away from shopping and restaurants on Newbury Street. and four blocks from Boston Commons.There is a little walking involved if you want to explore the North End or walk the Freedom Trail. If you are in descent shape I would say you would be OK. There is plenty of transportation option available for those who do not want to walk. I highly recommend that you DO NOT rent a car. There is a Hertz Rental Car center three blocks away. We did pick up a car there the day we left Boston. I did walked back to hotel from North End one night about 10:00 PM. Never felt unsafe. Overall this is a great hotel with a great staff and I would highly to recommend this hotel to all. There is one thing that I didn't get at the hotel that I read about. Was the warm towels at check-in. Maybe next time.

Reviews.Title: “More than adequate for the price!!!”
Reviews.Author: SuePhoenix
Reviews.Content: I can't find a thing wrong with the Back Bay Hotel, other than our room had a lousy view, but we weren't in the room long enough for that to be an issue. The hotel is a five minute walk to the Arlington subway station, a five minute walk to the Boston Common, walking distance to Fenway Park. The room was very clean and the beds were very comfortable. The lobby is very nice, and there are restaurants on premises. Valet parking was $35 for one night. But the room was only $158 (before the Taxachusetts taxes), which is a screaming deal for the city of Boston. Other reviews said they had problems with the A/C shutting off once they went to sleep, but it seemed to me the unit was on all night. We weren't able to "set" the temperature to a specific number. It seems programmed for the room to be at 2l.5C (which we think is about 72F), which was very comfortable. We would most definately recommend this hotel and return ourselves.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: North York Moors National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I've ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: ditsydaisy2010
Reviews.Content: We visited Boston in October when it was Jurys doyle. We went then to see the Fall Foliage. From our initial checking in, the staff were extremely pleasant and helpful. The hotel lobby is lovely and homely. The Cuffs bar is in the hotel near the lobby which we frequented for meals, drinks and coffee. Good place to meet for a drink prior to going out. It was busy with office workers on a Friday and Saturday evening and had a great buzz to it. The room we had was spacious and had a turndown service each evening which was a nice touch. The bathroom was really big and had luxury toiletries which were topped up each day. Also there was a mini fridge which was topped up with two bottles of water each day. Room service was friendly and efficient. One and only downside was that we had a room for four and there were only two bathrobes. Although we had fun fighting over them each day. (In hindsight, we could have asked for two more and I'm sure they would have provided them). Staff in the hotel helpful when organising trips and locating attractions in the area. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Would I stay again?...... most definitely”
Reviews.Author: ROb49Swansea_Wales
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed for 7 nights. On arrival the receptionist was very friendly offering us hot towels and once checked in gave us a street map of Boston and explained where the hotel was in relation to the rest of Boston. We had a standard room which was clean and comfortable the bed was extremely comfortable. The only criticism of the room was it lacked more natural light and although it was a standard room coffee making facilty would have been nice. Bath robes, nice touch. On two occaisions we ate in the Stanhope Grill the first occaision was a nice experience the waiter made us feel as if we were regulars, the level of service and food we could not fault, however the second occaision the level of service was poor. Cuffs was very pleasant. On the whole the staff were extremely helpful and courteous. Would i stay again, most definitely.

Reviews.Title: “An absolutely brilliant hotel with great staff and a perfect location in Boston”
Reviews.Author: NICruiser
Reviews.Content: My wife and I needed a good hotel in Boston to spend a night prior to our cruise on Royal Caribbean's Jewel of the Seas. We chose the Back Bay Hotel based on it's location and after reading several reviews of it and researching it on the internet. We found an absolute jewel. It's the old Boston Police Headquarters and is a beautifully restored and renovated old marble building. When we arrived tired and hungry after our transatlantic flight, we were checked in and in our room in about 15 minutes - no fuss, just great service. We were thinking of taking a tour of Boston, but at 6:00pm we decided just to have some food in the hotel and get a good night's sleep. Cuffs bar, the one in the hotel, is superb - a genuinely well presented "Irish" bar - not one of these tacky 'themed' affairs. The staff here were great and we had food from their extensive bar-menu. The hotel has a restaurant as well, but we didn't want that level of formality - just some good food. Well, what can I say; the food was absolutely delicious - just a burger and fries but well prepared, presented and full of flavour. Just what we needed. We had a couple more drinks and retired to our room. The rooms a re good sized and beautifully appointed with one of the best en-suite bathrooms I've seen ever. The bed was huge and extremely comfortable whilst all the other amenities were just excellent - especially the huge flat-screen TV and Hi-FI system. After a good nights sleep, we woke, showered (great power-shower in our room) and, since it was only 7:00am, decided to go for a walk to see the local area. The sun was shining, it was lovely and warm and Boston was just waking up. We found a small diner serving breakfast and simply people-watched until the shops opened at 9:00am when we walked for what seemed to be miles shopping and sight-seeing as we meandered back to our hotel. Check-out was quick, efficient and the young lady even made change from $100 for me as I had run out of small notes. All in all, an excellent hotel and extremely good value for money. This is the perfect place for anyone wanting to stay in Boston either for a stop-over or a longer vacation. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, friendly staff, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: lanceB2
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel right in the middle of Back Bay. It was within walking distance to a lot of great touristy stuff as well as to a train station. The room was clean. It has free wireless Internet service. The staff was friendly. They also had a great special on their website where you can buy two nights and get the third night free. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to visit Boston.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a good location!”
Reviews.Author: larrchar
Reviews.Content: The staff of this hotel could not be nicer. The room was very nice and quiet. The cocktail lounge on the lower level is a hot spot. Stop by. At this time we do not recommend the restaurant. Both our dinner and breakfast were a disappointment; poor service and only fair food. Stay here; eat somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but hotel and staff seemed tired”
Reviews.Author: kermit1Cornwall
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as it had rave reviews but we were a bit disappointed. The rooms we had was in need of an update and repair although the bathroom was great. The staff seemed tired and disinterested - a couple of requests were not responded too. We expected more from a hotel of this 'quality'.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ali1964
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Back Bay Hotel for 3 nights. Friendly and efficient receptionist who offered us hot towels, gave us a map of Boston, and recommendations on where to shop and eat. Our room was a deluxe room with a coffee machine, comfortable bathrobes, bottled water everyday and a walk-in shower (no bath but the shower made up for this). The toiletries provided were of a high quality. Breakfast was very good - especially omelettes which were made to order. The only niggle we had was that the wi-fi access was very intermittent in our room. When (not if) we visit Boston again, we will use this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boston Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CumbriaLakewolf
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel as it was a great bargain on Expedia so wasn't expecting a lot but we got first class quality and service and would thoroughly recommend it for visiting Boston. Good location and only two blocks away from the T underground and Copley Square where you can join the hop on hop off bus tour of the City. Also only three blocks from Boston Common park. Bar has great beers and bar meals. Bonus free internet in the business centre. Didn't use the restaurant but had a great value three course meal next door at the Laurel Bar. Hotel staff very helpful and great service. Breakfast was a good buffet or alternatively you can get coffee and cake/breakfast sandwich in the lobby bar. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a few days in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Magswithbags
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel based on previous reviews for our 10th wedding anniversary trip to Boston and was not dissappointed. Great location for exploring Boston. beautiful building and very well converted from its previous use as Police HQ. rooms and beds clean and comfy but what impressed us most was genuine helpfulness of staff particularly reception staff. I stay in a lot of hotels and its such a key thing to get right. Even though a double room was not available the first night we were given the option to change the following night which we did (it was our anniversay!) This was handled very efficiently by reception staff. The only negative thing was we did think breakfast was expensive in the hotel but we dinner in the bar and no complaints with that. Thanks for the recommendation for SkipJacks. Food was excellent and thats coming from 2 real seafood and fish lovers.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay in Boston.”
Reviews.Author: member_england
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Back Bay hotel for the first time, I have been to Boston on many occasions and usually stay at the Sheraton, which is very well located next to the Prudential Centre, but this time it was full. I can't say enough good things about this hotel, the rooms were lovely, good air conditioning, nice bathrooms, comfortable beds. First hotel I've stayed in that gives complimentary bottles of water in your room every day, a simple but really nice touch. Also, a fridge that you could actually use that wasn't stuffed with over priced mini-bar rubbish, even a decent hairdryter. We found all of the staff to be friendly, welcoming, not over pushy, when checking in I asked for a room with bath and shower and they made sure I got one. Even liked the hotel restaurant, fantastic breakfast and not over priced. Don't think I'll be going back to the Sheraton and would certainly try some of the other hotels in this chain. When we left early on Sunday morning, the house driver was there to take us to the airport, same charge as getting a cab, one flat rate, fantastic stay. No need to worry abut location either, 5 minutes walk to Copley Place, through the Back Bay station, which even felt safe at 11pm on a Friday night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: MichaelMBelfast
Reviews.Content: Upon check in we were offered warm towels to refresh ourselves. Great Start! The room was large only down side no tea or coffee making facilites. The room did however have a fridge and a large bathroom complete with bathrobes. The concierge was very helpful, he booked us a trip and when the tour company cancelled it due to low numbers did all the calling, emailing to get us a refund and was able to suggest and alternative. Will stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Back Bay Hotel - Great location, great service!”
Reviews.Author: le-metro
Reviews.Content: We visited Boston for one night and chose the Back Bay Hotel for its location and service. It is very convenient to Copley Square, Boylston Street, the Duck Pond and the Boston Common. Located only 3 block walk from the Arlington Station on the Green Line "T". The hotel is housed in the former Police Headquarters which has been transformed to a very pleasant hotel. We were greeted with a friendly reception by the front desk who offered a warm towel to "freshen up" one's hands and face. The room was reasonably sized with modern conveniences including an expresso machine. The concierge was very helpful in assisting us with bus tour tickets. Ate breakfast in the restaurant on the lower level. Although a bit on the pricey side, the food was excellent, with good portions and freshly prepared. Would definitely stay again at the Back Bay Hotel if ever in Boston for a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Hungry_TravelerUk
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights recently and were impressed overall by this hotel. The front desk was helpful. The room was spacious and clean with good coffee. The quality of the room amenities (slippers, towels and bathrobs etc) was also good. It's a short walk to many places of interest in the Back Bay area, and not far from the Green Line Boston T. The only niggle we had was the quality of the continental breakfast in the Reception lounge. Having said that, we would recommend this hotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Back Bay Hotel Was Lovely”
Reviews.Author: SDallas
Reviews.Content: We were only there for one night, but the lobby and entrance were stunning. It smelled good, too. I had read that hotel rooms in Boston are small because all the buildings are older, but it wasn't bad. We asked for a crib and they brought one w/ baby product samples and a cute teddy- which was a nice touch. The restaurant was accomodating to us and our baby, and all staff very helpful. We used Boston's Best Babysitters to have some adult time, and our sitter was great. I loved the Beacon Hill area, wish we could have done more shopping there. It felt more neighborhood-y.

Reviews.Title: “UN HOTEL OÃ™ IL FAIT BON VIVRE....very nice place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: PaulBernard
Reviews.Content: My reservation was made from MontrÃ©al over the phone and I had some special requests for the room and they were all met. From the time I left my car to the valet until my departure everything was great! At the front desk we were expected ,didn't wait to get access to our room , got informations as where to eat outside the hotel, where to go, what to see etc. Bellboys were diligent and very nice! The room was fine and well decorated so for the hotel. It was quit. Never saw such 'spacy' bathroom wow! It is very well located for shopping centers, museums, restaurantsand few minutes from a nice park to have a little walk after breakfast or a the end of the afternoon ! C'est vraiement un hotel oÃ¹ il fait bon vivre...bon voyage!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AuroraOnt
Reviews.Content: this hotel is in a great location, rooms are big and modern, beds VERY comfortable. The staff was overly nice, called to ensure our room was satisfactory. Overall we were very impressed. We did get a great deal on this hotel but I would still stay here at the regular rates. The only issue for us was the valet parking - super expensive $$$.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty hotel with unfortunately sub-par service”
Reviews.Author: papi34
Reviews.Content: Reading a review posted by another couple who checked in on the same date - I actually thought I was reading my own posting. My husband and I stood in line awaiting check-in while two women who were in the process of being checked in were LITERALLY offered warm towels to refresh themselves - oh, and a code for free high-speed internet in-room. When it came our turn we were told that our room was not ready and that it should be approximately an hour or less and that they would contact us via cell. (We also had the 4:10 Sox game to make.) Thinking the wait would be no more than an hour, we went downstairs and had a bit to eat. With no call to our cell, we went back upstairs to check on our room. The woman at the counter had to call housekeeping to check and again told us to wait and that it would only be a few moments. After another 35 minutes (of sitting in the lobby) we asked again and were told it was not ready - after she made another call to housekeeping - as it was obvious she had hardly been checking on it in our absence. (You would have thought that with all of these calls to housekeeping they could have asked them to make cleaning our designated room a priority.) After another 20 minutes wait or so, the Concierge noticed that we were now standing in the lobby and asked us if she could help. She literally went behind the desk and got keys for our room. (Two hours after we had arrived.) It is understandable that a room might not be ready upon ur arrival, but it would have been nice if they told us the truth, or even appeared to have our interest in mind while they basically strung us along for two hours. We might have found somehting more interesting to do than to hang around the lobby becoming frustrated. Oh, and we were late for the game. The other issue was that we had booked a package that included amenities like breakfast, a movie, room service popcorn, etc. yet no mention was made of this. We had to ask SEVERAL front desk personnel, none of whom seemed to understand what we were talking about. We never did find out what we were supposed to do to have our complimentary breakfast becasue we got tired of asking if we needed a voucher or some such thing. Upon checkout we fortunately dealt with a professional gentleman who at least took off our room servcice charges for the 2 beers we had odered the night before. He explained that we simply had to go and have breakfast and the front desk would remove the charges (no other employee seemed to know this). The hotel had great potential in that the rooms were spacious and clean and the common areas were aesthetically pleasing, but the service was horrible and inconsistent, and that can be unfortunately more memorable than the physical aspects of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Could be a fourstar hotel - but very poorly run”
Reviews.Author: booboosmommy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent our First Anniversary there. We came into town on Saturday morning and had plans to see the Red Sox vs. Yankees as an anniversary girt. Upon arriving to the hotel we were impressed by the overall service being provided to the other guests. When it was our turn the young lady behind the front desk informed us our room was unfortunately not ready (at this point it was 1:30pm) but they would make it a priority as the previous guest had already checked out and to come back in an hour. We told her we were in a rush and needed to make the 4:10pm game at Fenway - she said no problem - we went and ate lunch and returned at 3pm. Upon returning we were asked to wait while they checked on the status of our room ...after waiting at the desk for ANOTHER 30 MINUTES We were informed it would be at least another 30 minutes until the room was cleaned. We then asked to be put in any room that was available - although we were supposd to be in a Junior Suite. We were checked in a very clean room with nice amenties, albeit many did not work properly such as the espresso machine and stereo - which had one small window which faced the interiorof the building. We had to rush to get a cab and did not arrive at the game until halfway through the first inning, which was very disappointing. Upon checkout the next morning our bill came and was NOT adjusted to show the reduced rate for the King room as we were assured it would. When my husband went down to the desk to point this out the gentleman working informed him that the man working the prior day had been mistaken in telling us that - which was ridiculous and not our problem as far as we were concerned - and after telling him this he finally honored the previous front desk workrs promise. And then he offered us breakfast - whichhad already been promised to be taken care of the day before - although there was no note of that. Overall this is a very clean hotel, with nice rooms and bathrooms - but we were let down by the service and for what we hoped to be a wonderful experience on our fist anniversary. All it did was cause us frustration and stress - over and over again. We had been planning on staying at a Doyle Hotel in London and most certainly will not based on this experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to scratch”
Reviews.Author: shoesandkittens
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because it was highly rated on Trip Advisor but were quite dissapointed. In our first room the shower pressure was very poor. I reported it to reception before we went out to dinner. On our return it was just as bad and, on phoning down to reception was told that iit needed some major work to fix but that they could give us a different room (upgraded) there and then, move us in the morning, or offer an alternative to shower in. Impressed by the good customer service we decided to move immediately (this was 10.30pm) so we could get settled and enjoy the rest of our stay. We waited quite a while for the promised bell-boy to move our cases and had to phone up and remind them. We were moved to a better room, however it was disability 'friendly' which sadly meant an even worse shower and a lack of cabinets and hanging rails. If I had been disabled, I wouldn't have been impressed. Next morning when I asked if we could have an alternative room, we were offerd one without hesitation. Sadly the lock didn't work on this one. Thankfully we hadn''t moved in. Room number four was lovely - an upgrade from our original booking and everything in working order. One of the reasons for booking was the free internet access, so that we could keep in contact with our daughter. However this never worked properly as most areas (including emails) were blocked. Although we were told this was a temprary problem that was being addressed, as it continued for the 4 days we were there, I actually think this was ongoing. I suspect that they just don;t have that facility. My overall impression of this hotel? This is so close to being a great hotel but needs some attention. The problem is that it is priced as a great hotel. The staff bent over backwards to help, but I suspected this was becuase they were used to these sorts of complaints

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with a great history in a City with a great history”
Reviews.Author: Fabregasuk
Reviews.Content: Standing outside the foyet, it is easy to imagine the police vans bringing in the gangsters of the early-mid part of the twentieth century to this building, the grand former City of Boston Police HQ. Now, it is a classy city hotel with great accommodations and a very good value breakfast. The rooms have reasonable wi-fi, flat screen TV and the radio is tuned in to a very soothing station on arrival. The bathrooms are spacious and pretty modern. The bar area is buzzing with after-work 20 and 30 somethings in the evening and the staff are very efficient. I had one of the best gin and tonics in my life after a particularly gruelling day of shopping. There is a fantastic glass staircase and water feature leading from the bar to the reception. It could do with some neutral colour though - presently, it is lit in a green/blue which seems a bit 2000 and late. Also, first timers might want to wear sun-glasses in the lift - it has a huge multi-coloured holographic style wall covering, where a tinted mirror might be kinder. The bed was huge and very comfortable. The air conditioning was a bit noisy, but efficient. The cleaning staff were amazing - everytime we walked through the hotel, there was some sort of deep cleaning going on - it really was spotless. This was my first time to Boston - what a clean City you have! Some great shopping in the malls, and the trolly rides were fun, if a little chaotic at times. I went on the 'green low carbon emissions' one, but was somewhat surprised at the politicised nature of the commentary, which had some very dubious and subjective historical and political observations!! Boston is great for a three - five night stay, and should be in your plans if you are also thinking of NY and DC. If you are American and can't get over to Northern Europe for whatever reason, then get up to Boston - it is the closest thing you will get and has some real history and fabulous old buildings. Whilst there, get to the Back Bay - you will love the old 'police' feel - it's an historical building in one America's most historical Cities.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: gardengalCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Chose this historic spot for a recent weekend in Boston. Real restaurant area, high quality food prep- inside and out seating, bar area and general ambiance a cut above. A solid location and feels intimate. Nice main level seating area. Caters to Europeans, lots of Irish guests. In Back Bay, close to lots of great places. Had to change rooms.. 9th floor too close to air conditioning main exhaust, too loud. Exercise room, standard small below ground. Seems to be a nice spot for business meetings, lots of small meeting rooms. Nice room, furniture/amenities. Lovely robes, Korres products. Front desk, extremely professional. Parking is pricey (duh).

Reviews.Title: “Consistently excellent hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: doogo
Reviews.Content: My third time of staying here - and it never has disappointed me. Excellent rooms. Super bar for food and drinks. Great location in Back Bay. Friendly warm service with attention to detail from all staff - front desk to bellboys. Would rate as my #1 Boston hotel - it does not have all the amenities of the big chains but neither does it have the price tag, impersonal service or pretentiousness

Reviews.Title: “good loaction, good rooms, good staff”
Reviews.Author: ally2
Reviews.Content: great location, good sized rooms, nice bathroom, friendly staff and great concierge, great buffet breakfast, small but functional gym, free internet access in the business centre, would defn recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Irish hotel in a truly Irish American city!”
Reviews.Author: UKTINKER72
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Back Bay Hotel for a long weekend before traveling onwards to a business meeting, hence on my own. Tip, if traveling from the Airport, take the free Route 66 bus to the Airport Dock and then take a $10 water taxi into Boston, then get a Taxi from there, makes a wonderful start to the trip! When arriving at the Back Bay Hotel, you immediately see it's beautiful architecture as it was previously the Police Headquarters, and therefore is very well located near Copley Place/Prudential Building for Shopping. Also it is a very short walk to MJ O'Connor's (good Irish pub) and the park with the start of the Freedom Trail (red line) walk. If you stayed here, you could manage without taking a single taxi except for when you arrived and left as it's located near the main shopping areas and bars. The foyer is split on two levels, bar/restaurant downstairs and lounge bar/reception/business center/lounge upstairs. It is very nice and the pictures on the website are very accurate. I was greeted with a hot towel while checking in the the reception staff are very attentive. I stayed on the 8th floor and the rooms are very good and clean. LCD TV, fridge (no mini bar), free wifi and wired internet, free bottled water, nice bathrooms. Food in the hotel bar is very good, Burgers, Steaks, Pizza, etc.... But nothing that is outside the ordinary. I personally wouldn't go there for a meal in the evening, but breakfast and lunch was good. I didn't eat in the Restaurant outside of Breakfast, so the menu there may be different. The bar in the hotel does get busy after 10pm, but didn't keep me awake on the 8th floor at all. I booked a 3 nights for 2 from their website, hence I thought the price of $130 was very good and when I met some business colleagues from Boston in the Hotel, they said it was a very good hotel in Boston and came highly recommended locally. There is no dedicated parking, but there is valet parking for $18 for 6 hours or $39 for 24 hours. The parking is in a local public car park. I would recommend this as a good place for a couple to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended for sightseeing Boston”
Reviews.Author: Philippians4-6_7
Reviews.Content: Close to Hancock Tower, Comfortable, well-equipped room. Friendly staff, excellent concierge - Heather. Good fish and chips in downstairs bar! Legal Seafood close by. Avis car hire (Clarendon St) 5 mins walk and much better value than airport. Easy reach on foot to shopping (in Prudential Centre and Newbury St) and sight seeing with 5 min walk to nearest subway entrance and the wonderful T-system in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, rooms and services”
Reviews.Author: corkjohn29
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 7 nights recently and had a very pleasant time. This hotel is good value for money for what you get, the rooms are a good size and the bathroom is good size, do request a bath as then you are ensured you'll get the slightly bigger rooms. Location is also very good which is a big plus however the name of the hotel has recently been changed from jurys so the taxi drivers in boston brought me to the back bay hilton hotel twice as they are not used to the name being called the back bay hotel so make sure you say back bay jurys hotel. The food is very good but with most hotels in usa the breakfasts are expensive (min $20-$30), go for room only, and head up to newbury street which has lots of gorgeious cafes for breakfast instead with lots of good people watching- its about a 5 min walk max. The gay bars are also within walking distance which is handy.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Heaven!”
Reviews.Author: andik7
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel - staff were the best we have encountered in any country. They even helped us get two tickets for the Boston Red Sox for 25 dollars each!! Were originally booked in for 3 nights but extended to 5 as there was so much to do in the surrounding areas. Room / Bathroom fab. Restaurant excellent and staff so friendly and helpful. Would (and have) recommend this place to anyone we know who is travelling to that part of US - would absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: glenysPlymouth
Reviews.Content: Boston was our first city on our holiday to the USA in July. We only had 2 nights here but the hotel was perfect. My husband remembers visiting this building when he was in Boston with the Royal Navy and it was the Police House. The check in staff were so courteous and offered us hot towels whilst we checked in. The room was massive with two huge beds and an enormous bath room with wet room and bathrobes. Every where was spotlessly clean and the room was serviced throughly next morning. We also had a 42" plasma tv and free WIFI which was terrific. The receptionist phoned our room after 1 hour to check we were happy and everything was acceptable, how is that for service. We ordered room service first night as we were exhausted and we were amazed at the service. The food came on a white clothed table with silver cutlery and everything we needed, including the most amazing triangle t bags with perfect little leaves to hold as we made tea!!!!! My husband thought the miniture condiments were terrific and the food was wonderful also!!!!! The hotel was well located and nothing was to much trouble at all. I wish we had stayed a few more days as it was total luxury and so enjoyable. On checking out they even gave us a packet of forget me not seeds to plant when we got home. How nice is that. I would certainly stay here agian and wouldnt hesitate to recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice that looks after its guests”
Reviews.Author: Obderver
Reviews.Content: This is just a brief confirmation of other good reviews. This is a good hotel that goes out of its way to look after its guests. A good choice - based on my experience you are unlikely to be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but certainly not the best in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Markhamon
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 days in July/09. Some of the staff were quite friendly but the waiters in the restaurant were not friendly and quite slow. The rooms were small and the shower had mold in it which requires some powerful cleaning. The 24/7 business center was closed for the entire duration of our trip and we asked each day if it was open to be told it would open tomorrow each time. This is a nice 3 star hotel but certainly not the best in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value for the price”
Reviews.Author: mgblrms
Reviews.Content: We made a last minute decision to stay overnight in Boston midweek in July, and got a great deal from Travelocity of $175, $202 including taxes, for a superior king room. Although the room was a bit small, it was quite adequate, and the bathroom was very roomy with good amenities, including bathrobes and a wide showerhead. Complementary water and Wifi were also provided. The only complaint is that one can hear people in the hallway, so you want to be away from the elevators, if possible. Bed and linens were very comfortable. As noted by others, this hotel is in a great location and convenient to both the Green and Orange lines of the T. Back Bay is great area for walking and window-shopping. Also, Fenway Park is nearby. And driving in from the airport was quite easy. We'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Neat idea - staying in the old Police HQs!”
Reviews.Author: NeedMoreVacations08
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on a fabulous rate through Travelzoo. I will say that according to the floor layout on the back of the door, we were given the smallest room on the floor but it was plenty spacious. I will say that because the room was smaller but (I'm assuming) the furniture was similar to the other rooms, there was some wear and tear because the furniture was too big for the room. For example, the desk was crammed in between the bed and a wall (doubled as a nightstand) and the back of the swivel chair had rubbed the wallpaper right off! Not something you expect from a 4 star hotel. Enough of the pickiness though! The room had good bathroom products, fluffy robes and an umbrella. Internet was free through a wired connection. A mini-fridge was a nice touch with bottled water restocked daily. The only tough part was the A/C which is on a motion sensor. This is not the first hotel where I have experienced this and the main problem is that the room keeps warming up when I'm sleeping. The first night, I just waved my arms around every couple hours. I simply had to mention this to the front desk staff and the engineer was in the room teaching us how to get it to work just right. Awesome! We did have dinner at Cuffs, a bar style restaurant in the hotel and thought it was pretty good, if not standard, bar food. Prices were reasonable for a downtown hotel. We didn't eat any other meals here but were able to locate a Starbucks and Au Bon Pain for breakfast nearby. From a location perspective, this hotel is just a couple of blocks from shopping, the Esplanade, Boston Commons, etc. It was pretty quiet on the weekend as most of the surrounding buildings are businesses. Perhaps the best part was that access to the Esplanade for 4th of July fireworks was just a few short blocks away. What put this hotel above and beyond in my book was something that felt like a disaster when it first happened. I collect the plastic souvenier soda cups from baseball stadiums and I left my Fenway cup in the room. It honestly looks like a disposable cup and unfortunately, housekeeping did throw it away. When I realized what had happened, I talked to the front desk manager and he indicated he was going to Fenway in just a few days, took all of my information and offerred to buy me a new cup and mail it to my home in Seattle. I was VERY skeptical I would ever see that cup and I know it sounds so dumb over a $6 drink cup. Just a few days after we got home, that cup arrived via Fed Ex. That is service above and beyond.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: bikerider57
Reviews.Content: I was promptly greeted upon arrival by cab, and my bag was carried up the stairs to the reception desk (unlike the experience of one of the other reviewers). The check-in clerk was friendly and helpful, and said be sure to ask if I needed help making plans for dinner. The room was not super large, but very nicely decorated and plenty large enough for my needs as a single traveler. I appreciated that the fridge was actually open to put things in, as opposed to being a mini-bar stuffed with overpriced beverages. There were two complimentary bottles of water in the fridge. The bathroom was roomy and hotel bathrobes were supplied. One tiny thing - even though the room was very clean, there was a dust ball sitting right in the middle of one of the chairs?? It was sitting right next to the AC unit, so I have to wonder if it blew out of the HVAC. I especially liked the hotel restaurant's outdoor patio for having breakfast. It's set one level down from the sidewalk, so it feels very quiet and tranquil for being in the midst of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff and a lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vaughan1
Reviews.Content: The staff were helpfull and attentive from when we arrived dripping rainwater over their clean floor and even after 4 nights with a screaming one year old nephew in their midst. On arival we asked for a cot, and received a quality cot, with blankets and even a mini baby toiletries set. On the first night we had an early diner in the restaurant, and the food was fantastic. The staff were attentive without being annoying, and they were very tolerant of the mess created by a small child. The bar looked great too, with subtle lighting and a relaxing feel I didn't see any other small children staying there at the time, but even though it was not the norm, the hotel was very accommodating The location is ideal and we easily walked around back bay and through the common. The only thing it missed was a pool, as the weather was terrible and a pool would have kept us occupied

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service - Good Food - Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Tommal
Reviews.Content: We booked into the Back Bay Hotel for 3 days as part of a 5 stop tour of New England. We were immediately impressed by the genuine very warm welcome at the reception. The room was as we expected - clean - spacious - and well furnished. All the staff were very efficient and friendly and genuinely pleased to serve us. The food in the restaurant for both breakfast and dinner was very good and good value. The position of Hotel was very conveniant for Newbury Street Shops - The Park - Fenway Park only a short walk (or $12 Taxi). We were extremely pleased with our stay at the Back Bay Hotel and got us off to a great start. Tom & Marilyn Basingstoke Hampshire England

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Back Bay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NCmomtravels
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. There is a coffee bar in the lobby. Hotel restaurant is very good, but expensive- we ate there one night. Easy walk to shopping, restaurants, and the T stations. We did not have a car so cannot comment on parking. Nice room amenities- free internet, umbrellas, robes, nice shampoos/toiletries. I was very comfortable in the bed, but my sister complained that it was too hard. It was quiet while we were there. This was my first stay in Boston- very easy to travel on the metro- would definitely stay here again if we could get a good rate again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Robin_in_Raleigh
Reviews.Content: My family of three stayed at the Back Bay for four nights last week based on the reviews I saw on tripadvisor. I was not disappointed. When I drove in, the valet was at the sidewalk to greet me. Our bags were loaded up to our room and the front desk attendant upgraded our room to a "deluxe double". The room was large enough for me and my two teenage boys. The bathroom was large with nice toiletries. There was a tub and a separate shower in our bathroom. The shower had great pressure and hot water. Maid service was excellent. Our room was cleaned everyday and our bed turned down every night. Two free waters were in the fridge everyday. The fridge was a fair size, so if you like to stock up on snacks on sodas, there is plenty of room. I ordered room service twice and was very pleased with the quality of the food. The AC worked well in my room, although it was a little noisy. We walked or took the subway to our destinations. The hotel is two blocks from the Bay Back Station. I have poor feet and it was a fairly easy walk (10 minutes at my slower pace). I was also able to walk to the Boston Park and Charles Street, although these were longer. I found the residents of Boston to be very friendly and helpful. The only cons of our stay were that the wi-fi access, although free, was a very "low" signal, which was frustrating when trying to look up Boston things. We were on the 9th floor, and even with the AC going, could occassionally hear road traffic. Also, there were no vending machines, so you had to use the hotel restaurant or room service. We bought some extra sodas and snacks from a nearby 7 Eleven to keep in the fridge. Overall, I would not hesitate to stay here again if I got the same rate as I did last week. Tip: The concierge recommended a great breakfast place within walking distance, "Charlie's Sandwich Shoppe". It was not fancy at all (ex. no restroom), but the breakfast was reasonable priced and great-tasting. The breakfast was so filling that we skipped lunch that day.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price, good location”
Reviews.Author: cmacginnis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Back Bay Hotel in June 2009 when we were visiting the city to see friends. It's very well placed for the trendy South End, Copley area and Newbury Street so can't fault that. We spent both evenings in the South End which was brilliant - Butcher Shop, Toro and 28 Degrees. The room itself was decent but certainly not luxurious. One of the light fixtures in the bathroom was burnt out the whole time, which we thought surely a maid would notice and fix but it remained that way the whole time. The bed itself was nice and the fridge with free water a definite bonus. $40 a night for parking was steep but I suppose that's Boston! The only downside was we could definitely hear bass pumping from the downstairs bar until midnight on a our last night -which was a Tuesday - and the free Wifi signal was too weak to receive in our room. All around decent if you can get it at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a Boston week-end escape”
Reviews.Author: ctgal2008
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed Fri and Sat nights at this hotel and felt we were in a perfect location. Immediately greeted when we drove up to the entrance, assissted with our bags, and taken to the front desk. Extremely easy access on and off Mass Pike(90). Our room was large and tastefully decorated... overall hotel style being trendy elegant. 2 blocks from shopping, galleries, and dining on Newbury St; 5 min walk to a Starbucks and other breakfast establishments; easy walk to Public Gardens & Boston Common. We walked to Quincey Market and the North End as well. The hotel has it's own restaurant and spirited bar scene. On Sat night took a 10 min cab ride to and from Fenway (Red Sox won!). It was clean and convenient, but the air conditioning system could have been a bit cooler. The engineer immediately assissted us with our request to lower room temp with increased a/c, but it didn't seem to make a difference. All and all a great stay at The Back Bay Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but missing some details for this price range”
Reviews.Author: Steve5052
Reviews.Content: Our second stay at this hotel (first time was last year when it was Jury's) was a little less polished. It is a nice hotel, the rooms are very comfortable, it is quiet and the service is generally good. Our experiences in the restaurant were very good, all the food was good, fairly priced and the service was above average. I guess what sort of tugs at me about this place though is that it seems like in some respects the service is a bit lacking. I like the place, but it feels like they aren't trying all that hard, especially considering the room rates. For example when I arrived I unloaded 6 bags from the car literally 10 feet from the doorman who was standing there on the other side of the sidewalk. There was no one else loading luggage and the doorman was not talking to anyone that I could see, he was just watching traffic go by. Once I got them out of the trunk and give the keys to the valet, wife, 6 yo son and I picked them up and walked past him up the stairs to the checkin desk, with 125 lbs of luggage. No one ever asked if we wanted help with the luggage, not the valet, the doorman or the front desk attendant. I don't mind carrying the luggage, I don't have to tip anyone that way, but it's a strange approach for a place that charges over $350/night. When I checked out the exact same thing happened, I walked past a doorman with 7 bags and no one offered to help me get them either to the curb or into the trunk of the taxi (except the taxi driver). At 7 AM the doorman was there at the entry and never did anything, he said hello, but that's it. I waited several minutes at the curb so there was plenty of opportunity for the doorman to earn a tip, but nothing. Very strange. The hotel was not full when we stayed there, in fact I found out after we checked in that rooms were available during our stay for about 22% less than our reserved rate. So, I was kind of disappointed that I was paying a premium to stay there compared to someone walking in off the street with no reservation, even more so when they put us in a room with a view of an internal courtyard. My sense (I could be wrong) is that the hotel was less than 75% full and yet they put is in a smallish room with no view on a 3 night stay while charging us a relatively high rate. They can do that, but similar to the doorman's lack of helpfulness, it's not going to win them any long term customers. I do appreciate the free wifi, it's fast and consistent, and free - which is what wifi should be in 2009. Location is a subjective thing but I would not recommend the Back Bay area for families with young kids, we have had trouble finding suitable places to eat in this area on our two trips. Lots of nice restaurants that would be great for a night out with your spouse, but not so great for small children. The hotel restaurant has a pretty good kids menu though, so that's where we normally ended up.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Top-Notch, and Good Value”
Reviews.Author: ToughCritic36
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference in Boston held at the Park Plaza Hotel (see my review on that page), but chose to stay here instead, since it's just one block away and is rated MUCH more highly on TripAdvisor. I made a very good decision! Every staff person that I met was friendly and helpful. Although I booked a promotional rate of $175, I was still upgraded to a superior room (apparently a bit larger than standard, with an in-room espresso machine). The hotel, which (until 1997) was the headquarters of the Boston Police Department, has been lovingly renovated. It is beautiful, inside and out. Strangely, the elevator interiors are decorated with a garish prism-like wall covering that reminded me of a disco ball. But all the other space was lovely: modern, but comfortable. Since almost all full-service hotels charge around $15/day for Internet access, it's extremely nice that the Back Bay provides wireless Internet for free (not just in the lobby, but in the guest rooms, as well). It wasn't as speedy as my connection at home, but it was consistent and got the job done. I was initially given an accessible room with an adjustable low-flow shower head. When I saw two peepholes in my door, I realized I had an accessible room and asked to be moved to a different room with a better shower. The hotel staff moved all of my things during the day, and, indeed, the shower was better in the second room (it even had a second shower head for my back!). Like several high-end hotels I've visited, the Back Bay Hotel has a glass shower stall and a separate bathtub. However, this bathtub reminded me of my tub at home (only without a shower). Most hotels with separate tubs have super deep "soaking tubs" (at a minimum), sometimes with jets. They missed an opportunity here to provide an additional touch of luxury. My room was turned down every night, including chocolates on the bed and ice in the bucket, and I received two free bottles of water each day. Nice touches. And if you're coming by train, the Back Bay Hotel is less than a five-minute walk from the Back Bay station. It's also a short walk away from the T (Green Line at Arlington Station).

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Texas123_7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Back Bay Hotel in the begnning of June during our first vacation to Boston. We stayed at the hotel for 5 nights. Upon check in, we were very happy and found the hotel to be extreemely nice. The lobby area and check in desk are beautiful and the bellmen were very helpful. The room is a decent size, I wouldnt say its huge, but it is in no way small either. The bed is huge and I found it really comfortable. The bathroom is also a good size and the vanity area is great. There were included toiletries as well as robes to use while at the hotel. A problem I had with the robes was that they are extreemely heavy and not good for summer use....but they would be perfect for winter. The shower head had great pressure. Did not use room service so I cannot rate that, but housekeeping did a wonderful job. Each day we went out to sight see and when we returned, no matter what time it was our room was made up. There is a mini fridge in the room and you get 2 free bottles of water. We actually went to Shaw's and bought other beverages and snacks and kept them in the fridge as well and it was very convenient. So that might be a good idea if you will be a guest at the hotel for multiple nights. I drink lots of water so it was nice having plenty in the fridge. The hotel bar is the most happening hotel bar I have ever seen. During the lunch hour we saw many business people having lunch and at night it was always "hoppin'! We had alot of fun after going out at night and then returning to the hotel and hanging out at the hotel bar. My only complaint was that when we arrived, we were asked for our credit card, to only be used for incidentals.......well, the day before we left my husband checked his bank account and we had been charged again for the room that we had paid for months in advance.....it was resolved in a timely manner, but it was still a headache. We loved the back bay area and would probably choose to stay at the hotel during any future Boston trips.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel with one careless housekeeper”
Reviews.Author: Sensenigr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Boston Back Bay Hotel (formerly Jurys Hotel) for three nights over the Independence Day Weekend, for a fantastic rate. This hotel is located in the Back Bay section of the city, just blocks away from the Prudential Center, Esplanade, Boston Common, and so much more. Upon arriving at the hotel, we were quickly checked in and sent to a room on the third floor. We did have a room that faced the inside of the building (meaning that your window faced other rooms within close proximity and the gravel roof was right below you. It would be nice, considering that probably 40% of the rooms face the way that we were facing, if they would do something with the roof, perhaps make a garden, a green area, or a recreation area. The room itself was well appointed with a large LCD TV, a refrigerator hidden in the entertainment center, a nice desk, a closet with a laptop safe and an umbrella for use, and a bathroom with a wonderful shower head and bathrobes to use. As stated in some other reviews, we did not have an issue with the climate control system. We woke up every morning very comfortable. We did frequent the Cuffs Irish Bar and everything was fine in that area. We did not use any other food service at the hotel. We did encounter housekeeping issues during our stay which are completely unacceptable. First, my partner did find someones dirty socks and undergarments on top of the phone book in the one nightstand. Now, this was hidden inside a cabinet and I understand it is not the biggest issue. Secondly, and more importantly, we had a blanket we used for the July 4 fireworks along the Esplanade on Saturday. When we came back on Sunday we hung it over the shower to "air out". On Sunday morning, we took it off of the shower and placed it on the floor in the bathroom. That was the only thing on the floor of the bathroom, as we reused our tools and did not place any towels on the bathroom floor. When we came back later on Sunday, we noticed that the blanket was gone. This blanket was a very large queen size blanket. It did not at all have the same texture, color, or style of any of the towels or blankets used at the hotel. We did report it missing. To the credit of the hotel, they have been following up to assist us in finding it; however, I don't believe the same one will be found. They are sending me one; however, I certainly don't believe the one sent will be the one that housekeeping took. I would give this hotel an overall rating of 3 out of 5, or 4 out of 5 if it were not for the housekeeping issues. I would stay again at the right rate; however, unfortunately, sometimes one rather careless error, leaves you wanting to not make that your first choice on a return.

Reviews.Title: “Back Bay is great”
Reviews.Author: okoshi2002
Reviews.Content: I have been to Boston once before and stayed at the Fairmont Copley. The Back Bay is comparable if not superior in terms of the rooms which are beautiful, spacious and beds very comfortable. The shower was absolutely luxurious ! The location is quiet but easily accessible to great shopping and eateries on Newbury Street which is just a few blocks away. The nearest subway stations are Arlington and the Back Bay- both within 5 minutes by feet. We enjoyed our stay and will return.

Reviews.Title: “No control over thermostat - otherwise attentive care”
Reviews.Author: OPTravelers
Reviews.Content: I thought our air conditioner had problems because it would not respond to the temperature I set for the room at night. After asking to have it checked three times, I was informed that the cooling is preprogrammed and responds only to movement in the room. That explains why we were so hot at night. With little movement, the air conditioner and fan shuts off. Therefore, the thermostat in the room controls very little. It did help when I left the fan running during the night. We switched rooms with a little improvement. I am happy to help with "green" issues, but want to sleep well at night, not in an oven. This factor really decreases the value of the hotel and rating of the room. The majority of the staff was very helpful and polite on all other issues, especially the concierge and the nighttime manager. Bathroom was good sized and very clean - good for a family with teenagers. Good sized TV. Carpet could be cleaned for spots but overall the room was clean.

Reviews.Title: “room comfort, learn to move around in your sleep”
Reviews.Author: htchicago
Reviews.Content: this hotel is jumping on the "green" bandwagon per steve the general manager which is really code word for saving lots of money on heating and air conditioning bills. recently the trend is for hotel chains to put in Sensor Stat thermostats in rooms. Marriot chain has them nown and others I have stayed in. A sensor stat thermostat is a new control for heat and ac. They have an Ifra Red sensor on them so if they detect no movement in the room they turn the AC or heat off. This designed to save money and energy, great idea. Nope theirs a huge caveat in this system, problem is that most folks don't do jumping jacks in their sleep or move around in their sleep so the system shuts down when they sleep so if you set a tempature it won't go there as it the sensor stat shut s down as the device now thinks that you are no longer in the room. Great idea wrong! The guest now will wake up out of sound sleep sweating or freezing depending on the season, you go to thermstat and it turns on again as it detects you. You go back to bed and it shuts off as it does not know you are there. The number 1 thing people want in a hotel room is a good nights sleep and this is impossible with sensor stat as you can't get the room to tempature you want while you sleep. So my opinion is this avoid hotels that have them and call hotels before you book them and ask the system they use, if they use sensor stat book another hotel. Yes their are some work arounds to the issue like putting mylar balloon in front of the sensor so it thinks your moving around in there but why should you have to go buy a balloon in a room to be confortable.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable bed, great location, rockin' lobby bar”
Reviews.Author: KKOakville
Reviews.Content: The Back Bay hotel was awesome. Close to shopping, restaurants, and tourist attractions. The rooms were clean and the bed was heaven. The lobby bar was happening all weekend. Fantastic mojitos.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: BOBDNYC
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Back Bay this weekend and had a fair if not thrilling experience. The hotel nearly makes it on so many levels, yet never quite hits the mark. The staff was lovely at check in. Very friendly and efficient. The room was comfortable and not too cramped for what it was. However the bed was horrendous - perhaps fashioned from old cots left over from the police headquarters days. The bathroom was very spacious, yet the layout was wrong - shower needed upgrading, poor water pressure and the tub was a small shallow item which was presumably good to bathe a pet, but hardly adequate for human cleansing. Bathrobes were great as were the bath amenities. Room service was a great deal and delicious and the Nespresso coffee a nice treat. Yet there was no newspaper available. The solid gold dancer decoration in the elevator and disco stairway with water element seem ill conceived and adds to the schizophrenic nature of what could be a solid home run of a hotel. Perhaps its still having growing pains after renaming itself from the Jury's Inn. For now the jury is still out on this one.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to the billing!”
Reviews.Author: Chubs13
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a trip over the Memorial Day Holiday to Beantown. Was actually able to score a really good deal on Jury's through Orbitz so had booked the hotel before I had even seen the reviews on Trip Advisor. Needless to say, I was really excited for our stay after I did read the reviews and Jury's certainly lived up to all the hype. Location-- absolutely perfect. It's tucked away on a quiet corner away from the hustle and bustle of Boylston (which is less than 5 minute walk). Nice to come back to a quiet place after a day of sightseeing-- most other hotels we saw sat on busier streets/corners in the area. It's a 10-15 minute walk to Commons, Garden, South End, Chinatown and 15-20 to Fanueil Hall area. You can probably make the North End in 25 by foot as well. The T stop at Arlington is also less than 5 minutes away if you're not a walker. Super easy to get around the City in general. Service-- very good. We didn't quite experience everything noted on other reviews like the call up to the room to make sure we were happy, the free upgrade, etc. But the Front Desk staff was very very nice. The Concierge was dead on with 2 dinner recommendations and made reservations for us and even the doorman pointed us to a great nearby sandwich shop for a quick lunch. Rooms-- solid. We had a standard King. Maybe a bit on smaller side but not familiar with typical Boston size room but was fine for 2 of us. Very clean and had nice LG flat screen and king bed that was comfy. Good drawer and closet space. Bathroom was good sized with fun 2 jet shower in there, towel warmer, good products, etc. We didn't come to Boston to sit in our room so we were very happy with it. Not much of a view may be only downfall. Didn't eat at the hotel but did visit Cuffs (the Bar) a couple times. Certainly not a typical hotel lobby bar and does attract a general crowd, not just hotel guests. Open late which is nice. Prices weren't outrageous for area either. They had some food which looked good as well although didn't eat anything there. Overall was very very happy with our stay and would certainly look here again on our next trip to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: ClaireandJohn
Reviews.Content: Just back from a three night stay at Jury's, I have stayed at other Jury Doyle Hotels and wasn't disappointed. The staff are excellent, we had a lovely Penthouse room on the tenth floor. I bought a kettle prior to my visit as I read on Tripadvisor there were no coffee making facilities in the room but there was in ours. Wi-fi was available free of charge. The nearest 'T' stop is Arlington on the green line and very close, a weekly 'Charlie' ticket costs $15. Lots of restaurants on Boylston street nearby. We had breakfast at the hotel, lovely but way too much food. Dinner at 'Top of the Hub' (Prudential centre) is a must, the views are superb. We enjoyed our stay in elegant surroundings with the friendly Jury's staff.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Boston Experience”
Reviews.Author: epicurean81
Reviews.Content: Just got back from beautiful Boston and our trip to the Jurys was perfect. The staff is more than accomodating and the facility is simply beautiful. There is something for everybody: location, elegance, comfort, and the best service in Boston. Will go back again!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SG_03
Reviews.Content: This was a real nice place to stay. The dÃ©cor and ambience were all very pleasing. However, during the evening, we did find the bar a little noisy on entering the lobby area, but once in your room, all was quite. Rooms were very comfortable, with all the necessary amenities, and the added bonus of a 37inch LCD and micro Hi-Fi! Bed was lovely and comfy too! Location is great. We were able to walk to most places of interest and found it central for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with excellent location”
Reviews.Author: cjt9t9
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely 4 night stay at Jurys Boston. Room was a good size with a very comfortable bed, large TV, wardrobe with safe and iron as well as a good sized bathroom. Location was excellent, walking distance to Newbury Street, Boston Common, Chinatown/Theatre District and had a number of subway stops nearby. Although we didn't visit the bar, it looked good and was busy in the evenings. Within walking distance there was a variety of restaurants and bars. The hotel does have a business feel to it but I would not hesitate to recommend it to tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in ideal position”
Reviews.Author: IMPSurrey
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Jurys for 5 nights frm 7th May after reading good reviews on trip advisor. Can see why it is highly rated. Ideal position, located in the Back Bay district. Very smart and modern hotel. Rooms reasonable size, very clean, beds very comfortable. Added bonus of bottled water left daily in fridge. We used the coffee bar for breakfast every morning found it a lot easier and quicker than searching around for a cheaper alternative. Take your travel kettle with you NO Tea or Coffee making facilities. One piece of advice we were recommended a fish restaurant by reception-SKIPJACKS, CLARENDON STREET. VERY, VERY, DISSAPOINTED, VERY VERY Over priced, VERY VERY average food. Would not be surprised if the prawns and crab were frozen! Give it a wide berth. There are evidently much better and more reasonable options locally!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in a perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: YoshiDus
Reviews.Content: First of all, I am very, very picky about hotels. I travel to Asia a lot and the Hotel quality there is much better there than in the US (try to compare the Grand Hyatt BKK to the Grand Hyatt SFO and you know what I mean). Nevertheless I need to say, that my recent stay in the Jurys Hotel Boston was very pleasent and to my full satisfaction. The room was immaculate clean and comfortable. Slipers and bathrobe as well as a turn-down-service added much to the experince. Staff was nice and friendly. Liked the bar and the hearty breakfast innthe restaurant, despite it was a litlle bit pricey. Free WIFI worked fatanstic through the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “best and most unique in the Back Bay”
Reviews.Author: footballmomBoston
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Jurys Boston Hotel for a business stay, and was delighted with the design, service and unexpected extras. The hotel was beautifully designed, with great colors and Irish touches everywhere (they named their meeting rooms after Irish artists). Very unique.
