The people were awesome... smiling, accommodating, and answered questions without feeling like I was bothering them. I particularly liked the soft beds, the bottled water, and the restaurant was much better quality than the typical "hotel restaurant". I would highly recommend this hotel for families or business travelers... a bit of a "boutique find" in the heart of the Back Bay and right near the South End.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: HappyWanderer72
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Jury's Boston with my Mum in December 2008 and would definitely stay there again. Great location - an easy walk to Boston Common, Boylston Street and the Theatre District. In fact we walked everywhere easily. On one of the four days we were there, we walked from the hotel to the start of the Freedom Trail, had a good look around Quincy Market and Fanueil Hall, continued on the Freedom Trail to the end, then walked all the way back to the Prudential Centre for cocktails at sunset. It was a heavy day on the feet, but certainly manageable. The room was large and clean with lovely comfy beds, big soft feather pillows and crisp, white linen and warm comforters. Great furnishings all round really. We had a massive bathroom with separate shower and bath. They supplied lovely toiletries. The business centre had two PC's with free internet access and free wireless internet. The downstairs bar was nice and served lovely desserts, which on one night I took up to the room. Very lovely! The restaurant off the bar was expensive, but given it was absolutely freezing and blowing a gale one night we were there, we opted to eat in and chose lovely home-made soup and crusty bread. Try Bangkok Blue next to the Charlesmark Hotel on Boylston for cheap and cheery Thai and the Irish bar MJ O'Connors about a five minute walk from the hotel for good hearty pub grub. Also try a Boston Cream Puff at Mike's Pastry shop on Hanover Street. If you're there in December, I'd highly recommend a visit to the Boston Holiday Pops at Symphony Hall - very Christmassy! Really great hotel and good value booking through expedia.com.au. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Understated excellence!”
Reviews.Author: sandman478
Reviews.Content: I was in Boston for a conference and stayed at Jury's, oddly a converted former Boston Police Headquarters, of all things. The conversion to a 4 star hotel was excellent!! From the moment of arrival, thru service at Stanhope Grille, to the VERY active lounge and bar (even comfortable for a Celtics hater!!! ), the service was seamless and impeccable! There is tremendous value here!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: njpmg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for only one night for a business meeting. The location was great being close to Copley Square but not in the midst of it. Newbury Street was only a couple of blocks away. The room itself was nothing exceptional although the bathroom was good-sized. I noted that the room, especially the bathroom, could have been cleaned more thoroughly. The bed was not very comfortable either. However, they did have a room for us when we checked in at 8am. The price was fairly comparable to any other 4-star hotel in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Was expecting more and got less...sleep.”
Reviews.Author: travel2muchNYC
Reviews.Content: Perhaps my expectations were high due to the glorious reviews from TA's users. In fact, it is what prompted me to try the place out and abandon my usual business stayover at the Kimpton. It was listed also as the #1 hotel in Boston. And the night I stayed there, it was. The bar and lobby were packed with a drunken after work crowd and there was a line to check in. When I was finally given a room, I was not pleased with it as it was small and faced a brick wall. When I asked for a change, I was told that "it would be $40 to upgrade." Not really the answer I'm accustomed since I travel every other week. I went down to the front desk and they begrudgingly gave me another room...all in earshot of another guest checking in to a "we've upgraded you." My new room was just as small but it faced a rooftop instead of a brick wall and took it. My night was not a pleasant one. The bed that one reviewer referred to as "rediculously comfortable" was so worn that I slept in the middle of it...on the hump. My ventilation did not work so they brought me up a fan. My shower the next morning was like standing under a dripping faucet and the bathroom smelled like mold. I thought that it was just a "bum" room but my colleague complained of the same thing the next day. While I was given some compensation for my inconvenience, we both agreed we'd be returning to the Kimpton.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Shopping0704
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nice, the price was good and the staff was very helpful and friendly. Had some loud neighbors, and they promptly moved us to another room. Overall a great experience. I have stayed in much more expensive hotels but never had this level of service and friendliness.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tiggytiger
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week over the Easter holiday. From the moment the door was opened for us on arrival the service was outstanding. All the staff we encountered were extremely friendly and efficient. Our Deluxe room was spotless and comfortable with a HUGE bathroom. Loved all the little touches like the hairdryer with a diffuser (I have prone-to-frizz curly hair!), free bottled water in fridge, bathrobes and slippers. (My only minor complaint is the window was small so didn't let in much natural light during the day. However we were asked if the room was ok for us and we chose to stay put.) Cuffs - the hotel bar - is a fun place to be in the evenings. Most sightseeing spots and good shopping are between a 5 - 20 minute stroll away. Didn't eat at the hotel so can't comment on the food. Try Globe Cafe for a casual lunch or Vlora for dinner (both on nearby Boylston Street) or The Daily Grill at The Prudential Centre (10 min walk away) . Had delicious meals at them all. This is a great hotel in a great city and we'll certainly be back to visit them both.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a Good location”
Reviews.Author: jobetim
Reviews.Content: This hotel is highly recommended as a great place to stay. My only caveat is that I would have liked to have been able to make my own morning tea, rather than spent $13 on a thermos of hot water, 2 teacups, 2 teabags and some milk; but I guess that's the deal in up-market hotels these days.

Reviews.Title: “I picked a winner this year”
Reviews.Author: stewindy
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at Jurys for Boston marathon last weekend. Perfect hotel to stay if your running. Staff was very helpful and location was just what I was looking for. We at downstairs for lunch twice and I was very pleased with the food. We've stayed at the Ritz Carlton and Four Seasons in the past. I will be staying at Jury's from now on. Bed was extreamly comfortable, flat screen tv, huge glassed in shower, towel heater, and great service. Room wasn't huge but it was comfortable. They actually impressed me!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a Good Location”
Reviews.Author: bmelter
Reviews.Content: The Jur's certainly does have a nice location, centrally located in the Back Bay and within walking distance of many of the sights of the city. Coming here for business, I really didn't need to see the sights. I just look for easy check-in, good service, a clean room, a quiet night, a good night's sleep and proper amenities. Jury's hits most of these. The location, in the old Boston Police HQ building adds some historical charm. The rooms are a bit on the smaller side. Cleanliness is OK with some wear and spots on the carpeting, some missed housekeeping touch-ups, and some chips out of furniture. Noise from neighbors plumbing can be heard very easily. In fact, I awoke to my neighbor turning on their shower which lead to the sound of water pipes echoing through the room. Street noise is quite pronounced as well. Little amenities are nice such as two free bottled waters in the fridge, nice toiletries, and a heated towel bar. Shower pressure is pretty good with plenty of hot water. With all of the 5 star reviews, I would have expected a Four Season, St. Regis, or Le Meridien type room which are always spotless. Not the case here, but certainly a great stay for the price.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: scores11
Reviews.Content: As usual T.A. reviews were dead-on. Never having traveled to Boston before we had to rely on friends and TA for our accomodations. The Jury did not disappoint. Great central location, where my wife and I were able to walk everywhere; from the North side to the south side (and even Fenway Park). Room was great (only slight problem was the air flow in the room- they said they were going to send somebody up, but I don't think they ever showed up) Never made the bar scene that everyone raved about, but the bar was definitely jumping all 3 nights we were there) Doormen extremely helpful, and even arranged a car to take us to airport which turned out to be a very nice SUV, which was cheaper than a taxi. (oh, the fitness center is really small, so if you want to get a great workout, run the loop of the Charles River- you get to sightsee and run at the same time!-skip the gym)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: EdgeofExistence
Reviews.Content: As is generally the case, DH and I decided to take a little weekend away for respite, after long stretches of no sleep (work-related) and for my recovery after a minor surgery. We chose Boston, and then based on a deal we found on travelzoo and the great reviews on trip advisor, we chose to stay at Jurys. We were not disappointed! It's a decently sized hotel with a small-hotel feel, right in the center of everything in Boston. Despite this, when we were done with walking around Newbury street and done checking out the busy bar scene downstairs, we retreated upstairs to one of the quietest, most relaxing rooms I have ever stayed in. Additionally, I made it a point to request that we 1) get a room away from the elevator, 2) have a room with a tub and 3) have an extended checkout. The staff kindly honored all of my requests, and even called our room after we were settled to make sure that we were happy with the accomodations. I would especially like to commend staff member Aruna, who went out of her way to make sure were comfortable and to make a restaurant recommendations that absolutely floored us (the restaurant was Kashmir - great for Indian food, plus some great vegetarian options!). The room itself was medium sized but spacious, immaculately clean, and elegantly garbed. There were a couple of splashes of light green that helped balance the neutrals in a way that was representative of the rest of Boston - a nice balance between traditional and modern. Valet parking was steep at $39 a night, but we shopped around and found that this is the standard for all garages (even if you self-park). Overall, we were happy with our experience, and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: klausj
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel. Well placed. Good value. Lively bar / restaurant at street level from lobby - but noise didn't affect the room.

Reviews.Title: “The right balance of formality and informality - great hotel”
Reviews.Author: JMFTravels
Reviews.Content: A select chain of hotels managed and staffed by genuine people who make the effort to make your stay as pleasant as possible. I received an excellent service in all aspects from the check-in process to the restaurant, room service, bar and front door. Whilst recently staying in Boston on business and selecting Juryâ€™s for personal historic reasons (having had my Wedding reception in Juryâ€™s Dublin Ireland in 1991), I can only recommend this hotel for its location and general attitude. While everyone was clearly eager to help in every way, two people stood out in particular to me. Brian, one of the managers who certainly one would regard in any customer facing role as a great asset and Mike, the Bar Manager who finds the right delicate balance in customer interaction and engagement without overstepping the mark. These two examples just typify the staff profile. With regard to the room, food, cleanliness and general ambience, it is a treasure of a hotel in Boston, so the bottom line from me is highly recommended â€“ well done Doyle Hotels, keep up the good work. On a final point, I remain however to be convinced on the re-branding strategy of losing the Juryâ€™s name, understanding the sale of the Inns and the conflict with the Juryâ€™s Inn brand. Please at least keep a common theme, â€œDoyle Hotelâ€� or something similar such that the market can identify with the group of hotels. I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Such a nice well placed hotel”
Reviews.Author: StretchRyan
Reviews.Content: My friend and I where over for 6 nights over the Paddies Day celebrations. Everything about the hotel was perfect, staff where so nice and helpful. Very informative Doorman. The Bar is very good and prices are fine including the food. Meant to enjoy the fitness centre but never made it due to be unable to get out of such nice beds and many heavy nights on the beer. But overall it was great place to be based as very close to so many of the cities amenities. Will definetly be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location & Friendly, Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: ccsmrc
Reviews.Content: I stayed back in November 2008 for one night while on business and really liked this hotel. The staff was incredibly friendly--from the valet to the check-in to the concierge...everyone was attentive and happy to help with all of my questions. The location (on the edge of Back Bay) is excellent as well as there are plenty of restaurants and things to see in walking distance. Rooms are comfortable and larger than I expected and the bathrooms were nicely done. Also liked that they had a barista/cafe upstairs were you could read the paper and relax. Downstairs there was definitely a crowd at the bar (Cuffs) the night I was there. Looking forward to going back to Boston for a leisure trip and staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Casual elegance done right!”
Reviews.Author: jjbri
Reviews.Content: 2nd visit, but this was a weekend leisure trip with family...great location... friendly and personable staff...great food -- both pub grub and more formal fare...can not say enough good things about Jurys!

Reviews.Title: “warm welcome and beautiful room!!”
Reviews.Author: Emmy3
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in back bay which is a great location!! everywhere is walkin distance!! 10 minute walk to cheers, 5minute walk to newbury street, 5 minute walk to prudential center. As soon as we arrived at the hotel the door man was more than helpful with the bags and when we checking in the guy in reception was lovely he was more than helpful and really friendly. He gave us city maps and ideas on things to do as it was are first trip to boston. When we got into our room about 3minutes later we got a call from reception asking were we happy with our room and we were as it was clean with beautiful decor and large bathroom. We got room service one morning and we got a full cooked breakfast!! it was massive......we could of shared one!!! We ate in cuffs bar twice on our 5 days stay and the food was lovely and really cheap!! They have all the are drinks from home too which was nice!! The day we were leaving the hotel we asked them to order us a taxi but they have a service were have a driver and a big jeep to take u there and its only an extra $10 so worth it!! On the whole this hotel was brilliant!! i would stay here again for defs!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: trumpet123
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a one night stay after skiing in NH. Rooms were very comfortable and clean. Location was great, walking distance of anywhere you need. 1 block from the nearest 'T' stop. Staff very helpful. We only paid Â£75 for a double room as well, which i thought was a bargain for such a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “3 Night stay after Skiing in Vermont”
Reviews.Author: jay_mit
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after Skiing in Vermont , Hotel was fantastic , really friendly staff !! Easy walking distance to Boston common & shopping areas , certainly don't need a car or Taxi's to get around. Our children loved the free internet access and was able to research attractions using the PC's. Wrap up warm if traveling in winter time . we were ok as we wore our thermals, we used for skiing... ear warmers or a thick hat are a must. We found Macey's Store on a sale day fantastic value + UK citizens get an extra 11% off . Also we flew with BA , they were fantastic too, flight times were 6.5 going and 5.5 return... Enjoy , Jason & Karen

Reviews.Title: “It was all good.”
Reviews.Author: IAmAt
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful place to relax during a visit to busy Boston. It has all the gracious amenities, yet still retains a cozy feel. Everything was spotless, the rooms were wonderfully quiet, the service was friendly and the staff was unstintingly helpful. The food is great, whether at the bar or in the dining room. The upstairs lounges are a treat for comfort at the end of the day or whenever you simply want to sit and read a newspaper or watch the world go by. Thanks to other recommendations on this site, we booked rooms for four nights and enjoyed every one of them. If you're heading for Boston, stay at Jury's. By the way, if you don't want to stuff yourself on the dining room buffet breakfast, there's a Dunin' Donuts to the left about a block and a half away. There is a top-drawer Italian restaurant about the same distance to the right. The name escapes me at the moment. Pricey, especially the wine, but the food was delicious. Ask the consierges -- they were a great help. You might also arrange a chauffeured private tour at a relatively reasonable rate. We zipped around Lexington, Concord, Harvard and whatnot in a little over three hours. Just sit back and relax, the driver will stop whenever you want. You can also get a teriffic massage at a huge nearby spa.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Sadie_NB
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay. From the parking valet, to the front desk to the concierge, all the staff was pleasant and helpful. Although a bit small, our room fit our needs. The bed and linens were comfortable. The hotel is still relatively new and it seems up to date. They had nice touches, such as towel warmers, two robes, mini fridge, cd player, and even an umbrella in the closet. We didn't have neighbors the first night. The second night we did and we could hear him/her moving about the room. He or she was quiet, but I was amazed I could hear the drawers opening and closing. So if you are unlucky in your neighbors the thickness of the walls could be a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bubbles26
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Jurys with my family (husband and two teenagers) just before Christmas. It is a lovely hotel. The room despite accommodating four of us was spacious, well equipped. and clean. We asked for extra toiletries and towels enough for the four of us and this was dealt with very quickly and efficiently. The only problem we had with our room was that it was too hot, but the room did have it's own thermostat which we were able to regulate. The staff were very helpful. The concierge booked our shopping excursion and within five minutes had arranged for the bus to collect us from our hotel despite such short notice. The business suite (a couple of computers with internet access and printer) is free which pleased our kids and was helpful, enabling them to print a map with directions to our next destination. We had breakfast at the hotel every morning which was lovely and the food was excellent as it also was at Cuffs. Location was good and we would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at The Jurys”
Reviews.Author: KCJB
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Jurys for a three night stay over New Year. The hotel was fantastic, the staff very friendly and helpful. The room was great with a very comfortable bed and plenty of room. We ate a couple of times in Cuffs and would recommend the sandwiches. It was extremely cold (not exaggerating!) on New Years Eve so we wandered over to Boston Common to watch the fireworks at 7.00 p.m. and then as the hotel had a great bar and was so comfortable we decided to return to the hotel rather than battle the bitter cold. You are within easy walking distance of bars, restaurants and shops. We want to return to Boston and would definitely stay at the Jurys again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: suzyjacuzzi
Reviews.Content: We live North of Boston and decided to book a 2 night stay at Jury's to enjoy the city and nightlife. The hotel is in a perfect location and within walking distance to tons of shopping and great restaurants. Our Deluxe King was a beautiful corner room with a huge bathroom and tons of natural light. Valet parking, reception and housekeeping were all top notch. The bar in the hotel is a lively spot for both hotel guests and outside customers (!). I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Boston. The only small complaint is that the workout facility is very small and does not meet the standards of other hotel properties in this category.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: janatzee
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a four night stay at Jurys Hotel. Very little to complain about most of the Staff were very friendly and helpful and went out of thier way to accomodate all guests. The concierage was excellent the door men everybody we encountered except the receptionist on check in we had two rooms booked as we were travelling with our elderly mother i had emailed the hotel and requested that the two rooms be allocated on the same floor. However she informed me this was only a request and we could not be accomated on any floor in the hotel for which i find hard to believe no two rooms on any floor at 15.30pm in the afternoon. Anyway after this inital hicough we enjoyed our stay at Jurys. Location was good close to all shops and Prudential centre a walk from Fauneil Hall but it is an enjoyable walk. The doorman arragnged a Taxi back to the airport for us which cost us $50 which was good value for five people and all our luggage. On our last night we asked for a nice restaurant to be recomended and they recomended Grill 23 across from the Hotel while our meal was nice this food was overpriced for a party of four with one glass of wine no dessert tea/coffee we paid $275 other just as nice restaurants even the hotel was nicer than this. The rooms were good and spacious we booked two rooms for 5 people so three shared one which was still ok. The beds were very comfortable, room service was good and efficent we ate in the restaurant on our first night just when we arrived this was a lovely meal and reasonably priced service excellent

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel... Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: msindependent
Reviews.Content: Myself and my mom stayed at Jurys in Boston for 5 nights. It is worth spending a bit more as the rooms are lovely and the staff are very helpful. The concierge was extremely helpful with organising trips and booking restaurants. I will definitely go back to Boston, as its a fab city and Jurys will always be my first choice for accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best”
Reviews.Author: lindie_h
Reviews.Content: Recently spend a week at Jury's when we belatedly celebrated by husband's 60th with a trip to Boston to see Tina Turner in concert at TD Banknorth Stadium. As other reviewers have said, the hotel is first rate. All the staff are very friendly. We were upgraded on arrival to a superior room. The room itself was large, the bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was great with a huge walk in shower. We had asked for a quiet room and we were given one at the end of a corridor. We ate at Cuffs bar one evening - where we found the food was reasonably priced. That bar can get very noisy on some evenings but there is another quieter bar on the floor above which is open some evenings. We ate breakfast in the restaurant most mornings. The service was good but the buffet did not have as good a choice as other hotels I've stayed in. There is a business centre where guests can access emails etc. You are conveniently placed for both the shopping (Prudential Center and Newbury Street within easy walking distance) and the T, with Arlington station close by. There are many restaurants nearby. I'd particularly recommend Grill 23 opposite for a great evening meal.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Jury!”
Reviews.Author: Nebraska12
Reviews.Content: Best hotel I have ever stayed at. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: alzo
Reviews.Content: stayed or one night found hotel very high standard upgrade to mini suite (i think) hotel in great location easy to find ,i found the loby very small and cluttered,the price i found to be on the high side and not value for money that would be the only fault i found staff great a nice stay but overpriced

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FosterDublin
Reviews.Content: I flew in for the weekend Fri to Mon, from Dublin. Taxi from airport took 20 minutes to Jurys. Hotel is ideally suited for shopping, with Filenes and Marshalls just a couple hundred yards away (two large stores competing against one another and offering huge discounts), and within a 20 minutes walk downtown to Macy's, Faneuil Hall, Quincy Food Market and the East and West Markets with their street entertainers. Jurys is a small hotel (220 rooms) compared to some of the other tower block hotels (1000+ rooms) in the Back Bay area, and is extremely personal, with the most friendly, helpful and obliging staff imaginable. Our room on the 9th floor, was spacious with a lovely view of the John Hancock Tower. The room included fridge, aircon, multi channel TV, Espresso Coffee Machine, Safe, King size bed, walk in shower etc. The mattress was the most comfortable I have ever slept on with its quilted top layer. The bar (CUFFS) aptly named, as the building was the former Boston Police Headquarters: is a lively, comfortable, modern meeting place for residents and locals. They serve wonderful bar food at very reasonable prices. The hotel restaurant menu has a wide selection, and I recommend the fillet steak served with pomme puree a la crÃ¨me and crisp onion strings (To Die For!) The deserts are equally as good. Breakfast is a hard choice as there are so many variations to choose from. The Smoked Salmon Benedict was without doubt my favourite, and you have to try the pancakes with fresh berries and maple syrup, all 4 of them! (forget the diet for the weekend!) If you like seafood or lobster, go to the Legal Seafoods Restaurant (if it isnâ€™t fresh, it isnâ€™t legal) on Stuart Street, and donâ€™t forget to order a bowl of their creamy Clam Chowder! No visit to Boston would not be complete with out a City Tram Tour, which includes a 45 minute cruise of the bay. Get off at the Prudential building, go to the 50th floor viewing platform, and donâ€™t forget your camera! Peter Foster. Dublin

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but ...”
Reviews.Author: Bicyclemadefortwo
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel but when something goes wrong I would question the ability of management to deal with problems dispite the absolute courtesy displayed. We recently stayed for 5 nights having booked directly with the hotel as we were asured they could provide the connecting rooms desired as we were travelling as a family. On arrival we could not be given the connecting rooms as they had been 'given away the previous night as the hotel was fully booked'. We agreed to the offer of upgraded non-connecting rooms, with the option of moving to the connecting rooms the next day, but on checking the rooms only one was an upgrade and the other reeked of smoke. Moving to another two rooms caused a delay of another half hour (having already spent a considerable lenght of time at the reception desk) as one had to be cleaned in a hurry. How well this was cleaned became evident the next morning. When using the shower a previously used bar of soap with hair embedded was found! Requesting the rooms to be throughly cleaned we opted to stay put as it was just too inconvenient to move - enough time on the first evening of our holiday had been wasted. All our complaints were dealt with in the most courteous manner but we were still left with a bad taste in the mouth. It is a beautiful hotel but ....

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: dublinsdelight
Reviews.Content: we stayed in 2 rooms on the 8th floor in jurys. excellent service throughout. staff very friednly and very helpful. Rooms were spacious and beds were comfortable. The hotel location is excellent, within 10-15 minutes walking distance from downtown crossing for shopping, short walk to newbury street and prudential centre. All major attractions are close. Would definitely recommend this hotel, free use of gym and internet. We didnt have breakfast included and ate in the hotel once which we thought was overpriced for what it was but that is the only negative that i could find

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: madkal
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week at this wonderful hotel had a lovely stay beds are the most comfortable beds i've slept in in any hotel, hotel staff extremley helpful and polite. Ideally located. Food in resturant is lovely but a bit pricey but plenty of places to eat nearby so not a issue. Would highly recommed this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: angie1972
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Jury's Boston in October this year. We were a party of 4 adults and all absolutely loved this hotel. From the minute we arrived the hotel staff were friendly and helpful. We checked in around 6pm evening time and there was a great feel to the hotel. We went to our room to change and found the room to be beautifully decorated and very clean. Firstly we went down to the hotel bar which is called Cuffs. There was a mix of hotel guests and city workers enjoying a drink after work. There was a warm and friendly atmosphere which instantly made you feel comfortable and relaxed. There was also a patio area leading from the bar which was lovely. We ate in the restaurant for breakfast each morning and although this was not included in the room rate found it to be excellent value for money. There was a choice of buffet breakfast which included eggs, hash brown, bacon, sausage, cereals, danish and fruit juice or you could eat A la Carte breakfast which also looked lovely. We also ate in Cuffs bar during our stay and again the food was excellent. I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone who was looking for a hotel in Boston. We all hope to visit beautiful Boston again one day and would definately stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but don't eat there!”
Reviews.Author: pjjonesy
Reviews.Content: I agree with another review that the hotel is noisy from the locals in the bar. We never got a seat in the bar as it was full of locals. The room on the internet says it caters for four. There were four of us and the room was quite comfortable but was only ever catered for two, with towels for two, choc for two etc. On the first night we ate in the restaurant. There was 8 of us together and they didn't seem to be able to cope with the group. We waited over an hour for our food. Some asked for well done steaks, which came out medium. When we spoke to the manager Nuala she said what did we expect as the steaks were thick. What kind of a way to deal with people complaining. On the next night after a hard days shopping we decided to try the bar and to go in in two groups to try and speed things up. The food was the worst food I'd ever come acroos. the chips were more than burnt. All 8 of us sent our food back. I asked for mayo and got a little jar that was already used. In fairness to the hotel we spoke with the food manager Shane, who was embarrassed when he seen the food. He offered us drinks and more food to make up. We wouldn't accept so he gave all 8 of us free breakfast the next morning to prove that the hotel could serve good food. Next morning the breakfast was good, with a good variety of foods. Its a nice hotel and the staff at the front deck and porters are very helpful with bags and where to go. They were very imformative.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel & Service”
Reviews.Author: sars4619
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 room in Jurys late October. From the minute we walked in we felt the ambiance and sophistication. We arrived early and were able to check into one of the rooms at 10 am. Rooms were adequate and had all the facilities we required. Although the twin bed room had no bath. Reception was able to book our rooms opposite each other. We availed of the breakfast buffet which was lovely. Try the waffles! :) Although table service was very slow & we had to ask for orange juice/coffee refills. Nice fresh pastries. Well worth the $19 we paid. Irish sasuages too! We also took drinks in the bar which was very lively. Seems to be the place for after works drinks. Nice cocktails. We dined at a restaurant called Da Vinci's on Columbys Ave - 2 blocks away. Highly recommend it. Please ignore what Philly said - sounds like he was in a different hotel. Jurys is in a great location for shopping, eating, sight seeing. I highly recommend it for anyone visiting Beantown. We are returning in 2 weeks time with friends. Cant wait.

Reviews.Title: “Jurys is a credit to the brand”
Reviews.Author: redlisab
Reviews.Content: My mum and I stayed in Jurys the 1st week of september, and the next time we go to Boston we will stay there again. The hotel is beautiful, the rooms are superb and the staff couldnt be nicer. I really wouldnt take any notice of the reviewer from philly because it soulnd like sour grapes. Everything was rated below average, because of an incident which they admitted happened!!! Anyways moving on, we fould the staff exceptional. Do order room service, we were hit by hte rains of the hurricane on the sat and ordered the steak and the pizza. In the room in 30mins and so beautifully presented. $40 total incl room service charge, tax etc. Do go to the oulet centre. This can be booked with boston common coaches, or through the concierge. $35, you are collected and dropped off at your hotel. My advice is to walk to the very top and work your way back, make sure and check out Ruby tuesdays for lunch there, The salad bar is amazing. Try legal seafoods if you like fish! I compliment the jurys brand and remeber sour grapes taste bitter, so if you travelling from Ireland, look up prices on Expedia.ie We got a weeks stay in a deluxe room for 1000 eur. Stay there, you will not be disappointed. Slan Niamh O'Brien

Reviews.Title: “BRILLIANT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: irene1206
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here and had a brilliant experience- we being myself,husband and 17 year old son. From the moment we entered we felt we were important. The staff were very friendly and had time to chat when we asked anything. The room was welcoming and we all loved the huge walk in shower. The beds were very comfortable and the pillows big and fluffy. The whole hotel was very clean. It is in a perfect position for exploring the city-which we all really enjoyed. We would recommend this hotel and hopefully will be coming back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Verdict is in... Jury's is the Best”
Reviews.Author: luggageinhand
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a four-night stay at Jury's. Everything written about this hotel is spot on. The employees are incredible and the rooms spacious and spotless. Wouldn't consider staying anywhere else in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Stay Ever”
Reviews.Author: philly11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Jurys Boston Hotel in September. While Boston was lovely, Jurys was terrible at best, especially considering the room rate. The last straw was that I was charged $500 three days after I checked out for room damage. While I acknowledge that the carpet may have sustained some minor stains, $500 is ridiculous. And there was no notice or anything. On top of that the assistant front office manager was so smug when confronted. I will never stay there (or any Jurys) again and Iâ€™m advising everyone I know to avoid Jurys as well. Boston is so lovely, especially in the Fall, donâ€™t ruin it, stay somewhere (anywhere) else.

Reviews.Title: “Will go again!!”
Reviews.Author: Ali2503
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at Jury's for 3 nights and would definately recommend it to others. It was in a good location, really easy to walk everywhere, 2 minutes to Newbury street (nice shopping and restaurants. Also Grill 23 is opposite the hotel (not cheap in dollars but compared to home not bad for such good food and service) definately worth a visit if your having a romantic evening and want to stay close to the hotel. Overall i would say believe the pictures on the website. We had a standard king size bed and it was lovely. Nice size room with a super comfy bed, really nice quality pillows and linens. Bathroom was big, as was the shower stall so we did not miss having a bath. Also powerful hairdryer provided so won't bother packing one. This hotel isn't cheap but i felt it was worth the money. I watched this hotel for a while on Hotels.com before i booked and got emails when deals came up. In the end we saved about 15% by doing this. I think this hotel is perfect for young couples who will enjoy the novelty of sparkly lifts and a staircase that changes colour. We also arrived at the hotel 3 hours before check in and were taken straight to our rooms. Next time i go to Boston i'll go back to Jury's.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, at best.”
Reviews.Author: papahills
Reviews.Content: We arrived Thursday evening for a three night stay after a trip to Las Vegas and were greeted by more noise in the lobby than anything Las Vegas had to offer ! The bar on the ground floor resembles an after match booze up and appeared to be patronised solely by non-resident young Bostonians. Friday and Saturday evenings were exactly the same and therefore there is nowhere in the hotel for residents to sit and have a quiet relaxing drink. We had an executive corner best view room on floor eight which was tiny even by US standards. The view on all sides was straight into occupied office buildings and the bathroom ( shower room ! ) had a clear view window which meant the blind had to be down whilst the bathroom was in use. The bathroom was large but poorly designed without a bath although more than adequate space existed. We breakfasted once at the hotel and the food and service was adequate but nothing special. Although the printed bill for breakfast said service was not included an additional rubber stamp in red highlighting this fact was stamped on top of the bill - how thoroughly naff ! We paid $565 per night to stay here which seems absolute top dollar and the booking was made on the hotel's website. Whilst the location is good for walking around the shopping district, the hotel staff were friendly and helpful, the bed and bedding were extremely comfortable, my wife and I find very little else to recommend the hotel and quite a few things as highlighted above to put you off, and especially the bar noise which was quite absurd ! The real mystery to me, having used Trip Advisor extensively in the past, is how this hotel can possibly be the current number one recommended hotel in Boston on Trip Advisor..... Philip Hills

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Geecee_7
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely holiday at Jurys. We stayed for 3 nights in a lovely double room. We ate in the hotel dining room twice. We had 2 lovely steaks - highly recommended. We also had breakfast on our last morning - again also very nice. The staff are really attentive and can't do enough for you. The rooms are lovely, big comfy beds, and lovely bathrooms. Our room was at the back of the hotel and was nice and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “A most pleasant stay, with very friendly and accommodating staff”
Reviews.Author: MinisterOfCulture
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at Jurys for five nights, in a deluxe double double, a large room with two double beds, and a shower stall separate from the bathtub. The accommodations were most comfortable, and for my partner, who has mobility issues, the room was quite close to the elevator. The front desk and concierge staff were all uniformly friendly and as helpful as they could be. There was an issue with the toilet seat in our room (my partner normally uses a raised seat at home, and we did not enquire as to the availability of such a seat before our arrival - the one that the hotel had was otherwise in use), but the hotel made every other accommodation to our needs, and made excellent suggestions as to restaurants in the area. There is a very active bar scene in the basement bar at the hotel, with much of it spilling into the exterior courtyard in good weather, but from our room, we heard nothing (we were on the 8th floor).

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cannytraveller2008
Reviews.Content: Spent 8 night's in Boston with my 19 year old daughter. I selected Jury's on the basis of other trip adviser reports and the fact that I got a good rate of Â£840 from Opodo back in January for 8 nights. The hotel was perfectly adequate but lacked the special something that other guests seemed to find. The restaurant was pricey, the bar (Cuff's) noisy. I missed the fact that there were no coffee making facilities in the room although I accept that American hotels just don't seem to do this. We made use of the fridge and hotel safe but toiletries were not replenished each day which was annoying. The free bottles of water and chocolates on our pillow were a nice touch but my quilt had a cigarette burn hole which should have been noticed when room was prepared and the bathroom light only worked when the main room light was on which made life difficult during the night. Concierge was helpful when approached and willing to keep our bags on the last day as our flight home was in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the place!”
Reviews.Author: Rich_Forbes
Reviews.Content: Jurys Hotel - Boston After a long and tiring journey to Boston we arrived at Jurys to be told that due to the weather they had to relocate us at another hotel. At the time we were disappointed however the hotel were helpful organising and paying the taxis to and from the Colonade hotel. The Colonade was a lovely hotel and when we went back to the Jurys the following night they had upgraded us and provided us with fruit and chocolates and a letter from the manager to offer their apologies and to offer us an upgrade if we stayed at Jurys again. Jurys is a beautiful hotel in a great location. The bar has a fantastic outdoor area which would be great place to spend time in the summer. One point i would flag up is the hotel room telephone. I rang family in England and a 15 min conversation cost me $60 so beware!! Would highly recommend Jurys - and the Colonade if you have the money!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: LondonIrishgirl
Reviews.Content: The staff were incredibly helpful and we found our overall experience at Jurys better than expected. The hotel bar, Cuffs, was buzzing - I've never seen a hotel bar so popular! Great cocktails and the food in the restaurant next door was great too. We had a corner bedroom and it was well equiped if a bit on the small side. The hotel was in a great location for seeing the sights of Boston and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: DevanSam
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Jurys for a week in early September, and loved it. The location was fantastic, just a few minutes walk to lovely Newbury street, Copley Mall and Boston Commons. The hotel itself was very beautiful. We checked in late, but the staff at Cuffs bar downstairs were fantastic and ensured we got a good meal even though it was their kitchen closing time. Beds were very comfortable, and the room was very spacious. Great shower in the bathroom with plenty of hot water at good pressure. Only thing we found odd was that the room by default didn't have a kettle to make hot water for tea/coffee - nevertheless, the hotel said they would have lent us one but they had none to spare at the time we were there. I would definitely pick this hotel again if I ever went back to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “top hotel”
Reviews.Author: merseydave
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Jurys for a week- 3rd floor corner room- alot of room, great spacious bathroom- desk but no sofa, just 2 chairs, one reclining Wasnt really noisy at night- the bar is buzzing at the weekend. Helpful pleasent staff, valet guys chatty. Easy in room check out, turndown service, complimentary water and coffee machine in your room. Wi Fi sometimes struggles to cope with the numbers logged on but its free I would only point out that it sometimes takes 15 - 20 mins for the guys to get your car- ring down from your room in advance and they will get the car ready for you. And it costs $39 per night to park- plus you feel obliged to tip. THere is a public garage down the road But it was top rated on Trip adviser- certainly seemed deserved to me

Reviews.Title: “Met expectations”
Reviews.Author: n1cf2
Reviews.Content: After selecting this hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews, I researched best available rates online. I then called the hotel directly and they quoted a much higher rate, which I questioned based on my research. After I provided the specific websites and rates I was referencing, the hotel graciously honored the lower rate. We arrived on Friday and checked out Sunday. The property is a typical boutique hotel in the business district and is in an excellent location for visitors to Boston. The entrance is a bit awkward. There is a small foyer at the street with a flight of stairs up to the lobby, reception desk and elevators. A flight of stairs down from the same entrance foyer, there is an impressively active, quite noisy bar open to both the entrance and the lobby. Due to this, I requested a quiet location. We were given a corner king-bedded room on the third floor with a back street view. We did not hear any noise from the hotel's bar and it was otherwise quiet except for some late night noise from the street below us (a crowd of men yelling and cheering -maybe a bar on the back street?) and early morning noise from garbage and delivery trucks). I would recommend a higher floor. Our room was attractive, clean and welcoming. It was not overwhelmingly spacious, but did allow for a desk on one side of the room, an armchair and lamp table on the other, and a wall unit with a television compartment, shelving and drawers opposite the foot of the bed. An in-room safe, ironing board/iron and umbrellas were provided. The bed was very comfortable and made up with high quality pressed linens. The bathroom was clean and modern with a walk-in shower (no tub, but this may vary room to room), L'Occitane toiletries, fluffy towels and bathrobes, and a full-sized hairdryer (rather than the travel size usually encountered in hotels). The housekeeping was very good and provided nightly turndown service. There was one odd thing about the hotel dÃ©cor, which was otherwise attractive and tasteful - the lining on the back wall of the elevators is a gaudy, iridescent material that looks more in keeping with a cheap nightclub.

Reviews.Title: “Love Jurys Hotel! #1 in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: rokeedy
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about how great this hotel is! We have stayed here twice when we have visited Boston and I wish I could afford to stay here every time! Gorgeous rooms, elegant hotel and gracious staff! I was very impressed with their crib bedding for my infant....nice and cozy with bumper included! They provided a teddy bear, blanket and bath set! If you stay in Boston, this is a wonderful place! Walking distance to Boston Common and Newbury Street, short T ride to Fenway! Will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great staff.”
Reviews.Author: WANTOTGOTHERE
Reviews.Content: What can I add to the other reviews ? Great hotel, great service, brilliant staff, excellent rooms, great bar, great food.............does it all. Other hotel owners should go and have a look at Jury's because they have got it just right. From your first moment in the hotel until the moment you check out the staff make you feel special. Great introduction to Boston. If I had to put my finger on one aspect that was better than all the rest then I would have to nominate the "Stanhope". Great food, fantastic service, best waiter (Greg I think!). If there was one little downer that would be the parking fees .but then again this is the middle of a big city and parking costs...... Would go again and stay at Jury's anyday.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: vzamparelli
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the hotel and found it to be a wonderful experience. It is obvious that a lot of care and attention was given to all details. The decor is modern and sophisticated. The staff is friendly, congenial and attentive. The rooms are elegant with an excellent bathroom. Glass shower separate from the tub. The room was immaculate. Two anecdotes that help describe the type of service the hotel offers: When I went to check out the Manager noticed that the front desk was busy. He asked me if I was being helped and then proceed to complete the transaction. After I left the hotel I noticed I had misplaced my Iphone's charger. I called the front desk to explain what happened. They told me they would check to see if they could find it and call me back . After an hour had passed they called to let me know they had found it and that they would keep it in a safe for me. That is service.This is very well run hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY!!”
Reviews.Author: piperbarson
Reviews.Content: WOW! My husband and I came here about 5 months after our honeymoon. You couldn't really call us "newlyweds" but not really "old dear couple" either. We called this our first real trip together. We didn't really consider our honeymoon one because we only flew in hour. Anyways, we booked this hotel 2 days before we left. Money was not an option so we looked for the best. And we found it! I wasn't expecting it to be as good as it was but it definetely surprised me. I have done a lot of traveling before I was married but I had never stumbled upon a hotel like this one. The service was great. Everyone was friendly and kind. Anything we needed was brought fast. The cleanliness factor was top of the notch. Everything was clean and orderly but very well decorated. Our room was beautiful and the view was magnificent. I want to come back here one day on our 5th anniversary so this will definetely be the hotel I book.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Superb”
Reviews.Author: LorraineSK
Reviews.Content: I visited Boston with my cousin and stayed at the Jurys Hotel from the 29th August 2008 through to the 3rd September 2008. We were celebrating my cousin's 50th birthday and everybody there made it very special for her. The service at the hotel was excellent and the staff were really helpful and friendly. One example being the concierge researching how we could get to Martha's Vineyard, providing us with bus timetables and Ferry schedules, including prices. This was not one of the normal 'over the counter' excursions but still they did everything they could to help (and we had a great day on the Vineyard as a result). The bar at the hotel - Cuffs - was fabulous. The prices were good and the measures even better!! We didn't try the food in the restaurant, but the bar food was delicious. It is obviously a popular place as there were locals in the bar every night, although it was never too crowded. We were made to feel welcome by the locals too, which was an added extra. The rooms were large and clean. Having stayed in a number of 5 star hotels - I can say the bathroom is the largest one I have seen - and the towels were changed twice daily! The location of the hotel in Boston is excellent, with everything being in walking distance if you are fairly mobile. We had considered going to the Liberty Hotel, but having seen both, we definitely chose the right one. Special thanks to Chris in the bar and to the lady outside the restaurant. We never actually got her name, but her and Chris made us feel more like friends than guests.

Reviews.Title: “Book it Dano!”
Reviews.Author: Kendo3
Reviews.Content: just returned from Boston, Stayed at Jurys and the Langham, and would recommend Jury's every time. No gripes about anything at Jurys, the room was good, Excellent breakfasts with very attentive staff. Free internet access, (Langham charged $10). Jurys give you a couple of bottles of water in the mini bar everyday free!! (Langham charged $8 for a bottle of water from the mini bar) also like the more relaxed feel about Jury's,

Reviews.Title: “Loved Jurys Boston”
Reviews.Author: D_and_JCharlotte_NC
Reviews.Content: This a lovely, elegant boutique hotel with impeccable service. We were treated like royalty by the excellent staff. For example, 4 staffers recognized us by name and followed up the next day after we made an inquiry at the Conceriege. Wonderfully appointed rooms in this historic building that recently has been completely renovated.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CDJ13
Reviews.Content: My wife and myself stayed 3 nights at Jurys at the end of July. The stay was a memorable experience. From the moment when we checked in after a very long flight, we were met a a smiling face who gave us hot face cloths to freshen up. The room was great, good decor, not clinical, and the best bed we have ever slept in. The staff throughout the hotel were friendly and very helpful (special note of thanks to the doormen who were a mine of information). The location was within easy walking distance for everywhere you would want to go. Boston as a city supprised us, and we still talk about how friendly, clean and safe it felt. We highly recommend Boston and Jurys to stay in while you are there.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to the Airshaft”
Reviews.Author: dayjob
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate by booking through one of the onlines. After arrival it didnt seem like such a great deal. The room had NO light. I'm not THAT picky about views but the airshaft-facing window made the room dim at noon on a bright August day. Even with lights on it was tough reading a magazine. There was no tub, something we hadn't been made aware of... just a standup shower. Hallways were often full of cleaning supplies just lying around. At one point a cot had been abandoned, wedged in the corridor. This entailed pretty much crawling over it to get to the elevator. Staff was pleasant but didn't seem particularly connected. On arrival the doorman just stared at us until I said hi and asked what the process for valet parking was... no hello, nothing. In our days there with a lot of entries and exits, 3 or 4 doorguys were always hanging around... not a single hello or acknowledgment from any of them. The concierge gave us vague directions to a major museum wrapping with the helpful advice to "just ask someone" where it was when we got off the train. Room service was crazy expensive (and I'm used to NYC boutique hotel prices) and REALLY bad. Public spaces were nicely designed and pretty on the good side. The building is an old police department building. Again pretty but not pretty enough to justify the price and lackadaisical service

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Fitzy2
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect - it was in a great location, really central, the rooms were a good size with a very comfortable bed and a big bathroom, and most importantly it was very clean. The staff were lovely, the ambience in the hotel was relaxed and friendly, and there was a lovely bar downstairs that had great food. I cannot fault this hotel and it would be the top of my list for future stays in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Jury's Boston - Even better then the real thing”
Reviews.Author: Craigtown
Reviews.Content: Jury's Boston is a nice hotel in a very convenient location and is more than worthy of a 4 star rating, however the thing that pushes it from 4 to 5 star for me is the excellence of the staff in being friendly, accommodating and making the hotel a home from home experience. I find this a bit strange as I used to play for a rugby team in Ireland who would have stayed in Jury's hotels when we travelled to away games, and although the hotels were always pleasant there was never anything exceptional about them. Jury's Boston has obviously set out with the goal of bringing Irish hospitality to the States but has managed to actually outshine the original. We arrived at 10am Sunday morning after an overnight flight from Vegas and were pleasantly surprised that they had a room available for us straight away. The check in staff arranged to have our bags brought up the room, but when there was on one available after 5 minutes the check in staff brought them up themselves. Our room was comfortable if unspectacular, The bathroom was a bit small, but having previously been the home of Boston Police the building clearly wasn't a blank canvas for Jury's to work with. Two free bottles of water were left in the empty minibar along with a note to say that if we were coming to stay again we could email ahead to advise what drinks and snacks we would like to have placed in the fridge ahead of our arrival. After a quick sleep we ventured downstairs to cuffs bar for an 'Irish breakfast' which was one of the best I have ever had. From here it was a short walk to the Prudential Centre for a Duck Tour. Unfortunately the heavens opened 30 minutes into our tour and we wished we had brought the umbrella that the hotel had left in our room for just such an occasion. On each night of our stay we had drinks in the Cuffs bar and found it to be a welcoming and relaxing end to a long day of sightseeing. We also had dinner in the Stanhope grill, which was of a very high standard. There are several nice restaurants within walking distance of the hotel; Fleming's was one which we particularly enjoyed. The hotel has a small gym, but no pool which is one negative point, however the computer room with complimentary access to the internet and printing is a nice touch that more hotels should offer My wife and I both really enjoyed our stay in Jury's. We don't normally visit Irish bars when we are in the US or try to find a home from home when we're away, but we booked Jury's because we got a good deal and seemed to have a pretty much spotless record from TA reviewers. We weren't disappointed with our choice and every aspect of our stay was filled with thoughtful touches from the hotel from the free internet to the suitcase air freshener left on our bed on the day of departure. I feel that this hotel is a fine combination of traditional Irish hospitality and the friendliness of the Boston people which we found was highly evident on every corner of this welcoming city. Will stay here again if we return to Boston

Reviews.Title: “A Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ben_melb
Reviews.Content: Jury's provides a very comfortable stay with everything you need to make you feel at home. I generally like to stay in boutique hotels so I straight away noticed that there was nothing distinctive about the hotel's design or furnishings. However, the bed is comfortable, the TV is large and the shower was great. In fact, this hotel had a very nice, and large, bathroom for the price. The room itself was a little small. We ordered room service once and it was a very tasty angus burger delivered after midnight and in generous portions. Bonuses: Free internet and printer. 2 terminals downstairs that you can use at your leisure. Free water bottles, 2 per day. The mini-bar fridge is empty. What a fantastic innovation! We loved this and could fill it with our own soft drinks and extra water and even put some snacks in there the night of our departure to eat the next day. Very convenient! The only complaint I can make is that the room is a little drab in terms of decorating and the TV didn't have much of a selection of channels. The only cable channels were sports & news, no entertainment channels. Also from what I read I expected the neighborhood to be more energetic. It was really a business district and completely died after dark. All in all I would definitely recommend the Jurys Boston and also recommend the tiny Italian takeaway place on the corner down the road called Viga (304 Stuart St). Yum! It's only open 11-3 on weekdays for lunch - lines out the door!

Reviews.Title: “Excellenty located high end hotel”
Reviews.Author: Corb2000
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here in a king room. Very tastefully designed and furnished hotel throughout with some beautiful sculptures in the public areas and nice design touches, thus avoiding a bland corporate look. Much higher quality hotel than the Jury's brand manages to achieve in Great Britain. Noticeable change in guests between weekday and weekend as the business areas kicked into life on Monday with all of the meeting rooms being in use and the bar later being taken over for a private evening reception. Not a problem in space terms as there is a large lounge next to reception but just made it difficult to get a post dinner drink on our last night. Very professional and attentive staff across all levels. We only visited the basement restaurant twice for breakfast as this had an unnecessarily elaborate menu and was expensive. The hotel is in an excellent location for the Back Bay area of Boston with Newbury Street and Boston Common plus plenty of restaurants all within easy walking distance. Once you have your bearings Boston is an easy city to walk around. We would recommend Legal Seafoods on Park Plaza for lobster / seafood, Smith & Wollensky on Columbus Avenue for steak and Stix on Stanhope Street just for interesting food! We thought driving in Boston was fine, although the signage can be very last minute for turns into the recently built Interstate highway tunnels so you need to be alert.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: catlovertina
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Jurys Boston a few months ago and I was very impressed! The staff were so helpful and warm. The room was very good and clean . I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “trip advisor was right with this one!”
Reviews.Author: mvks
Reviews.Content: Wow what a fabulous hotel! Close to shopping and train. Train easy to get around on. DO NOT DRIVE IN CITY. So confusing. You have no idea. I have driven in the busiest/biggest of cities....boston is very hard to get around by car. Hotel was extremely clean, comfortable and the hotel staff ....amazing! Hotel food was great but as with any hotel...pricey. Would stay there again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Comfy Beds and great cocktails”
Reviews.Author: ScotiaJen
Reviews.Content: Lots of nice touches at Jurys Boston from the heated towel rack to L'Occitaine products. Handy location to "T" and Newbury Street. Enjoyed drinks at Cuffs and an excellent breakfast at the restaurant. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “a hotel in the heart of it all”
Reviews.Author: spinderella420
Reviews.Content: The Jury's Hotel was exactly as advertised. Great location, beautifully appointed rooms...l'Occitane products were a nice touch...fluffy robes and turndown service. We didn't have a view, just a brick office building, but that would be my only beef. The bar was hopping downstairs...and there was a good vibe in the lobby. Walking distance to Boylston and Newbury. It was a nice place to come back to after a long day of touring around.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: gibraltarr
Reviews.Content: The best thing about Jury's was it's location. It is near to 2 different T stations, near to Newbury street with all it's restaurants and walking distance to the Public Gardens and the start of the Freedom Trail. Staff were all friendly and did what they should. We had a street view which was nice. I found the bed uncomfortable which was disappointing. Biggest gripe was that one lift was broken for 4 of the 6 days we were there - so the delays in the morning were really unacceptable. I agree with a previous reviewer, I am not sure why it is top in popularity , but it is a good hotel. We could have done with a pool.

Reviews.Title: “alright but certainly NOT #1 in Boston”
Reviews.Author: westonct1998
Reviews.Content: Service was good, but elevator was not working and a deluxe room had a view of an alley. Alright overall, but perhaps a 3.5 out of 5 at best, certainly NOT #1 in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to reviews”
Reviews.Author: PalmDebbie
Reviews.Content: Jurys location is fabulous. You can walk almost everywhere and easily hop the T or a bus. The room was average and when we arrived we found a pair of sun glasses left under the desk and a dirty washcloth under the drapes. It did make us wonder how well the room was cleaned but everyday the room was made up very well. Neat to have an empty refridg and the bottle of water. No good places for breakfast nearby. The hotel restaurant is expensive but good. Try Smith and Wolensky just around the corner in an old castle with great steaks, etc. The desk people were efficient but cool however any call made was quickly responded to and every effort seemed to made by the staff to respond to requests. We had a broken desk chair that was exchanged within 15 minutes after a call. Overall a good experience in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Unpretentious comfort and luxury”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaE
Reviews.Content: Chosen for a night stay in Boston, I was impressed with the service, the style of the hotel and the comfort of the rooms. The little touches such as complimentary water, decent sized towels and quality toiletries make it a great place to stay. The quirky history and stunning renovation make it a unique place to stay. The location was good, a 5 minute walk from Newbury and Boylston St attractions. I have high expectations for hotels- as a former flight attendant I have stayed in so many I lost count but this was a great choice for a Boston.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tbrain
Reviews.Content: An amazing hotel! Location was amazing, food in both the bar and restaurant was of a good quality and reasonably priced. Free water in the rooms was appreciated givven that we arrived in the middle of a heatwave! Concierge was also excellent. Will definitely stay Jurys again!

Reviews.Title: “Jury's is Great”
Reviews.Author: willyboy
Reviews.Content: This is our family's first trip to Boston and first time staying at a Jury's and it's a fabulous hotel. The employees are all friendly and helpful, the rooms are relatively small but luxurious and the hotel offers lots of nice amenties, like free wireless internet, fitness center, bath robes, towel warmer, complimentary water, etc. Jury's is located within two blocks of the Arlington "T" station which makes it easy to get around town without a car. It's 3 blocks from Newbury Street, which has an abundance of great restaurants and shops. It's also easy to get to Fenway Park on the T if you're going to a Red Sox game or to walk to Boston Common and the Freedom Trail if you're interested. Our family really enjoyed staying here and would definitely stay again and would recommend to anyone visiting Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but lacking charm”
Reviews.Author: joe_soho
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a convenient distance from the rail station and not far from the centre of town - so a good location for business travellers who don't want to deal with car hire but need access to the areas around Boston. It was a good stay. Quite expensive but that may have been because I booked last minute. One reservation I had was with the charm of the hotel. The hotel bar is used mostly by those not staying at the hotel - which is not too surprising because the hotel did not seem to be very accommodating for its guests to eat and drink, except in their own hotel room. I would consider staying here again but more as a bed for the night than as a place to enjoy Boston in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay With Pilgrimage to Fenway Park”
Reviews.Author: PapaJamieRockefeller
Reviews.Content: At the end of a baseball trip up the East Coast, this was my final hotel in my final city. This place was spectacular! The only -- ONLY -- significant drawback for a single person traveling with friends is that there is no "traditional entrance". Normally those things are tacky, but when catching a cab, they're quite benficial. Otherwise, for a 2 twin-bed room (bed sizes were btwn twins and fulls), layout was great, location great, comfort superb. I would easily stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Experience!”
Reviews.Author: 3boyz2keep
Reviews.Content: We tried Jury's from recommendations here on Trip Advisor and once again we weren't disappointed by everyone's suggestions! We fell in love with this hotel, the service was beyond what we've experienced with other stays (even 5 star). Everyone on staff, front desk, bell hops, valet drivers and general manager were extremely welcoming. They even helped us dismantle our travel box from the top of our vehicle in traffic (and then kept the box for us in storage in the hotel) --was really a special sight my husband doesn't want to re-live! Note to other box top travelers---travel boxes on top of SUV's or Mini-vans don't clear parking garages in Boston, none of them, notta..... Hotel was clean and inviting, fabulous eclectic style. Awesome location, no vehicle needed. Close to freedom trail and lots of restaurants within easy walking distance. Bathroom, very nice, heated towel warmers, robe, etc... Toiletries lovely! The bars in the hotel were packed. The hotel is in what seems to be the "financial district" We were there on a Fri. and Sat. night---professional crowd. Highly recommend! I searched out the best deal on Travelocity and then called the hotel directly, they honored the same rate. Hope you enjoy Jury's and Boston as much as we did!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: cyberlynx7
Reviews.Content: We visit Boston every summer and stay at a different hotel each time in order to sample as many as possible and to find a "favorite". Based on countless positive reviews we selected Jurys this visit. Although the location was very good and the room satisfactory I was quite disappointed with the stark and generic ambiance. The lobby is cramped, unimpressive and awkwardly located a flight up from the street. This made a poor first impression of which we were reminded each time we arrived at or departed from the hotel. Although my husband waited at the curb for me to check in, no doorman or valet greeted him to ask if he could be of service. The front desk staff was cordial but distant. Nothing about the check-in experience, or the hotel for that matter, felt welcoming. With all the hotel choices available to Boston visitors I'd think twice before selecting Jurys.

Reviews.Title: “Judge and Jury's no longer out!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kiltedwarrior
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel in early June but have been a bit negligent in writing a review. I, as always, paid close attention to Tripadvisor reviews. Not let down in any way- a great hotel. Very modern, clean, well kitted out rooms - which I feel were spacious. The hotel is located well and only a couple of blocks from the Common and Newberry Street. What really made the hotel (as with all hotels) is the staff. They were helpful, professional and treated you as a friend - particular praise to Joanne in reception and Emily in the bar! The bar is a really jumping place which may be the only negative in the eyes of some travellers looking for a quiet place to relax in the evening. Suited me just fine - going back next week.

Reviews.Title: “Staff make this an excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Canadianbiker
Reviews.Content: We found the staff to be great. We arrived by car in a frazzle due to Boston traffic and street patterns, We were greeted calmly by staff who immediately learned our names and were very helpful. This process carried on through our stay. We would highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel”
Reviews.Author: YoYu
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my wife for 5 nights during a business trip to Boston. The hotel location is great, close to the T and at the heart of Back Bay. The hotel atmosphere is great and the stuff makes you feel that you return home after a long day. You come to the room and the bed is ready for you, there are 2 bottles of water (free) and a small chocolate. If you need to work you can do it easily from the hotel, free internet access (wireless at the lobby and wired at room), business center with printer, copying machine and facsimile - all free. Two things I didn't like: 1) The hotel room is quite small with small desk and 1 sofa. 2) Ordered Pizza from room service and was shocked to see it was tiny (it is our usual dish for late night room dining and in every hotel we were it was quite big pizza, here it was very small. Bottom line: great hotel to stay with special atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Jury's is all about the service!”
Reviews.Author: Frenchie
Reviews.Content: We were able to check in early afternoon and were given a room on the side of the Pub courtyard. Check in was managed thoroughly and quickly. Upon arrival to the room, the front desk called up to make sure all was OK. The room was nicely decorated, with 2 bathrobes, l'occitane bath products, 2 complimentary chilled water bottles, Conde Nast travel mag, free wireless as well as free use of the business centre and printer (handy for on-line check-in). Heated towel rack was a nice touch although not needed in the summer. Blow dryer was located in the closet (outside the bathroom). Beds were very comfortable. Turndown service included 2 chocolates left as a treat. Only downside: carpet in our room was a little 'worse for wear' with some noticeable stains and the pub is popular so we could hear them into the early morning. Staff were very accommodating in allowing us a late check out (mid afternoon) as our departing flight left late. Hotel is in great location, within walking distance to shopping, public transportation etc. We even walked home after the RedSox game! Hotel itself is nicely decorated although small lobby - understandable given that it is a converted former police station. The staff at Jury's were very friendly, knowledgeable and welcoming. Would definitely stay again, mainly for the service!

Reviews.Title: “exactly what we were looking for”
Reviews.Author: kr31
Reviews.Content: Arriving in Boston around 11PM after a 28 hour flight from Australia, my partner and I were looking for somewhere quiet and comfortable to recover from our journey. Jury's was perfect. Check-in was blindingly fast (and they even gave us refreshing hot towels at reception). The room was just large enough, and really comfortable. A perfectly acceptable room service meal was delivered to our room within minutes of ordering and we had a great night's sleep. And walking distance to the Public Garden next morning - couldn't have asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “Great City Hotel - Location, Energy, Extra Touches”
Reviews.Author: lynnegold
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel over the weekend. This is one of the few times when I had nothing to do with the selection of the hotel (my boyfriend did the leg work) and I was pleased with nearly everything! The hotel room was in impeccable shape and we loved the free bottles of Poland Spring we received each time the room was cleaned, the chocolates at night, and the dual headed shower. The towels were bath-sized and fluffy, the bed was super comfortable and filled with soft pillows and blankets, and the hairdryer came with extra attachments (not necessary, just a nice touch). My only complaint was that the bathroom had a frosted door, which isn't wonderful for privacy. There is a very active bar downstairs (locals love it for happy hour) but you wouldn't know it upstairs. The location puts you in walking distance to Back Bay (where hotel is located), Newbury, the parks, etc. Highly recommend for a fun city stay!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mistymask
Reviews.Content: Just back from a fantastic 7 night stay at Jurys Boston.One of the nicest hotels I've ever stayed in where we were treated like royalty from the moment of arrival Got a fantasic deal with Expedia as we got 30% off because we stayed more than 5 nights. Our room was a double superior on the 6th floor.Gorgeous bathrobes,L'Occitane products and turndown service each night.We had breakfast in their restaurant each morning where a buffet was available for $18.I had an omelette each morning as well as fresh fruit and cereal which could be ordered from the server.Delicious!! I was really impressed with the complimentary use of the internet in their business centre,We stayed for 3 nights in a Hotel in Cambridge before checking into Jurys where it cost $5 for each 15 minutes use. The staff at the front desk were always so friendly and helpful especially Joanne who was so kind to our little boy.She sent him up milk and treats one evening.Such a lovely gesture. I can highly recommend Jurys for a fantastic stay.Enjoy the pampering!!We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: GeordiesNewcastle
Reviews.Content: From checking in to checking out I cannot fault Jury's Boston. All of the staff were professional, very friendly and basically couldn't do enough to help. Our room on the 8th floor, was clean, quiet and very comfortable. We were never without clean fresh towels and the toiletries provided were absolutley gorgeous. At turndown more fresh towels and a chocolate for each guest. The hotel is only a short walk from Boston Common, Theatreland and from an indoor shopping mall and out door shops. If you like a great steak I would recommend going to Grill 23 just across the road from Jurys where I had the best steak ever.

Reviews.Title: “Not Quite There Yet (5 Star)”
Reviews.Author: Brian_NVA
Reviews.Content: We had a corner premier room (320) for a three night weekend stay in Boston. Got a substantial discount from Orbitz, at least over what was posted on the hotel website. Jury's was a good value for the discounted rate, but I would have expected better for the rack rate. The corner room was nice, but did not have a flat screen TV or ergonomic chair as advertised on Orbitz. Service was always provided with a friendly smile, but there were some kinks here and there. Follow through by the staff was not always there for requests. Despite the reservation having been made for two, the room didn't seem fully prepared for two...for example, there was only one bathrobe, one bar of soap, and insufficient towels (at least for us).
