Turn down service in the evening provided fresh ice and chocolates. My partner didn't care for the frosted glass on the bathroom door, as light from my late night forays kept her awake. We liked the barista in the lobby for morning coffee and muffins... very good. Unfortunately, they were closed Monday morning, so I had to deal with Dunkin' Donuts' lines. Free local (Boston Globe) and NY papers were available each morning in the lobby...a nice touch. As with most fancy hotels, there was no coffee maker in the room, and no vending machines in the halls. This hotel is in a great location...just blocks from the Arlington and Back Bay T stations, as well as the Theatre District and the Public Gardens. Jury's is trying hard to be a five star hotel, but isn't there yet. P.S. Don't miss a delicious dinner at Giacomo's on Columbus Ave. This site (unlike the one in the North End) does take reservations, but both are cash only. Best halibut I've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely well located Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tenrab
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Jury's for just one night at the end of a two week fly drive around New England, but we are so glad we did, this is a brilliant hotel, with the perfect blend of modern decor and old fashioned hospitality. From the moment we checked in we were impressed with the clean, modern look of the hotel and the friendiness of the staff. The room was also great, quite large with two queen size beds and a fab bathroom with almost a wet room for a shower. Having spent three nights at the Omni Parker at the start of our stay, there is no comparison Jury's wins hands down(Omni was fine, just a bit weary and dated with very small rooms) We were also impressed that food/drinks in any of the hotel's bars/restaurants were not of the extortionate price you expect of hotels generally, rather they were on par with any of the bars we visited during our stay. This is also a great hotel location wise, with many bars/restaurants being located only a few minutes walk away and about a 25 minute walk from Faneuil Hall and the more historic part of the city. All in all a great base from which to explore a lovely city.

Reviews.Title: “Not good for 3 ina room”
Reviews.Author: mogsysuffolk_England
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was very clean and friendly staff helped to make our stay enjoyable. I had booked a room for 3 people not near the evlevator; we arrived to find our room next to the elevator and only 2 beds. This was rectified by allocating another room for us but it was not big enough to have the "cot bed" out until the other 2 people had finished in the bathroom each night. This was very inconvenient. The restaurant did not cater for vegetarians during our stay there either.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Jurys Boston 14-17 May 2008”
Reviews.Author: alemap77
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our honeymoon in the US, part of which was 3 nights in Jurys Boston. We arrived and had no problem with check in and had assistance bringing our bags to the room. We had requested a corner suite room and this was exactly what we received on arrival. The room was large with plenty of storage room and also a desk and a small table and two comfy chairs. The bathroom was beautiful with excellent amenities incuding L'Occataine toileteries. There was a small bath and also a double walk in shower with a fab double shower head. We ate in the bar on the first night and the food was nice but a small menu choice. We also had to wait for our order to be taken for quite a while. It was very busy as there appeared to be some sort of convention on nearby. On the other two evenings we ordered room service and it was of a high standard. The hotel is very well located for walking to the main sights in Boston as the various sights in Boston are located fairly close to each other. The hotel is also very close to a number of T stations which was very useful for visitng attractions further away from the centre. Overall , we loved staying in Jurys and would definitely stay there again. The rooms are expensive but I think it is worth it as the service etc offered is very good. As an added bonus when the hotel realised it was our honeymoon they gave us a bottle of champagne and chocolates which was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “truly a winner”
Reviews.Author: sheba55
Reviews.Content: i stayed here for 3 nights from april 10th to 13th 2008. i had initially booked a twin room for 2 adults on hotelsclick,com and the rate was 513euro for the three nights. a week before we were due to arrive, a friend decided to travel with us. i contacted the hotel directly to enquire about the possibility of a rollaway bed for the 3rd person. i was told that i had received a complimentary upgrade and that the room could accomodate 4 adults. when we arived, after a swift check in, we were shown to our beautiful room 922. beautifully decorated, spacious with lovely l'occitane products in the bathroom. in the resturant at dinner that night, we received complimentary appetisers from the chef. my cola was refilled free of charge. breakfast was a treat each morning. the staff service was impeccable and was more 5star standard than the hotels 4 star rating. i can not say enough nice things about this hotel

Reviews.Title: “deserve its first place”
Reviews.Author: jean marc G
Reviews.Content: we stayed 4 nighs, deluxe roon in corner, great room with space. really a great hotel, great location in boston

Reviews.Title: “Right up there with the Best of 'em!”
Reviews.Author: rosebudrmm
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Jury's before, and have loved it every time. I had recently stayed in a "four star" hotel that was so severely lacking, I could not help but compare the Jury's! Everyone is so friendly and helpful. The rooms are lovely, the beds comfortable. For a 3-star hotel (I believe) this hotel has thought of everything and outshines many 4-star hotels. Instead of having to purchase bottles of water for $4, they put complimentary bottles in your fridge, which they restock! There are full-sized ionic tourmaline hair dryers with narrow attachments AND diffusers! They carry L'Occitane, which is always lovely, in the bath. Returning from a long day to Irish music playing and chocolates on my bed makes turndown so wonderful. The Cuffs bar is so lively, the restaurant delicious. Late checkout goes until 2pm!!! The hotel is also in a fabulous location close to all that Back Bay and the South End have to offer. All for a reasonable price. I promise, you will NOT be disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “Big Mistake”
Reviews.Author: jetlagged7
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of all the great reviews on this site. BAD IDEA. We checked in in the late afternoon and learned they gave our confirmed room with two double beds away (with confirmed guarantee for late arrival which we weren't late for at all) and offered us what they said was an upgrade...a corner room with one king size bed for two adults and two children. After waiting for over one hour for their engineer to figure out how they will fit in two roll-aways (which was against the fire code) they decided to move out the desk, chairs etc to fit the beds in. The roll aways were just threads away from the springs popping out, needless to say the kids were up all night and so then were my husband and I. The manager on duty offered half off for the night, after I said we weren't paying for the night. Not exactly the gold standard in customer service...the room should have been offered at no charge right off the bat since they broke their confirmation with us, had us wait for over an hour to try and resolve and then delivered two horrific roll-aways. We checked out in the morning and moved to another hotel. When they learned we were checking out two nights early they offered us the junior suite. By that time we were so aggravated and had made other arrangements and were ready to go. We moved over to the Hyatt Regency...professional staff and very clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but nearly flawless”
Reviews.Author: thehebrewhoya
Reviews.Content: Pluses: good location, professional and friendly staff, well-appointed and well-sized rooms (why do people think they're small?), tasty food from room service, free water bottles in the minibar and no tempting junk food (unless you request it to be stocked). Minuses: overpriced valet parking (use a garage instead), overpriced a la carte menu (order the pre-set breakfasts via the door tag instead), not all rooms have bathtubs (but the shower was nice), crowded bar downstairs (no problems with noise, and the bar may be your scene, but it wasn't for me). I didn't have as good a view of the city at Jury's, but I thought our room was great and convenient. The room was smaller than the other Boston hotel I stayed at, but it was very comfortable and the corridors were nicer. Lots of staff at the desk and doors, though checking in or out can get congested at times. The elevators had this awful shiny wallpaper in them, but the stairs by the bar had a nice waterfall... I will be booking Jury's again for my next trip to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ukgirl48
Reviews.Content: Our first time to Boston. Got the hotel through recommindations on TripAdvisor. Best staff ever had at a hotel - were all very friendly and polite. Hotel was in a fab location. Would certainly recommend this, and when we return will definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: janiel
Reviews.Content: This is a really great Hotel. It is very centrally located.( No need for a car). The Staff are really great, very helpful and Friendly. The Hotel itself it Beautiful, clean and tastefully decorated. The bedroom we stayed in was very spacious with a great shower. The bar was really busy with a great atmosphere. We had the Bar food which was great quality, great value and huge portions. We ate in the Restaurant last year and that was also very good. I would highly recommend this Hotel and will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: tinytay1or1981
Reviews.Content: Could not fault the Jurys though didn't utilise all its features. The double bedroom was small but perfectly formed. There was also a mini fridge in the room which was replenished daily with two bottles of still water yet enough room to house own refreshments. The bathroom only has a shower, not an issue for me, but I appreciate the need for some travellers to have a bath. Luxury toiletries (including ear buds and cotton wool) which were, again, replaced after use. I used the fitness room at 6am, 7am, 8am and 6pm and, although small (6 cardio machines, rack of free weights and modular weights) I didn't have a problem with having to Q for equipment. It also has three tv screens, magazines, a water machine and towels. As other reviews have mentioned; location's ideal, staff are pleasant and helpfull and internet access was a bonus. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would gladly stay here again if I ever return to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Jurys”
Reviews.Author: orchard_03
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 6 night stay in Boston at Jurys hotel in early April, staying in a deluxe double room with my husband and 9 year old daughter. The hotel is very good. Room was plenty big enough with free internet access which we found extremely useful - for booking restaurant tables, checking opening times for attractions and checking in to our return flight online. We had a laptop but there are computers available downstairs if needed. Location is very good. We walked to the waterfront (Aquarium & Childrens Museum) on the first day which is just a little bit too far, especially with a child, but we quickly found the T very easy to use and only just around the corner from the hotel. It also meant we explored Newbury Street & Trinity Church which we may not have done if further away from Back Bay. We had breakfast in the hotel on 3 mornings but other days just went to Au Bon Pain next door to Arlington T Station which was fine when we didn't need a big meal. If having breakfast in house, the buffet is best value - you can order waffles with the buffet & they were great! Staff at the hotel were all very friendly and there are various dining options all very close by as well as the bar or restaurant at the hotel itself. Heartily recommended!

Reviews.Title: “No Coffeemaker”
Reviews.Author: AnnaAnnapolis
Reviews.Content: While the location was very convenient, there was no coffeemaker in the room. We asked for one, and initially were told one would be brought up, but half an hour later, the story changed. They had all been taken out of the rooms and none was available. This turned out to be quite inconvenient for me, an early riser. My husband and I also enjoy a cup of tea in the afternoon, but that was not available either. We had to walk 4-5 city blocks on a blustery spring day to find a cup of tea at an Au BonPain. This is a standard amenity in other hotels. We won't stay there again because this simple convenince is not available. There was also a lot of thumping bass noise from the basement bar until quite late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing time at the Jurys Boston Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Albs86
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Jurys Boston Hotel for a week at the end of March with my boyfriend and had an absolutely incredible time. It was my boyfriends first time in Boston whereas I was returning after 11 years from having lived their previously. We had an incredible week and were very sad to leave. The Jurys Hotel was by far one of the nicest hotels I've ever stayed at, and I've stayed at a fair few. The hotel staff were very friendly and very accommodating through-out the whole trip. The room was lovely, some have said the rooms were quite small but I thought it was a great size. Everything about it was wonderful. We had breakfast in the hotel a couple of times, we didnt have the buffet as we didnt think we could possibly eat enough food to justify spending $18. But what we did have was great. It's in an absolute perfect location for everything, a two minute walk from the 'T' station, some great restaurants in the area, one especially great meal was at the Bonfire Steakhouse, a bit on the pricey side but so so worth it. We had a great night there. The complimentary internet in the Jurys business centre was very useful as it was the only means of communication with some friends I had in the area. We had drinks in the bar Cuffs a couple of times too, it had a great atmosphere and we weren't disturbed by it at night at all. I don't have a negative thing to say about our stay at the Jurys, and when we go back to Boston we will definately be staying with them again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: slcSF
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Jurys with my 17 yo daughter for 4 nights in Feb/08 and loved the hotel. The room was extremely comfortable, if a little small, but the bathroom quite spacious. The beds, luxurious sheets and towels, heated towel rack, and L'Occitane toiletries made us feel pampered. The best thing about the Jurys for us was the location! Three blocks from Newbury Street, within easy walking distance to Copley Place, Back Bay, the Public Garden, and Downtown Crossing made the Jurys the ideal hotel for us. Public transportation could not have been easier: less than 2 blocks from Arlington Station on the Green Line, within 4 blocks of South Station on the Orange Line which is also the Back Bay stop for Amtrack. A Hertz rental car facility was only a couple blocks away near the Park Plaza Hotel. In short, a wonderful base from which to explore the Boston area. While the location is fairly quiet in the evening, the Jurys' hotel bar is quite popular and filled with revelry every night. We asked for a quiet room and never heard a peep from the crowds in the bar. It wasn't until our last day that I discovered the spacious and comfortable sitting area in the hotel lobby. It's separate from, and off to the left of, the check-in area.

Reviews.Title: “Jury's Boston Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Franticflo
Reviews.Content: Stayed this week-end at Jury's and had a lovely time. They're very welcoming from the time we pulled up in our car to the time we left. While there really aren't many restaurants immediately around Jury's, there are a bunch of great looking restaurants within a 10-15 minute walk (especially on Tremont Street). The hotel rooms are small, but pretty, and well-designed. In the interest of being "green" the thermostat is kept at 69 degrees, which is fine, but that temperature is cold when you're getting out of the shower (no baths). They should have a heat lamp in that bathroom so you don't freeze! Other than that, the only negative I have is the $39 plus taxes charge for parking your car. Worked out to almost 25% of the room cost. However, we would recommend Jury's for a nice Boston hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Jury's - Trip Advisors Were Spot On”
Reviews.Author: honorGalway_Ireland
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Jury's for five nights recently and it was excellent. All the staff we met were very helpful and polite. The room was beautiful, very clean and the free bottles of water were a lovely touch. There is free Internet access in the business centre which was handy. The location is very central - there are plenty of good restaurants with in easy walking distance and the shops on Newbury and Boylston are close by. We caught the T at Airlington Station just two blocks away. I knew that Jury's was No. 1 for hotels in Boston on Trip Advisor but it was even better than I expected.

Reviews.Title: “Jurys Boston is Fab”
Reviews.Author: TahirDublin
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at Jurys Boston for five days over Paddys weekend. I work in the hotel business and can be very critical of other hotels but I must say I could not find fault with Jurys. The rooms were spotless, the staff were really friendly and helpful and the food...well not gourmet but american! I think I overloaded on fries. Just watch if you are having breakfast and do not want to eat much order off the a la carte menu as the buffet menu is great but costs $18.00 per person.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter037
Reviews.Content: Fantastic place, terrific staff, warm welcome and very clean. Food very good. Will definately be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CorkPaul23
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel, well located in a fantastic city. On arrival, the staff are friendly and courteous. The room was reasonably sized and clean. The bed was very comfortable and there was a 32 inch TV. One nice touch was that 2 complimentary bottles of water were in the fridge and replaced every day. The maid service was excellent and the room was thoroughly cleaned each day with a turn down service each evening. as mentioned previously, Cuffs bar is nice and very popular locally. The hotel organise a bus to the outlet shops in Wrentham every day for $38 per person and it takes about an hour to get there. On the bus you will get a coupon book and if the aim of your visit is shopping this is very useful. The hotel is well located in Boston and Boston Common is within 5 minutes walk of the hotel. For shopping Newbury street is 10 minutes away. The closest T station is arlington and even more shopping can be found in Quincy Market (3 stops on the green line to Government Buildings) One restaurant worth mentioning is Stephanies on Newbury St. Really good fine dining and when we went on a Monday night it was full but luckily had made a reservation through the hotel. Overall, a great city was made better by a lovely central hotel with staff whoi were very pleasant and genuine

Reviews.Title: “Best bar in town”
Reviews.Author: MJMGlasgow
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very central for shopping, sightseeing etc and from the moment we arrived, we were very well looked after by staff. Cuff's bar has a great atmosphere, and seems to be the place to be after a hard day's work at the office!! I would say though that the food in the bar was disappointing. A great place to have breakfast is the YWCA just round the corner from the hotel - don't be put off by the paper plates and plastic cutlery. The food was excellent and the place was spotless. Breakfasts were superb!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Dana_SF
Reviews.Content: I did a tremendous amount of research before our 3 night trip to Boston to find just the right hotel: not too expensive (under $200/night), but nice enough to feel like we were in a special place. Jurys did noit dissappoint. The staff is friendly and attentive, the decor is upscale and modern in the lobby and the rooms, and the room was quiet and very well appointed (gorgeous bathroom with all stone tile/counter tops and nice robes, nice linens, furniture, etc). They give 2 bottles of water free everyday, wired AND wireless internet is free, and room service was good and extremely prompt (10 mins on average for breakfast to arrive everyday). The location is also ideal. I highly recommend this place! TIP: the room has a stereo with a CD player. The have a limited selection of CDs to lend at the front desk, so bring your own.

Reviews.Title: “Great Sevice and Location”
Reviews.Author: BraveTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Jurys from Saturday-Wednesday. The service was excellent. The location is ideal for getting anywhere in Boston. It is a $24 (including tip) cab ride from the airport. I was traveling with my daughter and the first night they gave us a King size bed rather than two queens. There was not another room available until Sunday but they moved us as soon as a room became available. No inconvenience to us at all. The rooms are spacious and the beds are extremely comfortable. The housekeeping staff did a great job daily and turned down the beds at night. The blankets are wrapped between two sheets for those who enjoy this. Personally, I can't stand it if the hotels do not do this so notice it right away. The rooms have empty refrigerators which was great too. We were on the 4th and 9th floors during out stay. The pub in the hotel, Cuffs, was very busy on Saturday night but we did not hear any noise in our rooms as mentioned in other reviews. Our departing flight was not until 7:00 pm so the hotel held our luggage so we could get in another day of sightseeing. We had dinner at Cuffs one night which was very good and relaxing with the fireplace. We had breakfast one morning in the restaurant in the hotel too. Just a light breakfast which was ideal. Full breakfasts were available. Starbucks is two blocks away for those who need that kick. About a 5 minute walk. The subway stop is right beside Starbucks. The Consierge service was great. Take advantage of this service as they were all very helpful. The doormen were very friendly. (other than the one who couldn't pull himself away from playing solitaire on the computer) I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: GalleyBayBride
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed here for 4 nights over Valentines day, our room was on the third floor, didn't have a fantastic view but wasn't awful. The room itself was lovely, spacious and clean. The bathroom was also a fair size and spotless. We did hear some construction noise from the left of the hotel in the mornings and also deliveries to the hotel as we were above the loading bay. The staff we encountered were friendly and happy to help. We ate in the Stanhope Grille for breakfast and for valentines day, the food was very nice, and the price was very reasonable for what you got. Cuff's seems to be the place to be, the bar was always packed and sometimes a little to noisy we went and sat upstairs in the hotel bar. The location of this hotel is excellant, everything is within walking distance. On the whole we had a fantastic time in Boston and we certainly come back here again.

Reviews.Title: “How a hotel should be”
Reviews.Author: Baltimoron
Reviews.Content: We decided to book our President's Day weekend getaway at Jurys after seeing the reviews on Tripadvisor. It is a terrific place to stay-warm, friendly, and good value, given that it's a centrally located hotel (near Newbury street) in downtown Boston. The hotel is tastefully decorated-the lobby is warm and inviting and there are ample public spaces in which to read and work. The rooms are smallish-we booked a larger room, which still measured only about 300 square feet but are very nice. What I like in particular is that Jurys does not bill you for little extras, that I think should be included as part of a hotel stay. For instance, in the room, there is free wired and wireless internet (as well as in the common areas, there are public computers and wireless access available). There were two waters in the fridge for free as well as two free milk-based drinks to help you sleep at night. There was a nice complimentary gym and friendly service from the front desk and concierge. For singles, there is a swinging bar on the ground floor which was packed on the weekend evenings. The food in the hotel is solid-the breakfast buffet is expensive at $18/person but that's fairly standard for most hotels of this quality. When I come back to Boston again, there's no doubt that I'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great one night stay at jurys”
Reviews.Author: kenyonmartin2003
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. We stayed one night -- Sat. night -- on holiday weekend. We got a decent price -- im sure there were better out there but the hotel is very nice. Great front desk service, etc. The room we had was very small -- but nicely decorated and not a problem. The location was great. Ten minute walk to theatre. Lots of very popular clubs/bars close buy -- for the under 30 crowd it looked like. Jurys itself had a very crowded bar and restaurant but also a quieter lounge upstairs. Nothing negative to say at all. This will be my hotel in boston.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic 5oth birthday getaway”
Reviews.Author: everywheretraveller
Reviews.Content: My husband planned this trip as a surprise 50th birthday gift.... what a fantastic place to stay..... the staff was awesome the room was beautiuful pure luxury the bed was the most comfortable sleep we have ever had...... the view was excellent from our corner suite... room service was absolutely perfect!!!.. we would stay there any time and we reccomend this to anyone looking for a great experience in a fantastic location!!...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelman15
Reviews.Content: This Hotel has everything you want! I'm 27 y/o and i went on a weekend get-a-way w/ my girl to explore the city of Boston and maybe see some snow (and we did). The Hotel is about a 5 min walk away from Boston Common (the park) and it is next to all the shops and nice resturants! Upon my check in i wanted to eat at grill 23 but it was a 2 hour wait....not to worry the staff at Jurys called a couple of steak houses around the area and was able to get me a table with no wait! We went to Bonfire, a resturant run by Todd English and had an amazing time! Once we got back to Jurys there was a line that was wrapped around the door...we we're a little shocked to why all these ppl we're waiting out in the 20 degree weather to get into the hotel...it trns out the bar is a "hot spot" for locals to party at! How can you beat that? As for the room the views are avg, but the bed and pillows are so comfertable, i sunk eight into them after a long day of exploring the city! I woucl come back in a heart beat...great place great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Jurys”
Reviews.Author: FlyboyPA151
Reviews.Content: Based on the reviews, the Jurys seemed like a reliable bet for great stay in Boston. While our stay was similarly satisfying like other reviewers experiences, I felt that it was a little overpriced for what you got - although it IS downtown Boston. The room was clean, very nicely appointed and had an extremely large bathroom with heated towel racks - a nice touch if you ask me. The bedroom area of our Deluxe King room was pretty small, however, but adequate. One disappointing feature of the hotel is the exorbitantly priced Valet. $40 per day, and all they do is drive it to the nearest private parking garage with whom they have a deal with. You would do yourself a favor by utilizing one of the THREE parking garages within a block of the hotel: (http://maps.google.com/maps?near=350+Stuart+St,+Boston ,+MA+02116&geocode=&q=parking&f=l&hl=en&sll=42.350052, -71.071318&sspn=0.001947,0.005021&layer=c&ie=UTF8&ll= 42.35171,-71.071308&spn=0.007786,0.020084&z=16&om= 0&cbll=42.350935,-71.070727) The hotel has an Irish Bar - Cuffs - and they serve up an amazing lobster bisque! The bartender even served up my Guinness properly - with a shamrock design in the frothy head. We had a mind to skip our dinner reservations at Grill 23 across the street and just stay here! Of course, we're glad we didn't, as the meal was tremendous at Grill 23 as well!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: relaxaway
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at the Jury's Hotel. The Hotel is in a great location and walking distance to wonderful shopping. T stops are also very close to Hotel which makes it easy to get over to the North End, or Cambridge. I was a little disappointed in my stay this time as the first time the service was fantastik, and this time the staff was not as eager to please. I had a few issues with housekeeping, but in the end they were resolved. The bar in the hotel, Cuff's is a terrific place to hang out. It is very busy with hotel guests and people who work in the area. Being a single person this is a great place to meet people and make new friends. The bar staff are very friendly and fun. Looking forward to staying again at the Jury's Boston Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great stay at Jurys in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: woodchucker
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night for a little weekend getaway in Boston. We chose Jurys based on the TripAdvisor reviews and weren't disappointed! What a lovely hotel, and the people who worked there were super nice and accomodating. We got a fantastic deal through one of the discount hotel websites, and when we called to ask if we could check in an hour early or so, they upgraded our room to a deluxe. The room was very nice, spotlessly clean and attractive, the bathroom was good-sized with very nice amenities, there was free internet access and a flat-screen T.V. The beds were super comfortable. There was a fair amount of traffic noise from outside our window (we had a room facing Berkeley Street) but I consider this just part of staying at a hotel in a city. The public areas are very attractive and kind of quirky, with lighting overhead, on the stairs, and on a "waterfall wall" next to the stairs that change colors from green to blue to purple to red, etc.There are very unusual gas fireplaces covered with sparkly stones (I know it sounds odd, but it looks great!) The trash containers near the elevators had a bowl of potpourri on one side ! We ate dinner at Cuffs, the bar on the lower level, and had a great meal of sandwiches and fries, with two awesome desserts which I would highly recommend (a trio of ice creams in cups made of thin cookies and a blackberry creme brulee). Prices were very reasonable.We had breakfast in the Stanhope restaurant, and it was very good, too (pricey, though-- if you don't order either the full or the continental buffet, where the beverages are included, watch out for the prices on the juices and coffee!). All in all, it was a great stay and I'd love to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ian_ok
Reviews.Content: We only had one night in Boston after finishing a cruise and before we headed to the Florida sun. We chose this hotel for its location and the good reviews it had received. We were not disappointed. The hotel looked beautiful with all its Christmas decorations. The bedroom was very comfortable with fantastic beds and good bathroom. And even better high speed internet access was free. Staff throughout were extremely, especially in the business centre when we wanted to print documents out and scan other documents in â€“ which was all done at no charge. (Watch out for the telephone charges though! ) We ate at an excellent nearby fish restaurant called Skipjacks (Clarendon Street) just a few minutes walk from the hotel and had a memorable meal. There were plenty of other restaurants nearby if you want to venture out of the hotel. Overall we thoroughly enjoyed our short stay in the city and this hotel in particular. Certainly if we were back in Boston again would want to stay at Juryâ€™s.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Boston Hotel”
Reviews.Author: APicc
Reviews.Content: If I could stay anywhere in Boston, it would be at Jury's. Our first experience staying there was about 2 1/2 years ago, for just one night. Ever since then, whenever we have an occassion to stay in downtown Boston, we stay at Jury's. Immaculately clean, spacious marble bathrooms, and excellent location. Just across the street from Grill 23 if you are looking for a good meal too!

Reviews.Title: “New Year In Boston”
Reviews.Author: alfie92
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Jurys Boston Hotel where we stayed for 4 nights over the New Year. Excellent location in the Back Bay area with a 5 minute walk to the Prudential Centre shopping mall and access to the ' T ' only 1 block away. The hotel is within easy reach of all the shops,cafes and restaurants on Newbury Street as well as the delightful Boston Common. The hotel is very welcoming and the bedroom was nice, large and clean. The furnishing's were nice and new and the bathroom was a good size with L'occatiane products and an impressive shower. The hotel bar, 'Cuffs', is handy for a drink after you've hit the shops and the food served there is very nice. We also ate in the hotels Stanhope Grill Restaurant on News Year Eve which was superb. We had breakfast there every morning and you could either order off the menu or have the full buffet breakfast that included bacon, sausage and scrambled eggs or the continental breakfast which included fresh fruit, yoghurt, pastries. We really enjoyed our stay at the hotel and time in Boston and will definitely return to both.

Reviews.Title: “Character and location galore”
Reviews.Author: NEtraveler07
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay. The hotel is lovely and has many details that I apprectiate. Interesting appointments and attention to small luxurious decorative details. It is small, but it is a city hotel with an old world feel. The bed was sumptuously comfortable. There are also small stylish details, such as note paper with quotes in the room, great bar and restaurant options onsite. Check in was seamless and all the staff including doormen were very helpful and pleasant. I was however diappointed that upon leaving I left behind an expensive and unique jacket that was unable to be found within hours of my departure. As we were leaving the room, the chambermaid asked us if we were checking out...unfortunate.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Ben1400
Reviews.Content: We'd heard so many good things about this hotel but it still exceeded our expectations. I got a great deal through Hotwire, but would definitely pay full price to stay again. The service was perfect, the room was super clean, the bed was comfortable and the shower was great.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: juleskee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights from 6th Dec & was more than pleasantly surprised & pleased! This hotel is in a superb location with only minutes walk to the Copley & Prudential Malls, Boylston & Newbury St. It is also less than 2 mins walk from the closest T Station on Arlington. Our room was spacious with the most comfortable hotel beds I have ever slept in! The hotel bar 'Cuffs' was hopping practically every night.....with a line outside on Saturday night waiting for entry!!!! The food in the restaurant was pretty good & the breakfast buffet for $18 was more than substantial! The front desk staff were very pleasant & helpful & the concierge couldn't do enough for us.....more than helpful! All in all, I would highly recommend this hotel & would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay @ Jury'sin Back Bay”
Reviews.Author: Buckshee
Reviews.Content: Choose Jury's Boston primarily because of it's reviews here on Tripadvisor and have to give a big thumbs up up to all the previous reviewers. Couldn't fault the place on any front at all. This is one of Jurys's "hotels" as opposed to a Jurys "Inn" and the differece in class is immediately obvious. Rooms were large and well decorated and the bathroom and shower were especially well appointed. Staff extremely pleasant and helpful particularly the concierge and the front door guy. Food was top class as was Cuff's bar which was extremely lively every single evening we were there. Top class athmosphere and refreshments on offer into the wee small hours. The hotel is well located in the Back Bay area and within strolling distance of "downtown" and some of the city centre malls. Plenty of well recommended restuarants on the doorstep so you certainly won't go hungry. Free wi-fi all over the hotel if you have your own laptop and free regular internet connection on two Pc's adjacent to reception which was most heplful on our 6 day stay for making various bookings. Best thing I could say about Jury's Boston is that if I ever make it back to Boston I won't be wasting even a single minute looking at another hotel, I'll just be searching for the best possible rate for Jurys and booking it.

Reviews.Title: “Gem”
Reviews.Author: psycomum68
Reviews.Content: Cant add anymore than everyone else has said... Hotel is an absolute gem. Position excellent. Immaculately clean. Food good. But overall whats makes this hotel so good is the staff . From the cleaners to the concierge, from the minute you arrive they cant do enough for you. If you are looking for a hotel in Boston look no further. I am a Travel Agent and very rarely can find no fault with a hotel, but this one has made it through with no faults.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: BowensSwanseaUK
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fab, friendly welcoming staff, great rooms and a great location especially for the Back Bay train station. Special mention has to be given to the Concierge, a lovely lady who couldn't do enough to help. And Cuffs, the downstairs bar had a great atmosphere and lovely hot chocolate!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and rooms”
Reviews.Author: londonfamily3
Reviews.Content: Had one night here at the beginning of a trip around New England - perfect location for all that Boston offers. The staff were extremely helpful, welcoming and friendly. Rooms really good and clean. Wouldn't stay anywhere else in Boston for value and location. Fine for young children too.

Reviews.Title: “Mainly Excellent”
Reviews.Author: ozymandias69
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel from 12th to 20th November inclusive. From arrival to departure all the staff were very friendly and extremely helpful, always willing to go the extra mile to make sure everything was OK. Special mention must be made of the concierge(s) to whom nothing was too much trouble. Whilst we had one of the smaller rooms this was comfortable and clean. Given that we were only using it for sleeping, it was entirely adequate for our purposes. The Hotel is modern, the decor is excellent and the public rooms good. It is ideally situated, close to Newbury Street and the Prudential Centre and Copley Place Even Downtown Crossing, Fanueil and Quincey market are all within a 15 - 20 minute walk. Given that we were there a week the charge of $27 for a Coffee Maker was reasonable. OK - what about the negatives. Our room was at the rear of the Hotel and was quite noisy, we were awakened every morning between 0530 and 0600 by garbage collection and deliveries. The much vaunted Cuffs Bar is OK if you beloing to the younger set and can tolerate 100+ Decibels, given the layout this noise also percolates into Il Barista upstairs. It also 'drove us' to eat out of the Hotel every night. Whilst we were there the staff in Il Barista stopped serving at 2200 hrs (no way did we want to venture into Cuffs) which in a Hotel of this quality is deplorable. The Reading Room is very under utilised - an oasis of calm which could be better used - tip - buy your drinks and take them there! For a Hotel of this quality to run out of supplies for the Coffee Maker, Corn Flakes and Bran Flakes is really not on. However all the negatives above should be taken in the context of - yes we would definitely return - a little more attention to the 'extra' bits would make this a really excellent hotel - Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Value Lacking”
Reviews.Author: WSyankee
Reviews.Content: The Jurys Hotel in Boston is a nice facility but the value received for the room rate is questionable. When you pay a top rate, you expect a top end experience all the way around and I didn't experience that at Jurys. It's what is missing that makes Jurys fall short. The good things: 1) The rooms are very nice and well appointed. The tiled bathrooms are large and feature a tub plus a stand up shower with multi nossle sprays. I had no problems with water pressure. The radio system was turned on when I first arrived in the room which gave me the impression that this place is special. Nice touch. 2) The main lobby has a lot of places to sit and gather with friends or business clients or just for a peaceful read of the morning paper. 3) The staff was very eager to please and make the stay more enjoyable. I know a night manager came to a buddy's room at 1 am to make up a fold away couch. 4) The bar and restaurant were nice and again everyone was eager to please. The missing: 1) The main lobby coffee bar was not open and not operating in the am (or at all as far as I could tell) and the hotel was booked for the evening. 2) There were no vending machines anywhere to get a soda. 3) The workout room is a joke for this class a hotel. A few machines but no steam, sauna, or nothing. You get what you pay for and in this case, I felt like I was staying in a super elegant Comfort Inn and I didn't even get a free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Not Nice Enough For the money”
Reviews.Author: rnicu39
Reviews.Content: Jury's was in a great location. Room service was good and the staff was nice. I only had a couple of problems. The water pressure was terrible in the shower and I didn't feel like I even had enough water to say I had showered. Second the temperature in the rooms is controlled by the hotel so no matter how I dialed the thermostat it was always at a set temperature the one they set! The coffee absoulutely sucked and they charged me five bucks for it. The rooms are small but the bed was comfortable and the room was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: eddieore
Reviews.Content: We are just back from 4 nights in Boston & stayed in Jurys Hotel. We really enjoyed everything about the hotel-friendly staff, rooms, the showers!!, the bath robes, location, helpfulness of everyone, cleanliness, Cuffs Bar. We have travelled quite a bit and this hotel had everything, & more, than we could ever want on a city break. Brilliant Jurys-well done

Reviews.Title: “good place but expensive for what it is”
Reviews.Author: Garak
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the hotel four or five time since 2005 and actually quite like it. Especially the bar inside the hotel is a happening place and great for pre-dinner drinks. During the recent stay I found the hotel staff as friendly as usual but for some reason I felt it was time to try something else next time when I am in Boston. Reflecting on this I think that the Jurys simply isnâ€™t anything special and I guess I liked it more a couple of years ago when I stayed there first. Now it feels just like any other big hotel with relatively small rooms and high prices. Itâ€™s a shame since nothing is really wrong with the place but on the other hand I donâ€™t feel compelled to stay there anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Jury's was good”
Reviews.Author: Jojill
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my teenage son from 20th October for 5 days during some unexpectedly warm weather. Really enjoyed our stay. Comfortable rooms, friendly staff, good location. Had 3 breakfasts which added to our costs but very enjoyable. Good restaurant called "Laurel" just next door in Berkley St. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Quality and Service at Jurys”
Reviews.Author: MalcolmOrlando
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a 5th floor corner room strretside. Was surprised to have minimal noise despite rabid BoSox fans enjoying the World Series. The staff- from front door to check-in and especialy concierge- were GREAT. Even the maid staff seemed happy! Couldn't recommend this hotel more.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and well run hotel”
Reviews.Author: FelixStowe10
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights towards the end of October 07 and enjoyed our stay at Jury's. We found the staff very attentive - they recommended good places for breakfast and were generally very helpful throughout our stay. The room we had on the 9th floor was larger than usual and well decorated. The facilities were of much higher standard that we have experienced at other hotels. The location was good for us although it might not suit everyone. It was conveniently located near the Back Bay railway station so we could easily get the train to New York. It did not appear too difficult to get to the hotel from the airport using the metro although we were so tired after the flight we opted for a taxi in the end. It is a little way from the central area of Boston but it is an easy and pleasant walk through the common and there is the metro nearby or bus if necessary. Our only slight problem was the noise from the building work behind the hotel which started at 8am. We were usually on our way out at this time so not a problem to us. I didn't notice any internal noise as a previous reviewer reported. All in all a good place to stay and we would definitely return again.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect spot.”
Reviews.Author: J_and_A_1
Reviews.Content: Housed in what was once a police headquarters, we chose this hotel based on reviews at this site, location, and price. We were not disappointed. We had two rooms, a superior and a deluxe. The deluxe rooms are slightly larger with a bigger bathroom with a separate shower. We liked the superior room better because it was cozier with good furniture placement. The extra space in the deluxe room was just an empty area where an extra chair should have been. Of course we liked the bathroom better in the deluxe room, so good luck making your own choice. The rooms have nice tones to them with rich fabrics. The bathrooms are nice, but fall a little short of a true luxurious look. The rest of the hotel is also very nice with a modern cool look in the lobby and bar area that helps give the hotel a boutique feel. The location is pretty good for enjoying Boston. You are within walking distance of most of the major attractions. The immediate area around the hotel is quiet, but just walk two blocks in most directions and you are in the action. Finally, the value for this hotel is pretty good. It seems to fill a void in Boston between very expensive, and expensive but not worth it. With nice rooms, good location, and a nice boutique feel, this hotel is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Not much more to add”
Reviews.Author: gcoop17
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in september and really have little to add to the reviews already posted. Everything really good. Professional reception staff, excellent and friendly door men, very helpful barman who kept me right on American bar ettiquette when asked. No complaints about the room - spacious, clean and comfortable. For a modern non boutique hotel you could not really ask for much more. Well done Jurys.

Reviews.Title: “Jury's is simply fantastic”
Reviews.Author: boston6_8guy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I actually got married at Jury's Boston Hotel, and it couldn't have been a more perfect experience! I found this hotel during Boston's restaurant week, and enjoyed dining at the Stanhope Grill (which is incredibly good.) After seeing how kind and accomplished the staff was, and how consistent they were at being so great, we booked the restaurant and 10 rooms for our big day. It couldn't have been a better experience, both the wedding and the hotel stay. All of our parents and family who stayed in the hotel had a fantastic time with great service and comfortable rooms. The larger two-double-bed rooms had a gorgeous bathroom, and our single-king was nice too. The room was spotless, and all the staff was super kind. If you want easy, friendly, elegant service that is better than the supposed-best hotels, than Jury's is the place. There's no finer property in town when you consider the whole package, and the location is superb. Considering I paid way over $10K for my wedding to be held here, I think every cent was well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “A superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lewes
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 3 wonderful nights in this excellent hotel. Its location is very convenient for most of the city's attractions. The reception staff/porters were extremely welcoming, and our room was delightful, very quiet, and had an excellent large shower. Although we did not sample the breakfasts, we did enjoy an excellent meal in their restaurant. Faultless!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kenmason11
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights and had a great time. Very nice hotel, great staff. Very close walking distance to many things. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly perfect hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jdtOregon
Reviews.Content: We took an east coast vacation for the first time, and were a little nervous about where to stay. We looked at trip advisor to give some recommendations. Jury's Boston Hotel was rated #1 on the list, so I thought we would give it a try. It definitely deserves the rating. It is a small, intimate hotel, and the staff is very friendly and helpful. The room was really nice, but the bed was amazing! It was the most comfortable bed we have had in a hotel (I actually liked it better than my own!) The hotel is very conveniently located for people without a car. We were able to walk one block and get on the trolley for a great tour of the city. Lots of great restaurants nearby, great shopping. We had a great time, and would recommend anyone stay there that wants to be around friendly, helpful people!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mark17
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 4 nights at the Jury's, everything was great. The service was exceptional (especially Heather the concierge, who advised us on the best places to go to). We had room 738 a corner room over looking the street, the room was very large for a city centre hotel. The room was very clean and the bed was one of the most comfortable that we have ever slept in. I would recommend this hotel to everyone wanting to visit Boston. If you get a chance go to Grill 23 across the road from the hotel, best steaks you will ever have.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: pbh73
Reviews.Content: Wonderful conversion of the old Police HQ in a convenient location a short walk from Copley Place and many of Boston's attractions and shopping. Very comfortable rooms with traditional decor. Great service and friendly staff makes this an ideal base for your Boston stay, whether on vacation or business. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best”
Reviews.Author: davysims
Reviews.Content: At the price I was expecting someting well above average and was not dissappointed. The only possible let down was the restaurant on the Sunday evening, which was very poor. However, that was well made up by the genuinely friendly staff (yes there are a lot of very pleasent people in Boston - but some seems to be playing the part). We had seven nights. The room was made up almost as soon as we left it, so when we came back for an afternoon rest it was perfect. The bar "Cuffs" is excellent. recemmended

Reviews.Title: “Good Cop Shop”
Reviews.Author: pnmdotcom
Reviews.Content: Nicely converted police HQ. Room not huge but Ok, would have preffered king size bed. Room very clean, good toiletries and huge bath towels. Slightly spooky TV that tuned onto the hotel entertainment menu when somebody in another room was trying to purchase adult entertainment! However, the front desk dealt with this very efficiently when contacted. Indeed all the staff we encountered were excellent. Good lively bar in the basement, really good atmosphere for a hotel bar and not expensive. If arriving by air use the subway, $2, and get off at Arlington and use the Berkeley Street exit which is just two blocks away. If arriving from the south by train get off at Back Bay station and turn right outside then first right onto Stuart Street. The hotel is on the right just five minutes walk. Enjoyed the stay, nicely located five minutes from the Common in a good area, slightly expensive but would consider staying again.

Reviews.Title: “high specification, comfort and quality”
Reviews.Author: ospreyUK_europe
Reviews.Content: high specification on rooms, quality , with attention to detail . service friendly , location central. we were very pleased and no wonder it was No 1 , with Tripadvisor. from 2 world wide travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Good but surely not the best in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: rumblesLeicesterUK
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel without being brilliant. The rooms were nice but small. It is conveniantly located within walking distance of lots of great sites. it is astonishingly busy at night with an irish theme pub attached to the hotel. We were high up and it didnt disturb although floors below may have problems.Price wise it was expensive although no real complaints. A comfortable hotel although surely not the best in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent but Pricey”
Reviews.Author: pfpurcell
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights with my family from Aug 13th. on a stopover en route back to London. I have a 9yo and a 15yo. The only gripe was that, while excellent, it was very pricey. The service was superb, although the room was not huge, (it is the converted Police HQ). If you can get it for a good price then I strongly recommend it, but at $275 a night it was not good value for money. Patrick

Reviews.Title: “Loved Jury's Boston!”
Reviews.Author: FranM
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a 6 night stay in Boston. We booked this hotel on Expedia based on the reviews from Tripadvisor, and they did not disappoint. Thanks to the reviews we were prepared for no coffee maker in the room (fine, we don't drink coffee anyway), and no tub in the bathroom (I asked, they have tubs in the higher category rooms and suites, it wasn't a big deal, the shower was fabulous, with 2 shower heads!). The turn down service at night was a nice touch and after the 2nd night we were getting 2 chocolates, not just one (there were 2 of us in the room). We found the check in staff a delight, very helpful with directions, storing bags etc. The concierge was great as well. The bonus of this hotel is location. Very close to shopping and sights. The restaurant is beyond good. We had a pizza that made me think I'd died and gone to heaven! Service was attentive but not hovering. Excellent. Yes, there was some construction, but we had an "inside" courtyard room, so it didn't bother us. The front desk told us if you find an Internet rate, they will honour it. Good to know for next time. And if we return to Boston, which we certainly hope to do, it will be Jury's all the way!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, friendly hotel.”
Reviews.Author: taglio1
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here in August 2007. We arrived from CA at 7:30 am and by the time we reached the hotel it was still several hours to check-in. We did the paperwork and left our bags with the concierge and asked for an early check-in if possible. My daughter and I went to kill time having breakfast and shopping, but the concierge called and we were in our room getting ready to get a nap by 10:45am!!! The room was a king and on the small side but the bathroom was very spacious and nice. The carpet in the room could use cleaning. We stayed 6 nights and enjoyed the cool well decorated hotel. They turned down the bed every night and the bed was comfortable with crisp linens. Location was wonderful and very close to the "T" (metro)Newberry Street, lots of shopping, historical sites and restaurants. Daniel, our conciegre was awesome and helped us get situated and ordered tickets etc. VERY friendly and helpful staff. On check out our flight was scheduled to depart at 7:45 pm so the hotel gave us a late check out.

Reviews.Title: “Another excellent visit”
Reviews.Author: sue-manchester
Reviews.Content: This was our second time in Boston and second time at Jurys. Check-in staff and porters were as friendly, polite and helpful as we'd remembered them and the room (deluxe doubles, 9th floor) was spot on. I like this hotel because there is very little (if any) noise from adjoining rooms. However, here was a fair amount of noise from the street on this visit (commencing around 8am and continuing until tea time) because of a big building project going on just along Stuart St. If you are staying in the next few weeks I'd advise that you ask for a room that does not face onto Stuart Street. Some free tourist stuff for you: Fort Independance (South Boston),open at weekends only and easy to reach by T and bus #9. Historic fort with great tours, pleasant beach and views of harbour. USS Constitution is also free to visit and easy to get to. If you have a week saver T ticket it is also valid for the boat trip from Long Wharf to Charlestown Navy Yard at no cost. A great way to arrive. This is easily combined with a climb up the Bunker Hill Monument. My husband highly recommends the Samuel Adams Brewery Tour (few dollars donation requested). Trip round the brewery and a generous sampling session with souvenir glass (word of warning - children are admitted on the tour but not allowed in the bar where the sampling goes on). T to Stony Brook and a couple of minutes walk at most.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic Place.....book this now!”
Reviews.Author: dre51
Reviews.Content: This is one great hotel! It's located in an historic building which used to be the Police Headquarters for Boston, yet the rooms are ultra hip, modern, and very spacious. We booked this as the last night of a seven day trip to New England and wished we would have stayed here instead of the Fairmont Copley Plaza, where we had spent three days at the start of our vacation. The bathroom was the biggest one I've seen in years, marble, glass, and even a heated towel rack. It had a separate, glass doored shower with two shower heads, a separate tub and a gorgeous vanity. The bed was comfy and the place was quiet. We did have a drink in the bar (there are two) - one is crazy noisy - it's called "Cuffs" and filled with twenty and thirty-somethings. The other is a lobby bar, nice and quiet and sedate - more our style. In the morning they'll make you a latte or espresso too. Book this place...it's worth it. It was hundreds of dollars less PER night than what we spent at the Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: mollyBarcelona
Reviews.Content: I would have given five points to this hotel hadn't been for its staff. It is a good hotel indeed. Rooms are giant and clean, beds are confortable, bathrooms are big and they provide wonderful bathrobes. The only but is the staff at the reception desk. Rude and unhelpful. Sorry to say so, they can't care less about their hosts. It's a pity that in a hotel with this level and price, employees don't make an effort. After all, it should be part of their job too.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Lovely”
Reviews.Author: VivaG
Reviews.Content: Jury's hotel is centrally located in the Cityof Boston and walkable almost to everything worthwhile except for the Seaport and wharf area. It's located in the former police headquarters which fits well into the mixtures of older and newer architecture in the downtown area. Our room the first night was a regular king room and although not huge it was extremely well appointed with all the conveniences. The furniture was deep cherry in color including the bathroom vanity. The bathroom had tile and marble. The color scheeme was green, gold and tan which is perfect since this is supposed to be an "Irish" Hotel. The linens were frette and gorgeously high thread count. The duvet and sham covers were luxurious and I only wish I could have them at my home. I loved that they had always replenished complimentary bottles of drinking water in the inroom fridge and 24 hour room service for snacks, meals and all types of beverages. The front desk personnel were fast, efficient, and mostly Irish. The head concierge was tremendously accomodating when I could finally get a hold of him and helped with dinner reservations and a private driving tour of the city. HIs restaurant suggestions met our needs exactly and we were trememndously impressed by the reccommendations. Housekeeping did a tremendous job and the same housekeeper tends to the same block of rooms day after day which I found refreshing, so I knew my tips were going directly to the person responsible for the upkeep. There is a restaurant and bar in the hotel. The bar was accessible and quite a hot spot in the evening. The lounge/bathrooms even offer cloth hand towels for drying ones hands with l'occitane soap and lotion. This hotel doesn't msis much in terms of lavishly serving their clientele. The door men and valets remembered us by name. When we returned for 4 nights at the end of our East Coast holiday we were given a corner room with a view which was more spacious, though the smaller room was almost more charming. I can only sing the praises of the Jury's Boston Hotel. It's true, it is only 3 years old and I'm hoping they keep up with the excellent standards that we experienced. I would stay at this hotel again, and definately reccommend it to any traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Muzzdobetter
Reviews.Content: Can only reinforce what others have said. We arrived late after 3 flights from the UK, and were met at the taxi, bags taken, check in very quick, and upstairs in no time. Staff were helpful at all times-we asked the doorman where we could find a diner type place for breakfast-he directed us to Billys, 2 blocks past the Subway Station, which was simple but cheap and effective. I'd also recommend the Cottonwood Cafe one block along Berkley Street for good atmosphere and excellent reasonably priced food.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mong1114
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a weekend trip to Boston, and we stayed at the Jury's hotel. It was a very nice hotel, and we didn't have any problems, but I must say that I am surprised that it is ranked the #1 hotel in Boston. that is not a complaint about the hotel, rather I would think that surely there are nicer hotels out there. The hotel is very nicely decorated, very contemporary and centrally located. It was clean and the service was very good. The concierge, Heather, was particularly helpful in recommending and booking dinner reservations. We ate breakfast in the dining room each morning and the food was very good. They have a nice breakfast buffet that I think was around $18 per person, comparable to any large hotel. The bar attracts a lively crowd, especially after work, and there is a nice outdoor terrace for when the weather is nice. Be sure to visit the bar area to see the police memorabilia (the hotel is a renovated police HQ); very interesting! Where the hotel lacks is in basic amenities...there is no coffee maker, no complimentary newspaper, no pool, no gift shop. It wasn't a huge deal to us, but one of the reasons I was surprised the hotel is in the #1 spot. The rooms are on the small side, and though we received turndown service each night, we found it amusing that they left a single chocolate each night, despite the fact that there were clearly 2 people staying in the room. We also thought that the bed was uncomfortable. When we first arrived, we loved it...you sink right in. Same with the pillows. However, sleeping on it is a different story...our backs were killing us because the mattresses are so soft. So, if you prefer a firmer mattress, this is NOT the hotel for you! Just a matter of preference. Here is another tip...the hotel charges $39 a day for parking, which I think is pretty standard among Boston Hotels. However, we did notice towards the end of our stay that there is a parking garage approximately a block past the hotel on Stuart Street that charges $12 for all day parking. It might be something worth looking into! Having said all that, we would consider staying at the Jury's on future visits. I think it would come down to price...if we could stay at the Marriott or Lenox at a better price, we'd probably try one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: daveCalifornia
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel simply based on the reviews we read here and I have to tell you they are right on all counts!!! This is a GREAT hotel... My family of four stayed here Aug12th thru the 15th and had a wonderful time. The staff is great and the hotel is just gorgeous...centrally located and very near a subway stop(arlington off the green line...three stops from Fenway) The beds are the most comfortable I have ever slept on at any hotel chain and the pillows...well there seemed to be a never ending supply of them laying around! The hotel is a decent walk (15 minutes or so) from the freedom trail and what I would call central Boston but for the price we paid(199.00 per night) it was a steal!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: linkakk
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for a boston getaway. Stylish, serene, impeccable details. My only complaint was having to leave in the morning. Be careful if you would like a tub and shower. Our corner king had only a shower, which was no problem for the night but for longer stays I would have liked a tub in the bathroom. Given the excellent attention to detail, I have no doubt that if I mentioned this to the front desk, we would have been moved without a hesitation to a room with a tub.

Reviews.Title: “Intersting Irish hotel in an old Police station”
Reviews.Author: Mad537
Reviews.Content: Within walking distance to super restaurants, shopping and Boston Commons. This converted Boston police station is a top notch hotel. The lounge on the ground floor is Cuffs, with pictures of old Boston policemen. Very friendly and accommodating staff. The room was relaxing and peaceful.

Reviews.Title: “Jury's was fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: kmoran927
Reviews.Content: Jury's was a great little surprise - wonderful location, walking distance to many Boston sites and areas. The staff were friendly and helpful. We will definitely stay again when in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely good”
Reviews.Author: Traveller73London
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights at the Jury's Boston. Arriving straight from the airport on a Saturday evening I was a little alarmed by the noise coming from the ground floor bar. However, once we had checked in and arrived in our room there was no noise at all despite being only three floors above the bar. The room was generous and very well appointed and beds were comfortable. Complimentary water was provided and replenished daily - and despite the summer humidity outside we were able to turn the AC off and enjoy a comfortable night's sleep. The only problem we experienced was a smell of cigarette smoke for the first three nights of our stay despite being on a non smoking floor. This was presumably coming from a neighbouring room but when I asked reception about this they sent someone up to spray the corridor with ioniser within ten minutes. Location is great, a short work from Copley Square and Prudential centre shops (all the NYC stores!) and Filene's Basement. Also recommend Smith & Wollensky steak house a short walk in the opposite direction (another NYC import!!). In summary, great hotel, excellent location and superb service. (Only criticism is no tea and coffee making in room!)

Reviews.Title: “Solid 4-star experience”
Reviews.Author: SanFranciscoSfgal
Reviews.Content: The Jurys was a solid 4-star hotel experience. The service was unfailingly professional and friendly, from the bell staff to the concierge to the front desk. Our room, a deluxe with two double beds, was standard-size and was decorated nicely in a contemporary, neutral palette. The extra touches in the room that we appreciated were: free bottled water in the mini-fridge, a full-sized hairdryer that wasn't attached to the wall, Aveda toiletries, comfy double-sheeted beds with good-quality linens, a CD player, a fairly large television, a cool retro bedside clock, turndown service with chocolates, and 24 hour room service (with decent food, no less!) The only negative I can think of about the room is that there were no cotton balls or q-tips provided in the bathroom. It wouldn't have been a big deal had I not forgotten mine. I'm sure I could have called housekeeping and they would have brought some. Finally, the decor of the lobby was a little bit off. The hotel has a mostly traditional-to-contemporary feel, so I am not sure why the designer thought it would be a good idea to throw in some neon lights under the stairs and weird disco panels on the walls of the wood-paneled elevators. Dunno, maybe they were trying to make it look more trendy. I thought it looked out of place. Overall, though, a good place to stay and a good location for shopping in Copley and along Newbury Street.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stuart84
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Jurys Boston for four nights and chose it after reading the Trip Advisor reviews. We were not disappointed, the hotel has atmosphere, the staff are friendly, the bar and restaurant are well used and popular. The location was ideal for us, not too close to the centre but within easy walking distance of shops, bars, restaurants. Definitely a great base from which to explore Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Style, Luxury and Amazing restaurant”
Reviews.Author: tlhjar
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 2 days while there for work and booked based on TripAdvisor Reviews. They were right! Beautiful, comfortable rooms, elegant lobby. Free internet off to the left of the lobby, in their business center (they have the computers, you don't have to have your own) and a large, very nice sitting room. Concierge and front desk were great. Restaurant on the high priced side (what hotel isn't) but exceptional and memorable. Crab Flatbread, strawberry rhubarb shortcake, gnocchi, salads, steak, all magnificent and original. Would absolutely be my first choice if I ever go to Boston again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Hotels we've stayed”
Reviews.Author: sacanon
Reviews.Content: We travel enough to know a great hotel and this is it! The staff was A+. The atmosphere was A+. The rooms had such charm. This hotel was a former police headquarters and when they did renovations, they did so properly. The rooms were a bit small though. However, they take care of every detail in making you feel that you are their number one priority. We'll be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it !”
Reviews.Author: RichDe
Reviews.Content: One of the nicest hotels we've stayed at. It was a bit expensive, but very nice for a one night weekend stay. Great location, near restaurants, theaters, and subway stops. Super comfortable beds and pillows. Extremely quiet - often a pet peeve of ours at other hotels. A very nice restaurant for breakfast - I recommend the scrambled eggs. The only complaint I have, and I must dig deep, is the cost to park. After paying premium rates for the room, $39 / day seemed tough. With that said, surrounding public garages are $30-35 / day, so maybe it's not a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: jpk35
Reviews.Content: Loved it! Loved the decor, location, bar, bed.....everything. We stayed for our 3rd anniversary and it was so lovely. We hated to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Bucajack
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel. Staff are ultra friendly and helpful. Great bar with great food that is reasonably priced. Twin room was huge and comfortable. The shower could have held four people easily! Complimentary internet in the business center. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - modern, but large classical rooms”
Reviews.Author: Mr&MrsWilko
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights - a couple of days sight-seeing and 4 days on a business trip. Great hotel. In the converted police headquarters - so old building but very comfortable and modern inside. The staff were really helpful - had advice and help from the main desk and the concierge. Only 1 concierge on duty, so might have to wait to see him/her, that said spends a lot of time helping with queries and you really feel looked after. Lots of sofas and chairs off reception to wait in. Bedroom was very comfortable. Excellent bed and pillows, spacious desk (with free internet and plug-in cable(!) and free wi-fi). Bathroom had separate shower cubicle (although talking to colleagues at my business meeting, this was not true in all rooms, so might want to ask for room with separate shower, if that is important to you). Public areas very good - relaxed bar with outdoor seating area and breakfast (both restaurant and room service) were good. Liked it a lot!

Reviews.Title: “Jurys - Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VA07
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Boston (July 2007) and stayed in Jurys hotel. We liked it very much. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was nicely decorated and clean. The bed was very comfortable. We would definitely stay here again if we come to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “A home from home in Back Bay.”
Reviews.Author: Lanerrossi
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Jurys from July 1st through July 8th. The whole experience was excellent. Everybody at the hotel from doorman - front desk - concierges - cleaning staff were marvellous and couldnt have done more to ensure our stay was absolutely spot on. The hotel is ideally placed a short walk away from most things you want to see. Anything you are not sure about - then have a chat with any of the concierges - nothing seems too much trouble. Our room - a corner king executive - was large, bright and airy. Beds were very comfortable - and each night - as one would expect in a hotel of this standard - the sheets were turned down and the obligatory chocolates left on the pillow - still a nice touch though. I hired the coffee maker for the week and I am glad i did. Each day the tray was replenished witha selection of coffees and tea, and fresh milk and cream left in the fridge together with water bottles. I would recommend that anyone staying here hire the coffee makers - its $27 dollars for the week or Â£14 . I dont see what the fuss about hiring them is - I have never stayed anywhere in America except smaller backwood places where there has been any kind of brewing facility in the room , and certainly never seen one in any city hotels. We had the feeling whilst we were there that everyone genuinely wanted us to be there and we were made very welcome . We will certainly go back should we ever return to Boston . For me its a no brainer to stay anywhere else. This is a very good hotel with a laid back cosy atmosphere - not like many hotels of this standard which can be a bit stuffy and staid. Places we ate at and thought OK Joes - Hamburgers and american fare Laurel Grill - next to hotel - good food and very reasonable California Pizza - OK for quick meals Changs Chinese Bistro - reasonable standards , good value. Rock Bottom Beer Company - American - OK - cheap ! Maggianos Little Italy - Excellent - cheap ! All the above are in easy walking distance of the hotel and whilst they are probably not in the good food guide to Boston a la this forum - they will stand muster with most eating establishments for good reasonably priced meals - buts its all a matter of choice and opinion. All I can say is we found them OK. Things I can recommend to do Duck Tour Sky Walk Whale Watch Harbour Tour Charlestown and Bunker Hill Things i wouldnt recommend Wrentham Village Cape Cod Excursion - Gray line Spirit Cruise. All in all a wonderful stay in a wonderful hotel in a wonderful city Pity about British Airways - but thats another story.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel with awesome showers”
Reviews.Author: workandplay8
Reviews.Content: Fun tacky lobby, pretty good staff, excellent room, particularly the walk-in tile showers. I'm so tired of $200+ a night hotels with standard 32" shower tubs and those silly curved curtain rods. Nasty Days Inn in rural PA use them - can't the better hotels find a classier solution? Jury's by far had the nicest (but not the biggest) bathrooms I've seen in Boston. Excellent fixtures, but best of all, the only walk-in tile shower in town so far. Otherwise, renovations, details, surfaces, everything was in excellent shape. Mattresses were very good, pillows excellent, clock radio was actually high quality. Room was very clean. Worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT SPOT!”
Reviews.Author: ShelOt
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Jury's Boston 3 times now as part of a semi-annual "girls night". The hotel is in a perfect location for such an evening! It is right in the heart of the back bay and within walking distance to several fun spots although the downstairs bar is always lively and alot of fun! The staff is very helpful and the beds are very comfortable! You can certainly get better deals on rooms in Boston but Jury's is definitely worth spending a little more!!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: NolaGal_2
Reviews.Content: The room was luxurious and romantic - double sheeted blankets, ample pillows, turn-down service with chocolates, ice container filled with ice in the evening. Loved the service. The folks behind the desk as well as the concierge were very helpful - where to catch the "T", where to have dinner that night (happy to call for reservations), breakfast places other than their own wonderful restaurant, etc. Perfect location. Local restaurants that were a "find" for us included: Giacomo's (Italian - reasonably priced and rated well by Rachel Ray in a recent visit), and Charlie's sandwich shoppe for Blueberry pancakes (yum).

Reviews.Title: “Where did the irish go?”
Reviews.Author: carlv247
Reviews.Content: Beautiful property in a very good neighborhood. Decor, ambiance, it's all there and my wife and I would probably be back - but first we're going to check out another hotel on our next trip to Boston. This was our first with an overnight stay, and I was looking forward to the Irish hospitality and the attentive staff that other reviewers were raving about. I know Irish hotels from the New York City, and they have (mostly) irish staff.
