However, if I were irish myself, I would probably opt to spend the summer in Ireland too, which is where we both thought the Jurys hotel staff had ventured off for. We met literally just 3 irish during our short stay, and the attention other reviewers got during breakfast, dinner and the rest, well, it just wasn't quite there. The room was very nice and clean but needed some maintenance (tear in the bed linens, scratches on furniture, not entirely scrubbed down shower stall). Jean, the valet, was the one and only bright spot during our stay. He was upbeat and really enjoying his work: welcoming guests. All in all, we left with mixed feelings, so next time we'll check out some other hotel unless the Jurys has a good deal going because otherwise this is a good place to spend the night and have few drinks at the bar.

Reviews.Title: “A must”
Reviews.Author: WordTravelerBrazil
Reviews.Content: Very nice environment and honest services. Its a great cost/benefit deal.

Reviews.Title: “Saturday night stay”
Reviews.Author: Beachlover742
Reviews.Content: We went to Jurys for a bachelorette party. The hotel was beautiful. The staff very nice. The room service food was gross. We had chicken tenders and french fries at 2 in the morning and they were totally disgusting. The location is great though, walking distance to everything. Very nice time. The rooms were smaller than average, the bathrooms were beautiful but only a shower no bath.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: florida999
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem and I could not fault it in any way. Staff are fantastic, rooms are extremely well appointed and spotless. Location is ideal with metro 200yds away and shops/restuarants a short walk. If you are staying in Boston you must use this hotel !!

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Torita
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the Jurys, especially considering the price. It was less expensive than the Boston Marriott Copley Place, where I stayed when I visited Boston last year, and I preferred both the large room and the general location just a few blocks from Newbury Street. As a frequent visitor to Boston, I think this will be the hotel I stay at from now on!

Reviews.Title: “Jurys Boston - First Class Stay for mid range price”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Uh
Reviews.Content: We had to stay one night in Boston to conduct some personal business, but wanted to make the trip somewhat social and fun. The Jurys Boston Hotel certainly made the accomodation part of our stay hassle free. The hotel is the former Boston Police Headquarters, and has been tastefully remodeled (except for the funky mirrors in the elevators!). Our room with two double beds was first class, not too small as some reviews have said. Three adults stayed comforably, though we admittedly packed light. Free internet service was both wired and wireless, and easy to connect to. The beds were comfortable, and the bedding was changed as requested prior to our arrival (due to a down feather allergy). The hotel allowed us to check in early (which they do not guarantee but will try to accomodate). The bathroom was large, with nice modern decor. It featured a large, walk-in shower with dual shower heads. One of my few minor nit-picks was that water leaked out at the base of the door and soaked the bath mat (not a deal breaker). The room included a lockable safe, mini-bar, iron, hair dryer, robe and umbrella for your use. The hotel has a nice restaurant (The Stanhope) and bar (Cuffs). We had a drink at the bar and watched sports on the big screen TVs. We had breakfast at the Stanhope the next morning. It was of the usual "big hotel" price ($7-18), but I have to say I did not regret the price-convenience trade off because it was EXCELLENT. The location was VERY easy to find by car, right off the Mass. Pike Prudential Center exit. It is close to Copley Square, Newberry Street and Boston Common. My wife recently stayed at the Four Seasons in Boston, and although she liked it, said it had nothing over the Jurys (which was ~$200 less per night). We love going to Boston, and do not get there enough. Next time we DO go, it is almost certain we will stay at the Jurys Boston hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay at central location”
Reviews.Author: fkaway
Reviews.Content: This hotel with a busy Irish bar is centrally located in the Back Bay area, just minutes away by foot to Copley Square, where youâ€™ll find lots of sights (Prudential Center = tallest building in Boston), shopping opportunities and restaurants. Even the bus stop for the city bus tour (Hop on, hop off) is within 5 minutes walk reachable, adjacent to the Hard Rock CafÃ©. Our spacious room used for 2 nights on the 2nd floor had twin bed, due to fire regulations the hotel doesnâ€™t allow an additional rollaway bed for the 3rd adult, just used extra-sheets/linen. Room had inroom safe, free WIFI, Iron board, and a spacious bathroom. Service was good and helpful, easy-going atmosphere in the hotel. The breakfast buffet with sightkitchen costs $16.-p.p. and was just ok, nothing fancy or spectacular. The fitness room had a running band, crosstrainer, weight machines and dumbbells. We absolutely enjoyed our stay at this hotel in this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Average Size Room, Above Average Service”
Reviews.Author: NhTravelmama
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Jury's for business on May 1, 2007. While traffic getting there was badly snarled by the Red Sox game, the hotel was more than worth the trouble. As we checked in, the staff was very accomodating and went the extra mile to make sure all of our needs would be met. My room was smaller than a lot of hotels I have stayed at before, but very well appointed. The bed was very comfortable, and all the pillows one could ever need were provided. The stereo was playing some soft music when I came in, which at first spooked me (did I just walk in on someone?!), but once I realized I was alone in my room I appreciated the comforting touch. The bathroom was very decadent, with a separate tub from shower, marble flooring, and more shampoos and soaps than one could possibly use in a night! The heated towel rack was a wonderful touch that I'm going to think about adding to my home. The full body shower head was great after a long car ride. The room would have been cramped for more than 2 people, but alone it was perfection. I would love to go back again. Every member of the staff said, "Hello" and anytime we needed help, any staff member we spoke with was eager to help in any way they could. They were all friendly, and not the average "snooty" types that you often run into in finer hotels. Thanks to all at Jury's for a relaxing stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Jury has Reached a Verdict!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tackle
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a conference and the convention hotels were booked. I made a reservation at Jurys on Travelocity; the price was steep: it averaged $340 per night before taxes. For that price I expect something special.... Location: Excellent; within an easy walk of the Charles River, Back Bay, Copley Square, Newbury Street, and Hynes Convention Centre. Check-in: Fast, friendly, and accurate. Top notch in fact. Room: Small but nicely appointed. No view. Large modern bathroom with heated towel racks (nice touch) and high quality soaps and shampoo (but nothing exceptional). Beds were very comfortable. TV and stereo were excellent. FREE INTERNET SERVICE IN THE ROOM: YAHOO!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Only downside with the room: slightly stained carpeting. Concierge: knowledgeable and friendly. Business Centre: Excellent and responsive. Hotel Bar: hopping and busy. Check-out: Efficient, friendly and accurate. Overall impression: an excellent business hotel, well run, and friendly, but not a five star experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Bluemantraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Jurys in Boston for 4 nights in April 2007 and found everything about the hotel to be fantastic. The location is really good - close by a T station, near to loads of bars and restaurants and within a 15 min walk of Quincy Market and the central Boston area. The rooms are well laid out and the service was excellent. I would recommend the hotel and are already looking forward to returning. The people of Boston were so friendly and it is one of the nicest cities we have visited and excellent for shopping and eating out. One slight disappointment was when we were leaving the hotel the door man recommended we take the hotel transfer service to the Airport for $25 which we took for convenience. When we arrived at the Airport the driver charged us $35 ($40 including tip) which was a bit pricey for a 10 min drive and not what we had been quoted prior to setting off. This did not spoil our stay though - we just know to take the taxi next time.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel near to everything!”
Reviews.Author: cngw
Reviews.Content: Booked the Jurys Boston Hotel online for three nights and got a last minute 15% off - so that was a good start. When I arrived, the room was not available. The staff was MOST apologetic and had another room arranged for me at a hotel a couple blocks away. Of course, the paid for the first night - and gave me an upgrade on my next stay. The service at the Jurys Boston is excellent - the staff know what they are suppose to do and do it in a friendly, professional manner. The hotel was, I believe, a former police station and has a very solid feel to it and is tastefully - and not overly - decorated. The rooms are generously spacious with all amenities in working order, including the complimentary Internet service. The lack of an in-room coffee maker with a selection of teas, coffee and other hot drinks, however, was bit of a disappointment as this was expected in a hotel of this caliber. The location is excellent - near to Newbury Street, walking distance to the Commons and Downtown and stone's throw away from the Prudential Centre. Overall, a very good experience and definitely recommended for those who prefer the smaller hotels

Reviews.Title: “Love Boston”
Reviews.Author: PeterandLuli
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was number 1 on travel advisor, and it desrves to be there. Visited Boston for the first time between 7 - 9 April 2007. The valet service, although not inexpensive was well worth it (40$ per day), the front desk recognised me and sent us up to our # 646, "Deluxe King Room". Complemetry wireless internet, great size room, big bathroom. The Jury's is very central a short walk to Newberry St. for shopping and just a bit further to boston common park. Wifey loved the body cream, lotions shampoos and so on, she says they are quality stuff (what do I know) The gourmet restaurant was amazing. great lamb chops. Didn't try the Irish pub, I hope to go back and try it out.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service at Jurys, Boston”
Reviews.Author: Philomena
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Jury's Boston at the beginning of this month for 3 nights. Everything about our stay was excellent - especially the room and the attention given to us by the staff - all of whom were very friendly and helpful. When my husband and I were checking in, other members of staff were showing my teenagers the map of the area etc. We booked Jury's because it came up as the No1 choice on tripadvisor. It absolutely deserves this ranking. The room was large, beautifully decorated with a superb bathroom. We ate in the bar downstairs which was very good. The hotel staff were extremely helpful in organising a trip to the outlet shopping mall (highly recommended - the coach driver provides extra discount vouchers which make up for some of the cost of the trip itself - really good value). If you're planning a trip to Boston, you can't go wrong with Jury's..

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the Jurys”
Reviews.Author: Penguin_Fan
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. Great staff, good location, nice ambience, nice extra touches. No constant extra fees, e.g., for sending faxes.

Reviews.Title: “Eloquent”
Reviews.Author: nic1047
Reviews.Content: Once the top cop shop (HQ) and recently converted to a very eloquent hotel with very very friendly staff. Has a charm which most of the big chain establishments lack. Good location on the edge of Charming Back Bay just a 3 minute walk to Newbury Street, Copley Square and Arlington T stop and 10 minutes to Downtown. Hotel restaurants and bar in the basement are excellent and worth a visit even for non residents although there are dozens of great places to eat within a few minutes walk. Not for the budget traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: GoneTil9
Reviews.Content: Jury's is a nice hotel. The lobby is beautiful. It's in a fantastic location too. The bed was ok, a little firm for my liking but the comforter and pillows were nice. The room was actually very small and there wasn't a lot of room on the sides of the bed. I liked how the room had a CD player. Bathroom was nice. Good, but not great, water pressure in the shower. I didn't have to pay for the stay, but it seems like the prices are good compared to other hotels in the area so I'd probably stay again. However if I could I would opt for the Marriott or Westin because I know Marriott beds are more comfy, and I've heard the Westin beds are comfy too.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!!”
Reviews.Author: halsy2311
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from an 8 day stay with my mum. We booked the hotel purely on the strength of reviews read on here and weren't disappointed. The rooms are very well appointed, we had a large two double bedded room with shower. As stated by many previously, the beds are to die for!! Its the little touches that make this hotel stand out. The complimentary bottles of water each day and newspaper. The ice and turn down service and the exceptionally friendly staff. The Stanhope Grill food is worth the higher than norm prices as it is was one of the best meals we had during our stay. Equally the bar food is reasonably priced and very tasty. There is nothing we could fault about the hotel and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hotelier558905
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel to people travelling to Boston. They run a fine property and provide outstanding service.

Reviews.Title: “St. Patricks Day magic”
Reviews.Author: madpaddyo
Reviews.Content: We were unable to travel to Ireland for St Patricks Day week, and decided that 5 days in Boston would be the next best thing. And where else to stay but in an Irish owned hotel ! The Jury"s Hotel was splendid in design, trendy yet warm and cozy. The staff was polished and personable. The rooms decor was stunning, the feather bedding and crisp linens devine! We also must mention that we had the BEST full Irish breakfast ever, and this is no casual comment since my husband is a Dubliner. Thank you so very much for the grand time. We have resolved to spend next St. Patricks Day with you , along with some friends and family to share in your wonderful hospitality. Your delighted guests, Michael and Carolyn Foley. P.S. Thanks for the "magical" snow storm on 3/16.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: LillyAtlanta
Reviews.Content: On our way back from skiing in Maine, checked in on a FREEZING cold night with plans to walk to a restaurant in Copley Square. Instead we checked out the bar area of the Jurys, which seemed to be the place to hang out. Nicely dressed crowd of interesting people. Ended up ordering dinner off of the bar menu. The lobster bisque was some of the best I've ever had. Reasonably priced menu and great atmosphere. The decor at the hotel is very modern, nicely appointed and boutique-like and the rooms, although not oversized, are comfortable. Great mattress and the shower was heavenly. Wish we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DVS
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on Trip Advisor, we booked our reservation with this hotel. The staff could not have been any more helpful and friendly. The room was wonderful. It had a comfy bed, tons of great pillows,blackout curtains, stereo, two complimentary waters and big bathroom. The room was very clean. We loved our stay at this hotel. The only negative was our room was close to the elevator so it was not very quiet and the doors slam shut so loudly that it woke me up several times. I would advise getting a room at the end of the hallway on the side away from the street if a quiet room is important. Other than that, it was a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: AJS2006
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2nts after a skiing trip in Vermont. Excellent service, modern interior with a lively bar area (the bar food is excellent by the way!!) Rooms are very large and modern. Only thing this hotel lacks is a swimming pool or jacuzzi. About a 15min walk into the centre of Boston. Excellent choice if travelling to Boston!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dedfar
Reviews.Content: I am from Boston and now live in CA where my wife is from. We visit Boston a lot and try to stay in different places. We've stayed in just about every area of the city at least once by now. I ranked this hotel excellent in the context of the price. The location is great. It is very clean, modern looking and had a bunch of nice touches thrown in that other hotels either don't have or want to charge you for (free internet, large-screen tv, dvd. etc.). The bar in the lobby is a lot of fun and all of the stafff was great. You shouldn't expect a four seasons experience, but you won't pay that either. I read someone complained about the room being small. Ours was not. Sometimes I find if you book through expedia or hotels.com you do end up with smaller rooms. I booked with the hotel's website and found a good deal. While I"ll keep trying hotels for the experience, once I start to repeat, this will be the first on my list.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: jkmri
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a one night stay at the Jurys Boston Hotel. I've been a Trip Advisor member for years now and have never felt compelled to write a review until now. This hotel was the best in Boston that we've ever stayed at. The staff was great and the rooms were nicely appointed and very clean. We loved the heated towel rack!! I could go on about all the amenities and the little things that made the hotel so great, but you just have to believe all the rave reviews because they're true. Kudos Jurys and keep doing what you're doing!! We'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way...”
Reviews.Author: gizana
Reviews.Content: We made reservations at Jurys solely based on trip advisor's reviews, and it did not dissapoint. Why would anyone stay anywhere else in Boston? We are used to staying at the usual 4 or 5 star, especially Four Seasons, and I would put Jurys right up there. Frankly, I don't see the point of why you would pay an additional $200+ per night to stay at the Four Seasons, because all the amenities are the same as well as the service is above and beyond excellent. A couple of weeks before we arrived I spoke to Richard, the guest services manager about some restaurants and other things we wanted to do, and I guess I had mentioned that it was my wedding anniversary. To our surprise, upon our arrival, we had a beautiful display of champagne, chocolates and fruit awaiting us in our room. I don't even remember that I told him that, but he remembered! So, yes - we would definitely stay there again if ever in Boston, and you should too!!

Reviews.Title: “I didnt want to go home”
Reviews.Author: nottinghamgirls
Reviews.Content: Large, quiet and comfortable rooms. Nice and comfy beds with nice and soft bedding also loads of pillows. Very clean and smart. Fluffy and Large towels on a nice heated rail, lovely Aveda toiletries (we very very well stocked). Powerful Shower and nice large bath. Fridge in room with complementary bottled water Hotel staff all extremely friendly and helpful. Fabulous turndown service with nice classical music. Lively and friendly bar. Everything finished to a nice standard not just in the rooms but also reception and corridors. Close to everything, most things are in walking distance , it is also close to a T subway stop. I didnâ€™t want to go home

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: privatewire
Reviews.Content: This is a great Hotel in Boston, the rooms are large and comfortable (the bed especially) and are well soundproofed. Cuffs bar which is downstairs is a lively, atmospheric place to enjoy an evening and is obviously popular with locals. What also impressed me was the quality of the staff at Jurys, who were all extremely friendly and helpful, (especially Jean or John the doorman) at big hotels this is not always the case, but here, the staff seem to be well trained and happy to be at work. We found the location of the hotel to be ideal for our needs because it was near to bars, restaurants etc and also very handy for the T if you wanted to venture further afield. We love Boston as a city, and when we return we would not stay anywhere else than Jurys.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - couldn't be happier!”
Reviews.Author: ll127
Reviews.Content: Made reservations based on the reviews on TripAdvisor - right on target. Great location, value, service.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: kazdaz
Reviews.Content: We booked the Juryâ€™s Hotel for our first trip to Boston on the recommendations of other Trip Advisor travelers & we were not disappointed. Hotel was lovely. Very clean & smart (as you'd expect with a new hotel I guess). All the staff were very helpful & friendly (especially the concierge at finding a pub that was showing the premiership games over the new year period!) Our room was spacious and well decorated with enough storage space for clothes, cases etc. The only negative we found was the lack of lights. There were several lamps and up-lighters, but in the main bedroom area, no ceiling light, great for effect, but a little impractical at times. The onsite bar, Cuffs, was a great place to unwind. It serves good food and gets quite lively near and on the weekend Location wise we found we could walk everywhere. Minutes to Copely Sq & Prudential Centre and only around 15 -20 min walk to Quincey Market. We will definitely be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Service”
Reviews.Author: Liberal_Laney
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in at the Jurys Boston Hotel over a weekend in mid-December. Overall, the hotel was nice. We enjoyed the plush furnishings and nice attitude of the staff. The location was great for site-seeing, shopping and was near a lot of wonderful restaurants. However there were a few caveats which keep this hotel from remaining a 5 star. ~ We had to choose between a bathtube and a shower, we could not have both. ~The restaurant was expensive (30$ for breakfast) and the bar was so packed everynight we didn't have the opportunity to try it out. ~The doormen were always talking and never opened the door for us, and we had half our luggage unloaded from the taxi before they stepped up to help us. This isn't a big deal, but it is their job. Overall, the hotel was nice and I would definitely go there again when we return to Boston in April.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: shinyhappy
Reviews.Content: Just back from a week long stay at Jurys Boston Hotel. Hotel was in a wonderful location, within walking distance of major sites, and for those further afield ,taxis were cheap and underground even cheaper! The rooms were comfortable with 2 queen size beds...not ideal for sharing tho! CD player and TV were a bonus as everything was closed on Xmas eve and Xmas Day. Hotel Bar was open tho which helped. My only negative about the hotel was the over priced luke warm food served at the bar!! The morning buffet breakfast was 16 dollars p.p. (but well worth the extra money.) There was also a great diner around the corner from the hotel where breakfast was a more reasonable 6 dollars p.p. The hotel staff were extremely helpful and obliging (one waitress was very unfriendly, but she was only there on Xmas eve so didn't upset me too much). Nuala was a wonderful wealth of information..thank you! I would definately stay here again. Loved being close to Hard Rock Cafe and great shops on Boylston Street

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Jurys!”
Reviews.Author: kaykat4533
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Jurys hotel. The location is good, it's not too close to any one thing, but keep in mind that Boston is really quite spread out. It was easy to walk to the malls, restaurants, etc. I was very happy with the cleanliness of the room. Staff members were not overly nice when entering the hotel, but I think that's because there is a bar on the first floor which gets many non-hotel guests. Once the doormen recognized us, they were friendly. The hotel is decorated modern and pretty. There were guests of all ages staying there. We ordered desert from room service one night; i got a Blue Cheesecake (which to me was blueberries). Once I took a bite I realized it was actually blue cheese cake. Big difference! The staff removed the cake from the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great staff, All round Big Hitter”
Reviews.Author: Tenerife_in_2_days
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Juryâ€™s Boston from 25th December to 1st January 2007. After arriving at 8.00pm we were met by the staff in a very friendly manner â€“ they couldnâ€™t do too much to help. Room was on the 9th floor and very comfortable. Both room and bathroom were of a good size and equipped with all required amenities other than tea/coffee making facilities which we did really miss, especially with jet-lag on the first few days. The location of the hotel is very good as it is two blocks from Copley Square, and a few more blocks to the Prudential Centre. Newbury Street is also 3 blocks away where the designer boutiques such as Cartier, Valentino and Jimmy Choo located. We used the nearby T station to get around, but when we returned to the airport, we simply asked the concierge to organize a taxi for us. Cuffs Irish bar on the ground floor was very reasonably priced â€“ similar prices to outside of the hotel and comparable to UK prices. The staff again were very friendly and helpful. Food was served very quickly and was standard pub fayre â€“ if you are looking for anything other than traditional American fries etc then this is probably not the best place to eat, although they do recommend some really good restaurants close by â€“ the concierge can make reservations for you. One in particular was Davioâ€™s Italian restaurant â€“ just one block away and a really good break from fries and burgers â€“ we can highly recommend the tagliatelle Bolognese. We can also recommend the hotel for morning coffee in Il Barista on the first floor â€“ much better than Starbucks (two blocks away). Other good restaurants in the area are â€˜Pappa-Razziâ€™ â€“ again an Italian restaurant with very good Bruschetta as an appetizer â€“ one is enough for two people â€“ donâ€™t try the calzone though unless you have a poor sense of smell. Kashmir Indian restaurant on Newbury Street was also really good although service could be better. They tried to take away our starter plates before we had even finished â€“ this was different from the usual standard in America were we usually end up with our main courses before we have even finished the starters. Hired a car for a few days â€“ car rental itself is reasonably priced but beware of Valet parking charges as it cost $40 each night and there was no option of self parking â€“ other car parks around were similarly priced.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: TripAddictIreland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in October as part of our honeymoon from Ireland. We really liked this hotel. The only issue we had was that they never even mentioned that we were on honeymoon. We did not get upgraded our receive anything which from other friends who have been on honeymoon we were kind of epecting as the norm! But it was a lovely hotel. Great bar food, breakfast, concierge, room, shower. No complaints. Its in a great location. My husband and I had a fantastic week exploring our old haunts from our student days in Boston (even if a lot of them had gone!). Great hotel in a great spot! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bick'n'Nic
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Jurys hotel for 3 nights in December and thoroughly enjoyed the break. The hotel was clean and well maintained and all staff were courteous and friendly. A call to our room by the front-desk staff 5 minutes after our arrival to check everything was ok was a nice thought. The location is excellent - close to shops, restaurants and tourist attractions. The room was well laid out and a reasonable size. We didn't experience any noise-related problems. Complimentary water was provided in the fridge, and mini-bar snacks could be requested - in fact you can pre-arrange for your favourites to be present in your room upon arrival. Cuffs is a pleasant, typical hotel bar with decent service and surroundings. The breakfast buffet in the restaurant is worth the extra money and offers a good selection. Wireless internet access is available throughout the hotel for free, and the business facilities including printing are also free (handy for printing out airline boarding passes!) Whilst the front-desk staff could not accommodate our request for late check-out, they efficiently organised the storage of our luggage allowing us to make the most of our last day. It should be noted that using the T subway from the airport is pretty easy - especially as the Arlington station exit has been moved from Boylston/Arlington to Boylston/Berkeley during renovations - a stones throw from the Jurys.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: LeeSQL
Reviews.Content: After reading the many good reviews here, I was disappointed in my stay at this new hotel. Location is convenient for walking to restaurants and shops. The staff seemed to be running to a script, with little real warmth; barely a hint of a smile. The first impression, when I entered the place, was the smell of chlorine. There is a waterfall underneath a stairway, which for some reason, smelled like a swimming pool. I heard others remarking too. The room was an OK size but was crammed with furniture, so you had to creep around avoiding hitting doors or chairs. I'd have taken a smaller bed for more space; and I am not a large person! CD player was a nice touch; giant tv not needed. Air was very, very dry and we both had sore throats by the morning. Bed sheets had holes. There was a fridge, empty but for 2 bottles of water, but no tea/coffee-making machine. These are mostly small gripes but for a fairly new hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: auntie-ellie
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the excellent reviews it received on Trip Adviser and we were not disappointed. We found the rooms to be comfortable and very clean. The staff were always very helpful. The only negative thing we would say with regard to the room was that we found that it was nosiy - we seemt to be able to hear the traffic quite abit and you certainly would not be able to sleep with your window open, but this would not stop us from staying there again. This is certainly a beautiful city and one that we were comfortable walking around at anytime night or day. We would now like to return in the fall to see the beauty of it then and to go whale watching. If you decide to visit don't forget your walking shoes because that it is certainly the best way to enjoy the city.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: martinduff
Reviews.Content: I booked a four night stay based on the reviews from tripadvisor and was not dissapointed i have have to say this really is the No. 1 in boston The staff from start to finish were excellent superb service very polite and helpfull, look out for greg in the restaurant top man. The hotel is ideally located right in the centre of everything and ideal for a short stay. The food through the hotel was very good Breakfast buffet, Lunch in Cuffs the irish bar attached to the hotel and also dinner with greg in the restaurant all excellent Keep up the good work we will be back soon

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: dlovely
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Jurys on business for one night in July and loved it so much I booked it again for a week the next month! Things I loved: Walk in shower Comfortable and big bed Aveda products Turn down service w/ classical music playing when you get home. Bar downstairs The whole hotel always smells great! It was very clean and friendly, great location and I will definitely go back if I get the chance to travel there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Jurys Hotel”
Reviews.Author: scottiek
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 nights at the Jurys in October 2006. From the minute we arrived all staff could not have been more helpful and courteous We were upgraded to a deluxe room- wow Well situated for restaurants, entertainment and sightseeing. Would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay agin if we return to Boston. Can't wait to visit some of their other hotels in UK

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Sugarbarn
Reviews.Content: I had a fabulous stay at Jury's. Very welcoming and comfortable. Fantastic location. I loved Cuffs, it is a great restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Jurys' a jewel in Boston's crown”
Reviews.Author: Debbie R
Reviews.Content: I selected Jury's in Boston due to the reviews it had received on Trip Advisor & we were not disappointed. I went for a shopping weekend with my 2 elder kids. We shared a room with 2 double beds & there was ample room. the rooms are delightful &the beds just what you need after a day's shopping! The Aveda products in the bathroom are a real luxury. We ate a few times in the Cuffs bar - the food is delicious & the atmosphere great. The only problem is that it is very popular & on Fri & Sat evenings it is heaving. The location of this hotel is excellent. 5 mins walk to Boston Common, 10 mins to Downtown Crossing (Macy's) & about 10 mins to the Prudential Centre. Nearest tube is about 2 mins away. If you are looking for a great quality hotel in a brilliant location you really won't go wrong with Jury's in Boston. A delightful hotel in the wonderful city of Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway Weekend”
Reviews.Author: jneil
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Jury's from 11/18 to 11/20 to celebrate our first wedding anniversary. We only live about fifteen miles away from the hotel but wanted a "getaway" experience. I booked the hotel based on these reviews and I was not disappointed. We traveled by the T (public transportation) and only had to walk one block from the Back Bay station. Upon check-in, we found the front desk staff to be very friendly, Actually, everyone who works at this hotel is very friendly. When we got to our room we were pleasantly suprised by chocolate covered strawberries and a bottle of champagne. Soon after, the front desk called us to make sure we were happy with our room, and we were!!! The room was an adequate size with a big, comfortable king sized bed! We loved the bed and the large bathroom with Aveda products, very impressed! The shower had great water pressure and we liked the added heated towel rack. We went to the bar area for a late lunch/snack and were very happy with the ambience and service, We both ordered delicous mushroom soup and split an order of lightly fried calamari while watching college football on their two flat screen televisions. After going out for dinner, we returned to a very crowded bar scene but we lucked out and were able to get two seats at the bar. Some people have criticized the crowd but we found it to be very electic. The next day we wanted to stay in bed and enjoy the Patriots so we ordered room service which was very good (same food as bar and same price) The room had a good sized flat screen tv and a mini cd stereo system. We also liked the mini-fridge b/c we could put some of our leftovers in it! That night we were meeting friends to go see a show at the Coloniel Theatre and we could easily walk there. Actually, you could easily walk to a lot of places from the hotel. We were both very happy with our choice to stay at Jury's. The next time we want to play tourist in our own city, we would not hesitate to return to Jury's and we would make sure we eat at their restaurant (we will actually be back next time we are in that area) If you are a tourist, not only is the hotel beautiful and clean, AND the staff very friendly, it has a GREAT location. Highly recommended!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “it deserves its great reputation”
Reviews.Author: scgreen
Reviews.Content: My wife, her sister, husband and I stayed at Jurys for four nights from 15th November 2006 We booked the hotel solely because it was the top rated hotel in Boston on this site. We booked using a website called travelax which compares the prices on lots of different sites. It saved us Â£140 over Jurys own site which promises its prices cannot be bettered. I have stayed in hotels all over the world and can honestly say that this was as good as any I have stayed in. The hotel has all the amenities you could want (except maybe a pool). The rooms maybe not the biggest but you would have to be very fussy to complain about the size. The beds were extremely comfortable and all rooms had a good hairdryer and an iron and ironing board. They also had a free safety deposit box. But what set this hotel apart from the others I have stayed at was the staff, we checked in with Kimberley she was polite and certainly made no difference because of the way I had booked my room. She was genuinely friendly and made a point of saying hello when ever she met my wife or me. But the person who really made our stay was Richard the Concierge he was knowledgeable, friendly and patient. He made all of our restaurant reservations and even phoned around various shoe shops to try and find the Heelys for my daughters. We went to the Cheers Bar and they DIDNâ€™T know my name but when we got back to Jurys the waitress in the bar said how was your day Mr Green that said it all to me. . To sum up this is a great hotel made even better by the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: LSMc
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel on the strength of reviews in Trip Advisor and can only add to those by saying that it lived up to its reputation. It is perfectly located, beautifully maintained and delivers excellent service with an unerring pleasantness and warmth. We have been recommending it unreservedly to anyone I know who is considering visitig Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: mcards
Reviews.Content: We chose the Jury's Boston because of the reviews on Tripadvisor and were delighted they were right! There were several comments on Tripadvisor about the bed, well we certainly agree. The bed and pillows were so very comfortable that since I have been home I am dissatisfied with my own bed. The room was not huge but it had loads of closet space and the shower room was a good size. The tiled floor of the bathroom was very slippy if you were not careful, but the large fluffy towels and bathrobe made it feel very opulant. I would advise any traveler who likes a morning cuppa to take a travel kettle with them as I had to ask for one as they do not included a kettle or coffee maker as standard in the rooms. However they did find me a coffee maker for our stay, but that doesn't make the best hot water for tea (I know I am a typical Brit). The staff were very helpful and we enjoyed watching the locals in Cuffs bar downstairs. We were able to get to everywhere we needed within Boston from there. We had been to the Streisand concert at the TD Bankworth stadium and felt very safe returning to the hotel late.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Lovely72
Reviews.Content: My Mum and I stayed at Juryâ€™s Boston from 14 â€“ 18 October to celebrate her 60th birthday. Overall the hotel was lovely, the staff were polite and friendly and the food was excellent. The room was kept to a very high standard and had all the extra touches eg Aveda toiletries, iron, powerful hairdryer, safe, complimentary water and turn down service (with chocolates!). The only disappointment with the room was that it did not have tea/coffee facilities although we understand this is often the case in America. Breakfast in the hotel restaurant was excellent although we would suggest that you go for either the Continental or Buffet breakfast as this includes both tea/coffee and juice. It can work out quite pricy if you order individual items. Cuffs Bar downstairs was always very popular and lively and the service was always good even though it was often very busy. Location of the hotel is perfect for sightseeing, shopping and all amenities. Very close to Boston Common, Theatre District, Duck Tours, Newbury Street (for shopping) and Prudential Centre. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just loved it !”
Reviews.Author: chocolatefriend
Reviews.Content: We stayed October 12- 17 and had a king corner room no. 338 and it was wonderful and worth the $$$. Great sized room, great shower with all the attachments and Aveda products. Heated towel rail great especially for drying smalls ! Lovely robes and big towels too. Bath very shallow though. Great location can walk everywhere ! Boston has more sirens than NYC though ! Great big comfortable bed and a huge bonus is free access to the internet in the business centre ! Lovely big lounge to sit in, great breakfast in restaurant and "Au bon pain" my favourite too ! Will be coming back ! Spacey, friendly and fun ! A classy place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel....very good stay”
Reviews.Author: dingbatt
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were first time Boston travelers. Read reviews on this site and decided to stay at Jury's for three nights. Glad we did. Hotel is in a nice location....close to shopping on Newbury (2 blocks) and 3 blocks away from subway T stops. Easy walk to Prudential tower area. Hotel was very clean and very well maintained. Rooms a bit small however this was expected. Bathroom was updated and spectacular with Kohler fixtures, huge shower and Aveda products. Turn down service each evening. Nightcapped each night at the Irish pub located downstairs....very nice crowd. Only thing I would have additionally enjoyed in room would be complimentary coffee service.....even though both Dunkin Donuts and Starbucks were a block away! Would recommend hotel and would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Jury's Boston”
Reviews.Author: Shropshireladd
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, lovely rooms, but for Â£150.00 per night they should be! Only complaint was the food. Bar food expensive and not very good. For breakfast recommend "Au Bon Pain". 2 minutes walk from the the hotel and excellent and extensive and cheap menu,

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bookmarks
Reviews.Content: We were doing a 5 city holiday in the USA and Canada, Boston and Jurys was the first chose. I booked this hotel through expedia, which was excellent, it gave me all the infomation I required to made a good decision to book this hotel. This room was with 2 queen beds and of very good standard, although the view was not good (this did not bother either of us as the exploration of Boston was the proirity) the room was very clean and tidy and housekeeping was excellent. The beds were very confortable and the bathroom was of good standard. The staff were kind and friendly and the Cuffs bar downstairs at the hotel was good. The hotel was in an excellent location to explore Boston (which to me is a good walking city) and if I did return back to Boston I would stay at this hotel again. very good keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Challenger3802
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a long weekend, just as the city had a snow blizzard. The room was one of the smallest rooms I'd ever stayed in and the view from the room was over the offices of the building it backed onto, for the price I was charged I felt cheated. The cleaning was to a high standard and towels changed daily. The reception and other staff were polite and the room service was good. The food in the restaurant was first class and the waitresses equally so, but too expensive for anything other than breakfast which isn't even included in the room price. I'd stay in boston again but not here, this hotel is set up mainly for business travellers and the prices reflect that.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel in a Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: Pembroke_Traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights and could not have been happier. The lobby is tastefully appointed and fun with a waterfall that begins on a wall and flows under the main stairs. Our room was clean and well appointed. It could be described as small, but with the very high ceilings and clever use of space, we never felt cramped. It is obvious that a lot of money was spent in renovating this building and the room was very comfortable. The location of the hotel can't be beat, we walked everywhere, including Faneuil Hall with no sore feet. Public transportation also is close by. I recommend you stay at a hotel in town and walk or use public transportation as much as possible, parking is quite expensive. We will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Umba
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights & we couldn't fault the place. The location was excellent, check in was easy, staff were attentive & the attention to detail was second to none. I would recommend Jurys in Boston 100% & would use the hotel again if I were to return to Boston in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Count me as a regular!”
Reviews.Author: Bonpierce
Reviews.Content: From the moment we pulled up in a cab our experience was top notch. Even though thier computers went down our check in was a breeze. At check in they said they were out of non smoking rooms but were able to find one for me. The room was sparkling clean. Beds turned down with music playing on the cd player and ice in the bucket. The Aveda bath products were a nice touch. The rooms are beautiful and comfortable. The room was very quiet. I was sure we were the only ones checked in except for an occasional Red Sox fan in the elevator. The bar "Cuff's" is quite a happening place with lines forming outside at night. This is my only negative. The night we checked in we went for a cold one and a late snack. The service was very good. The next night we met friends there and our waitress was non existent, at least at our table. She spent her whole time catering to a table full of young guys. I had to ask another waitress to order some appetizers, and I also went to the bar to get our beers. It was crowded but she serviced the guys table which was right next to ours three times. The next night we went to the lounge on the second floor. It's very comfortable with sofas and tables and quiet enough to catch up with old friends. The woman working the bar was outstanding. She appeared at our table every time a friend joined our group. Each had a cocktail within minutes of entering. She should give a customer service lesson to the waitress downstairs. Everyone of the staff (except as noted) was exceptional. Don't hesitate to book here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Howser1
Reviews.Content: The reviews on this website led us to choose this hotel. From the glassy entrance with wall waterfall to the comfortable beds we didnt want to leave. The staff were most friendly, the hotel is really stylish and it centrally located for everything. The breakfast was delicious with a wide variety of items. It was spotlessly clean. CDs players are in the rooms and free bottles of water are provided every night. We didnt have a bath but the shower room is something I plan on modelling my own shower on. Fabulous!! If visiting Boston I will definately go here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2Ton
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a Juryâ€™s hotel in the UK and it was basic and functional so I wasnâ€™t expecting to much when I turned up at Juryâ€™s Boston Hotel. Checking in was a breeze, the check in staff were friendly and very helpful. The room was immaculate and very well appointed. A huge bed, big TV and even a mini music centre with a CD player and radio. The maid would come round in the evening and offer a turndown service, fill your ice bucket and leave you chocolate! When you leave your room in the morning a copy of the Boston Globe is waiting outside your door. The room had a fridge which had two complementary bottles of water left in it each day. There was a concierge desk in the hotel which was very helpful and had plenty of information on things to do in Boston although the Grayline office is only a 5 minute walk away. Copley Square is only a block away and Boston common is just over 5 minutes walking away. The hotel is located in the old police headquarters and the bar that is attached to it is an Irish / police themed bar called Cuffs. We drank in there most nights before going out into Boston. Itâ€™s a little expensive (about $11 for two beers) but it has a great atmosphere. This hotel was excellent value for money; I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: baseballgirl
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a five night stay at Jury's and we have to agree with the rave reviews. Hotel is in a great location, about three blocks from the T and four blocks from the Public Garden/Boston Common. The staff is very nice and accomodating. We had a few problems with our room, noisy A/C unit and door that wouldn't lock (!), but both were fixed promptly. Two waters were put into our empty (which was very nice) fridge every day, a GREAT amenity. Cuffs, the downstairs bar was very fun. We had a drink outside on the patio one night and upstairs on the other nights when Cuffs was full. They warned us at check in that there could be lines to get into the bar and there was! Although it was not a problem to get into the hotel at all. The only reason we didn't give the hotel five stars was the size of the room. I believe we had a standard room and the bed area was cramped. The desk and chair were right next to the bed and there was almost no room between the two. On the other hand, the bathroom was huge. Also, if you stay on a weekend, you need to tell them that you want a paper or they won't deliver it. We were not told this and did not get a paper on Saturday and we almost missed the Red Sox game. The time was changed from 7:05 to 1:05 the night before and if we had the paper we would have known. All in all, this was a great hotel and we will stay here again and would suggest Jurys to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with history”
Reviews.Author: Muntz73
Reviews.Content: Stayed on 8/31 for one night in a corner king room. Great location, great room, great bathroom, unbelieveable bed. Loved the Aveda products. The hotel is the old Boston Police Headquarters building. They did a beautiful job with this property! Definitely my new hotel in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe we can stay longer next time?”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaFM
Reviews.Content: On vacation for 3 weeks I tried to spend 200.00 a night on lodging, Because of a Microsoft conference in Boston when we were visiting, hotel room rates were higher than nornal. We booked Jurys for 2 nights at 350.00 a night. Luckily we were then able to get a room at the Hyatt in the Financial District for under 200.00 (another trip advisor review). I booked a non smoking room but because our flight from California arrived late and we checked in after midnight, all non-smoking rooms were taken and we were given a smoking room. You could smell the smoke in the hallway the minute the elevator doors opened. We were moved first thing in the morning to a non smoking room which then made our stay at Jurys more pleasurable. This hotel is first class all the way--from location, courteous staff, and luxurious rooms. Even though our first night was not ideal, I still rated Jurys excellent. If we return to Boston, we hope to stay at Jurys longer, especially if we can get a more reasonable rate!

Reviews.Title: “The Best in Bean Town”
Reviews.Author: dbro
Reviews.Content: Just simply one of the best hotels I have ever stayed. Just did not want to get out of bed in the morning .....I wanted to bring the mattress and pillows home with me. The staff were very friendly and accommodating. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortably Modern in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Moops
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over a weekend for 3 nights from Aug 4th to 7th in a Superior King room booked through an online site about a month in advance. Before tax, each night averaged Cdn $200, a great price given what the hotel has to offer. The location is fantastic. Situated in the Back Bay, it's about a 5min walk to several subway stations (Back Bay, Copley, Arlington) on both the Green and Yellow lines -- giving you a choice of starting points depending on where your destination is. The hotel is about 3 short blocks to Copley Square where the beautiful Trinity Church and Public Library are found. It's also just a 5-10min walk to a number of other destinations -- including the Prudential Centre, Newbury St. (great for shopping and late night dining), and the Public Garden. Anywhere you can't walk is an easy 10-15min subway ride away. The room was very clean, relatively spacious, and warmly modern. It featured a wide entry area, with a large double-door closet and oversized full-length mirror. The comfortable king bed was flanked on one side by a bedstand, and on the other by a large desk. This work area would be great for business travellers (with a rolling office chair, and free high speed access). One corner of the room had a side table and chair for reading. The TV was housed in a large wooden wall unit with lots of drawer space, a CD stereo (CDs can be loaned from the concierge), and a small fridge, great for storing drinks and snacks -- and which they stock with 2 complimentary bottles of water each day. The large marble-tiled bathroom featured a granite-topped wood vanity with lots of counter space, plus an additional glass shelf under the mirror for overflow. The tub was fairly small, but clean. Toiletries were Aveda, the towel-rack held oversized bath towels and was heated (didn't seem to do much for the towels, but a nice touch!). Other amenities included: Large in-room safe, ironing board and steam iron, bathrobes, umbrella for rainy days, two clock radios on either side of the bed, and a full-sized hair dryer. For turndown service, staff fill your ice bucket, leave chocolate on the pillow, and turn the stereo on to classical music. The room was very quiet, never once did I hear any hallway noise. The downstairs sitting areas were very comfortable and in the mornings you can grab breakfast treats and coffee at the "Barista Cafe". As others have noted, the lobby bar is very busy, but wasn't a problem where we were staying (9th floor). We easily checked our bags for a few hours on the last day, before setting out for Back Bay station to take the subway to the airport (40 mins door to door -- at $1.25 an economical option if you're looking to save on cabs!). Overall, this was a great hotel in a convenient location. I would not hesitate to stay here again if looking for lodging in the price range that I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Experience”
Reviews.Author: dengnell
Reviews.Content: Boston Jury's takes you back to service that's not often seen these days. From the welcome of the doorman, the quick luggage service from my cab to my room and the wonderful air of personal attention, you can't go wrong with this hotel. Had a superior king, never wanted to get out of bed and the shower with additional jets is to die for. Wish I had more time to stay, but plan on returning as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Irish_Tourist
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Jury's Boston for a few nights in July. Really loved it.. staff are extremely friendly and location is perfect for shopping & exploring Boston. Had a Superior King Room and it was so comfortable and lovely decor. The lobby & bar are also impressive, I was expecting more old-fashioned Irish style but it is really modern and great atmosphere too. Would highly recommend for visit to Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, But Hotel Bar ain't quiet !”
Reviews.Author: kevtee
Reviews.Content: We recently visited the Jury's Boston Hotel on Honeymoon and here are my thoughts on the service and experience that I received. In terms of being a honeymoon couple, I did not feel that Jury's went out of their way to make the trip more special. A Congratulations would have been nice ! However, that may have been down to the person on the desk that particular day. The hotel itself is very nice and clean, very modern and the rooms were also very nice as well. In terms of the location of the hotel- very good. The only downside that I can think of is with regards the bar in the hotel. Cuffs Bar is a nightspot for young revellers in Boston. Not a problem if you are young and up for a good time. But if you are wanting personal service from the hotel bar whilst in Jury's, this is not the place for you. There are queues at the weekend to get in the place and the service for getting drinks and food was very poor one night we were in. young couple out for a good time and doesn't mind noise then Jury's is for you - maybe i am just getting old ! In weighing everything up, 4 out of 5 would be a fair rating.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: lynachka
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Jury's for a long weekend and we were absolutely amazed when we walked in to the hotel. Everyone was so nice and accomodating. Concierge, the bellyboy and valet were all equally pleasant. The rooms are gorgeous. We stayed in a standard queen size room, which included turn down service, heated towel rack and complimentary water every day. Room service was impeccable. Everything was clean. The location is perfect. We walked through all of boston. I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to boston, families, singles. Its a beautiful hotel with very luxury accomodations. You wont be dissapointed.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Cape May Court House, New Jersey
Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Dr. Hong
Reviews.Content: Sassy, modern, friendly, and comfortable hotel. We didn't have a view at all, but the bed, pillows, robes, Aveda products, etc made up for that. The staff was wonderful and the Cuffs Bar was terrific (minus one waitress and bartender).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: There is nothing negative to say about this hotel! Great staff, fab location (in the nicer back bay area of the city with boston common, prudential centre and Newbry street shops all close by as well as easy transport links to the rest of the city via the T from Back Bay station), big rooms with a handy fridge and comfy dressing gowns! The daily complimentary bottles of water were a great touch...especially in the 90 degree heat of the summer!! Quite simply one of the best hotels IÂ´ve ever stayed in and I would highly recommend it to anyone travelling to Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault it.”
Reviews.Author: Targa25
Reviews.Content: Never been to Boston before so selection of Jury's was a bit of a gamble. Needn't have worried - staff super, food great, room excellent. The best hotel on our 4 week trip across the US. Also very convenient for Amtrak's Back Bay Station - couple of minute's walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Really good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We visited Boston on a busy week and found this hotel on the TripAdvisor site - the hotel was really good - rooms good, clean and bathrooms fairly spacious - my only reservation was that there was no bath to relax in after we came in from our long walks. The downstairs bar was busy and there was a good atmosphere in the hotel in general. I would certainly recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nancy875_123
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights over Memorial Day weekend and were completely thrilled with the Jurys Doyle. The hotel was immaculate, including the public areas and our room. We had a standard room with a king size bed. The room was quite large and airy and the marble bathroom was also large. We enjoyed the heated towel bar and the provided robes. It was very nice to have a large golf umbrella in the closet available for our use and then for later purchase if we so wished. We enjoyed having new water bottles in the fridge when we returned from sight-seeing. The location of the hotel was excellent. We valet parked the car and walked to all of our destinations with relative ease. The restaurants were excellent, as well, and I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Superior Value For a Major City”
Reviews.Author: imemine
Reviews.Content: This is a new hotel, which is something I tend to look for because of the furnishings. It truly is a fine place. Big marble bathroom and a nice interior decorations. The toilet area was a little cramped but the place is on a quiet street and it was about $190 per night. Hard to get much better for this type of Hotel on the east coast. Nice staff overall. The breakfast buffet was good but a bit pricey. It is about three blocks from the T. Not bad but that part of the city is like a wind tunnel and COLD in the winter. If they can keep it in good shape I would return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: Serena_S
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Jury's in December of 2005. I had not been to Boston for many years and did a lot research before choosing this spot. It was easy to get to (off the Mass Pike) and I happily let them valet park my car, I did not want to worry about it while in Boston. The room was lovely, very comfortable bed, nice linens and a beautiful bathroom with all the trimmings. I ate dinner in the restaurant that night, fantastic! Later on when my friend arrived from CO via Logan, we got him something to eat at the bar, also great. The bar was quite full for a weeknight, nice scene (a little yuppie but friendly). Breakfast there was fantastic, our waitress was super friendly. We checked out but left our bags behind while we wandered the city for hours. The staff was excellent, the room beautiful -- the whole experience was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Jubbsy
Reviews.Content: Arrived at Jury's to find that our reservation had not been received from Virgin Holidays even though we had an accommodation voucher to present to them with all the details. Manager came out to deal with it and advised that they sometimes go astray if they are received by fax. Not really a good excuse!! Were then given a smoking room (having requested non-smoking), as it was the only one available. After changing to a non-smoking room for the following night the stay improved. The hotel is very well presented and service was generally good. Rooms were a little on the small side and decor in browns and greens did not help. However, room quality was high, bed was very comfortable and shower was good. Location was good for all main attractions. Very close to Newbury Street Shops, the parks and Back Bay Station. Would stay there again but would confirm booking in person in future.

Reviews.Title: “Going above and beyond is customary here!”
Reviews.Author: SportsTraveler
Reviews.Content: The insanity surrounding the Boston Marathon could put even the best hotel through it's paces. However the staff at Jury's did not even flinch, coming through in spectacular fashion on our second stay here in as many years. We inadvertantly left the Do Not Disturb sign on our door the day of the race. At 6PM we sheepishly asked if we could have our room made up at this late hour. They never hesitated to satisfy our request. After returning from dinner the room was perfect. The beds are as comfortable as you will find anywhere and the oversized bathrooms are a welcome sight. The bell staff, concierge, and front desk are all very attentive. Only negative was a waitress in the lounge who was more interested in watching "Extreme Home Makeover" than serving us our dessert, which took 30 minutes and the lounge was virtually empty.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience At Jurys!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are back from a wonderful weekend at Jurys. I can happily confirm the positive commentary previously posted and add some of our own. Location is ideal. The hotel is in Bostonâ€™s Back Bay area, one block from the John Hancock building, a couple of blocks from Newbury & Boylston, a short walk (20 mins approx) to Faneuil Hall. Getting to the hotel is easy by car. It has about the easiest access to/from I-90 that you could ask, and they have valet parking (about $36 with unlimited in/out). Service is excellent and friendly. Jean at the front door was helpful and very enthusiastic about the city. The same goes for Keith at the concierge desk, who pointed us to several excellent restaurants in the North End & Cambridge. Turn-down and room service were prompt, professional and friendly. The room was most notable for its bathroom. We had a â€œDeluxe Kingâ€� room. The room itself wasnâ€™t particularly large, but the bathroom was quite big (nice separate shower & bath tub). The bed was too comfortable, causing us to sleep through our morning agendas. We did not have much of a view at all (some rooms likely have beautiful views given the location). The bar/restaurant were hopping while we were there; great if you want to join but the noise was somehow contained so that we were only as aware of it as we wanted to be. We saw several couples with young children and thought the hotel was just fine for families. We had breakfast in the room one morning; it was as good as any other room service breakfast weâ€™ve had. The gym was a small room with limited equipment. The wireless signal was strong and worked perfectly all weekend. The hotel gets the intangibles right (complementary bottles of water, surprise Easter eggs on Easter Sunday, a call to the room to be sure everything was ok, etc). Overall, we felt the hotel stood between a Fairmont and a Four Seasons in terms of overall service, features and attention to detail.

Reviews.Title: “Far better than New York”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in Boston for two nights after a week in New York. The Jurys Copley Square was far superior to New York's Waldorff Astoria for 30% less! The conveniene was critical to enjoying all Boston had to offer. What's more, the rooms were new, clean and full of amenities. Parking was pricy at $36/night but the staff's eagerness to assist us offset any concerns. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: BeanCJ
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I stayed at Jurys for 3 nights and we were not disappointed. The service was friendly, efficient and respectful at all times. Our room was spacious, the washroom was large (we enjoyed the heated towel rack and Aveda products)and the beds were very comfortable although we would have been happier with two queens rather than two doubles. As first time visitors to Boston we found the location excellent - we were able to walk almost everywhere and felt very safe going to and from the hotel after dark. I would definitely return to Jurys!

Reviews.Title: “jurys”
Reviews.Author: falkirk
Reviews.Content: spent a short {4days} in boston, staying at jurys boston. family of four could,nt have asked for more, room excellent, service 1st class, food good, guiness poured as it should be. city was delightful, will be back, and will stay at jurys

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: aggie07
Reviews.Content: A group of us stayed at Jury's this past weekend. Excellent location. Staff was very friendly and service was far above expectations. We had two rooms which were across from each other but we could close a private door to close them off to the rest of the hall. Bar very busy, a huge line outside waiting to get in, we're not sure why? Only complaint is that we got "spoken" to when we first arrived as we were all in one room talking at 730pm??? Will definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Class”
Reviews.Author: James6259
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights with my wife. I would rate it as one of the best Hotels I have ever stayed in. The Bar "Cuffs" served the best Pint of Guinness I have ever tried in North America. Breakfast was tremendous. What made our stay so memorable was the staff, courteous and efficient especially the Manager who was around the bar entrance at the Lobby each night (think he is from Donegal). Tip: Bar gets quite busy - it is definately one of Boston's IN places.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Jurys ”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went for St. Patrick's Day and loved it - great hotel, great food, Irish Heritage is wonderful and the bar is wonderful! The rooms are nice and modern and elegant. All of the employees were overly helpful and the service was great! Will definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “Warm Repception Absent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay in Jury's Boston based on the excellent review posted on trip advisor. It was clean, modern and in great location for shopping and sightseeing, however the staff were extremely rude at times. As the weather was extremely cold and my companion and I were out and about all day on foot we dressed for comfort rather than style. We soon discovered that level of service from staff was dictated by what we were wearing, as we were often ignored and disrepected by some of the staff. It seems we did not fit the image the hotel was hoping to project. On one occassion while I was wating in the lobby for my friend I was rudely questioned by female staff member as to why I was sitting in lobby. These experiences made it an uncomfortable stay at times and we got the distinct feeling that we were not wanted in the hotel. We will not be making a return visit to Jury's as we were made to feel like uninvited party guests.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: burnig
Reviews.Content: I had booked Jury's as it was the best rated hotel out of a list given to me from Airmiles (needed to use a few miles up). In between booking and travelling Jury's went to number 1 on Tripadvisor...so I was looking forward(even more)to my first trip to Boston. I was not disappointed. The rooms are well furnished, (mine was not large but perfectly adequate for our 3 day stay. I worked out if you turn left from the lift (elevator) then chances are you will have one of the larger rooms, I did see one when the maid was cleaning, if you want one try asking for a twin, instead of a double), and are decorated in relaxing colours. The bathroom had a shower and bath and was well stocked with Aveda products. The staff are extremley polite, friendly and helpful, a warm welcome awaits all guests. As for the facilities, there is a small gym, 2 lounges next to the lobby, a basement bar and restaurant. the bar can be noisy, but that is just because the sound echo's a little, you don't hear it when you are away from the entrance stairs nor does it seem that noisy when you are in it. It is well worth having a beer or two after a long days shopping or pre dinner. Dinner, the one downfall is the restuarant, don't use it even for breakfast. My wife and I did have one meal, we were too tired to start looking for somewhare else, so decided to give it a try. My food was tasteless (monk fish was watery and had no flavour at all, my vegetable starter I knew it was based on tomatoes and mushrooms because that as the shape and colour of the food, but where was the taste? nowhere, probably left in the kitchen.) Breakfast even though we were down early (around 7:30) the buffet breakfast was stale and overcooked. There are many many places to eat go somewhere else. We did not stay at Jury's because of the restaurant so it did not detract from our overall experience. I would highly recommend Jury's, the location is perfect for Boston Common, Beacon Hill, Copley Square and Downtown, all are no more than a 10 min walk. When I go back to Boston, my first choice will be Jury's there is a lovely warm relaxed feel to the place.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch and classy”
Reviews.Author: Stuck_in_CT_Forever
Reviews.Content: Stay at the Jurys Boston. It's great. My girlfriend and I stayed there this past weekend when visiting Boston for a romantic getaway of shopping, sightseeing, etc. We were thrilled. She stays at some of the best of the best hotels, the Ritz e.g., all over the country with her big shot job and she thought that the Jurys Boston was the nicest hotel she's stayed at so far. While planning the getaway, I got to know Jurys Boston's friendly and courteous staff while I made arrangements for our big weekend. They were always the most helpful, friendly and knowledgeable. We stayed in an Executive Corner King on the 6th Floor--Room 638 to be exact. We were met at the door by the valet who promptly help us unload and took care of the car. The Valet and garage fee was an extra $36, which is competitive for Boston parking. We went through the impressive lobby and had our room keys in less than five minutes. We entered our room and I immediately noticed that it was filled with welcoming light from three large windows. Also, I noticed that the vase of long stem roses I had arranged with the concierge the night before was waiting on the table and filling the room with fragrance. The stereo tape/CD player was also set to softly playing classical music. The bathroom was finished completely in natural stone and marble with a walk-in shower and a large spacious bath. There were fluffy white towels and pristine white robes waiting for us. There is also a large closet off the bath with a safe. There was a king size bed that was absolutely clean and perfect, and the room just set the perfect mood for the trip. The true test of a hotel is the bed. So many top hotels have terrible beds that are old and moldy. Not Jurys. I was so impressed with this bed that I wrote down the name of the mattress manufacturer, size and style and I plan to order one of my own. My girlfriend, the world traveller, was equally impressed. She says she usually wakes up from a hotel stay with a backache. The bed was so nice that, unfortunately, we missed a few hours of sightseeing because we just stayed in the bed wrapped up in the hotel bathrobes (I also wrote down the manufacturer's name of the robes). Fortunately, we didn't miss much sightseeing in the end because outside it was freezing outside anyway. You wouldn't know it because this is no drafty old money hotel like others I've been in Boston. It was so warm and cozy in the room that I just assumed that the blue sky meant a gorgeous warm day outside. The insulated windows weren't cold, so how would I have known? Well, at other hotels, I would have known because of cold windowsills, drafts and condensation on the windows. The concierge was also helpful in getting us around. We got breakfast at a place the concierge recommended and it was excellent as well. I've been to many hotels where the concierge really didn't know much about the area at all. A good concierge can make a huge difference in the success of your trip and Jurys's concierge was certainly friendly and reliable. I only wish we'd had time to stay for two or more nights. We didn't even get to eat at the restaurant on the premises or spend much time at Cuff's Irish Pub downstairs. On Saturday night, it was packed! It's clearly a popular place, and well decorated. The waterfall staircase and open fireplaces are elegant. In contrast, the hotel lobby was cozy and inviting. If you need to do work, this is a good lobby. It's not one of those giant echo-filled lobbies where one can get easily distracted. The lobby at the Jurys Boston is again well-lighted, and well furnished with sound-absorbant materials. There were many people this Sunday just sitting on the big comfy sofas reading the complementary Boston Globes. Had I had the time, I certainly would have joined them. In short, we loved the Jurys Boston. Even though I'm curious about staying at other hotels when we come back to Boston, I'll be hard pressed to risk a stay somewhere else that might not measure up. Jurys was the cleanest, friendliest, classiest and highest quality hotel experience I've ever had and I couldn't recommend it more. Lastly, I only picked it because it was rated #1 on this site. I don't know anyone who's stayed there so I went completely based on what people on this site had to say. Nice going TripAdvisor!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but could be better...”
Reviews.Author: NJTraveler79
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here on business and while the stay was pleasant enough, if I were returning to Boston for pleasure (and on my own dime), I would shop around before returning here. The good: location, appearance, bathroom amenities, comfortable bed. The bad: Housekeeping. Upon first entering the room, the pillows were in a stack in the middle of the bed without cases, as if the housekeeper had simply left in the middle of setting up the room. When I informed the front desk, they promised to send someone up promptly, which they did not. It was only when a woman came for turndown service and noticed the pillows that anything was done. Also, some of the towels had black smudge marks on them. In summary, although the hotel has several nice features, there is no excuse for poor housekeeping especially when hotels that charge half the price manage it just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cdblues
Reviews.Content: Could not pick a better Hotel! It has character, rooms are beautiful, ask for a high floor. They have one floor for smokers I think it was the 2nd and when the elevator opened it reeked of smoke! Even if you are a smoker the rooms on this floor are not as nice. My husband is a smoker and I made him go outside everytime he wanted to smoke. He didn't mind he got to know the doorman real well. The hotel was in the middle of everything. Do the trolley tour and buy it on-line it was cheaper and you learn alot about the city. A must is the Aquarium. It was GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “The best”
Reviews.Author: John34
Reviews.Content: First stop on our honeymoon, and the best Hotel we stayed in. We spent 3 nights in this fab Hotel with virtually everything we came across, the best. Check-in was a breeze â€“ with very friendly and knowledgeable staff. Our room, while not huge was exquisitely decorated with high quality furnishings and impressive attention to detail. As a few other reviews have mentioned, the bed was the most comfortable we have ever slept in.
