The bathrobes were of the highest quality â€“ (you can purchase one @ $45) â€“ and the shower was the large walk-in variety. The food there was also great. We ate in the Stanhope Grill the Hotelâ€™s restaurant on our first night the weather was unusually warm (89Â°F/30Â°C in Sept) so we dined al fresco.and were impressed with the quality of the food, the service and the value for money. On our second night we ate and drank in Cuffs the Irish bar, The food again was excellent and the atmosphere super â€“ itâ€™s very popular with business people for a drink after work and is nicely busy in the evenings with a good vibe. Breakfast while pricey ($16.50pp) was the best we found. What else â€“ well on our last day Hurricane Ophelia was in town so we used the hotel driver to return to the airport - $30 all in â€“ when considering the trip to the hotel by taxi was $25 â€“ this was good value for the sheer ease and comfort. We will go back to Boston, which we found to be a very friendly, manageable city, we will stay in Juryâ€™s again. Top shopping tip: if you havenâ€™t been in Boston before like us â€“ take a left on exiting the main door and head for Newbury Street we only found it on our last day â€“ the street is lined with upscale shops with a laid back atmosphere. Point to note - if you want to lie in â€“ in the morning be sure to put the do not disturb sign out â€“ housekeeping starts at 8.30am!

Reviews.Title: “Second stay, just as good”
Reviews.Author: matthew.cronin
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Jurys for the second time on the weekend follwing Thanksgiving. Upon arrival we were welcomed back (acknowledged for having stayed there once before) and given the same room we had during our last stay. The room is of decent size, was perfectly clean and the bed is very comfortable. Given the consistancy I've experienced and the relatively good value, considering the amenities and location, Jurys is my first choice when staying in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Try it ! not pompous !”
Reviews.Author: Scouser-Sue
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Le Meridien before and it was pompous, not doubt about it . but Jury's is a great location managed by real people. The location, two blocks from the Copley Place Mall is great for shopping, same distance to Boston Common and 10 mins walk to Faneuil Hall and Quincy's Marketplace. Rooms are USA large, as expected. Showers not baths - no problem for us at less than $100 per night. Breakfast at $15.00 for the buffet is a little overpriced, but hey , who eats Hotel breakfasts in Boston when there is Paramount on Charles Street !! which is famous for breakfast. The Concierge had a rental car delivered to the foyer for us with less than 24 hours notice, the cleaner loves cleaning the lounge of this hotel as it is "her pride and joy " How often do you hear this. the Bar has a line up on weekends because the atmosphere is so good. Yet, it is one of the quietest hotels in a city we have ever stayed in. One comment, the minibar is not stocked, but they have 24/7 Room Service - so no need I agree. The beds are amazing, the toiletries are Aveda. So ignore the last UK rating. Dont be ripped off by the more expensive options, stay at Jury's . They do what they say on the label, and don't make a big issue or try to be what they ain't !

Reviews.Title: “Third stay - losing some ground”
Reviews.Author: SophiaNY
Reviews.Content: Third stay here, and hotel is beginning to show some wear. The first room we were taken to, the carpet was quite stained, and the room was very small for a "Delux" rate. The second room had some housekeeping problems (soil under the bathroom sink). Forget about using the bar on the weekend unless you are 25-35 years old and don't mind standing, shouting and not getting anywhere near the bar. Suggestion - they should open the coffee bar at night for drinks, or use the large "living room" as a relaxing cocktail lounge. The service in the restaurant at night is wonderful, and the breakfast service is still very slow and sometimes breakfast never comes. I believe that next family visit, I amy try another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Jury's In and the Verdict Is Great!”
Reviews.Author: ShelbyOH
Reviews.Content: After a recent stay at Jurys Boston, I can safely say that it was excellent! The only two drawbacks I found were 1. No hooks in the bathroom near to the shower (the shower was huge with ample hot water and good water pressure); 2. The afforementioned glitter panels in the elevators (a bit rough to deal with after a few pints in the pub). Parking was a bit of a shock - It really was $36.00 per day - we spent nearly as much for dinner! But, by and large the room was very comfortable and nicely decorated with soothing taupes and greens, and humongous bed pillows. The full Irish Breakfast was (according to my spouse) as good as one had in Ireland!

Reviews.Title: “Simply fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Misbeehayve
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay here and were secretly glad that the hurricane kept us indoors! the staff were great - really professional but with some irish charm. rooms were like a dream and the hotel bar was always buzzing. stay here and you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in many ways. The staff are all terrific. Room service is excellent. Rooms are beautiful and clean. But please ask for a quiet room if possible-mine was on the second floor (212) just above a loading dock that got noisy at 4 am. An inner room would be much better.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: andycaggs
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with friends for 3 nights and had a blast. The rate was a little steep, but if you book early enough you can get good deals. The location is excellent, and the bar and club in the restaurant are nice perks. We couldn't have asked for a nicer or cleaner room, including the bathroom. The service was always helpful. If you're in Boston for the first time, I'd highly recommend this hotel as it provides the full tourist experience. I'd also recommend it for couples or those of us under 40 years of age. Don't pay too much, but don't hesitate to book if the price is competitive with everything else in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the most poorly run business I have ever encountered. I booked the trip online - prepaid. A week after leaving they charged my checking acount $653.45 for the cost of the room. Not only did they make this ridiculous mistake but they were completely incompetent at correcting it. Thanks to this establishment I could not pay my bills and was bouncing checks. I have contacted them 6 times and even though they admit it is thier mistake, I have yet to see a penny. I would rather stay in a motel 6 than go through this experience.

Reviews.Title: “dirty bathroom”
Reviews.Author: kragan
Reviews.Content: The Jurys of Boston has a great location and the beds are very comfortable. The bathroom is very pretty with a nice big shower; however, our bathroom was not clean. The floor had not been mopped and I don't think the shower had been cleaned. When I called about the dirty bathroom they did send someone immediately to clean it and were apologetic. The breakfast downstairs in their restaurant is very good. Overall we had a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Does everything well”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having just spent five nights at Jurys it's difficult to find fault. The hotel's position is great and it's an easy stroll to many of Boston's attractions. If you need to go a bit further afield, two T stations are on your doorstep. My room was a standard twin but was a good size with all the amenities you'd need, including a big walk-in shower. Bed was very comfortable and the room was very quiet. There were no problems with cleanliness, as other reviewers have mentioned. At first sight I wasn't that impressed with the bar, bearing in mind it's one of Boston's 'in' places right now. But once it starts filling up it's a lively place to mix with the locals and enjoy good drinks, service and food. The hotel's restaurant is decent enough but trying to be a bit more upscale than it is. Better to spend that kind of money in the many other really good restaurants on your doorstep. My final word's reserved for the staff, who were great throughout. Really friendly and Keith the concierge is particularly helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Cozy, Lovely Service”
Reviews.Author: aileuron
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two night- mid week get away to Boston. First time staying at Jury's and I chose it based on Trip Advisor reviews. Although a bit pricey - Service was wonderful, they couldn't have done more! We are newspaper addicts and they not only leave the Boston Globe at your door but were happy to send along the New York Times as well. Room was small but quite cozy, bed was heavenly, bathroom lovely. Appreciated the windows that opened and the towel warmers and bathrobes. Although the bar is amazingly loud when you come through the front doors the rooms were quiet as could be! Didn't eat at the restaurant, but then there are so many wonderful restaurants in the area. I would go again, great location!

Reviews.Title: “pleasant weekend at Jurys”
Reviews.Author: ABonnie
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Jurys last weekend. The rooms are small, but very nice. The bed is super-comfy. We were traveling with our one year old daughter, something I would not really recommend since the rooms are so small and the common areas less than kid-friendly. While the decor of the hotel is very nice, in my opinion the random details that I assume are meant to be "hip" look out of place and just weird. For example, the glittery stuff on the back wall of the elevator -- what's up with that? Also, the stairs from the bar to the front desk area that change color every few minutes are just ugly. I guess these are a continuation of the happening bar downstairs that adjoin them. We very much enjoyed the food we had from the hotel -- a delicious room service breakfast and a lunch in the bar was tasty, too. I did find it odd that the bar was the only place for lunch, though. Being the trendy place that it is, it wasn't really a cozy place for lunch on a wet Saturday, particularly with a kid in tow. Also, I searched high and low for a cup of tea on Sat. afternoon (it is an Irish hotel after all!) and was told the bar, again, was the only option. The staff was very friendly. We received a great breakfast recommendation -- Charlie's, a Mom and Pop greasy spoon diner with very good food in the South End, about a 10 minute walk away. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Irish hospitality !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location, wonderful service, comfortable rooms, large bathrooms ... I could go on. Irish hospitality in a trendsetting hotel with a happening scene at the bar (Cuffs). If you appreciate good design and friendly service(not always found together in hip hotels) Jurys is for you. My only criticism - the gym could be larger, although it was functional. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: evergreen123
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, but a little stuffy. We stayed at Jury's the second weekend that we were in Boston at the end of September. We were expecting a nice Irish hotel and it was nice, but probably not worth the money. The first weekend we stayed at the Millennium Hotel near Faneuil Hall and we ended up moving from Jury's to the Millennium our last night in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Close the Bar!”
Reviews.Author: TimeTraveler123
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for the second time. The Jury is in a great location, close to Back Bay, Commonwealth Ave and shopping. The standard room is very nice, but small. Would feel very cramped with two people if staying more than a couple of days. There isn't room for a good reading chair. Bathrooms are nice with a walk-in shower - a real plus. Hotel restaurant was very good with excellent service. Main lobby bar is very comfortable and elegant. Concierge and desk people were excellent. The big problem with Jury is that the downstairs bar is clearly a favorite of the 25-35 year old investment banker/hedge fund crowd out to flash money, sip martinis and impress their followers. Very, very loud and the sound extends into the restaurant and upstairs main lobby bar. Late on a Friday night there was a line to get in out on the sidewalk. Not what you want at your hotel. Hopefully they'll move on when something hotter opens!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: edinburgh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights based purely on reviews on this website. Whilst the location was excelellent and the staff were very friendly I found the standard of cleanliness in the rooms below par. For a hotel which has only been open little over a year I was disapointed to note the carpet and bedcover were badly stained amd the armoir extremely dusty. It was so bad in fact we requested a room change. The staff at the front desk could not have been more apologetic and did move us to another room with a better view however although this was an improvement it still fell way below the standards I would expect from a 4 star hotel. The rooms are extremely attractive as are the public areas however stained carpets etc. are exremely offputting and I don't know if I would consider Jurys again if I was to return to Boston. I noted another guest wrote a review on this website in a similar vein so obviously we weren't just unlucky!!

Reviews.Title: “Just so, so”
Reviews.Author: Robsgirl637
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Jurys Boston for 3 nights in Sept 05. The hotel is in an incredible location. It is very close to all attractions. However, the customer service was not up to par for what I think is a 4 or 5 star hotel. The room was very small, and over decorated which made it seem even smaller. The bed took up most of the room and every other piece of furniture seemed to be cramped in. The room did have some good aspects. Free bottled water was a first in any hotel I have stayed in. The oversized towels, bath robes and Aveda products were very comforting. Would I stay at this hotel again? Maybe if it was less than $200 a night, but at the rate we stayed, we would find somewhere a little cheaper, with larger rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Treated Like Royalty”
Reviews.Author: neverenoughtime
Reviews.Content: We were treated like royalty! This is quite possibly the finest hotel Iâ€™ve ever experienced. Our â€œroyal treatmentâ€� started before we even arrived. The day before our visit, I realized I had forgotten exactly where we had made our reservations, and called Juryâ€™s as I remembered that they were one of the hotels that came most highly recommended by trip advisor reviews. Our recollection was that they had been booked for the dates we needed and had recommended another boutique hotel in the area. I spoke with a gentleman named Dan, who I later learned was the Deputy General Manager. To my great surprise, he offered to call around to other hotels on my behalf to find out where we had our reservation. Clearly, there was no benefit to him to provide this service, as he believed we were not staying at his hotel. After spending an hour calling around to other hotels, he called to inform me that we were actually booked at Juryâ€™s. We both had a well-deserved laugh. Once we arrived, the royal treatment continued. The hotel is absolutely lovely and extremely hip. Carefully selected paintings and sculptures abound. There is a fashionable lobby with a bar on the lobby level, and a â€˜happeningâ€� bar and restaurant downstairs. The rooms are wonderful with great attention to detail, including warming racks for the towelsâ€¦and the beds are oh so comfortable. Most impressive was the extraordinary level of customer service they provided. Everyone, including the doormen, the reception staff, the concierge and waiters were fabulous. We got the feeling that they really couldnâ€™t do enough for us. Of special note were Keith, the concierge, Kevin, our charming Irish waiter and of course Dan the Deputy General Manager (who also had a gift tray sent to our room when we arrived). We enjoyed our stay so much that, even though we were supposed to transfer to the Four Seasons for the last two nights of our stay, we cancelled that reservation in order to stay at Juryâ€™s. Obviously we canâ€™t recommend this hotel enough and it will certainly be our choice when we visit again. Thanks to all of the staff for making our visit to Boston so perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel- great city”
Reviews.Author: Braikley
Reviews.Content: Location was ideal, easy walking distance for many of the main attractions. Staff very friendly and helpful with good advice about nearby restaurants etc. Breakfast selection was very good and the option of outdoor seating made for a relaxing start to the day. Cuffs Bar busy but great atmosphere ! Room was comfortable and well equipped. Would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe we were just unlucky??!!”
Reviews.Author: mommy2boys
Reviews.Content: Ok, so maybe we were just unlucky when we stayed here for 2 nights over labor day weekend?? My husband and I were staying without the kiddies for the weekend, because we were heading up to Lahey Clinic on Tuesday and decided to have a couple nights to ourselves. So, after reading the reviews for Jurys and Nine Zero we picked Jurys. I guess I wish that we had tried the Nine Zero. Our first room was on the 10th floor, one of only 3 rooms, so it would be quiet, which was great. However, the bedspread and pillows had numerous stains on them, the toilet in the bathroom had the seat unattached, and the TV did not work right. The volume on the TV is capped, which is not a problem, but it is when one speaker out of two total speakers is not working. No problem, we called down to see if we could move, as we were planning on catching up on our movies via PayPerView while we were away. We were relocated to a room on the 5th floor. It was not noisy and was a pretty good size. The pros and cons of the hotel are as follows: PROS: 1) Good location. 2) Nice Aveda Products in the bathroom 3) Fabulous dual head shower and towel warmer!! 4) Nice and accomodating staff, really superb. 5) GREAT breakfast room service, try the blueberry pancakes. 6) Refridgerator in room that is empty so you can stock it. CONS: 1) Very expensive room service, as expected, but atrocious dinner food. 2) No stores to buy snacks or sodas within close walking distance. 3) Room not the cleanest...dust on furniture, stains on carpets. All in all, not bad, but for $250+ a night, I would expect the hotel to be in a little better condition. Little things that were annoying were we only had one bathrobe, the "warm" cookies from room service were good, but not warm, parking was $36 a DAY, not easy in/out either - a good 15 to 20 minute wait each time. All the other reviews were very positive so maybe it was just us. However, this is what happened during our stay. I probably would not stay here again, would opt for the other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and service”
Reviews.Author: Queen_of_NW2
Reviews.Content: Just returned from visit number 3 at Jurys, and already planning return. What clinched it for me since I go to Boston often on business, is the free broadband and the quality of the bedrooms. Beds are almost Westin-like for comfort, bathrooms with Aveda toiletries, which as a woman, I really like and actually do take home. My employers are cheap skates, but I have demonstrated to them that the nearby Park Plaza and other dives are a false economy compared to the goodies on offer at Jurys that happily have me working longer hours. Room service pleasant and prompt, but food fairly indifferent.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful ”
Reviews.Author: charlotteguy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Jurys Boston for Labor Weekend. All I can say is that it was PERFECT. Wonderful rooms, super location, and an outstanding staff. I could not have been happier.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed an extra night”
Reviews.Author: danajf
Reviews.Content: Perfect central location in boston. We walked everywhere we needed to get to....and boy did we walk. Found some wonderful restaurants....again in walking distance. The beds were phenomenal. Be careful of parking on the street boston police like to fill their quotas....maybe a new york license plate?? Gym was tiny but clean and new. Nobody else seemed to use it. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Jurys Boston for one night after a long flight from Seattle. Had a really good rate and was very pleased with the whole hotel. I am used to staying in luxury hotels and my experience here was great. Great bathroom with beautiful walk in shower and aveda bath products - plus a mirror that doesn't fog up! The room was small but that wasn't a problem. Free internet, nice flat screen tv, radio, and complimentary water - all in all very good ammenities. The bar Cuffs is very popular and loud at night - there is a line to get in but if you are staying at the hotel, you do not have to wait - worth checking out. I have stayed at other hotels in Boston and this is by far my favorite!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: leafgirl
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at the hotel during my first trip to Boston. The location is wonderful - near the Back Bay subway station. Walking distance to Newbury Street, Prudential Centre, Copley Mall.... I stayed in a "Superior" room. Kingsize bed, large bathroom with a fullsize tub. Nicely decorated. I wasn't facing the street, so it was very quiet. The room had a mini-fridge, so on my first night I took a walk down to Shaw's supermarket and bought some juice, fruits and veggies to keep in it. It's a nice little touch. There is Dasani water stocked in the fridge as well, at no charge. The bed was quite possibly the most comfortable one I have ever slept in...the pillows are phenomenal. The hotel has a turn down service and each evening, I came "home" to some chocolates, an inspirational card, and soft music playing on the mini-cd/radio. The staff was friendly and check in/out was quick and painless. There was no problem leaving bags in storage until I needed to leave for the airport in the evening. There are two computers with internet access in the business area, but there is no time limit on use, so a few times I got stuck waiting a long time to check my e-mail. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Attention to detail and oustanding service”
Reviews.Author: bigcitymagic
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a visual treat. Rich colours, sophisticated artwork in the common areas, a charming room...it all adds up to a great environment. And then there's the service. The doorman on duty when we arrived (Michael) was so pleasant and terrific; Ireland's beautiful Martina on the desk, who called me on my cell phone to let us know when our room was ready (we arrived at 7:00 am, and were in our room at 10:30); our waiter in Cuffs (Joey from Dublin) who was so engaging and pleasant; and our countryman Jean from Montreal who treated us like we were family (thanks for the Sam Adams, Jean!) all contributed to a very personal and special vacation. I've stayed in some fine hotels in North America and abroad. Jurys is my new number one.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly faces guaranteed!”
Reviews.Author: clarewall_iow
Reviews.Content: We had never been to Boston before our trip from Aug 25 to Aug 30. So glad we picked the Jury's for our stay - it gave us reassurance as soon as we stepped through the door that this was going to be a fantastic stay. The beds are.... words cannot describe the opulence and comfort. The staff are just wonderful, they would break their backs for you and the location is top, you are just a few minutes walk from Newbury street (I recommend The Closet...Jimmy Choos for $110!) and about a 30-minute stroll to Downtown crossing. I just cannot find fault with this place and I would challenge anyone to pick holes in the fine location, services and staff relations. This is by far THE best hotel I have ever stayed in, in the US. So people, book up and enjoy. What's to lose?

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in New England!!”
Reviews.Author: I_Mallon
Reviews.Content: This Hotel lives up to all the rave reviews. Firstly, the hotel is beautiful. Its fresh and new. The staff were excellent. They went that little bit extra for me and my fiance. For example, we had just landed in from a busy weekend in Las Vegas on the "Red Eye" flight at 7.30am. The Receptionist offered us a room straight away, even though we were not supposed to check in until 3.00pm. Its these extras that make a major difference between this Hotel and its competitors. We stayed in the Commonwealth Hotel in Boston also (see my other review) but Jurys Hotel was vastly superior. The decor was great. There is a cool water feature when you come in the front door. There is a lounge also on the first floor beside another bar. There is an excellent restaurant and Bar on the ground floor. Breakfast was also nice too. The staff were no problem when we ordered food in the bar one evening at 11.30pm. This Hotel has a great buzz about it at night with young people/couples using the bars. An open patio type area backs out just below street level from the bar and is filled every evening with people chatting and having a few drinks. The Hotel also seems popular for conferences etc. Its sitauated well too, its just a two minute stroll to Copley Square. The T Station is a three minute walk away. The Hard Rock Cafe is a block away. Also close is McCormick & Schmick. They do a $1.95 menu between 4-6pm and this fills a hole if you are hungry. The housekeeping staff were excellent. The Rooms were turned every evening and there was complementary drinking water in the fridge, which was welcomed after coming back from a long days sight-seeing. The door staff were also excellent. It was no problem for them to advise where to eat, drink etc. Hailing a cab was also no bother for them. One small draw back was the construction works outside which was certainly no fault of the Hotel. Overall, this is a great Hotel with plenty of value for money. Boston is a great city and i would recommend this hotel without hesitation. Ill definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: eb20
Reviews.Content: Jurys is a beautiful new (just over a year) hotel in Boston. It was great. Make sure you try the Key Lime maritini! I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “The Jury(s) finds for the reviewer”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i took my fiance to Boston for our anniversary in May of this year on a bit of a whim. When we checked in, we were told that our room wasn't ready yet but we could store our bags and the concierge would point us in the direction of some sites to pass the time until the room was ready. Richard was very helpful and provided us with a map and comprehensive directions. when we got back, we found our bags had already been taken up to our room (a corner suite on the 3rd floor) so we went to join them. the suite was beautiful - plenty of room, a huge bed with giant pillows, a walk in shower in the bathroom which you could have had a party in and a pretty good view too. we had breakfast the first morning in the restaurant which tasted great, if a little pricey but the service was excellent too. we also had after dinner drinks in the bar on the ground floor one evening too and it was a nice, lively place to drink, chat and people watch. the bar below ground floor next to the restaurant always seemed lively but you couldn't hear any noise from the room (well, not ours anyway). i would highly recommend the Jurys Doyle hotel to anyone wanting to visit Boston and its the first place i'll try and book if i go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Small Beds”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Jurys August 3 through 10 and had a lovely experience. Every staff member we encountered was helpful and professional. I only had two complaints about our stay. One is the beds. While they are extremely comfortable, they are also very small. We had two doubles since we had our two kids with us. I'm sure the king beds are a dream! Also there was construction going on across the street into the wee hours. This of course had nothing to do with the Jurys, and we tried to ignore it. Overall a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “issues resolved at Jurys”
Reviews.Author: desbaggie
Reviews.Content: We had an issue during our stay at this great hotel which was not of their making. we were woken at 2am by a construction team apparently repairing undergound pipework in the street opposite, the crew consisted of about 10 with a mechanical digger and heavy drill equipemt. In the early hours it sounded like down town baghdad and it is amazing that Bostonians are prepared to put up with this sort of thing, in the UK we have laws against noise pollution after 11pm. We called reception and asked to be moved but they were full that evening ( v popular hotel) but promised a change of room the for the following night. they were polite, even apologetic, even though the issue was not their fault. they moved us to a bigger room facing the back of the hotel the following evening and charged us the same price as a standard, which imo is great customer service. All the reviews on here are correct, it is a pristine hotel with wonderful staff in a brilliant location. the bar is also worth a visit although there are so many great bars and restaurants in walking distance do take the time to explore. In particular a restaurant just a couple of blocks away called the Mistral has fantastic food and service, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ive stayed at”
Reviews.Author: scot5
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at this hotel late last month. It was excellent, the location was great, the staff were very helpful. the rooms were big and spotless, Bathroom was also great and spacious. They even turned down our beds at night and left soft music and chocs. I would stay at this hotel again without a doubt. The bar was very busy at night, but that was probably due to it recently reopening, however it could not be heard from the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “The Jury's not out!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Jury's for four nights at the beginning of our New England trip and can only say that we were very much looking forward to the day we returned before departing to the airport. Lovely rooms with huge beds, fluffy white robes, Aveda toiletries...heaven! Although a small hotel in comparison with some in Boston, Jury's was friendly with good food in the restaurants and very well placed for a walk anywhere - just two blocks from the Boyston Street shops and the parks and two blocks in the opposite direction to the Copley and Prudential Malls the Prudential Tower and many good restaurants. The concierge was extremely helpful, booking tickets for us whenever needed and giving helpful advice on restaurants. We will definitely be going back here on a return visit to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Geezo
Reviews.Content: I can't imagine staying at a better hotel in Boston. The service was impeccable. The rooms were uniquely and elegantly designed. The bed was the most comfortable bed I've ever slept on. My fiance' refused to get out of it on the last day. The location is perfect (right near the Hancock Bldg.). True that the bar gets very crowded and loud at night, but the minute you step into the elevator the noise is gone. The only negative is that parking is $36 / night. However, in the heart of Beantown that is not surprising.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest Hotel we have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: BBrookline,MA
Reviews.Content: All I can say is "Wow, what a nice Hotel". Everything from the room, the staff, etc. was impeccable. The shower was the greatest! (The water actually stayed in the shower, unlike most hotels!) Even though we were right downtown the room was quiet. My wife said the bed was the most comfortable she has ever slept on. When can we stay here again? I can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “What a great pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: maxfli
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Jurys Boston this past weekend 8/28 to 8/31. Found this hotel on this website - what a pleasant surprise this jewel is. Probably the best service and the most professional staff I have encountered in a long time. Surprised to find the bar currently the hot spot of the Back Bay,even the staff has no explaination for it! Room was very comfortable, loved the large bathroom with tiled walk in shower. Location was convient and quiet during the evening hours, felt very safe walking around. Richard at the concierge desk has a great sense of humor and gives 110% to his job.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel located beside John Hancock Tower. This former Boston Police Headquarters was opened in June '04 and the staff are amongst the most pleasant you will find in any American property. Rooms are an adequate size and very well designed with in room safe and ironing facilities. Bathrooms are modern and of a great standard. All rooms offer free WiFi facilities. The bar on the ground floor is excellent, altho can be quite crowded at night as it has an outside patio area for the smokers!!!. Overall, one of the nicest, happiest hotels you're likely to experience in North America with staff that really make you feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great value!”
Reviews.Author: kboyd912
Reviews.Content: We were very pleasantly surprised by our stay at Jurys - the staff was wonderful (thanks, Richard!), and the rooms, although a little small, were quite elegant. We thought the location was top notch. It does get a little noisy at night with the downstairs bar/restaurant, but if you are looking for a lively place for a drink before settling in, it's great. Would definitely recommend and would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location; large, clean, stylish rooms; fantastic food, friendly service. The only downside was that our room didn't have a bath.

Reviews.Title: “First visit to USA will definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Visited Boston on 5th June and this was our first trip to the States. Encouraged by the reviews of Jurys on your website I booked our eight night stay there. We had an excellent time in Boston and managed to see all the main sights either on foot or by using the excellent public transport system. Jurys was well placed for the station around the corner at Back Bay and we managed visits to Rockport and Salem on the commuter trains. The hotel staff were all very friendly and the room quiet and comfortable. The people of Boston were very helpful - whenever we stopped to consult our town map someone would usually come up to us and ask if we needed any guidance. We have travelled extensively in Europe over the years but we will definitely be back to Boston next year and look forward to staying at Jurys again.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Irish Accents!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Everyone was so friendly at this hotel, even though it was July 4th weekend in Boston and hectic. Our room was the standard room, a bit small, so next time I will reserve a larger one, but the amenities were bountiful..Aveda products, heated towel racks, comfortable bed, and a great bar. The only thing I would recommend would be a coffee maker in the room. I had a hard time wanting to leave my room in search of coffee after a night out in the town.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: trickydicky
Reviews.Content: Really first-class Hotel with pleasant, polite and helpful staff. Very well maintained and immaculate rooms with great beds and very good bathrooms. We had a 'superior room' which was exactly that - first-class in every respect. Has its own bar, cocktail lounge and restaurant. Would definitely reccomend it & will stay here again next time in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: njh
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the jurys hotel Boston In may this year - we got a good deal by taking them up on their 'beat any proce deal' as Orbitz were offering a room cheaper than the main Jurys site and so they kindly matchedthe price! The room was huge - by british standards! the beds and pillows were unbelivevably comfy and the bathroom was nice clean and large. the restraunt was quite upmarket and a bit beyond our budget but they also serve food at their irish bar which is well worth the value for money. but be warned taht the irish bar is a hot spot for tourists and local on weekends so Friday and saturday nightas it is rammed! The staff are very kind, attentve and make you feel very welcome. I would definately stay here again- The only fault I could find was that tea and coffee facilities didn't come with the room and thats a standard thing for most british hotels and was shocked to see that if you wanted any tea making facilities they charged you- but that really wasthe only fault!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: **Pampered**!!!-7
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a weekend stay in Jurys and we were not disappointed. We arrived early and our room was not ready, so rather that leaving us waiting the receptionist gave us an upgrade. Lovely touch. The room was lovely, decor modern and unfussy , bed was huge and very very comfortable. I know it is a cliche but I loved the turn down service. The staff were very very friendly. From the concierge to the bell boy, they could not have been more helpful answering all our questions and providing us with loads of suggestions of how to spend the weekend. Free internet acess in the business center was an additional bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible...”
Reviews.Author: Headwall
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Boston for our 1st wedding anniversary and the Jury's hotel was one of the many highlights of our trip. The employees were very attentive, after our room service the front desk called to make sure it was alright. Walking distance to many shops, parks, and other bars if Cuffs gets to crowded. We are going to stay here again when we return to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Jury's”
Reviews.Author: Msk6261
Reviews.Content: Thanks Tripadvisor, the Jury's has another satisfied customer due to the postings here. We were not disatisfied with our choice......... & this from former Boston residents. The hotel is centrally located (halfway between the Copley & Arlington T stops, walking distance to Copley, Pru Center, Boston Commons, Newberry Street Shops, Boylston Theater district & the Starbucks or Au Bon Pain that we frequented when we did not want the delicious but pricey hotel restaurant for breakfast). The rooms and all appointments are new and the whole hotel is tastefully decorated. Staff was helpful and courteous. We went for 2 rooms for our family with 3 kids and we had 2 rooms at the end of a hall across from each other. The plus for us (& I'm sure our neighbors) was that there was an additional door that cordoned off our end of the hallway which made our space more like a suite. I noticed that each floor had 2 sets of these so it's worth requesting for a family. It was sure a plus! Our rates were quite reasonable for a downtown city hotel too. I'm sold on this chain of boutique hotels. I hope they'll bring more to the States from Ireland.

Reviews.Title: “I don't see it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read many terrific reviews of the Jurys on here, but I don't see what everyone is so impressed with. This is just a standard, average hotel with an above-average price tag. I expected a lot more.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Boston to see U2 in concert in May 2005, and we decided to stay at Jury's to fit with our Irish theme. We got an excellent rate ($139/night) on the hotel's website which we felt was outstanding for a hotel of this superior quality in this location (Back Bay). Speaking of location, the hotel is within a few minutes walking distance to the shopping districts of Boylston St. and Newbury St, and about a 15-20 minute brisk walk to Boston Common, Quincy Market, and the downtown area. The room was quite nice with fabulous amenities, including fine bed linens and Aveda bath products. This is definately a 4+ star hotel, and it certainly deserves all of the great reviews on tripadvisor.com I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Jurys was excellent”
Reviews.Author: eraserhead_baby
Reviews.Content: After looking at the reviews of Jurys on this site I decided to book here, and was not disappointed. I was in a party of six and we all loved the hotel. Its in an excellent location and is a lovely hotel. From the minute we arrived 'till the end of our stay every single member of staff went out of their way to look after us. The hotel was immaculate, the bedrooms were lovely and the actual beds were out of this world! The restaurant ("the Stanhope Grill") was nice and did a lovely breakfast. The bar downstairs "Cuffs" was great, a nice place to sit and have a well earned drink after a day of sight-seeing. It got pretty busy in the evening with the locals so it was also a great place to just sit and people-watch. We all loved eveything about Jurys and none of us can find one single fault with anything. i highly, highly recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our wedding night...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After researching Boston hotels on Trip Advisor, we decided to stay here on our wedding night on Memorial Day weekend. It was fantastic! They had upgraded us to a corner room. When we walked in, there was a plate of chocolate-covered strawberries and gourmet chocolates laid out for us, along with a bottle of champagne. The decor is modern, tasteful and warm. No tacky prints on the walls-- interesting artwork. The bathroom was great and stocked with Aveda products. Very nice touch! Beds are very comfortable. We ordered room service in the morning and the people were unbelievably friendly and prompt. The service here was great all around. I'll only mention a couple of things-- first, the bar that greets you when entering the hotel does detract from a relaxed atmosphere (although you leave it all behind when up in your room) and the valet parking is expensive, although not unusual for Boston-- just something to keep in mind when budgeting for your stay. I think it was $36 for one night. All in all, if we didn't live five miles away, we would definitely stay here again. The special feeling of our wedding day was enhanced by our night at Jurys. I highly recommend it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Jurys- The jury is in- it is a winner with a couple of dissenting votes!”
Reviews.Content: We loved the location, the rooms were very comfortable and well appointed. The coffee bar in the morning and as wine bar at night were real plusses. The concierge staff and front desk staff were very helpful. On a dissenting note - took 3 days to get extra hangers from housekeeping. The lobby entrance, glass staircase etc are not welcoming as you arrive to a huge din of people in a very crowded bar- some nights they were lined up on the street to get in. The restaurant is pleasant, serves good food but suffers from almost being unable to get to given the crush of people at the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: KevinHPNC
Reviews.Content: Jury's exceeded our expectations from the time of our arrival to our final farewells. We arrived in Boston at 9:00 am and fully expected to check into the hotel but have to wait until noon or later to actually get into our room. Not so at Jury's! The receptionist had a room ready for occupancy and called for the bellhop. Within a matter of minutes, we were handed our door cards and led to the elevator for the beginning of our weekend. Once we entered our room, we were once again pleasantly surprised by the relaxing contemporary decor, absurdly plush bed (which I will get to in a moment), and huge bathroom with a full size walk-in shower! The shower has double shower heads for those hard to reach places. Shortly after, the bellhop delivered our luggage, gave us a tour of the room and all of the amenities in it. Explained the layout of the hotel and suggested that if we needed any further service to call the front desk and ask for Keith. I know that this is probably more of the routine learned at the initial training but his demeanor and pleasant smile made me feel like this was going to be a wonderful weekend. Once we were situated in the room, I took a minute to relax and test out the 'absurdly plush bed' I spoke of earlier. Let me give you a brief description of what that means. The bed was a standard king, long in width and short in length. The bed was covered with 2 decorative pillows, 4 rather large feather down pillows, an overstuffed comforter and underneath that was a feather down blanket. The mattress was pillow top and very, very thick. All in all, the assembled bed reminded me more of a colorful cloud than an actual bed. Needless to say, I had the best rest in a very long time in that bed. The only drawback is that the room was a little small. But you should expect that if you are going to stay in a hotel that was renovated from a very old police station. In the end, it really doesn't matter that much. Who goes on a trip to relax in a room? Lastly, after exiting the hotel, we come to location. With all of the outstanding things listed above about Jury's, there is the issue of location that keeps me from rating it a 5. The location isn't bad at all, in fact it is in the charming South End. You are only minutes from Copley Square and Newbury Street (SHOPPING!) or Boston Common for a relaxing day in the park. Unfortunately, it is located a good 20 minute or more walk from the famed Faneuil Hall and Hanover Street in the North End. You will probably use some type of vehicular transportation for the more famous sites like Fenway Park, Harvard, and Boston Harbor. Although that could be said for about any hotel in the central area. Depending on where you stay determines where you can walk to and where you will have to ride to. One last note more for Jury's than anything. You should change the 3-D holographic design in your elevators. It's so big and so out of place with the rest of the European design.

Reviews.Title: “The Jury is in”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. I brought a group here and we could not have been treated better. From Colin in reservations to the entire front desk staff we were treated wonderfully. Great room with lots of the little amenities that most hotels overlook. The bar was first rate again with great service. Let me emphasize SERVICE, they do it right. I could go on and on but let me just say, do not overlook this gem in the Back Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Not a real 4-star hotel (yet)”
Reviews.Author: NewChapter
Reviews.Content: At first, the hotel seems to be a one of high standards and quality. However, staying there brought to light some matters and lack of finesse that you would not expect to find in a hotel that charges as much as it does. â€¢ A faulty water feature that made the main fancy staircase tricky to walk on â€¢ Room doors that cannot be closed without being noisy and most people seemed to end up slamming theirs, at all hours â€¢ Hair left in shower from previous occupant (and which was not cleaned after being reported and after the housekeeper had completed her round) â€¢ No soap â€¢ Beds are overly sumptuous, too soft and too high â€¢ The bedding and unnecessary accoutrements are too fussy and the pillows too soft (no choice is offered) â€¢ Rooms are quite warm if the window is closed and a/c not used (a/c is noisy to sleep with) â€¢ Toilet pans give splashback to men and plastic seats move around â€¢ Toilet paper is fragile/flaky and breaks up in your hand â€¢ No towel hooks where they are needed, near the shower â€¢ No trouser press even though there is plenty of room for one â€¢ No clothes caddy â€¢ Missing hair dryer â€¢ Few power sockets, some not where needed â€¢ No backup umbrellas â€¢ Expensive movies â€¢ Most annoying is the function room in the lower ground area which is not sectioned off from the Entry and Reception area (nor has any doors to it). The result of this incomprehensible design decision is that guests are greeted by a phenomenally loud wave of general cacophony from the 75+ people gathered there each time you leave/enter the hotel from early evening onwards. It was not clear if this room is for guests only or if the hotel hires the room out for private use. Perhaps the above would not become issues in a $40 a-night hotel, but somewhere that charges upwards of $185 per night should not be having any of these problems. Better attention should have been paid to the details that affect guests (such as the ones listed above) and not on niceties such as the entrance statue, mesmerising lift walls, a sand-blasted staircase or a cascading water feature, nice as they all are but add nothing to a guestâ€™s comfort or benefit. In my view, the hotel should not charge more than $80 a night until the above are all resolved. The hotel can be commended for the following; Good overall design, style and dÃ©cor â€¢ Room furniture â€¢ Bathroom quality and design â€¢ Knowledgeable and helpful staff (except grumpy concierge) â€¢ Handy location â€¢ Turn down service.
